Well, at least it keeps the phone cool in summer, so it won't overheat.Summary: If you have horizontal louver vents, this one holds securely and is easy to use. Highly recommended.Please note that I received this free of charge so I could review it.

These gloves looked great for biking use, so I ordered them. I find them to be very easy to get on and take off, with great grips for the handlebar, but to not work at all with an Android touch screen.There is a lot to like with this glove. This is the most comfortable model I've worn; it goes on/off easily because of the velcro closure and fits my hands really well without being overly tight. I have no doubt they will be great for several hours. I also like the gripping edges, which are well situated for handlebars, with gel padding right where it needs to be, and space in the middle for the handlebar. It looks like a biker actually designed it! There is additional non-slip material on the inside of the thumb, index, and middle fingers, which help when working the gears and such. Construction is sturdy, with double stitching at stress points. The material is just the right combination of strength and stretchy.The glove is advertised to work with a cell phone. With my HTC M9, I was able to work the screen with the glove on, but I had to press a lot harder to get it to work. This is acceptable for the limited times I will need to use a phone while cycling. It works, but not the way your bare hand does.Summary: A good and very comfortable glove. Highly recommended.Please note that I received this free of charge, so I could review it.

CoQ10 is a vital part of my supplement regimen, so I was pleased to be able to order this one. I find it to be easy to take, with good ingredients.The pills are fairly small, smaller than other brands I've used with the same amount. They have no particular taste (but I don't chew them either). For some reason they don't list the ingredients on the product page, so I'm uploading a picture of the analysis and ingredients. I'm not sure about the effects of black pepper, but it should at least do no harm! Dosage is 1 per day, with food.If you are vegan, you should note that these contain bovine Gelatin.Summary: A good supplement for just about any diet (except vegan). Highly recommended.

This looked like an good laptop for basic use, so I ordered it. I find it to be fast enough for basic tasks, with a solid keyboard and decent screen.There are some good points to this laptop:+ I wanted this device for basic word processing on the go, and for that purpose it is very good. It is not as convenient to pack as my former 11 inch, and at 4 lbs is a bit heavy, but is fine for a backpack.+ Overall I'm finding that I like the size - the screen is easy to see and quite readable. Some folks will complain about the relatively low screen resolution (1366x768), but in fact this resolution makes it excellent for basic word processing; it is much easier to read (and use, overall) than my more expensive Dell convertible.+ I like that HP bundled Office 365 with it, with a one year subscription. The files are executed off the hard drive, which makes it run faster.+ The keyboard is a bit small, but has very good backing and is absolutely silent in operation - great for a classroom. I like it for touch typing.+ The overall construction seems quite sturdy.+ The dedicated keys for home, page up, page down, end, print screen, and etc. are separate and easy to use. This is a fully functional keyboard, unlike some models where the keys have dual use.+ The touchpad works very well, with a solid left and right click. More importantly, the keyboard is situated such that I was not constantly accidentally hitting the touchpad and moving the cursor. I've had some laptops for which I've actually had to disable the touchpad because it interfered with typing - not this one.+ With the default power saving settings, I was able to get 5 hours of screen time. I think this could be pushed with tweaking and turning on airplane mode.+ OK, it is only cosmetic, but I really like the blue color. In fact, the overall design is stylish, while not sacrificing sturdy build quality.+ Three USB ports, although only one is 3.0. What I don't like is that the 3 port is not colored blue, which is industry standard.+ The 3mm port supports both headset and microphone, which means you can plug in an earbud or basic handsfree for use with Skype and etc. This leaves the USB ports free for other tasks.+ The full size HDMI port is great for playing movies.+ The supplied charger is very small (a mini brick), which will fit better in the backpack.There are some things that are less good.- I found that the hard drive has only 15 GB free when booted up. Fortunately, it does have a MicroSD storage slot (unusual, since most have a standard SD), which can be used to store files. They also provide a one year subscription to OneDrive for a full TB of data.- The screen is not touch sensitive, but at this price point that is just a note, not a drawback.- The antivirus is only good for a single month, and ironically, it looks like I will have to uninstall it and reinstall the same program so that I can register it. Mcafee allows unlimited computers to use the same license at home, and it actually works very well.- There is some HP bloatware, but that can be easily removed. This is frustrating on a machine with limited storage space.- I did notice that the laptop has a definite way of operating - occasionally it will slow down for a brief second. But it is not noticeable in general, and did not detract from using it. I attribute this to the Celeron processor and limited memory. You have to work with the machine, rather than fighting it.- When using this laptop, you will want to stay with the basics. This machine is not at all suited for gaming, or heavy database / spreadsheet use. Programs can take a few seconds to come up, but then they run fine. I don't plan on running more than a couple of major programs at a time. I'm actually impressed with how well it works with only 2GB of main memory. Once everything completes the boot process, it runs well. I did not bother running PC diagnostics - if you are interested in those numbers, don't bother with this machine!Summary: A very decent laptop for student use, at a great price. Highly recommended for light word processing and excel.

This looked like a great box to multi output, so I ordered it. I find it to be well made, with great features that work well.The device has a lot of uses:+ Some older TV's have only a few HDMI ports, so this device will come in handy for those situations.+ Two of the import HDMI ports support MHL (Mobile High-Definition Link) version 2.0, which means you can connect newer smartphones and things like a Roku stick to the port, and play content directly to the TV. So even if your device doesn't support MHL, this box can provide it!+ The box will boost the HDMI input signal, which is of use if you have to run a long HDMI cable.+ The remote control provides very convenient operation. A manual button provides capability if it gets lost.There are a couple of limitations to the device.- It is limited to 15 yards input length and 20 yard output length for 1080P inputs.- The HDMI is 1.4b, which supports most of the modern functions, but is not as capable as the newer 2.0 standard. So check your system components and make sure it doesn't need the higher standard.The real mystery is why they included a white MicroUSB cable in the box. It is not used anywhere in the device. Oh well, a bonus I suppose.Summary: A nice box if you have the need for more inputs. Highly recommended.------------Design Notes:The box is made of metal, and is well put together. It has a single HDMI input on one side (next to the power input, which uses a power plug into the wall). The other side has two HDMI inputs and two MHL/HDMI (auto switching) inputs. The other end has the single HDMI output. The front has indicator lights for what is in use, and a single push button to change inputs. The remote is very simple, with just five buttons used to select the input source.Please note that I received this free of charge, so I could review it.

I listen to music when walking, so I decided to try these out. I find them to have good music output, especially on higher frequencies, with decent hands free capabilities, and an excellent mix of ambient hearing and music.There is a lot to like here:+ This is the most comfortable version of this "over-ear" bud that I've tried.  I always have trouble with this sort of earbud - it is just hard to get on. The key is to fit the ear piece first, then rotate the ear piece into place. The rubber on these is very pliable - much easier to use than others I've tried.+ The sound from these is pretty rich, but it is better on high notes than low ones. It is not as good on the bass as some other models I've tested, but I really like the balance between high and low output.+ I found that all buttons worked great (see design notes below). The thing I like about these for sports use is that while they put out a good sound, they also allow you to hear the noises around you. That means they are safer than some I've tried that really isolated the noise - which may not be the best idea when exercising!+ The device features voice confirmation, which helps with pairing and ensuring the device powers down.+ There is no blinking blue light when it is active - I hate those.+ The buttons turn out to be easy to use because they have raised patterns - I can work the controls without looking.+ The sound is controlled at the headset, but doesn't affect the Android master media volume. On some headsets, the ear bud actually changes the phone volumes, which results in my not hearing some of the Google voice outputs unless I go in and set it back. No such problems here!+ For hands free, the microphone is on the control portion, which sits high on the left side - well placed for voice pickup, although you might have to twist the cable so that the microphone faces out. Sound is acceptable, though this device is really only acceptable for occasional phone use, and definitely not as a primary hands free device.+ I have to mention the stuff that comes with it, because it is so great. They provide a very good quality hard zip case with a clip that will go on your bike or exercise equipment. It holds the included spare ear pieces and microUSB cable.The only thing to note that might be a drawback is if you prefer a lot of bass sound or noise isolation. This set is not built for those. Otherwise, no problems!Summary: A great design, well optimized for exercise. If you don't need maximum bass, these are perfect. Highly recommended.------Design Notes:The earbuds have a single multifunction key for power on / off (3 second press), pairing (5 second press), answer/hang up / play / pause (single press), and redial (double press). There are also a button for increase sound (long press for next track) and decrease sound (long press for last track or repeat).. The unit is rated at 4-5 hours use and around 100 hours standby.Please note that I received this free of charge so I could review it. I did order through Amazon.

You can never have too many power ports these days, with all the electronics around, so I ordered this one. I find it to be attractive, with good power output from all ports, but to have a somewhat bulky design that is best used at home rather than on the road.There are two plugs that put out the 2.1A that is standard for Android and iPad / iPhone, plus two additional ports that put out 1A, which was used for older devices (but can still be used for more modern items - it just charges slower).  I found that all four ports work fine.The only thing that could be improved is the small blue light they use to indicate power "on". It is right next to the left most port, and the light spills over through the port itself. It would be better if they somehow shielded the interior of the USB port so the light did not shine out. It isn't a huge deal, but if you are using this in a bedroom, you might want to keep something in that left port!Summary: A great device for home use. Highly recommended.-------------Design Notes:The product page pictures are exactly accurate. This is a fairly large box (3.75" X 2.75" X 1.2"), and it attached to the wall with a two prong cord, which is rather different these days (most of these chargers plug directly into the wall). There are small "feet" on the bottom to help stabilize it. This is definitely intended as a home device,and is not a lightweight plastic thing - it is actually somewhat heavy, and appears to have a metal base. Due to the weight (and size) I would recommend using it at home rather than for travel.Please note that I received this free of charge so I could review it.

This looked like a nice gift for my daughter, who likes to write, so I ordered it. I find it to be well made, with a nice rustic feel, and to have good quality paper that holds ink well.The book is made of a heavier leather and is pretty small, just under 4" X 6", which makes it a good size for carrying around. The pages themselves are 3" X 5". It has no snap, but rather closes by means of a rawhide cord that you simply wrap around and tie. One end of the cord has a nautical themed end piece (which actually functions to make it easier to tie), while the other end has a small metal piece that hooks over the inside clamps so as to form a bookmark - so you open to the right page every time.The pages are brown, and a bit thin, so I was surprised to find that the ink does not bleed through to the next page. Thus the book can be written upon both sides of each page, although if your pen has a very fine point, you might indent the page. This looks cool until you start using the reverse page! The design uses loose leaf pages, so they can be refilled if you can find some the right size that are six hole punched. That is not a very popular size from a brief online search.Summary: A nice gift for the person who appreciates the rustic look and likes to take notes. Highly recommended.Please note that I received this item free of charge, so I could review it.

This looked like a good quality cable, so I ordered it. I find it to work well and to be solidly constructed.The cable is the newer 2.0 standard that supports Audio Return and Ethernet via a special set of wires. I don't have anything that supports those standards, but I was able to test it on my 4K TV and it worked fine. I note that other reviewers had problems, but I'm wondering if they followed the instructions provided to reset the electronics involved. The instructions say to "press and hold the on/off button on your DVD/PS3/Home cinema so that it will reset and start working", or to try swapping the ends of the cables (not sure why this would help, but it is in the instructions). But if you have problems, the warranty is for 10 years (not including physical damage).I like the construction, with braided cable covers that will help prevent the cord from being frayed. The cable is also attractive, and includes triple density shielding, 23k gold plated connectors, and copper wires. I'm not sure why the product page mentions "flat" cables - these are round.One thing to note is that the ends are very stiff. I would not suggest this cable if you have to bend the cables to get it into your TV.Summary: A great quality cable that is backwards compatible for normal HDMI, yet provides for the future. Highly recommended.Please note that I received this free of charge so I could review it. I did order through Amazon.

I liked the look of this lamp, so I ordered it. I find it to be very compact, and to put out great light, but that there are no (English) instructions provided.The lamp puts out very good light that is fairly direct, and is excellent for reading and detail work. Maybe they list the color warmth in the instructions, but it definitely is not a warm LED - I could characterize it as "cold". I was surprised at how well the design holds up - so long as the middle part is not past the vertical, you can adjust the light just about any way you want.The lamp looks much like the product page, but is way cooler in person. Folded size is a little over 7" L X 1.75" W X 1" D. This means it would fit well in a backpack or briefcase for a business trip. It is powered by a standard MicroUSB port (such as is used in all Android phones), but does not come with a charger. It features a rechargeable LiIon battery, but there is no way of knowing how long it will last, because the specs are in Chinese. From the weight, it cannot be very large. I think it is best used plugged in, with occasional capability of providing temporary light without the charger. The unit is also very lightweight, but still solidly constructed. It consumes 1.6 watts of energy in use.There are a couple of things that could be better. The instructions are completely lacking, being Chinese only. The other thing is that the on/off switch is very hard to move. I have to close the unit, or pick it up, to turn the switch.Summary: This makes an excellent light for traveling or home use. Highly recommended.Please note that I received this free of charge so I could review it.

I was intrigued by the idea of a car charger that also had a built in battery for use without the car, so I ordered it. I find it to be a bit bulky in the car, to provide good charge when plugged into the car and also as a stand alone battery, but that it does not indicate charge properly with my hybrid vehicle.The bank is 5 inches (12.5 cm) long, and a lot wider than most car chargers due to the battery portion. The battery also makes this a bit heavier than you might think. When plugged in or on batteries, it supplies 2mA split over two USB ports, but it seemed to me that when used with only a single device, it charged faster, so I think they actually provide higher power for single port use (the documentation is not clear on this point). Most modern phones will accept a faster charge that 1mA (the output if both ports are used), but will still charge well at the lower throughput. There is a single light that has dual uses. When used from the battery source, it flashes red below 20%, solid red up to 69%, and green above that. When charging, it is solid red until it reaches full charge, when it turns green.There are three things to be aware of when considering this device.1. This is longer than you think. The power port location varies widely on different vehicles. On my Ford C-Max, it just barely fit without interfering with the gear shift. On my 2002 Civic, it stuck out a pretty good way, but again did not interfere. But be aware that it IS long.2. My C-Max is a plug in hybrid. On this car, the device did not indicate charge correctly. It kept blinking red when plugged in, which it should not do. I tried it in my Civic, and the light immediately turned green, indicating the battery was fully charged. I think that there is some interference between the device programming and my hybrid programming, so I cannot recommend this for use with a hybrid car like the Prius, or for a plug in hybrid like my C-Max. I did not test it with a full electric vehicle, so I cannot comment about that. I did not mark it down in the number of stars, because it does work in a conventional car, which I believe is the designed market. Just be aware if you drive a hybrid that the "charge" indicator may not work right, even though it is charged. Not being willing to take the chance, I will use it on my two other cars, because I don't want to risk any electrical strangeness!3. Since it is not good to keep a LiIon battery at full charge, I recommend that you charge this only when you are going to a place where you will need the external battery. That means this device is best used occasionally rather than as a daily charger. But for use with camping or backpacking, it is ideal - charge it up heading to the site, then have have some spare power to use. It also means that you can recharge it while you are at the campsite using your vehicle, then take it backpacking later, or back to the tent. This is the optimal use for the device.Summary: A nifty idea to provide a charge when there is no 110v power. Highly recommended unless you drive a hybrid vehicle.Please note that I received this free of charge so I could review it.

I suppose drinking red wine is supposed to be something relaxing, so you have time to open the bottle and let it air out. Unfortunately it doesn't always work out that way - sometimes you need to open fast, or open another bottle to go around. That is where this handy little gizmo comes in.The device is very simple - just put the detachable tube into the glass part, which then goes into the wine bottle like a rubber cork. As you pour the wine, it is aerated perfectly - the air mixes with the wine just right. This is so simple I wonder why I ever used anything else. From now on, this is the way I will drink red wine. Clean up is simple as well - remove the tube from the glass part and rinse with water. The only thing to be careful about is that you have to ensure you push the glass part on top of the wine securely (or you will end up with wine everywhere - except in your glass)!If there is any drawback to this system, it is that the tube sticks down into the bottle about the length of a standard bottle neck. This means that the last part of the bottle cannot get out through this tube. What I will do is to remove this device after pouring the first few glasses, so the last little bit can air out normally while we are drinking the first bit.Summary: Go ahead and pull out that extra bottle - and serve immediately. Why didn't I get this sooner? Highly recommended.Please note that I received this free of charge so I could review it.

This looked like a different design than my other harnesses, so I ordered it. I find it to be strong, very flexible for sizing, and easy to use, but to be a bit difficult to release.There is a lot to like about this harness: it has great padding in the chest area, and the straps have a system that reminds me of zip ties (except they can be released). This provides infinite adjustments to fit just about any pet between 15 and 30 pounds or so. It fit my very large Cairn Terrier (25lb) well. Once set, the adjustment is strong and won't let go accidentally. Finally, the leash attachment point is well situated to control the pooch nicely.The only thing I don't care for is the way the harness has to be removed. The latch works by pushing down with one hand while pulling it loose. In practice I found it really needs two hands.It takes two hands to release each part of the harness. At a minimum you need to release two latches, and it can be difficult to get both hands down there - twice - while the dog is wriggling to be let free. On my other harnesses, the adjustment is made with buckles, and the connection is a plastic piece that can be squeezed with a single hand.Summary: A nice design that is comfortable for the dog. Recommended if you pet will stay still to get it off!

This is a nice wrap for use just out of the shower. It has a velcro closure that has a pretty wide adjustment range (about 24 inches total), and elastic banding around the rest of the top. The material is a bit thin, so it is not suitable for actually drying anything, but works well as a wrap to use before dressing. It will be full length for my wife (4'10"), but about as pictured on the product page for most women. It is well made, with double stitching across the top where it will have the most stress.The only thing I don't care for is that it is not cotton - it is all synthetic fiber. While this makes it wash easily, it doesn't absorb or feel quite as good as cotton.Summary: A nice wrap for prepping in the morning. Recommended.

I needed a surge protector for my office, so I decided to order this one. I find it to be well designed and easy to use.It's a good thing I ordered this. When I plugged it in, the light for "ground" did not come on. I discovered that the one plug in my office wall (which was being used for my personal computer and the company routers) wasn't grounded! We quickly ran an extension cord and now everything is at least somewhat protected. And my personal computer now has this power strip providing some surge protection as well.There is a lot to like here:+ Construction is very solid, with good strength metal.+ The child locks, which slide over the power outlet to keep a kid safe - not useful in my case, but essential at home. I much prefer these to the spring loaded ones that can be hard to plug and unplug.+ There are indicators for power (one on the top and a lighted on/off switch) and for grounded plug status.+ It is really nice to see the cable connectors here. This would be great for those home users with antenna or cable connections.There are a couple of things to consider before purchasing. These are not "deal breakers" but you should be aware of them:- The protection is only 1000 Joules. I've seen expensive ones that cover 20 times this amount. But then again, those also cost a LOT more.- The cord is only 4 feet, which means it won't reach far. I usually prefer 6 feet.- The wall plug is angled and stiff. I like that it is strongly made, and this means it will be somewhat more flat than other plugs. But it also means that this protector is restricted to the bottom plug on the wall (otherwise it will block the remaining plug). You need to consider this - and not buy two if you want both to work in the same wall outlet.Summary: Not the highest levels of protection, but well designed and constructed. Highly recommended when this is all the Joules you need.

I needed a BT mouse for my laptop, so I ordered this one. I find it to be a bit small for my hands, but to be easy to pair, with good button action and accurate positioning.The mouse is easy to pair with Windows 10 (see below). I found that it moves easily across my mouse pad, and the two buttons on the side are very smooth. Left and right click were fine. I like the fact that it has three DPI settings - I can see that being useful when I'm working on website graphics and things like that. It is in fact quiet when clicking the left, right, and both side buttons, so I guess their advertised "quiet mouse" is accurate enough.You should note that the mouse is small, which is great for the backpack but may be a bit small on your hands. I have large hands, but was able to use it well enough - just not quite as comfortable as my normal large gaming mouse.The only thing I would change is to provide a small pouch for carrying the mouse around. With this size and (no Dongle) BT, it is meant to be used with a portable device, and it would be nice to have something to protect the mouse in my backpack.Summary: If you can live with the small size, this is a great mouse for your laptop. Highly recommended.------------------Design Notes:This is a small and light moues, about half the size of my Logitech G602 that I use with my desktop machine. The mouse has the normal buttons, plus a special one (on top) for changing the DPI resolution (1000/12000/18000 - I prefer the highest). To pair, simply hold the right mouse button and press the scroll wheel. I paired with Windows 10 on the first try by going to Settings and searching for "Bluetooth"  - that brought me to the setting and pairing menu. It runs on 2 AAA batteries that are neatly stacked on top of each other, and features two power save modes (slight and deep) in case you forget to turn it off. The bottom has an on/off slide switch. The mouse pairs directly with your device rather than using a BT dongle that plugs into the USB port.Please note that I received this item free of charge, so I could review it. I did order through Amazon.

You can never have too many chargers, and this one looked good, so I decided to try it. I find it to work fine, but to have only one full strength USB slot when two devices are plugged in.The device looks nice, with a shiny finish. It has dual USB ports, one rated at 1A and one rated at 2.4A. These voltages are significant, since older phones will max out at 1A charge, while newer phones and tablets will be able to use the full 2.4A charge to fill up the battery faster.In use, I found that the two ports worked about equally well in charging up my phone, provided only one port is used. This makes me think that they programmed the device such that either port will put out maximum, but if both are in use one will max out at 1A. This is better than some models I've seen, which appear to split the charge to 1.78A per USB port when both are in use. At least with this one you can be sure that the one port will have a full output. The device is "smart", meaning that it will detect your device charge needs and not over charge the USB port. This is great because you can connect anything with confidence that it won't get fried!There are two features that are better than many models. First, it has a very small blue light to indicate that it is powered up (so I don't have to look at the phone to see it charging - I know it is inserted into the car charge port correctly). They got the intensity just right - it is not annoying at all, but does the job well. The other thing I like is that they clearly label each port so you aren't guessing which has the high power output when both are in use. I plan to have different color USB cables in the two ports.Summary: This one delivers the power regardless of what you plug into it. Highly recommended.Please note that I received this item free of charge so I could review it. I did order through Amazon.

I do most of my meat roasting on the patio BBQ rather than in the oven, and this looked like an interesting thermometer, so I ordered it. I find it to be easy to use, to have accurate temperature readings and excellent display options, but to lack any way to turn off the screen when not in use.The great feature of this thermometer is that it has a colored screen that flashes different colors based on the temperature settings. Blue means it is well below the desired temperature. Within 15 degrees the screen turns green. At or above the set temperature the screen flashes red, and an alarm sounds for 60 seconds to let you know it is done. I find the screen really useful at night; I can turn off the patio lights and know at a glance how the meat is doing.I tested this with a pork roast on the BBQ. It is really simple to use - just set the temperature, insert the probe, and walk away. No more opening the BBQ to insert a thermometer. The only thing to watch for is to make sure the probe wire doesn't get trapped between the cover and BBQ bottom - I ran mine out a hole in the side of the cover. When the screen flashed red and the alarm sounded, I checked the temperature reading against my regular quick probe - this unit was exactly accurate. Just a side note, modern pork is safe to eat at 147 degrees - try it and you will be astonished at how juicy a pork roast can be!There are two ways to use this device. You can use the preset meat/doneness settings (which has the unit set the target temperature), or you can set a desired temperature. I found that their doneness settings were much higher than I usually prefer. Roasts in particular continue to cook after removing from the heat, and I think the settings they provide (while approved by national authorities) will result in over-done meat, at least to my taste. I highly recommend using the temperature mode instead to set your exact desired temperature.There are a couple of things to note about the design, neither of which is critical:It is common for probe thermometers to not shut off - I have another one that stays by the oven, and that LCD screen is always on and unnoticed. However, this unit flashes the screen blue continuously by design, and that is annoying. You can remove the batteries, but then you have to keep track of where you put them. I hope they change this on the next model to have a way to at least turn off the screen. For one thing, I'm not sure how much battery power that screen flashing is using up. I will probably remove the batteries between uses.The other thing that could be improved is that the clip is right over the battery cover, and interferes a bit with opening the battery compartment. It isn't a huge deal, but is a bit clumsy to use.A final note is that for the size of this unit, I was surprised they did not choose AA instead of the smaller AAA batteries. If you are going to have a unit this large, why not use the bigger batteries? There is plenty of room in this case!Summary: A good price for a thermometer that works great. Highly recommended.--------Design Notes:The unit is bigger than it looks, and has nice rubberized sides that grip really well. The front has buttons that change the pre-programmed meat settings (type of meat and doneness), or can be used to set to any specific temperature desired (which is what I used). The probe has a wire mesh construction, which I like better than the silicone versions. On the rear, it features a clip for the belt (used when in timer mode, presumably - no point in a belt clip when the probe is in use!). The clip doubles as a stand, which works really well - but interferes with inserting batteries a bit. The timer function will count either up as a stopwatch or down as a timer. There is no clock mode. It will display in C or F, and runs on 2 AAA batteries (included). The instructions are clear and easy to use, except that they include steps to set the timer when using temperature based cooking - I skipped those steps and everything worked fine.Please note that I received this item free of charge so I could review it. I did order through Amazon.

This looked like a nice headset, so I ordered it for use when I walk. I find it to have a very clear tone, with easy pairing, good voice prompts, and decent phone reception, but to have limited controls with Android.The volume controls did not work on my Android 5.1 phone (the instructions warned that not all phones support volume control), which is a bit surprising because some other headsets do work with my HTC M9. However, the sound output is nice, with quite a decent bass range and very clear sound overall. The button did work to move the track forward and backwards. I'm pleased with the sound, even if I have to adjust the volume with my phone. The earbuds were very comfortable in the default size; they also provide a larger and smaller size if needed.The phone functions work fine, and the sound is clear on both ends. The headset is not recommended as a driving handset, and I agree with that assessment. This is strictly for exercise use, but it is nice to be able to answer a call while working out.Summary: A decent value at the price: it doesn't sound cheap. Recommended.------------------Design Notes:The headset comes with a small MicroUSB charge cable, and the instructions say to use only that cable or make sure that the charger only produces 100 mA (a very small number; a computer puts out 500 mA). I connected it to my high power charger, and it worked fine. Most modern chargers will detect the correct settings, but if you are using an older charger, I do recommend using the supplied cable. It charged for me in about an hour. The unit is rated for 4 - 5 hours use time, 180 hours standby time, and 2 hours charge. I supports A2DP, AVRCP, HSP, and HFP BT profiles (BT version V4.0).  A single multifunction button handles play / pause (single press), pairing (Hold 4 seconds), on / off (hold 2 seconds), answer or hang up phone (single press during phone operations), and redial (quick double press). The same right side earpiece has a rocker that is supposed to increase / decrease sound and long press for move to the next / previous track. The device gives basic voice prompts for power on/off, pairing/paired, and incoming call.Please note that I received this unit free of charge so I could review it. I did order through Amazon.

My wife takes glucosamine, but I had never tried it until this product. What a difference! I have recurring neck and back pain, and within a week of using this product twice daily, I was feeling vastly better. I've been using it for about a month now. The stiffness is still there, but most of the pain and discomfort has been reduced to a fraction of what it was. I'm convinced! This product is going on my permanent order list when it runs out - it really works. The ingredients are listed on the product page, so I won't repeat them here.The pills are large, but the results are worth it.Summary: If you have joint aches and haven't tried Glucosamine, this product is worth a try! Highly recommended.

This supplement has a lot of the things needed for good nutrition. The Vitamin A is a bit high, but acceptable. There are a couple of things that are particularly good: the Vitamin D (which many people lack due to the use of sunscreen), and biotin, which helps thicken the hair.On the other hand, some of the amounts are just scary large (see list below). I wish someone would just make a supplement that cover about 90% of all needed ingredients, so that a person could simply be sure they are getting all they need, and not large amounts of certain things. Also, the potassium is way low; I can't imagine why they didn't include more, unless it conflict with other ingredients.Just a note, there are pretty large pills.Summary: A good blend, but very strong. Recommended only if these amounts agree with your nutrition plan. Study the ingredients carefully!--------------For some reason, they don't list the ingredients or analysis, so I'm including them here:Amount Per Serving / % Daily ValueVitamin A 5,000 IU / 100%  (as Beta-Carotene and Retinyl Acetate)Vitamin C 200 mg / 333%  (as Ascorbic Acid)Vitamin D 2,000 IU / 500%  (as D3 Cholecalciferol)Vitamin E 30 IU / 100%  (as d-Alpha Tocopheryl Acetate)Vitamin K 80 mcg / daily, preferably with a meal.Other Ingredients: Vegetable Cellulose. Contains <2% of: Gelatin, Natural Palm Leaf Glaze, Vanillin, Vegetable Magnesium Stearate, Vegetable Stearic Acid. â€¢ Contains milk ingredients.

I liked the look of this shirt, so I ordered it for the cooler weather. I find it to be very comfortable and to fit well.I like just about everything about this garment. The fabric has a sort of "mini-waffle" design that is small enough to be understated, but still adds an interesting variety; I like the longer sleeve length and closed cuffs that will keep the air out. The buttons have a two tone rustic feel, and the cotton / poly blend is just right for laundry - this will be easy to dry. But none of this would be good unless the shirt was comfortable - it is. This fabric breathes welll and feels a lot better than wool or solid polyester.It is a bit too casual for work, but will go great for outdoors as an undergarment, or for casual wear around town or the yard.Summary: A nice fabric and a good design. Highly recommended.

I have switched to non-stick cookware for breakfast, so I ordered these to use with them. I find this set to be well made but a bit rough.I liked the paint around the handles, which makes it a bit easier to clean up. The other parts are natural wood, and they are a bit rough around the edges - literally. I got a splinter when feeling them; they could use a bit of sand paper to finish them up. Other than that, the only problem I have is that I wish the two spoons were a bit deeper. They really don't have as much capacity as I would prefer.Summary: A nice basic set at a decent price. Recommended.

This looked neat, so I ordered it. I find it to be useful, with three survival devices all housed in the one bracelet.The bracelet looks nice, being braided parachute cord, but this isn't really a fashion accessory. It has a whistle built into the clasp, a very small device that could do a small bit of cutting (with a serrated 1/2 inch edge, not really that sharp), and a magnesium fire starter that you have to strike very hard (but it does produce a good spark when done right).This is a nice bracelet, but it is a bit tight on me - and there is no size adjustment. Additionally, when I put it on, the plastic parts covered most of my wrist area, which was not that comfortable. I will probably just attach it to my backpack.Summary: A nice little addition to your survival pack. Recommended.Please note that I received this product free of charge so I could review it. I did order through Amazon.

From the moment I saw this product, I was fascinated - what a great idea for anyone who loves taking pictures. I find this to be a great design, with good features that make it actually useful, not just a novelty toy.The cup is smaller than the typical travel mug, holding about 10 oz. It makes for a good coffee sized cup. The interior is made with aluminum, which is desirable for coffee because it won't capture the flavor, and there is no worry about the plastic leeching into the hot liquid. The top screws on, and features what looks exactly like a lens cover on the top. As for the outside, nothing works, but it all LOOKS like it is a real camera lens; very realistic.There are a couple of notes to the design.- The base is a bit narrow, because they stay true to the SLR format and size it like a camera mount. It will fit in a larger car holder, but not a small one. It fit in my Ford.- The top does not have any means of sipping - it is a screw down lid. This makes it less useful for the car, but OK for the office.Summary: Everyone will get a great laugh out of this one - but it will be a useful gift as well. Highly recommended.Please note that I received this item free of charge so I could review it. I did order through Amazon.

This looked like an interesting BT product, so I ordered it. I find it to be easy to pair and to put out very good stereo sound.The system consists of a small disk that takes 3mm input from your device and converts it into bluetooth. Then you simply pair your BT speaker or headphones and play your media. Simple, but very effective. I had wondered how the headset would pair - there are no screens such as you have on a phone where you choose the device. This transmitter automatically chooses the headset and pairs with no interaction. I had no trouble at all getting my headset to pair. It ranges out to about 30 feet without problems. It comes a 2 foot 3mm cord, a 2 foot MicroUSB charging cord, and very basic instructions. It does not include a charger.I tested this with a Turtle Beach 800 headset, and the sound was great. If you are using it for a permanent installation, I would suggest getting a small power source for MicroUSB and simply leaving it plugged in all the time; for sustained use there is no point in using the built in battery.When the kids were babies, we had wired headset hooked into our TV so that we could watch without waking them. With this device, we could have done it without the wires. The only problem would be getting a converter from the standard stereo output to 3mm jack, but that is easily done. Other uses would be to allow two kids to listen to the DVD output in the car by simply plugging in this little gadget. Really, it has a myriad possibilities, the only limitation being that a maximum of two listening devices can be plugged in at any one time, and that the output of your music source (input into this device) has to be 3mm, like a phone, MP3 player, or computer.Summary: Great sound output from a small device. Highly recommended.Please note that I received this device free of charge, so I could review it. I did purchase through Amazon.

This watch looked to be elegant and functional, so I ordered it. I find it to be very large, with sophisticated hands and markings.The watch comes with a nice box and a gift bag, and would make a great gift idea. You should be aware that this is a very large watch, and I would suggest making sure that the person wearing it has big enough wrists so that it looks nice. I really like the watch hands, which are elongated and tapered very nicely, paired with face markings that are just single slices. As a combination, it comes off looking quite elegant - and it looks better on the hand than it does on the product page. The day and date are small (but readable), making them fit into the overall scheme really well. The leather band is nicely understated, and adds a touch of natural class to the overall watch design. The quartz movement will keep good time, and the 30m water protection is all I need for casual use.Their "free gift" turned out to be a leopard hair clip in my case, which I won't use, but was fun to see bundled with a men's watch.Summary: A great watch for a super price. Just make sure it isn't too big on your wrist! Highly recommended.Please note that I received the product free of charge, so I could review it.

These looked like a nice set of shears, so I ordered them. I find them to have a great grip and to cut well.These shears are really well designed, with lots of great features:- The grip has full-length rubberized covers - I can hold them securely from any angle, and I think they will work for smaller as well as larger hands.- The blades are very sharp, and the action is smooth. These are spring loaded to open, and the spring is just right - not too stiff and yet quite positive.- The lock is a simple slider that is easy to use even with one hand.- You can separate the parts to sharpen the blades, but it is a bit of a pain to get back together. This is acceptable because I will probably only sharpen them every couple of years.- While cutting, I found these did a good job. The blades are straight rather than curved, and the maximum branch thickness I would recommend is about 3/4 inch thick. Beyond that you will be hacking away instead of getting a good initial cut. These are great for light branches, roses, and such.The only thing I can recommend is that they might consider providing a leather sheath. There is nothing sharp here when folded, but it would make for a nicer experience if I could carry it on my belt.Summary: A great little set of shears for light branch work. Highly recommended.Please note that I received this product free of charge so I could review it.

I needed to connect an older computer to a 32 inch TV, so I decided to try this device. I find it to work well, with true plug-and-play simplicity.Many televisions comes with the 15 pin connector to hook up a computer, but the audio signal has to come in from another source. The advantage of this device is that it plugs into the USB port and routes the sound over to the HDMI connector (HDMI carries both sound and picture). I found that it worked great right out of the box, and the picture looks good. You should note that this is not an upscaler - your picture quality will vary based on the capabilities of your video card. So while movies and etc. will look good providing your laptop can support HD video, the desktop and other programs will only look as good as your card supports. In my case the desktop screen is a bit clunky looking, but that is what happens when you present a 15 inch screen on a 32 inch TV!I have tried several Cyelee products, and every one has had very sound construction. This one is no exception - it is well made and simply works. Sometimes the best products are the simple ones; the less drama in my electronics, the better.Summary: A good choice if your laptop doesn't have HDMI capabilities built in. Highly recommended.Please note that I received this device free of charge so I could review it. I did order through Amazon.

I liked the look of this, so I ordered it to see if it would do for carrying my cards and etc. I find it to be well made, to look good, but to have no place to put the money.The case has a nice snap closure, and I really like that they provide two snaps, so that when it gets full you can accommodate the deeper size. The interior has only plastic slots, with room to carry 24 - yes, 24 - credit cards. As you can imagine, that many cards is pretty bulky, but that should be expected. The case is genuine leather, and is sturdy with no stitching - just a single piece of leather with two snaps and only a couple of grommets holding in the plastic insert. Simple and efficient. It works great for what it is designed to do.The only thing I didn't like (and the reason for four stars) is that they did not provide anywhere to put some cash. I seldom go out only with credit cards - I almost always carry some cash along, for tipping if nothing else. I would have liked a small slot along the inside to hold a few bills. Of course, you can always put some cash inside a credit card holder, but I'd prefer a dedicated place away from the plastic. In a case this big, I would expect to carry cash.Summary: I will hold a ton of cards, so if plastic is your payment of choice, this one will be great. Highly recommended.Please note that I received this item free of charge so I could review it. I did order through Amazon.

I sometimes prefer to carry just a few things, and this looked great, so I ordered it. I find it to be well made, elegant to look at, and very functional for light use.The holder looks very nice, with tan stitching along with the tan strip, all on black leather. It is single stitching, but appears to be well done (and it looks elegant that way). From the smell, it appears this is actual leather rather than the cheaper PU stuff you often see. The slots are just the right size for credit cards, and the interior pouch is good for maybe a dozen or so bills, folded over in half. There is no snap closure - it holds simply because of the design. This will make a great addition to tight jeans and things like that - it is compact, just the right size, and will impress folks when you pull it out.Summary: An elegant design, very useful for those times when you only need to carry a few things along. Highly recommended.Please note that I received this item free of charge, so I could review it. I did order through Amazon.

I liked the look of this design, with waffle style fabric, so I ordered it. I find it to work well for absorbing sweat, with a strange but useful shape.The fabric appears to be 100% cotton (although this is the first product I've seen without a laundry and materials tag). It features a nice strap on the rear that could be used to hang on a hook. There is indeed a zippered place for a cell phone or wallet, but they chose to make the zipper into a triangle shape - and it won't hold my HTC M9 in an Otterbox Defender case (too small). That is OK with me, because I would not want my phone or wallet to be in what is basically a towel intended to get wet and sweaty! However, I suppose it would be useful for those with smaller phones doing yoga or other things like that where you could use the other end to wipe sweat.The shape confused me for a minute, until I realized that the intent is to wrap it around your neck while you exercise. It works well in this use, although I would think that a phone would be a bit too heavy carried this way. However, it does do a good job of getting you dry rapidly. There are no washing instructions, but I plan to use cold water with a normal dry.Summary: Good for light impact workouts like walking where you can loop it around your neck. Highly recommended for this use.Please note that I received this item free of charge so I could review it. I did order through Amazon.

I was intrigued by the concept of a pouch to hold cables and etc. for a phone, so I ordered this. I find it to be well made, and to be best used for a Nintendo 3DS or similar device that needs cartridges.The case is suitable for carrying lots of electronic cables, and miscellaneous chargers. I see this as being useful for packing on a trip, so that everything is all in one place; it is a good size for my computer backpack. However, with some small modifications (see below), I think it would do even better as a case for the Nintendo 3DS XL, with plenty of pouches for game cartridges and room for the charger and etc. That would be my suggested use. That side of the case has more protection from outside damage than anywhere else, so I think the 3DS would be fairly well protected.Summary: A well built case, it will keep everything easy to reach. Highly recommended for the Nintendo 3DS.-----------Design Notes:The case is heavier than it looks, because it has an inside flap with lots of slots that are sized for Nintendo DS cartridges, although they are pretty deep for that purpose. There are several mesh storage slots, and a row of elastic bands that would hold power adapters in well. On the opposite inside are two large pouches, neither of which would fit a DS, much less a 3DS XL, but I removed the seam between the two pouches and it made a good sized area for a 3DS. The outside has a single zipper pouch. The entire thing zips closed with a nylon zipper, and construction is good, with double stitch sewing on the outside seams. There is some padding in various places, but not a huge amount.Please note that I received this item free of charge, so I could review it. I did order through Amazon, and the order process was fine.

I needed a good looking portfolio, and this looked to be good, so I ordered it. I find it to look nice (except for an easily scratched metal area), and to be well designed and constructed.The design looks really great, with a casual style combined with the elegance of leather, yet using white stitching that give a more rustic look. I like the overall functionality and looks - this is a great way to take notes at a client meeting. It is classy and yet understated. While the backing inside the case makes it a bit heavy, it also means that you can take good notes easily because it is quite rigid.The only problem I have is that mine came with the metal accent piece (a triangle sort of thing seen in the product pictures) already scratched, and I expect it would get even more scratched with use. The surface is shiny and really shows the scratches. I would suggest that they remove this piece entirely from the design, or make it of a different metal that is not prone to scratches. Despite this, I still like this product enormously - it just looks and works so well.Summary: A great looking device for note taking - it will impress the clients. Highly recommended.-----------Design Notes:This is a "padfolio", not a portfolio, as I discovered when I opened it. The case has no area for carrying papers, but has an area that accepts a legal sized pad. The left side has an ID compartment with plastic cover, a multi use pouch about the size of large post-it notes, several slots that appear to be designed for credit cards or business cards, and a solar calculator with basic addition funcitons. The entire thing has a solid backing, making it heavier that it looks. It uses "PU Leather", which is not genuine leather but looks good, and is waterproof. It all closes with a zipper that protects the contents from falling out, and zips easily.Please note that I received this item free of charge, so I could review it. I did order through Amazon.

I was intrigued by the idea of a steel door stopper (most are plastic), so I ordered this one. I find it to do a great job of holding open the doors on carpet or solid flooring, and to look good, but to be a bit longer and higher than you might think.The stopper looks exactly like its picture - stainless steel, with three rubberized bands. The rubber does a great job of holding the door. I didn't think the handle was necessary, but found that it does in fact make it much simpler to remove because it can be easily gripped. The rubber banding is not fixed - they can be moved around left to right; I was afraid that might make them less effective, but the pressure from the door is length ways, not left / right, so it is fine. This style would look great in a kitchen that features brushed stainless appliances.The only thing to note is that the door stop is just over an inch tall at the deep end, and 4 inches long (5 with the handle). That is a lot deeper than other stops, and considering the materials, I think it could be both shorter and lower while still doing a great job. I ended up loosening the screws for the handle so I could fold it over when in use - it takes up less room that way.Summary: A very nice door stop if it fits your interior design scheme. Highly recommended.Please note that I received this item for free, so I could review it. I did order through Amazon, and the process was fine.

I liked the idea of having a quick charge capability in my car, so I ordered this adapter. I find it to have excellent charge capabilities, and to work well.The adapter features a Qualcomm certified (9V / 2A and 12V / 2A ) quick charger, which puts out a higher voltage that some phones can support (it will charge compatible devices in 30 minutes or so). I like that this port is indicated by a green USB end (making it easy to identify). The other two ports put out up to 5V at up to 2.4A. I say "up to" because the total output is a maximum of 4A, so if you plug in two high power modern cell phones, they will each get 2A instead of 2.4. This is a bit slower than normal, but still very good, and better than my other car chargers. They include a heavy duty 2 foot USB cable.I really like a couple of features:- It is very compact considering what it can do - basically it is as wide as it needs to be for three secure USB ports, and is only as thick as the car electric port. It also looks good, with a shiny finish. The USB ports are sturdy, and the entire device appears to be well built.- The charger is "smart", so you can plug in anything, from older 1A devices, to modern 2.4A phones, to quick charge capable devices. All of them are safe because the adapter detects the right voltage and amps for the connection.- The best feature of all is that it doesn't share charge capability between all three USB ports. It can charge the quick charge at full strength, AND two other devices. This makes it great for car use, where there is generally only a single charge port in the passenger cabin.The only thing to note is that they supplied two foot cable has a fairly bulky end due to the solid construction. A few devices are built for narrow MicroUSB connections. But you probably already have a compatible cable ready, so this is not a huge deal (and it fits most devices anyway)Summary: Powerful, with quick charge if needed - a great design. Highly recommended.Please note that I received this item free of charge, so I could review it. I did order through Amazon.

I didn't have a quick charger, and my HTC One M9 supports quick charge under certain circumstances, so I ordered this one. I find it to do a great job with charging or quick charging.The device is a bit bulkier than some of the wall chargers (wider than the OEM charger), but not overly huge. It puts out 5V / 2.4A (normal high power charger for most modern phones), as well as 9V / 2A and 12V / 2A (Qualcomm quick charge). It has smart circuitry that will detect if your phone is capable of quick charge, and is smart enough that even older phones will be charged correctly. In my case the smart tech worked well (the M9 only quick charges under 10%). I plan to use it for normal charging, since I don't think quick charging is very good for the battery life - and the M9 has a fixed battery that is not easily replaced.The only thing to note is that the supplied 2 foot cable has a MicroUSB end that is very well built, but bulkier than some OEM cables. I have a couple of devices that this won't fit, because the cable end is a bit too large. It does work on my M9, for example, but not on my MP3 player, which needs a thinner end connector.The only negative about this device is that the instructions are printed in tiny font - I had to use a magnifying glass to read them. But you won't need them anyway - this is truly plug and play stuff.Summary: A great and very reasonably priced quick charger. Highly recommended.Please note that I received this product free of charge so I could review it. I did order through Amazon.

It seems that everything these days uses a microUSB cable, and many of the smaller devices are no longer coming with cables or chargers, so I ordered this to have some ready for use. I find them to be well made, and to work well, but to have a large housing on the small end.The cables work fine - for charging, connecting, playing, etc. I had no issues at all with that. I like the number and lengths of cables, which will be very useful. Construction is great, with solid end pieces and good, strong cable ends.The only thing to be careful of is that the MicroUSB end is large. While this is good in terms of strength, some cell phones (or bulky cases) will restrict the opening somewhat. This is visible in the product pictures if you look closely - the width and depth is about twice the size of the connector itself. So you need to be sure that whatever you intend to connect has room around the MicroUSB connection for this cable. It will do great for many uses, but not if the area around the port is tight.Summary: Great construction and it works well, with a decent price for this many cables. Highly recommended - but check your device before ordering.Please note that I received these for free so I could review them. I did order through Amazon

This looked like a great device for getting my hair dry on cold days, so I ordered it. I find it to work fairly well on the lowest setting, but to be too loud and too breezy on the other two settings.The device is larger than it looks - I have big hands, and this filled them up. It features three speeds - low heat, high heat, and cool air. The air turbine is in the base of the brush. I found that the brush works pretty good for drying, but that the bristles are far apart - it won't really do fine separation. It works best on the low setting (see below).There are a whole bunch of things I don't care for:1. It is LOUD. I needed to capitalize that, because it is appropriate. This thing is going to be 6 - 10 inches from your ear, and it is as loud as a blow drier. The hot setting and cool setting both are so loud that I'm afraid of hearing damage. The low setting is loud, but acceptable unless you have sensitive hearing.2. The hot setting is too hot. The instructions say it is for thicker hair, but it would have to be very thick indeed for this not to overheat the scalp.3. It is bulky. It really is very large in the hand. I think that a blow dryer might be more efficient - hot air coming in while you use a comb or brush.4. Except on the low setting, it blows the hair everywhere. It is hard for me to imagine hair thick enough to use the "hot" or cold setting.Summary: It will work on low, and may be useful if you need to make sure your head is dry before going out in winter - but be careful of your hearing! Not really recommended.

I needed something to pick me up in the afternoons, and this looked good for a low carb beverage, so I ordered it. I find it to have a slight aftertaste, but with good ingredients, high protein and low carbohydrates.There are a bunch of things I like about this mixture. It has a good ingredient list - I'm not particular about my supplements being organic, but that is a nice touch. I also am not sure of some of the digestive blend components, but I will say it has no ill effects on my digestion (so maybe there is something to it). But what I really like is the low carb counts. They thoughtfully list the ingredients and analysis on the product page, so I won't reproduce it here, but this is great for the low carb eater. With this product I can feel OK about having a little indulgence in the afternoon.As for the taste, I don't care for it cold. About the only thing the chocolate flavor works in would be as a milk shake, using crushed ice to make a smoothie. They suggest adding it to a fruit smoothie, but that really would only work with strawberry - if you are going cold and want to blend that way, I think the vanilla flavor is the way to go.Drinking it hot is another story entirely. This makes a great substitute for those instant hot chocolate mixes that have a lot of sugar. It has a slight aftertaste, but I find that if I put about half a scoop into 10-12 ounces of fluid, it is actually just as good - and a whole lot better for you. Don't overdo the amount of powder, because after a certain point the aftertaste punches through in a powerful (and not so pleasant) way. If you want to try my favorite, mix it with black Lipton tea; this is my relaxing drink in the afternoon.Summary: If you don't overdo the amount, this has an acceptable taste - and very low carbs. Highly recommended.

This is a nice piece of jewelry and makes a great gift. The finish is much lighter than the product page - it is entirely silver in color, not silver over black. I would actually have preferred the contrast, but this one looks good even shiny.  I like that it is not solid - the rear is hollow - because that keeps the weight lower, but still provides a solid look. The look is not as "Celtic" as some jewelry I've seen, but I suppose it is the shape of the cross itself that is Celtic - the design (which is exactly as seen in the picture) doesn't really feature Celtic loops.The pendant is made in China, not unexpected at this price point.Summary: A nice gift for the religious person in your life. Highly recommended.

I check my sugar levels daily, so I was intrigued by this meter. I find it to work really well, with or without the great phone integration.The meter is built for the iPhone/iPad, but there is an Android app available on the Play store that works quite well. I like the way it works; you pair the meter via Bluetooth, then take a picture of the test strip container - the meter then makes all the adjustments and entries necessary. No more ensuring the codes are entered right! The test strips are good for 90 days after opening. The meter recharges with a standard microUSB charger (used with most phones, so you will have one available); they include a cord but not a charger. The meter comes with a case, 50 strips, a lance device, spare lancets, a test solution, and the meter itself.Here are some notes:- The meter is accurate, based on comparisons with my OneTouch. I trust the numbers. Also, I find this meter easier to use, because when you insert the strips, it doesn't time out as rapidly (my OneTouch would often time out while I was getting the sample - what a mess!).- Along the same lines, the lance device is the best I've used. It still hurts a bit, but nowhere near as bad as the OneTouch device. Also, it looks very modern and cool. There is logic behind the design, and the button to use the lance is easy to push. Plus, it is easy to ready the lance for use. This is almost as great an improvement as the meter itself.- Please, please, DON'T prick your finger tips to get samples! The side of your finger works just as well, and is far less painful. I put a small rubber band around the base of my finger (gently), which helps get the blood sample.- The sample size is .7 microliters, which is a bit larger than my OneTouch meter (at .5 microliters). I don't really notice the difference, and the strips have worked every time - the OneTouch sometimes malfunctioned.-The app can keep track of your readings by uploading, but the phone doesn't have to be connected for the meter to work - it stores 500 readings.- The test strips are absolutely cheap compared to the OneTouch - 100 strips are 20 bucks for these, whereas they list for 70 bucks for OneTouch (although there are generic strips for the other meter). If you use insurance this won't matter, but for those buying their own supplies, these are a much better value.Summary: An excellent value, a great app, an accurate measure - a great choice all around. Highly recommended.

I have the Adventure Time Fluxx game, so I ordered this to see if it improves the play. I find it to be a good addition to the Fluxx game, with nice randomness.The add on consists of two new dice, a "meta rule" card that supplements the basic rules (if the players agree), and four event cards. As is usual for this game, the results on the game play are way larger than the components. If you run across the new cards, you have to roll the dice accordingly, and it adds a nice additional set of wackiness to an already zany game. Instructions are sparse (normal for this game), but it is easy to use.Summary: A nice add on to the basic game. Let the craziness commence! Recommended.

I needed a sleeve for my 15 inch laptop, so I ordered this one to try it out. I find it to provide good scratch and basic protection, but not impact protection.This is just what it says, a Neoprene sleeve. The zipper works great, and my HP laptop fits fine. The material is thin, and there is no padding built in. I think this provides decent protection for a laptop inside a backpack, but I would not recommend this as an only protection. It will keep the dust out, that is about all. But it works about like I expected; I bought it for a laptop backpack, and it works well in this use.Summary: If you want a bit of protection inside the backpack, this will do the job. Recommended as a supplemental case, not as a primary case.

I like to give the dogs some variety in their kibble, so I ordered this one.The dogs seem to like this kibble; they went to it immediately and ate it down. No problems with taste! I like the analysis, which includes only a couple of things that are not necessarily on the recommended daily nutrient list - that is better than some other brands that look like the analysis of a multi-vitamin for humans. So far the dogs have not had any digestive problems with this brand.Cost is about 40% more than store brands, but if you can afford it, this seems to be a good choice.Summary: A nice ingredient list, with dog approved flavor. Highly recommended.

I needed a converter to go to my old monitor, so I picked this one up. I find it to be simple to use, and to work well.The device is super easy to use - just plug in the DVI-D connector to your computer, then plug in the 15 pin VGA from your monitor. That's it. It just plain works.The real mystery to this adapter is the 3.5 mm cable they included. The DVI plug also has an input for a microUSB. Neither of these connections has anything to do with 15 Pin or DVI-D connections, and there were no instructions. The answer is actually pretty simple - this DVI-D part is used for other installations, specifically for DVI-D to HDMI - and HDMI carries the audio signal, so that port is explained. I still have no idea why there is a MicroUSB port on there, but in any case it all works. The ports are there because the manufacturer uses this same plug on DVI-D to HDMI cables.Note that it will also work with a DVI-I connector, and that the connector will work with a "full" DVI video card (although this is unnecessary because normal 15 pin VGA will not go to the ultra-high resolutions supported by "full" DVI).Summary: Ignore the extra cables and enjoy the adapter! Highly recommended.

I have been using a mortar and pestle to grind my seasonings, so I decided to try out one of these style grinders. I find it to do a decent job grinding leafy items, but to be less useful for things like allspice, cloves, etc.The device works as shown in the product page pictures, with a bunch of parts that screw together. The actual grinding is done by the very top, which has a magnetic closure. The top part has teeth that go in between the teeth right below it; the motion as you turn the lid causes the grinding motion. Unfortunately for my intended use, the teeth are so close together that I was unable to grind the spices (primarily cloves) that I like - they won't fit between the teeth, so the lid won't come down. However, the device does a good job of grinding weeds, which can be compressed down as you close the lid. I don't do "Weed" (presumably meaning marijuana) or tobacco products, so I can't speak to how well that works.Construction is excellent, with solid metal parts all around. It is built to last.Summary: Good for leafy products, but not so much for kitchen use. Recommended.Please note that I received this for free so I could test and review it.

I have a couple of area around the outside that need a bit of extra light at night, so I ordered these to try them out. I find them to be easy to install, to look good, and to work well for spot lighting.The lamps are very basic - just an "AA" sized battery attached to a photo collector (with a light sensor so that it works only at night), and a single on/off switch inside. You mount the light (or turn it off/on) by removing the clear plastic portion, which snaps off. It mounts with two screws (provided). The light is weather resistant because the main housing is of single piece construction at the top, and the light mounts below that. I expect it to be fine in an outside location.I find that it produces a fairly small amount of blue light - just about right for highlighting an entry way or walkway, but really better as an accent light than as a primary light. The photo sensor works very well; it only comes on at night.The only thing to note is that most installations will have this somewhere under the eaves of the house - and you need a good six hours of sunlight for a decent charge. Mounting under the eves will limit the sun exposure. I have not seen it run out of juice at night with my 1/2 day sun mounting position. However an optimal mounting would be away from the house proper, to get more sunlight.Summary: It looks good and provides a nice light. Highly recommended.Please note that I received this free of charge so that I could review it.

It is dark when I walk in the winter mornings, so I ordered this to provide some safety. I find it to be very comfortable, with good adjustments and great visibility.The vest is exactly as shown in the product picture, except that the color is more like the band instead of the belt pictured - it tends towards a greenish hue instead of yellow. This color is commonly used in some fire departments because it is so visible and obnoxious. The belt is reflective and very easy to see. As for comfort, it has adjustments for the belt and both shoulder straps - I found that they were just about the right length for my six foot height. The ankle strap has velcro closure and works fine.You should note that the belt is very elastic, so if you don't like that sort of feeling, this would not be the belt for you.Summary: Comfortable and visible. You will be seen in this one! Highly recommended.Please note that I received this item free of charge, so I could test and review it.

I have big mitts instead of fingers, so I was pleased to be able to try out this pen. I find it to work fine both as a stylus and as a pen, but to have a rather inconvenient cap.The pen is pretty much as shown on the product page - one end has black ink and the other has an interesting stylus with a flat plastic disc on the end. I was a bit surprised at the stylus end, but it did work very well, and with that plastic tip it definitely has not chance of scratching the screen. The pen is a standard ball point, and it lays down ink well. They provide a spare ink refill with the pen (a nice touch).There are two things that I would prefer to be different. First, there is no pocket clip, so it is not convenient to carry this around except in a case. Second, both caps unscrew instead of pull off. This is a bit less convenient to use - I'd like a pull off cap better. This design ensures the caps won't come off while stored, but having to unscrew them take too long for me.Summary: If you need more precision in working with your phone, this one will do the job. Highly recommended.Please note that I received this product for free so I could test and review it. I did order through Amazon.

I hate to use pockets when walking, so I ordered this belt to check it out. I find it to be well designed and comfortable to wear, with good weather resistance.This is a nice belt for use when exercising outdoors. It has a large plastic clasp closure, and is adjustable on both sides. There are two zippered pocket areas - one 6.5 inches long and the other 9.5 inches long. Both pouch areas are lined with waterproof material and expand in height, but you should note that the zipper is nylon, and therefore not entirely waterproof. However, I think that this will provide good protection in weather - just don't use it for water sports. I found that my HTC One M9 (in an Otterbox defender case) would only fit in the wider pouch. The belt is comfortable around the waist.The only thing to note before ordering is that the belt is elastic and not fixed. If it bothers you to have an elastic band around you when exercising, this isn't the model for you. For me, it works great.Summary: A really useful belt to carry those few essentials when exercising. This is going with me whenever I walk. Highly recommended.Please note that I received this for free so that I could review it. I did order through Amazon, and the order process was fine.

I needed a bag to protect my ultraportable, so decided to try this one. I find it to have an innovative design, to be very well constructed, and to provide good protection.The bag has a single large compartment that easily fits my 13 inch ultra, with two smaller pockets that will (just barely) hold my power cord and a few other items. I really like the way it is made - all the seams are double sewn, and while the zippers are nylon, the handles are metal and it zips well. The padding is not thick, so don't expect this to do a lot of protection against  drops, but for basic carrying, it is convenient to use and lightweight.When I first looked at this bag, I thought it had a major design fail - the handles are attached to the inside of the bag instead of the outside! That means it won't zip completely closed. I think this is actually the intended design, and it is a quirky touch that is actually pretty cool. I also recognize that this design allowed them to have stronger handle connections and a cleaner look for the exterior. But for a little more dust protection while carrying, I think I would have preferred to have exterior handles.The only thing I would change is to make the outside zippers into a single larger compartment, to make it easier to carry a power brick.Summary: If you need light protection, this is a good choice. Highly recommended.Please note that I received this product free of charge so I could test and review it.

You can never have too much power for today's portable devices, so I ordered this one. I find it to produce very good output, and to be easy to use, but  to be a bit heavy to carry.The device will accept input from modern 2 amp chargers (I used a lower 1 amp), and it outputs a total of 3.5 amps. Most modern devices use 2 amps to charge, which means that if both ports are in use, they will get 1.75 each, but still charge. For best results, I would use this for a single device unless absolutely necessary. To recharge your phone, simply plug in the cord and press the button. Simple and efficient. With this much power, I can recharge my phone over 5 times before I have to plug in the battery again! This would be great for school use.The only downside to this model is that it is pretty heavy.
