The side zipper should go all the way into the arm hole.  That would make it MUCH easier to get the dress on.2) It runs small.  In most dresses like this one, I wear a size 2-4.  I ordered this dress in a size 8, thinking I would need to alter it.  It fits, and is a TINY bit big under the arms, but the dress actually fits.  I would be VERY careful to order a size (or two or three!) larger than you actually wear.This is a great dress, but be aware of its zipper and size "issues."

When I ordered this sign as a gift, I anticipated getting a sign that was flimsy metal, but I was VERY, VERY wrong.Only 48 hours after I pushed "submit order," I came home to a fantastically wrapped package on my front porch.  The way the package was taped, it looked professional, orderly, and as if it was packaged to protect precious cargo inside.Once I opened the package, I was pleasantly surprised to find a heavy-duty metal recreation sign that measured 16" x 20," and which was packed inside plastic again.  The sign is in fantastic condition and is a nice, heavy-duty metal with a baked-on pain coat.  It is beautiful.The seller very effectively and professional included his contact information should I have any questions or issues.All-in-all, this was a fantastic purchase!

I first bought these "Ultomato Cages" four years ago, after having struggled with multiple other varieties of tomato cages.  I LOVED that these cages broke down into small pieces, which made them MUCH easier to store, AND I loved that I could personalize how close-together the horizontal supports were.  They were fantastic for the first two seasons, but then fell apart.  Please read below.~~~~PROS~~~~~ Tall, Five-Foot Stakes-- the height of these cages means that I can bury the first six inches or so (for support/strength) and still have PLENTY of height for my tomatoes to grow with support.  Each cage comes with three stakes, each of which are steel stakes coated in a thick plastic coating.~ Sturdy Supports-- each cage comes with nine plastic support clips that can be placed anywhere on the cage that works for that plant.  For bushier tomatoes, I always put the clips closer together near the bottom of the cage, while for leggier tomatoes, I spread them out more.  The GOOD thing is that you can buy extra supports, so you can add as many as you would like.~ Easy-to-Store-- Because this cage breaks down completely, it is VERY easy to store for the winter.~~~~CONS~~~~~ Begins to Crack After One Season, and to Break After Only Two Seasons--  The plastic coating on each stake began to crack at the end of the first season, and by the end of the second season, the steel was VERY rusty and VERY fragile.  The ends had broken off of eight of my twelve stakes by the time I set them up for the third season, and most were in five or six pieces by the middle of season three.~ The Ends Bend Easily-- Despite being made of steel, the ends bend easily, which makes it hard to push these into hard soil.I would absolutely recommend these supports as long as you don't expect them to last season-after-season.

This is a beautiful sweater, with a gorgeous silver sheen (that is not "flashy" or too "Vegas"), nice knit, and nice length.  It is not cropped, so it is appropriate for women who want a little modesty.This sweater does fit a bit on the large side, however.  I am 5'8" and a size 4, and ordered the size medium.  It is huge on me.  Usually, size medium sweaters are a bit baggy on me, but this sweater is huge on me.Also, one does need to be prepared for a few other "features" of this sweater.1) The sweater has a medium-loose knit, so it might be slightly too "see-through" for some women's tastes.  This can be easily remedied with a camisole underneath the sweater.2) In the back of the sweater is a large large cut-out area that might hit some women right around their bra strap.  That might not be a problem for some women, but might bother others.Overall, I think this sweater is beautiful and I do recommend it.

Caroline Kennedy's anthology begins with the perfect message-- "There's a poem to celebrate every moment in life."  Boy, is there ever!  Kennedy continues with her justification for why we should memorize poems-- "Poets distill life's lessons into the fewest possible words.  But those tiny packages of words contain worlds of images and experiences and feeling.  If our circumstances change and things seem to be falling apart, we can recall a poem that reassures us.  If we find ourselves in unfamiliar or frightening surroundings, a poem can remind us that others have journeyed far and returned safely home.  If we learn poems by heart, we will always have their wisdom to draw on, and we gain understanding that no one can take away."This book is packed full of around 100 poems, all perfect to "learn by heart," appropriate for children (and adults!) of all ages.~~ "Poems about the self" include "from The World is Round" by Gertrude Stein, "Don't Worry if Your Job is Small" by Anonymous, and "If" by Rudyard Kipling.~~ "Poems about family" include "The Parent" by Ogden Nash, "Herbert Glerbertt" by Mary Ann Hoberman, and "Ballad of Birmingham" by Dudley Randall.~~ "Poems about friendship and love" include "The Dream Keeper" by Langston Hughes, "Liberty" by Janet S. Wong, and "He Wishes for the Cloths of Heaven" by William Butler Yeats.Other sections of this book include:~ Poems about fairies, ogres, and witches~ Nonsensical poems~ Poems about school~ Poems about sports and games~ Poems about war~ Poems about nature~ "Extra credit"Sprinkled throughout the book are also some adorable, calming illustrations that beautifully accompany the text.The poems in this anthology are a fantastic, yet somewhat eclectic, mix of poems that will make you smile, make you cry, make you sigh, and make you squirm.  The anthology's poems are "classics" and "neoclassics," narrative and lyric, free verse and structured.  Overall, though, the poems are lovely.  Simply lovely.

I am a labeling fanatic and thus go through A LOT of tape and A LOT of batteries.  Even using rechargeable batteries in my two P-Touch printers was costing me a fortune, so I purchased this AC adapter.While using the AC adapter does mean my P-Touch is less portable, it also means it is saving a major headache-- running out of batteries mid-labeling-- and a fair amount of money in batteries.The cord on this AC adapter is nice and long-- about 5 or 6 feet, so it is more than feasible to plug it in and work at a desk.The connection on the adapter is nice and tight, and the plug is, as well.  I have run into ZERO problems with the adapter falling out of the device or the wall while I am happily labeling. :)I have now used this adapter in two of my three P-Touch label makers (1280 and 1280SR), and it works beautifully.  It does NOT fit my super-old P-touch labeler (1800?).  ***I would advise double-checking your model against the list of compatible models here on Amazon and/or on Brother's website.***

This lock box is very heavy-duty for residential use, and feels quite substantial.  It is easy to install with the four included screws that get screwed from the inside, and also easy to set the code (but be sure you are setting it in good light!  The arrows are hard to see if you are in poor light).  As for ease of initial use, this box earns an "A."You may use any code you desire, but need to be aware that the order in which the numbers are punched is insignificant because a code of 1-2-3-4-5 can be entered as 5-3-4-1-2, 3-1-4-5-2, or any other such combination.  This does decrease the security a bit, but not significantly. As for security, this box earns a "B."The interior box is very small, probably only large enough for a house key or two (I doubt any modern car keys will fit), but that's adequate for this box's purpose.  The keys can be hooked to the cover of the box, which helps keep keys from being lost.  As for size of the box, this box earns a "B+."

When my hair stylist pulled this product out for use on my very fine, very damaged, very frizzy, slightly wavy hair, I was quite surprised.  While my hair has definite waves (that does form some actual curls if allowed to full air dry without brushing), I wouldn't consider my hair "curly," and the label of this product clearly reads, 'For Curly Hair."When the stylist applied this cream, and then used a diffuser to gently dry my hair, while using only her fingers to separate my hair, I saw how fabulous this product is.  My waves never looked better, my frizz was almost non-existent, and my hair was shiny.  It was amazing!This cream is not too thick or sticky, so it works on hair that is fine and/or only wavy.  It doesn't weigh down the hair too much, nor does it leave the hair with that "wet" look that some curl enhancers do.  Instead, it lightly coats the hair and leaves it soft, controlled, and pretty.  It doesn't leave hair looking overly styled at all (which is a good thing, in my not-so-humble opinion!).After seeing how fabulous this product was in the salon, I bought a bottle for home.  It works well there, too, but without the top-of-the-line blowdryers and the professional expertise, I cannot get my hair to look as great as it did in the salon.  It still looks good, though, when I use the MoroccanOil Curl Cream!

I ordered these buzzers for use in my classroom, for use with a "quiz show" style review game (an alternative to standard reviews we use).  I liked the idea that these BOTH make noise AND light up; that makes it easier to determine who answered first!These four buzzers light up in different colors and make different sounds.~~ Green makes a "laser" sound~~ Red makes a siren sound~~ Yellow makes a buzzer sound~~ Blue makes a "Charge!" soundThe noise level is medium.  They are loud enough to be heard, but not so loud that they will disturb classes that are nearby.The buzzers each take two AAA batteries (not included), which are housed in a small battery compartment on the back of the buzzer.  In order to insert or change batteries, it is necessary to unscrew a teeny-tiny screw (I'd recommend a glasses screwdriver or a precision screwdriver set).  Amazon sells rechargeable AAA batteries for CHEAP, which is what I used.My only complaint about these buzzers is regarding the green buzzer.  The "laser" sound is similar to a digitized, video-game gun.  I just don't think that is appropriate for use in a school.  Perhaps I am being too cautious, but I will not use that buzzer in my own classroom due to concerns regarding its inappropriate-for-school nature.

First of all, I LOVE the color of these running shorts.  They are a very bright blue, and are quite pretty.  They have a white accent on the side, but the overwhelming color is a bright, cobalt blue.I ordered these shorts to wear under some of my running skirts that don't have shorts/bloomers attached. These shorts are perfect for that application. I don't think I'd wear them on their own, but that's because I like a little more coverage (I'm fairly modest) when out running, and these shorts are very, very short.The fabric from which these shorts are made is comfortable, and the shorts are quite comfortable to wear. No matter what I did, I couldn't get these shorts to ride up, either. That's a VERY good thing! It is unbelievably annoying to be wearing running shorts that ride up.I am a size 4-6 and ordered these shorts in a size medium, which is the perfect size for me. They fit exactly as I would have expected.

This dog food, which is composed of a rather large kibble, smells absolutely horrible to me, but my dog loves it.  Her main food is Merrick, but at pushing $2/pound, it is quite expensive.  Therefore, I purchase a second bag of food and mix it into the Merrick, which makes my dog very happy (she seems to like the selection!), and also makes my bank account happy.My latest "mix food" was this Science Diet Adult Large Breed Dry Dog Food.  It is only rated with 2.5 stars on the rating scale I have referenced for the past five years, but I am okay with that because it isn't the only food my dog is receiving.  The main reason for the lower rating is that this food is more heavily plant-based than meat-protein-based, which is not necessarily a good thing for dogs, an animal that needs a meat-based diet.My dog LOVES this food.  In fact, she picks out all of the Science Diet kibble first, and eats it before she eats her Merrick.  She eats the Science Diet, then looks at her bowl, then at me, then back at her bowl, as if she is trying to say, "PLEASE, may I have more of this food?"I have noticed that this food must have more filler than the last "mix food" I purchased for my dog, because her waste production has significantly increased since I began giving her this food.  That's not a great change, but I can deal with it.Overall, I'm happy with this food for my dog.  She likes it AND my wallet likes its price.

My daughter has several of these sets and she loves them. Far better then Fisher Price's line as these sets have so much more to do and numerous more features. Set is also very sturdy... will take considerable toddler-abuse. Highly recommended.

I originally wasn't expecting this to work, but it actually works very well. My wife and I have wine from time to time and use it often in cooking. This gadget simply attaches to the bottle, pierces the cork with a needle, then pour while pressing the button to pressurize the bottle. The pressure forces the wine out through the needle, however the flow through the needle is considerably slower then when popping the cork. I've used it three times already, and it works as expected.
Nice playset... my daughter has been enjoying it so far. Placing the Flipsies on various points throughout the set causes them to 'talk'. Well-built, sturdy toy... should last quite some time.

My kids have a few Uncle Milton items in their rooms, so I figured this would be a nice addition to my 10-year old daughter's room.It was a bit smaller then I expected, but worked out just fine. Comes with a 14" x 3-1/2" sign that's mounted to a backlight. The backlight sticks out a bit, causing the sign itself to be about 2-1/2" from the wall.The letters are stickers, so they went on just fine. They're somewhat removable, so corrections are possible. The part I didn't like about it were the decorations for the border... nice idea but poorly implemented. The plastic decorations are attached to the sign via tiny glue dots. Getting the tiny glue dots off the paper, then removing the paper on the opposite side as well, all while trying not to touch them too much was the worst part of the assembly. The adhesive reduces in strength every time it's touched, so we lost a few dots during construction. Even when properly attached, they won't stand up to much handling. This was certainly no project for a 10 year old as even I was having trouble with it. They could have saved a lot of trouble by simply making the dots bigger...Once it's on the wall, it works fine. When you press the sign, it lights up and goes through a cycle of multiple colors. Kids will have to be very careful when turning the sign on and off as to not knock off any of the fragile decorations.It's not very bright... wouldn't recommend this as a nightlight, if anyone is considering it. It lights up no where near as bright as the pictures above suggest. In a pitch black room, the ends of the sign are a bit dark, but the name is still visible.Lastly, this does not have an auto-off option, which can be good or bad, depending on how you plan to use it. Personally, I'm glad it doesn't have an auto-off feature as I hate wall decorations that are only nice to look at for 15 minutes before requiring you to reactivate them. My daughter has had this sign illuminated for three days straight and it's still shining brightly.Overall, it needs to have bigger glue dots and a slightly brighter light would have been nice, but otherwise it's a nice sign.

I got this to replace an old Briggs & Stratton 2000-watt generator I've had for about 20 years. It's amazing what 20 years can do... the Generac generator is so much more 'friendly' to use. Quality and construction is top-notch... I was not expecting this kind of quality is a sub-$1000 generator... very impressive.Adding oil is simple... remove the cap and screw in the included threaded funnel and just poor the oil it... super easy. I filled it up with gas, gave it a few pulls, and it started right up. It's also unbelievably quiet... at idle, the noise is muffled so well, you can barely hear it 50' away. It gets louder as the power draw is increased, but still quiet enough that I would use it at night without concern for waking the neighbors.It offers gauges for fuel and power output as well as a display for run time remaining. LED status lights show ready, overheat, overload, and low oil indicators. It ran great under the load of a few lights as well as a few moderately-powered tools.My only complaint is it would not run any higher-powered tools I have, such as 15-amp saws. Of course, this generator is rated for 1600w, with a max output of 2000w for startup, and a 15-amp (1800w) tool is 200w higher then the generator's rating, but my old Briggs & Stratton generator has the exact same specs and I didn't have any trouble running my 15-amp circular saw off it. I can't really hold it against the generator though...I mainly wanted it for an emergency use and camping, so the power output is perfectly fine. I'm very happy with it.

A great, simple case... not as bulky as other OtterBox cases I own, but still offers plenty of protection. I like the changeable inserts, but I do think they're very highly priced... $10 per pair, for pieces of cardboard seems a bit high to me.
A very nice keyboard case... typical Logitech quality. Fits my Samsung Galaxy Tab perfectly and works great. Cover provides a good deal of protection.

Reminds me a lot of the Fisher-Price Little People sets, as there are very similar features, however with this set, it seems that there's much less do to. The 'castle' is shaped like a castle, but functionally, it's mostly a bunch of windows. Requires a lot of imagination, I guess. My daughter didn't seem to like this as much as her Fisher Price and Vtech toys. This set is quite a bit cheaper though...

Pretty good quality... much better then I was expecting. We have a firefighter uniform from Melissa & Doug we got a few years ago and we were not impressed with the quality. This one seems much better, with a pretty durable helmet. Perfect fit for my five year old.

Like all my Canon printers, this was a very easy setup. The included guide takes you through setting up the printer, and everything worked perfectly. I had no trouble connecting to my wi-fi network and I was able to print within a few minutes.I previously had the Canon app installed on my phone from another Canon printer I own... it immediately saw the MG7720 and I was able to print from my phone very quickly. The options for printing are somewhat limited, but from my experience with other brands as well, it seems that's par for the course.Print quality is excellent... for the price of this printer, I'm really impressed. Very sharp and the colors are very accurate. The scanner also does a great job, even on photos.I have another printer from this line, the Canon PIXMA MG6820, which is one step down from this printer, however it terms of functionality and performance, this printer is miles ahead of the MG6820. Print and scan quality is far better. In addition, I also love having two enclosed paper trays rather then a single exposed tray... looks neater and the convenience, since I swap between two paper sizes often, is fantastic. I do miss the rear tray that many of my older Canons have, since it was great for quickly printing on a different type of paper, but the two trays and cleaner look of this printer make up for that.Ink does seem to go a bit fast though... I've printed several pictures and there seems to already be a dent in the ink supply. For some reason, it seems the newer Canon printers use a bit more ink... or the cartridges have a bit less. I have several older Canon printers, such as the Pro-10, MX892, and MG6220... all of which are able to print quite a few more photos before sustaining a 'dent' in the supply.Aside from that, I'm very happy with this printer. It's a really great printer for the price and a huge step up from the Canon MG6820.

Very good quality goggles... and versatile. Fits both my 10 year old and 5 year old. Has a LOT of adjusting room. The cushioning is very good and seals perfectly.One note though... the goggles I received are a bit different then what's pictured above. The lens that came with the one I received are mirrored (which looks really nice).

Very easy setup... just unpacked and plugged in, then followed the included instructions. It was connected in just a few minutes and I was able to connect to it through my computer and start printing. I haven't had a lot of success in the past with wi-fi printers, but this one was easy to get running.I installed the Canon Print Inkjet/Selphy was able to connect the printer to my smartphone, but it took a few tries for the app to see the printer. Once it was setup, I had no trouble printing photos directly from my phone. The options available for printing are pretty limited... the app is basically good for quick printing from your phone... if you want more control over the output, you'll need to transfer it to your computer.One complaint I have is the limited paper paths... it offers one exposed tray on the front of the unit, under the output tray. All my other printers have at least two trays... with only one, it severely limits the printer's versatility since you have to stop and swap out the paper. Since I often print both documents on 8-1/2"x11 paper and photos on 4"x6" photo paper, having to constantly swap back and forth is an inconvenience.Printing is pretty fast, but I'm not overly impressed with the quality of the photo printing. For the price, it's good, but compared to slightly higher priced Canon and Epson printers, the pictures aren't quite as sharp and the coloring seems somewhat off. I certainly wouldn't consider it 'bad', because again, for the price, it's quite good, however overall it's not overly impressive.Scan quality is also not overly impressive. I tried scanning in a photo and the quality wasn't quite what I was hoping for, especially when enlarging the size.I own a previous version of this model, the Canon MG6220, which at the time of purchase (two years ago) was in the same price range as this printer, but the MG6220 is an overall better printer in every way, in my opinion.Overall, it's a excellent document and graphics printer, although if you're planning on printing a lot of high resolution photos or you swap paper sizes often, I would recommend spending a little bit more... the next model up (Canon MG7720) is a big improvement.

Very nice case from Otterbox... fits my S5 perfectly and offers a lot of protection. I've been having trouble finding decent cases for my phone due to the S5's charging port cover... many cases make accessing the cover difficult. This case does not and allows easily accessing and opening of the cover.The case has a clear back and includes a heavy paper card with a design that can be placed behind the plastic for a unique look. What I like about this is that the card can be easily replaced with any other printed design or picture... simply use the included card as a template for cutting out the new design.The included card has a web address where you're suppose to be able to get more designs, but currently the webpage is not available.
I got this for my five year old, but it's a big big on her. Other then that, the coloring is a bit odd, but it's a great glove... nice quality, and don't require much breaking in.

It's amazing how small this USB memory is getting. The shorter design is a big help to be because I use them in primarily in two places... my car and my blu-ray player. The shorter length keeps me from having to worry about bumping them during use.Performance-wise, these are just as fast as my Corsair and SanDisk USB 3.0 drives.

I got this game mainly for my daughters who are huge fans of fantasy games which include dragons and wizards. Despite being far below the age suggestion on this game (10 and 5), both have a great time with the game and fully understood the rules and procedures for winning.Game play offers pretty basic rules and can be extended with more advanced rules. The game's man goal is to use your cards, which act as adventurers, to attack and kill dragons. Players can work together to kill dragons and share the loot, or kill them on their own, keeping all the loot for themselves.My kids ended up loving the game, however I personally didn't care for the 'negotiation' part. Although my kids understood the idea, it slows down the game, and not in a good way. Having to convince other people to allow you to have certain gems doesn't make a good aspect of a game in my opinion. Especially since there's a single black gem that's worth way more the rest of the gems... our first three game were close enough that the winners ended up being decided by the value of the black gem, so from then on, the fight for that gem became ferocious. It's rare that a compromise is met for the gem as others would prefer to see it sent back into the bag rather then be distributed to any single player. The last two games we played, we shuffled the loot and gave it out at random, leaving the negations out of the game. It's now our preferred style of playing.Overall, it's a fun game, with some tweaks.

Awesome watch... exact same size as the watch it's replacing (another Invicta I had for years). Not too big for me, but it is a bit larger then a standard men's watch.Clasp works perfectly... very secure. I had no trouble sizing the bad for my wrist myself. Been wearing it for a week now and I'm very happy with it so far.

I got this for my wife... a bit bigger and heavier then she's use to, but far from 'bulky'. She's fine with the size.The rose gold color is beautiful... very different from anything else she owns. The face is a nice vibrant white.Ended up bringing it to a jeweler to size the band... I've sized these before myself, but I was really worried about scratching the surface on this one. Overall, fantastic watch... works perfectly and looks great.

Interesting set for a younger fan of the Transformers. Ship offers a couple of features, such as an elevator, working crane, and jail cell. Set is a bit thin, but should hold up to kid's playing just fine. The included transformer, High Tide, converts into a submarine, however if I didn't read it, I would never have known... looks more like a space ship or futuristic car.This wouldn't be a bad set if it were much cheaper, however for the price, it's ridiculous. The inclusion of cardboard cutouts instead of actual figures was an incredibly bad idea... my kids don't even play with them. When I was a kid cardboard figures were considered unacceptable... with today's scrutinous kids, I'm not sure what Playskool was thinking...
Nice kit... much more interesting then I was expecting. There's a quite a bit of reading in order to learn how everything works, but it's done well, and kept simple for younger kids.

Easy to assemble out of the box. Overall quality is good, not great... plastic feels a bit cheap, but the construction is sturdy. The battery is very small and lightweight and the entire trimmer is incredibly light and easy to handle.Power-wide, it's 'ok'... I would say this is more medium-to-light duty. It cut through light grass with ease and the battery lasted long enough for me to finish my front yard. After recharging, I tried it on my backyard, which has denser grass and some weeds. The trimmer bogged down quite a bit and the battery didn't last nearly as long as with the front yard.Overall, it's a night lightweight trimmer, great for medium duty work and light trimming. If you have heavier grass or expect this to cut weeds, I wouldn't recommend it.

This is an incredible tool. My last oscilloscope, which I purchased in the early 1990's, was three times the size and twice the price, but can't touch this unit in terms of features and convenience. It's amazingly small. I've used this for various purposes so far, but mainly keep an oscilloscope around for automotive diagnostics. I've had it for a month now and it's worked flawlessly. I have it paired with my laptop via the USB cable and I can view and save data to my computer. I can also print output on my network printer. Amazing what a few years can do... this leaves my old oscilloscope in the dust.

I really had high hopes for this shaver, but so far I'm not overly impressed. I really liked the idea of the integrated trimmer and comb attachment... I currently have two separate tools that do the same job of this one. Unfortunately, although convenient, the rest of the shaver isn't impressive.Surprisingly, build quality is a bit poor... seems cheap, which I didn't expect coming from Panasonic. Although it's comfortable to shave with, it shaves no where near as close as my Philips shaver. Battery life is fine (although I always keep it on the charger) and the cleaning base works well.The comb attachment is fine, but for a close shave, this shaver just doesn't work as well as other shavers I've owned.
Perfect fit and very well designed. They go on easily and securely... almost no movement at all. They're very durable and will likely last a very long time.

Very good curling iron... feels really impressive and well-built. It have five levels of heating and keeps perfectly even temperature.Despite the quality, there are a few aspects that aren't particularly impressive. First, it's a bit larger then other curling irons and feels a bit cumbersome. Second, it has a couple of feet on the bottom so you can put the iron down between uses, but they're small and don't offer much stability.Third is the price... it's pretty expensive for what it offers, and comparing it to other curling irons I own. There are interchangeable barrels, which are sold separately at $85 each. These barrels are the main reason I would purchase this model, and adding barrels would make this iron very expensive.Overall, it's really nicely built and designed, but I wouldn't recommend it to anyone not interested in the multiple barrels feature.
Nicely made apron... a bit thin, but nice stitching and the print is very nice and unique. Pocket could be a bit deeper, in my opinion. Otherwise, works just fine.
Excellent gloves, pretty thick and durable. Nice cushioning inside.

Incredible watch. My current 'everyday' watch is an Invicta watch, with I've been very happy with for years. My watch always seems a bit heavy, weighing in at 5.5 ounces. This watch is huge, weighing in at 14 ounces. The size of the watch and band is also oversized, so be aware that the watch you're seeing in the picture above is not a 'normal' sized watch... it's quite big and bulky.Aside from its size, it's undoubtedly a beautifully designed watch. Aside from the time, it also displays the day of the week (Sun, Mon, Tues, etc.) and date of the month (day only, not the month). The orange braided wire really sets off the watch. Overall, it looks, and certainly feels like an extremely well-made watch.Frankly, although I really like how this watch looks, it's way too big and bulky for an 'everyday' watch. I'll likely just use it for special occasions.

Very solid and durable... top clamps down very securely. The bottom part is stainless steel, like description states, but the top is just insulated plastic. Despite this, it works extremely well and easily keeps food hot or cold, depending on your intention, for many hours. No problems at all...

I'm not a big fan of companies that copy successful products rather then coming up with their own idea. Although Terraria and Minecraft may have a different style of play, Terraria clearly copied the overall concept from Minecraft. The fact that the game is a rip-off is blatantly apparent in their toys... they're the same size and design as Minecraft and even the packaging is made to confuse anyone who's looking to purchase Minecraft toys and is not aware of the differences. My daughter, who is a Minecraft fanatic, gets Terraria toys from time to time from friends and family members who are not aware that they're different.That said, this set on its own is actually very nice. It's a very well-made toy, sturdy, and quite large. It has three levels and can be used with other biome sets that are sold separately. With a variety of figures, this can be a very fun set for kids. My daughter loves it, but uses it with her Minecraft figures. It really works just fine in either world...My biggest complaint is the price... VERY expensive for this set that only comes with ONE figure.
Great set... very durable and will take quite a bit of abuse. Assembles quick and easily out of the box. Lots of things to do to keep a young one busy for quite a while.

Very nice cleaning rod... spins incredibly smoothly and feels like a quality tool. Most importantly, it fits all my Hoppe's cleaning tips and accessories. My only complaint is that the original description (although changed on Amazon) and the case itself claims that it'll clean from .22 to .45 caliber... but it includes an attachment for only .45 caliber. You need to buy separate attachments for anything other then a .45. seems like a bit of a deceptive description to me...Other then that, it works perfectly.

On its own, it's completely uninteresting. You need to purchase other figures with 'memory spheres' in order to this to work, so it's nothing more then an add-on. Oddly, the Joy figure is included, but doesn't include her memory sphere! Seems like a huge oversight to me...

This is a decent set... nothing overly interesting. Although faithful to the movie, it's really just an empty truck. Where Lego is different as they would normally use artistic license to add something a bit more interesting to the set, Mega Bloks stuck with a more exact replica... which is better or worse, depending on your interpretation. Personally, I would have liked to have seen a bit more done with a set this size. Lego normally crams a lot of detail into every bit of space... this set seems to have a lot of bare and empty spots that just seem a bit 'boring'.My biggest complaint with Mega Bloks overall is their quality... Lego may be more expensive, but you know where the money is going when you compare the quality of the pieces side by side. Mega Bloks just doesn't compare... especially with the coloring, as pieces that are suppose to be the same color can often vary from piece to piece with Mega Bloks sets. Thankfully, this is almost unnoticeable with this set since it's made to look camouflaged.Lego aside, this is a pretty nice set on its own. It's pretty sturdy, especially compared to previous Mega Bloks sets I've owned. I think this set would stand up to childrens' play a bit more.Overall, this is a pretty good set, particularly if you're a fan of the movie. If you're heavy into Lego like me, you might get the feeling they missed an interesting opportunity to make this better...

This is replacing a Delta 50-850 1-1/2-horsepower dust collector I had for years... until stolen from my storage unit. This model is not quite as powerful as my last one, coming it at 1/2 horsepower lower less, and it certainly is noticeable as my last one was an absolute monster (I always believed it was powered by a miniature black hole). However, for my needs, it works just fine. It has more then enough power to be used at one or two stations at the same time.It's also a LOT quieter then my last unit... easily the quietest tool in my shop. When I first assembled it and powered it on in my living room, my kids barely even acknowledged it. My last dust collector would have had them running out of the room. It runs at 85 decibels, which is identical to my home vacuum.So far it works great... plenty of power and reasonably easy to empty. The stand is very sturdy and the upper bag is a nice heavy quality fabric which should last a very long time.

This is my first Hisense TV. At first I was a bit leery about how good it will be, replacing a 32" Samsung that works great, but I was pretty impressed with it out of the box. First, it looks good... certainly not cheaply made like some other off-brand manufacturers. I first mounted it on the stand, which was extremely sturdy for a relatively small stand with a TV this size. Afterwards, I mounted it on a wall with no trouble at all.Picture quality is pretty good out of the box, but it did have a bit more red then I preferred, so I adjusted it a bit, which I rarely need to do... not a big deal. Colors are nice and vibrant and the picture is very sharp. Extremely impressive for the price...The source menu looks a bit like Windows 8, but surprisingly I don't hate it.... works well for a TV. The remote is quite good... it's small enough that it fits in my hand perfectly, and is designed simply to control the TV and its many options, rather then them giving you an oversized remote that controls everything in your house. The remote is responsive and doesn't require you to point it directly at the TV to work... very user-friendly. I don't like the gloss black finish though... picks up fingerprints way too easily.The audio is quite good for a TV, especially these days when so little effort seems to be put into the sound quality on anything below top-range TVs.I'd love to give the TV five stars, but I did have a few problems with it. First, it connected very easily to my Vizio speaker system via optical cable, however when I setup my Verizon Fios remote to work with the TV, it also began controlling my Vizio speaker volume. Either Hisense and Vizio share the same codes, or the Verzion remote is the problem. Either way, it would work fine if it weren't for the fact that every time I change the volume, a pop-up appears, covering 1/5 of the screen, telling me I turned off the volume control on the TV... EVERY... SINGLE... TIME. It's incredibly annoying and I wish they would assume the user might not be an idiot and allow for turning this notice off. Unfortunately, after a short period of time, it became evident that there's a very slight, almost unnoticeable delay in the sound through the speaker which wasn't there with my last TV. Once I noticed it, it became a glaring flaw, so between that and the fact that the TV thinks I'm an idiot, I turned off the speaker and use the TV's built-in speaker.Second, I cannot connect to my home network. This is a result of a number of problems...1) I have two wireless networks connecting to my home network. The TV doesn't even see my main wi-fi network, which is supplied via my Verizon Fios router and which I can access on any wi-fi device anywhere on my property. This, despite the fact that I have an extender for this wireless service four feet from this TV. My cellphone has full strength when placed next to the TV and with the wireless extender turn off, it still has 70% strength. This TV cannot see it at all, with or without the extender.2) This TV sees my second wireless network, but cannot connect to it. It keeps telling me the password I entered is wrong, but I double checked the password on the router itself and even was able to successfully connect to the wifi network from my phone while standing next to the TV, so I'm not sure what the problem is here. I have never had any problems connecting any device to either of my wi-fi networks, so I can only assume it's the TV.3) When all else fails, plug an ethernet wire in and directly connect your network... except this TV doesn't even have a simple ethernet port! Huge oversight here...I'll be contacting customer support about the wi-fi issue and will update my review whether the problem is solved of not, but for now it's getting 4 stars. It's a great TV with a lot of features, while looking and sounding like a much more expensive TV. Unfortunately, my current issue negates half the features this TV has.

Excellent disposable gloves... greater durability then the Dynarex gloves I normally get. I use these mostly for lighter duty work, such as painting and handling chemicals, but they're durable enough for automotive work.

My daughter is a Minecraft fanatic... loves everything Minecraft. She already has a growing collection of mini figures and loves taking videos with her Kindle, so I figured this stop-motion set would be a good idea. She ended up loving it, and despite being only 5 years old (manufacturer suggests ages 6 - 12 years), she has no trouble creating videos with this set. This set works with all Minecraft mini-figures... the large figures are way too big.
Very high quality water bottle... should last a long time. Can't get it to spill if I tried. Intricate cleaning, but perfectly fine for just water.
This is one of the best toys I've seen from Leapfrog. Really nice quality and the songs seem endless (although that's not exactly a positive for parents). Includes quite a variety of foods.

Well-made, nice and small. Have had no functional problems with it so far. The only problem is the price seems very high for what you get. My main desk stapler is half the price, but bigger with rubber-coated sections. This stapler is just metal and molded plastic...

I'm not sure why these are marketed specifically for the Xbox, but I ended up getting these for my daughter for use with her Kindle. There are a lot of headphones in my family, all of which have their own specific purpose, so I've had a lot of experience with different style headphones at various different prices, from $20 all the way through to over $300.Out of the box, this set wasn't overly impressive. The ear pieces don't swivel very smoothly from the start, which affects how well they seal against the user's head. The headband is also pretty cheap looking and doesn't adjust particularly smoothly.When I ordered these headphones, I was concerned that they would be too big for my five year old's head, however they're a pretty small set. I don't have a large head and normally when I adjust a headset for my head, there's a LOT more room for larger heads. This set was only one notch from maximum size when I adjusted them for me, which is surprisingly small compared to all my other headphones. I am glad though, because at the smallest setting, they fit perfectly on my daughter's head. They're very lightweight and despite the headband, are pretty comfortable.Sound quality was great when I first tested it out on a phone call, but when I tried them for music and games, I was a little less impressed. Bass is decent, but the highs don't seem particularly crisp. I would compare the sound quality to roughly that of other headphone's I own which are half the price.The mic works great. I tested it out on a phone call and the other person said I sounded very clear. I really like how you can remove the mic when you don't plan to use it, rather then folding it away, although some people might have the opposite opinion since it could get lost easily.Overall, I don't like the headband and the sound quality isn't quite as good as it should be at this price, but the mic works great and it's pretty comfortable, so my daughter is very happy with them.

This is a Lego-clone that's similar in quality to Mega Bloks, however what sets this set apart from Mega Bloks, or even Lego themselves, is the light-up accessories you can add. A variety of standard Lego-style pieces are included, however they're all transparent. There's also a large number of clear tubes and blocks that have different color LEDs in them, which are attached in a non-standard way... just end to end plugs. When you add these LED pieces to a transparent structure, the entire model lights up.Very interesting set. Instructions included are similar is layout to Lego instructions... easy to follow, even for younger children.

Nice, lightweight cover. Easy to put on and secures tightly. It rained for two days after I put it on and the chair stayed dry, so it's working perfectly. It's ventilated on the back, but covered so that rain won't get in. Includes a pouch for storage.

I thought this would be a unique item for my daughter. It took eight tries before it properly set her voice password, and now she has to try anywhere from 10 to 20 times before it'll open for her. She doesn't seem overly bothered by that, but it clearly doesn't work as intended... the voice feature is nearly useless.It's also ridiculously easy to break into without damaging it... simply put your thumbnail into the right side of the safe behind the door and pull outwards 1/16"... pops right open. I know it's just a 'toy' but when I was younger, I had two toy safes... one tin and the other plastic. Both could be broken into without much trouble, but it would require actually damaging the safe. The Zillionz safe is so easy to break into, it's actually quicker breaking into it then using the voice feature, even if the voice feature worked every time.Overall, this voice activated safe fails at it's two main features... the voice activation and its ability to keep anything 'safe'.
Not too impressive of a camera out of the box... very cheap plastic. I had various issues getting it to connect, but ultimately it did finally work. Not nearly as clear as my other cameras.

Much stronger glove then I've used before. Great for automotive work where my old gloves would rip easily. The long length is also a big advantage as they protect further up my arm. There's a bit of sensitivity loss from the thicker material, but very minor and I certainly don't miss it.

This is a really nice set for a young toddler. As you'd expect from VTech, it offers a lot of sounds to go with the set, which is very customizable. The roads are like puzzle pieces and can be assembled in a variety of ways. The only problem is, it doesn't work well on carpeting.... the roads don't stay together very well. Works fine on hard surfaces.The age recommendation of up to 5 years is very optimistic, in my opinion. I don't think five year olds would be very interested in it.

These are a really nice pair of boxing gloves. They take a bit of getting use to in order to put them on and take them off, but they fit me perfectly. They're a bit stiffer then I'm use to, even for new gloves, but I'm sure they'll break in just fine.

This is a reasonably big set for a toddler. It has a lot of features, but most importantly there are no small pieces to worry about. Not much to lose or  choke on here. Not sure this would span all the way to a five year old as suggested, but it certainly is a great toddler toy.

I installed this under my TV in my bedroom. Installation was relatively easy and the shelf mounts very securely. The shelf itself is tempered glass with the underside painted black... it gives a very nice overall look. It also has a wire channel cover for hiding wires to and from the TV.The compartment under the shelf is a really good idea, but it might be a bit small for some. My Verizon Fios box fit perfectly, but I know other people with larger boxes that likely wouldn't fit. Opening is 19" wide by 2-1/8" high.My only complaint is the installation. Although the instructions are very good and explain everything, and the amount of included fasteners is great for a variety of mounting options, the setup expects you to either mount this to two studs or just one stud with added drywall attachments. The included drywall attachments are more like zip-tie meets molly bolts... you drill a hole in the wall, slide the device in, twist it, then pull the plastic tie tight. I really don't like these. They seem to work and are very easy to use, but they aren't easily reusable and aren't as tight as if the shelf was mounted to the wall with screws. With all the mounting options they give you, even including concrete anchors, I don't know why they just didn't include regular heavy-duty drywall anchors. After trying out the molly/zip-ties, I removed them and used drywall anchors I had, and it worked out better.Still, it's a pretty easy installation and mounts very securely. Looks great.

I bought this as a replacement for my Verizon FIOS backup battery. The original battery lasted over three years... this one lasted 8 months. The "Designed for long life: 6 - 8 years" statement is a joke.I finally contacted the company after a week of trying (even after a year, their website listed on the battery is not working) and they offered me a replacement, however I had to ship the battery back to them first at my expense. To pay $20 to return a $23 battery for replacement is ridiculous, so their "3-year replacement warranty" is absolutely worthless.

My five year old daughter loved the movie and was thrilled to get this character. Unfortunately, the button to get the doll to move and talk is too hard for her to push with her fingers. She has to place the doll on the ground and press with her palm. I've never seen a doll that required so much pressure to activate. Other then that, it's a nice doll, well detailed, and good quality.

It's a nice case that keeps your phone well protected. Easily one of the most durable cases I've seen for a phone, offering everything from drop protection to being waterproof. I have two main complaints that keep me from using this normally. First, the screen protection does reduce the screen's sensitivity quite a bit. I've adjusted the sensitivity settings, but it still requires a bit more pressure. I've used plenty of screen protectors before and never had a problem like this.Second, the actual case looks different then what's pictured. The actual case is a bit more shiny and looks like cheap plastic. Not impressive for a $70+ case.Overall, it will provide significantly more protection over that of a standard case, however at the cost of a less responsive phone. It's also overpriced for the quality you receive.
Very sturdy bench. Well built and much larger then I was expecting at 43" x 12-1/4". The foam padding is thick and dense, so it should last a long time.
Ok cable... works fine, but doesn't seem to be the same quality as other Belkin cables I have.

It's a nice snack box... sturdy and the lid snaps on securely. It includes a separate container that is stored inside the main container. My only complaint is that it's too small. I can't fit a sandwich in the box with the extra container in it without squishing the sandwich a bit. There is no room for a drink, so it's just for snacks, not lunches. Works fine in that regard, but the title is a bit misleading.

Very nice watch for the price. I love the blue accents. The clasp is a bit different then what I'm use to as it's hidden to make the band look seamless, but it works fine so far. Nice weight and feel... it's a pretty big watch.This watch offers the ability to monitor three different time zones... switching between the first and second with one of the knobs, and the third with the dial around the face of the watch.Overall, works great, looks great, no complaints...
Good fit, elastic openings seal you in well. I use these for drywall sanding as well as the once-per-year pesticide spraying of my property. Works perfectly.

Nice label flags... includes four labels per 4"x6" sheet. Had no trouble printing out flags with the downloaded template from Avery's website.Two complaints... first, the flags are pretty thin... about that thickness of regular address labels. Although they function fine, the price for just 24 labels is very, very high. You can get 350 Avery 5262 address labels which are nearly twice the height of these for less money. Cut them in half and you have 700 labels that are nearly the same size. The only thing missing would be the split tail, which can be copied with minimal effort and creativity.Second, the flags can be difficult to get on straight, and when they're not straight, it's very noticeable and doesn't look very good.Overall, they're good for a quick display, with a bit of patience getting them straight. If you don't mind a little extra work, you'll get a lot more labels for less money by being creative with other Avery products.

These are great light weight inserts that fit in many styles of shoes with ease.  I wear them in everything from boots to mary janes.  They are very comfortable, especially for standing and walking all day.  I love how light weight they are.  Most importantly, they keep my plantar fasciitis under control.  As a three pack, this is an awesome deal as I don't have to move them around very often.

The Kauai Coffee Coconut Caramel Crunch may be their most popular flavor but it tastes artificial to me.  I should have known better but I didn't see where the label says " with added natural and artificial flavors".  I even took it to work but no one wanted seconds....

Out of the multiple pairs of shoes we bought in the hopes of finding a pair that my dad could wear and easily slip on and off - this was the only keeper.  High quality construction - quality materials.  Nice design - Rockport has always been a very high quality brand.

This is a cute idea that's been executed with decent quality materials.  The back velcro closure could have been done in a better way and not all of the finishes scream "quality" but your kids won't know the difference.  It cam smooshed inside a box much smaller thanit is, so if you want it to look fresh and fluffy, you'll want to air it out before giving it as a gift.

This is a great book to read if you're new to the smart phone movement or are just switching to android from the iphone.  The chapters are laid out in easy to reference detail with all the side humor you'd expect from any "For Dummies" reference book.While a lot of the information is very basic how-to information (it IS for dummies, after all)  there are snippets here and there that are sure to school even the most adept user.  I learned something new about web browsing that will save me time every day.  I'm sure you'll find something new too.I think this book is best for new android users and first time smart phone owners.  If you're giving one as a gift, including this book may lessen the "start-up" time you'll have to invest getting your giftee set-up and running!

You may be familiar with Mark Lauren through another book he has written called "You Are Your Own Gym".  Like that book, this one is well put together in a format that is easy to read and easy to search.  He speaks from a lifetime of training special operations personnel and can be considered an expert on the topic.This book is written mostly for those who are seriously into training.  The idea of Body Fuel is that you cycle how you feed your body so that it is constantly getting what it needs without hitting a plateau common to most other diets.  I found this book to be very interesting as I have spent the better part of a year researching nutrition and was happy to see that he espouses a real food approach.  This approach to training isn't for everyone, but those who are accustomed to demanding and rigorous regimens will take to it very well.

These are good general purpose dishtowels.  They have a nice nubby texture that makes them great for polishing glasses or counter tops.  We have a ceramic stove top and they do a great job cleaning up the surface.  It's nice that they are while so that they can be bleached.  You get 4 good sized towel per pack.

I've already ordered a second one of these and am coming back to get a few more for a few friends at work who are also crazy cat ladies.  The price is SO worth it!  This is good quality plastic that is lightweight and easy to hang.  The bristles are hard and quite sharp.  You'll want to unclip it from the base when you hang it - otherwise it's pretty uncomfortable to press into place.I lost the hanging strips that must have come with it so instead I used Command strips because they are easy to install, are strong, and are removable.  There was a little bag of potent catnip in the box, but really it was unnecessary to get my cats interested in using this brush.  Our resident fluff-bottom spent a good deal of time having her way with it within minutes of it being installed.

The green color is a very neon (highlighter) green.  The entire pack is lightweight and constructed very well from quality materials.  There's extra padding on the back of the pack to protect your belongings, but it's not sufficient to protect your electronic gear.  You will want to put your laptop in some sort of padded sleeve first to keep the bottom and sides protected.It has various pockets and stash pockets to hold your gear, including a spot on the top to feed your headphones or earbuds through so you can listen while your gear is protected.  This bag will be reasonably water repellant but I wouldn't count on it in an extended downpour or any degree of submersion.  There are two net pockets on the exterior for water bottles and a plastic clip to attach a carabiner to for extended utility use.

This is a really well laid out Keto cookbook full of color photographs.  The authors make an effort to tell their own stories and how they came to live a Keto lifestyle.  This isn't meant as an introduction to ketogenics.  I find that it's a great supplement for those already on the path.There are a lot of creative and tempting recipes.  The first one we tried was Armadillo Eggs and it was a hit!  Many of these recipes are easy to adapt to different ingredients, which is nice if you have special needs.  I find them easy to understand and the majority of the ingredients are easy to find.I can say that since I've been following a Keto lifestyle that my autoimmune issues have quieted and I haven't felt this energetic for a couple of years.  Good stuff.

This is an attractive day planner that's about half the size of a sheet of copy paper.  It has a glued binding binding rather than a spiral binding and that makes me worry that pages may become loose over time.  It doesn't provide a flat surface for writing unless you press down to flatten it out - this will weaken the binding over time.It's set up with a new tab for each month.  These each have a dedicated 2 page spread.  In addition, behind each month, each week is laid out with plenty of space for notes.  There's also a ribbon to help you keep your place.  Thee are some extra note pages in the very back with some data charts providing the dates of holidays through 2019 and a map showing time zones.

Cute navy blue zipper case fits just right.  It has little interior pockets for earbuds or charging cable both inside the main compartment as well as the zippered side pocket.  The little drop handles are well made and are more than sufficient to carry a full case.  The interior lining is a soft red material that can act to clean the face of the device because it's so soft.  This looks cute with the pink device as well as the blue one.  Well constructed.

I love the way this smells on Mr. Pixels and Bits!  It does have a fresh clean scent that's perfect for daytime wear, but there's also an undertone of something almost musky about it.  It's actually pretty sensual, but maybe it's because it's my man wearing it.  Burberry is all about the classics and this fragrance delivers that on all levels.At the time of writing this review, there was no volume or size information available on the page.  For reference, this is a review for the 100 ml (3.3 fl oz) bottle.  The packaging is well designed and the bottle is very attractive (better in person).  This would make a great gift.

This is a fairly easy to read dual biography of both Alexander Hamilton and Aaron Burr.  The author takes great pains to describe the circumstances of their births, political lives and deaths.  It helps if you have an interest in American History and general understanding of the climate surrounding events associated with the American Revolution, as well as the key players shaping events.  John Sedgewick does a great job humanizing the people and events leading up to and surrounding this infamous duel and takes pains to explain points of view, motive and local custom.The book is sectioned into four main parts with associated chapters.  These include:Part One - The Roots of Hatred1.  In the Hands of an Angry God2.  Contentment3.  Platonic Love is Arrant Nonsense4.  The Prodigious Glare of Almost Perpetual Lighting5.  Refinement6.  In The Roseate Bowers of Cupid7.  Six Slayloads of Bucks and Belles8.  Holy Ground9.  A Fever for War10.  Liberty or Death11.  When in the Course of Human Events12.  The Malcolms13.  A Lady with a Beautiful Waist14.  Beauty is Woman's Sceptre15.  The Schuylers16.  But a Single Word, Burr17.  A Little Sorceress18.  In Ill Humour with Everything but TheePart Two - The Battle is Joined19.  Commentaries on the Laws of England20.  Children of a Larger Growth21.  Come my Charmer and Relieve Me22.  You Will Become All That I Wish23.  Two Men of Politics24.  A Dreaded Dilemma25.  To A Mind Like His Nothing Comes Amiss26.  Another Long Nose27.  And We Had A Bank28.  Botanizing29.  Embryo-Caesar30.  Other Than Pecuniary Consolation31.  Sober Among the Drunks32.  I Have Been So Cruelly Treated33.  Louis Capet Has Lost His Caput34.  The Best Woman and Finest Lady I Have Ever Known35.  Root Out the Distempered and Noisome WoodPart Three - To the Death36.  To Fight the Whole Detestable Faction37.  The Bubble of Speculation is Burst38.  An Absolute and Abominable Lie39.  Strut is Good For Nothing40.  The Lady in the Well41.  The Fangs of Jefferson42.  The Gigg is Up43.  Damn'd Rascal44.  Tant Mieux45.  A Still More Despicable OpinionPart Four - And Then There Was One46.  Have No Anxiety About the Issue of This Business47.  A Good Many Incidents to Amuse One48.  Motives of Profound Political Importance49.  A Terrible Whirlpool, Threatening Everything50.  A Slight Expression of Contempt51.  H.G. Edwards52.  In the EndEnvoiAcknowledgementsNotesBibliography

This watch is more impressive in person.  Like a lot of other Invicta watches, it's huge and it weighs a lot, thanks in part to the stainless steel housing.  You'll definitely know you're wearing it.  Mr. Pixels & Bits is a big guy (over 6 feet) and this watch looks stunning on him.  The face of the watch nearly covers the entire expanse of his wrist (Invicta says it's 48.5 mm).  The leather strap is long enough to fit his wrist with 3 holes to spare.I was curious how it would look in the rose gold tone and I have to say that I'm a fan because of the way it complements the brown strap.  It almost comes off as a light brown tone.  This watch looks amazing paired with browns and neutral colors.  I think it looks especially smart with dark brown dress pants and coordinating tie.(Mr. Pixels and Bits is something of a clothes horse.)I don't understand why they paired a leather strap with a dive watch, but this one is good up to 100 meters (300 feet).  It's nice to know that an aquatic emergency or accident (or more likely, an accidental dunking or submersion) wouldn't ruin the timepiece, but it's otherwise impractical for that purpose unless you change the band.  Some of the other features include:*  Dual time zone capability (to toggle between)*  There's a calendar that displays the day as well as the date.*  There's a 24 hour dial as well as a prominent second hand but the bezel is stationary and does not turn.*  It glows in the dark, just as you'd expect.*  It has a Swiss quartz movement on board to ensure that it keeps accurate time for years to come.*  It has a battery on board that keeps it charged.It's a good looking timepiece presented in a beautiful yellow Invicta box - perfect for gift presentation.

The serving size is large - 4 tablespoons.  I use it in a breakfast smoothie but I usually keep it down to a single tablespoon.  It's pretty gritty and easily overwhelms the mix texture.  The flavor is sort of a "green" nutty effect,This is a good way to add additional protein to your diet.  This powder is derived from shelling hemp seeds.This variety is Non-GMO, Vega, Gluten Free and Organic.

These are very thick commercial grade exam gloves.  They are textured to enhance grip and are powder free.  They are 8 mil thick - much thicker than most gloves.  These are intended for medical examinations.  They are more elastic due to their nitrile makeup and re resistant to puncturing.  In terms of size, the medium fits my average sized hands while my husband can squeeze into them with his extra large hands.  A small size on me would be more skin tight and more appropriate for closer examination where touch sensitivity is more important.

This is a high quality commercial grade latex free glove.  These are "extreme" textured gloves intended for tough/harsh  use situations.  They are puncture and tear resistant.  In terms of fit, The XL fits best on my husband's hands while he can fit a large, though it's more like a skin tight fit.  The medium fits me well while the large gives me room in the glove without restriction.

These are exceptional quality medical exam gloves.  They are a deep purple color so you don't mistake another glove for this purpose.  While they are textured to improve grip in wet conditions, they are also thin enough to provide superior tactile sensation.  I can feel individual hairs and facial contours wearing these.  These are the kind of gloves you want to fit snugly.  My husband might ordinarily wear an XL, but in these, a large was perfect because it fit tightly with good conformity to his long fingers and provided him the ability to sense tactile differences.  I am comfortable in a small or medium, with the small delivering the best tactile sensitivity.

These are nice heavy duty powder free latex gloves with thick fingers and palm.  They are textured to provide a good grip in wet conditions.  These are rated to be used in the automotive industry.  They are also rated by the FDA for use in the food service industry for the direct handling of food.  My husband its the XL very well with a little room to spare.  The large size fits him very tightly and is short in the fingers.  I normally wear a medium, but the small fits very well though tightly.

The are great latex free nitrile gloves with textured fingers and palm.  They are rated for commercial use janitorial applications and are also rated food grade.  They are power free.  My husband usually wears an XL in the AMMEX gloves we have tried but he fits best in the XXL in this particular style.  I usually fit best in a medium, but a large works well for me in this type of glove.  They are high quality commercial grade gloves that are resistant to puncturing.

This is a good standard desk sized calendar for 2016.  It's set up with a full month to each page.  Each day has a generous amount of space for noting your appointments.  There's space on the side for scribbles or additional notes.  There are 2 small calendars on each page showing a quick glance for the previous month as well as the next month.  I personally wish this feature were expanded to have a run of 4 or 6 months of previous and upcoming months at the bottom, like some other options.It's bound by two metal button tacks and attached to a very flimsy cardboard back.  The vinyl corner tabs are cheap but functional.

This back stretching wedge isn't exactly comfortable - if you don't want the deep tissue stimulation it provides you might try laying a towel over it.  The spikes and bumps are hard and designed to dig into your muscles to increase effectiveness.  There are illustrated instructions to show you how to use it a couple of different ways.  It's made of quality materials and doesn't take up much storage space.So far it has done a good job helping to relieve some persistent back pain.  I'll update over time as things develop.

This is DJ,  a great dinosaur puppet that talks.  You can manipulate the jaw and press on the roof of the mouth to make him talk.  He'll count and introduce himself among other things.  Little Man was afraid of him at first.  He likes it better without the sounds.  That's OK, DJ will be here when he's ready.

I like technological improvements and gadget for a lot of applications, just not testing my blood sugar.  Set-up required downloading an App, registering, and pairing to the devise.  Now you're ready to get a blood sample, so you insert a lancet into the pricking device, insert the test strip into the device and depress the button to get blood.  Fill the lancet.  From there - I couldn't make it do anything no matter how many times I went through the set-up and repaired the connection.  Some technology just shouldn't be difficult.  My father, who is in his 80's would have gone bonkers trying to make this work.  It's not for us.That said,the set seems very high quality.  There's a nice little travel case so you can bring along your essential supplies as well as an extra vial of testing strips.  Be careful when you eject the testing strip from the device, it's on a spring and the darn thing shot across the table and got blood on the laptop.  That could be a safety issue.

If you have IBS or other digestive problems, this product is a must - especially in the workplace.  It really does help conceal the odor of anything under the water line in the toilet.  They seem to be made from essential oils, which is probably why they cost so much.  The scents are pleasing and not cloying like many air fresheners.

These are nice nitrile gloves.  They are intended for janitorial use as well as food handling.  They are lightly textured to give them a good grip, especially in wet conditions.  In terms of size, I have average sized hand while my husband's are quite large.  I fit easily into a small but I end up with a little webbing between my fingers - this is a tighter fit than the mediums, which fit easily with a little wiggle room.  My husband is best fit by the XL but he can get into the large without tearing it.

These are a nice latex-free option made of PVC. They are not sterile but offer antimicrobial protection. I don't know if it's because they are made of PVC, but they tear pretty easily and aren't very thick. In terms of sizing, you kind of need to get it right or go a size larger. My husband, who fits in an XL, tore the large ones trying them on. The large are a little big on my average sized female hands but I'd be reluctant to try a medium.

These are a nice latex-free option made of PVC.  They are not sterile but offer antimicrobial protection.  I don't know if it's because they are made of PVC, but they tear pretty easily and aren't very thick.  In terms of sizing, you kind of need to get it right or go a size larger.  My husband, who fits in an XL, tore the large ones trying them on.  The large are a little big on my average sized female hands but I'd be reluctant to try a medium.

I admit was overwhelmed when I unpacked all the pieces that come with this jumper.  I hadn't found the instructions yet (packaged in with the seat) so I set to putting it together based on the picture on the box.  This was a surprisingly decent way to go about it.  Once I found the instructions, it was super easy.  I had a hard time getting some of the pieces to click into place, but with a little effort, everything seems solid and we haven't had anything get loose yet.  Thankfully, the seat came pre-assembled even though the instructions gave directions for putting it together.There are so many little things to do to keep a little one entertained!  The one piece that's electronic needed 3 AA batteries, so you'll need a small Phillips head screwdriver.  It plays music and sounds and learning sequences.Perhaps the best part is that it's adjustable in height so you can get more use out of it.  We're at level 2 with some time yet to go before we need to make it larger.  Little man has no problem finding his way around this awesome little play set.  It has the customary swivel seat so he can reach everything easily.  He's learning to grasp these days and this is an ideal tool to help him practice.I'll update over time if anything changes.

This is a great 2 person strategy game.  The game play is more intense the more competitively matched you are with your opponent.  While there are elements of luck (drawing cards), there is quite a bit of strategy involved in how you chose to play or not play your cards.This game doesn't take up a lot of space.  You could almost balance it on the seat tray of an airplane.  It's fairly quiet - based on how loud you and your opponent are with occasional outbursts.  The box takes up little space so it's a good game to take with you on the road.All of the pieces and materials are made from high quality materials.  The cards are coated to repel moisture but wouldn't survive a dunking.  The graphics are bright and engaging.  This is a fun new game to add to your toy chest - ages 10 and up.

So much of Putin's life would seem completely alien to the average American experience.  Born and raised in the aftermath of WWII in a place struggling from its own efforts to rebuild, Putin was shaped by forces unknowable by most.  The author begins at the beginning and offers insight not only into Putin's early life, but also the people and events that shaped and influenced him.  What fueled his early fascination with the KGB and how his early KGB career differed from his ideals - even though he seemed to excel and was rewarded with more responsibility.This is a very readable biography of a complicated current figure.  The author has researched it to painstaking lengths.  Including the works cited, there are over 500 pages in this book.  Separated in five parts, it's an extremely impressive scholarly effort.  Included are:Part One1.  Homo Sovieticus2.  A Warm Heart, a Cool Head and Clean Hands3.  A Middling Spy in a Dying Empire4.  Democracy Faces a Hungry WinterPart Two5.  The Spy Comes in from the Cold6.  Mismanaged Democracy7.  An Unexpected Path to Power8.  Swimming in the Same River Twice9.  Kompromat10.  In the OuthousePart Three11.  Becoming Portugal12.  Putin's Soul13.  The Gods Slept on their Heads14.  Annus Horribilis15.  The Orange Contagion16.  Kremlin, Inc.17.  Poison18.  The 2008 ProblemPart Four19.  The Regency20.  Action Man21.  The ReturnPart Five22.  The Restoration23.  Alone on Olympus24.  Putingrad25.  Our RussiaAcknowledgmentsNotesBibliographyIndex

This adorable little hardcover book is best for young children who can sit and pay attention for a reasonable length of time.  Hannah Viano has put together a gorgeous little book full of color illustrations depicting natural examples of the alphabet.  She uses the letter and word in a sentence and some of these will give the adult reader a chuckle.  They are always interesting and factual and they combine very well with the quality of the illustrations.  Some might think she takes a bit of liberty handling the X and Z letters but I think they are perfect and tie-in rather smartly with the book as a whole.This is not a board book style alphabet book.  It has paper pages and will become damaged with rough handling.  I think these illustrations are done so well it should be considered for nomination for a prize.

I was a bit skeptical at first, but this turned out to be a decent topical formulation.  It goes on better if you spread it out a little.  These topical pesticides are all a bit greasy and you have to be careful you don't put it where kitty can lick it off.  As our cats are already on a topical program, this was a maintenance dose.  It seems to have a strong odor.  So far, we haven't seen any bad reactions but I did not use it at all one one of our cats who has sensitive skin.  The bug season is longer, here in the south.  So if there's a problem, I'll know.  I'll update if anything changes.  This might be a good lower cost option for treating the ferals in the neighborhood, if I can catch them.

This is a great basic little "first" stroller.  Our granddaughter is fascinated with dolls and this little stroller fits most of the ones she has with little issue.  It's a good height for her - I'd say from 2 to 5 year range.  It's not constructed of long-life materials - the fabric is so-so and the wheels are plastic, but it'll do the trick around the house.  If you take this out to the store with you, or on walks, you might wear it out sooner than you wished.  Our granddaughter is so enthusiastic, she'd put her baby cousin in there if she could lift him!

These wipes are very effective at removing make-up - even the last bit of eyeliner and mascara that can be hard to remove with other methods.  It's so gentle you can even wipe the inside lid of your eye.  There are no fragrances or astringents.  The cloths are really soft and just the right size to clean your face.  You can use both sides.  My skin is pretty sensitive - especially around my eyes and I had zero reaction to this cleanser.  I'm going to want to keep these on hand - especially for travelling when you can't anticipate water quality.The packaging is a small portable bag with a strong sticky seal that is resealable.  I've used products similar to this before and one of the issues was that the cloths dried out because the hole they come out of was too big and let in too much air.  These are packaged with a small opening, though it is very easy to pull the towelette out even though it's small.

This is a small bag.  It's not very tall but is sturdily built and holds a lot of stuff very securely.  It's made of a tough mesh that is was resistant and has a texture that sort of grabs at the things you put in its pockets.  We took it on a weekend trip to the beach and it held all out toiletries and was easy to carry.  It's amazing how much it will hold and how heavy it becomes once you get it full of all you toiletries.  The handle is plenty strong enough for the bag to be loaded with full bottles.  It's great for trips and would be great for dorm living too.

This is a nice LED desk task light with a small footprint and a small head with a handy grab bar.  It has 2 levels of light - not three.  It also has a single USB port where you can charge your phone or other small electronic device.  You power it on and off by touching the power symbol.  In the pictures it looks grey to me but it's actually a powder coated white.Build quality is good.  One of the things I like most are that it pivots at three points, making it very adaptable for different situations.  I expected the light basket to be larger than it is, but it delivers a nice amount of clean bright light.  The light is instant on/off with no flickering or "warming up".  It's a good amount of light for reading or for small hobby work.

This workstation was relatively easy for an able-bodied adult to put together.  It's a bit heavy and the box was bulky, but Mr. Pixels and Bits put it together on his own in less than an hour.  It's mostly a matter of putting together big pieces and then installing various bolts and pins.In terms of adjusting it for use, it takes a bit of getting used to it.  He is over 6'2" and he can make it work.  It functions in a better height range for me at 5'5".  Once tightened up, it's pretty stable.  Adjusting it takes a little time and there's definitely a learning curve.  I don't care for the way the seat folds up - you have to un-pin and then re-pin it.  The seat is not very inspired but it's functional for short to moderate duration.  You can adjust the angle a bit to make it comfortable.
