The post-pubescent women on the show have all been shipped off, no explanation for the Nannie, who has been replaced with Batista's 18 year old anorexic sister who appeared out of nowhere, contributes nothing to the show and takes up far too much screen time with her flying saucer eyes.When Nick confesses on the beach to Brother Sam's murder, he laughs maniacally and taunts Dexter - The entire scene as with each episode is steeped in melodrama and felt more like an episode of Law and Order SVU...The show used to have a tongue in cheek humor in regards to sex. What was once humorous has degraded into old fashioned sexism and over-used clichÃ©s. Seriously, since when did anyone laugh at Masuka's jokes? He was a creep and his creepy humor was used to show how others perceived him and differentiated their integrity from his vulgar wit - a subtlety that flew over the heads of the new writers.The actors all seem to be on autopilot as if they are sleep walking through their lines - They can't even act excited to be stuck with all these bad lines.The show got itself stuck in a desperate cycle of having a guest start serial killer, unable to break free and try something new, the show circles through this now all too familiar ground. So the show goes for some shock value and guts all of its integrity by bringing back Brian.Not content to try and quicken this dying show with its former glory of the ice-truck killer coming back as Dexter's imaginary friend, they must instantly double dip this quickening with the left overs from the Trinity story line.So... on a road trip, Dexter grabs a quicky with a 7-11 cashier (what?! Dexter, whose been with two women in his whole life?!) Debra goes all emo and falls in love with Dexter?! Did this season's writers even watch the previous five seasons? None of the characters would act this strange if they all dropped acid and went to a rave.Someone tell me this entire season was a bad dream that Dexter will wake up from like Dallas's dream season or better yet, he'll wake up like Bob Newhart did, next to his wife.

The seasons starts with a whimper, and sputters along, convulsing till it regurgitates all of its previous highlights and glories.Everything is off kilter in this season. The writing is stale and predictable. My best advice to anyone considering this purchase is: Don't do it.If you feel you must watch it, find it at the library, or buy it by the episode. Had I bought it by the episode, I would have given up by episode four and not purchased anymore. On the strength of the last five seasons I purchased the entire season - BIG mistake.This season of Dexter is from an alternative dimension of time and space where quality writing and original plots have gone extinct.***SPOILER ALERT***Characters are doing uncharacteristic things with little, no, or entirely inadequate motivation. LaGuarta, was once a multidimensional character, who was smart, sexy, and ambitious - now she's morphed into a one-dimensional B*** who exists solely to give Deb a hard time.. Didn't we already see that in season one?Deb does her best impression of Doogie Howser in the shows' most absurd move of making her the lieutenant. Her promotion to detective stretched the credibility of the show given her tender age, lieutenant is ridiculousAnd speaking of age, Welcome to Miami Florida, where there are no women over 30... Well, at least not on Dexter. The post-pubescent women on the show have all been shipped off, no explanation for the Nannie, who has been replaced with Batista's 18 year old anorexic sister who appeared out of nowhere, contributes nothing to the show and takes up far too much screen time with her flying saucer eyes.When Nick confesses on the beach to Brother Sam's murder, he laughs maniacally and taunts Dexter - The entire scene as with each episode is steeped in melodrama and felt more like an episode of Law and Order SVU...The show used to have a tongue in cheek humor in regards to sex. What was once humorous has degraded into old fashioned sexism and over-used clichÃ©s. Seriously, since when did anyone laugh at Masuka's jokes? He was a creep and his creepy humor was used to show how others perceived him and differentiated their integrity from his vulgar wit - a subtlety that flew over the heads of the new writers.The actors all seem to be on autopilot as if they are sleep walking through their lines - They can't even act excited to be stuck with all these bad lines.The show got itself stuck in a desperate cycle of having a guest star serial killer, unable to break free and try something new, the show circles through this now all too familiar ground. So the show goes for some shock value and guts all of its integrity by bringing back Brian.Not content to try and quicken this dying show with its former glory of the ice-truck killer coming back as Dexter's imaginary friend, they must instantly double dip this quickening with the left overs from the Trinity story line.So... on a road trip, Dexter grabs a quicky with a 7-11 cashier (what?! Dexter, whose been with two women in his whole life?!) Debra goes all emo and falls in love with Dexter?! Did this season's writers even watch the previous five seasons? None of the characters would act this strange if they all dropped acid and went a rave.Someone tell me this entire season was a bad dream that Dexter will wake up from like Dallas's dream season or better yet, he'll wake up like Bob Newhart did, next to his wife.

1:11 MinsI like this book - its nicely sized to carry with you. It is approximately the size of a trade paperback and will fit in most purses. It is inconspicuous and doesn't look like your hauling your diary around with you - which is nice when you want to journal in public places.The book has some cons. The aged and distressed look of the book is more obviously faux in person than the picture renders. The photo looks as if it has a hard back, the description says that it has a soft cover - the soft cover is somewhat misleading, it is a paper cover, no thicker than the internal blank pages of the book. I'm not worried about it giving the book a damaged look, but find that without a hard cover the left side pages are impossible to write on if your not at a table or have a clipboard, which does limit its usefulness.Overall, I like the book - it's cute, clever, inconspicuous and portable

2:39 MinsI really like Pilot's Plumix refillable fountain pen. The pen feels great in the hand, it has good ink flow and writes smoothly across the page with no scratch.The package has no size details on the nib. However, the nib looks like and writes like a 0.7 nib (medium/average).My only complaint with the pen is the ink color. Package says that ink is blue, but it is a *very* light blue - I don't care for the light blue ink and would prefer a darker, more navy blue ink. I will update this review after I order replacement cartridges with information on how the color varies on Pilot's blue/black ink versus its blue ink. - I am not a fan of black ink.Overall this is a great starter fountain pen and a great deal at this price point due to its refillable option. Highly Recommended!***Update 9/15/12***I ordered Pilot Namiki Ink Refill Blue/Black 12Pk and can report that the blue/black shade of blue matches the navy blue ink from the Pilot Varsity pen in the video - ink cartridges are more reasonably priced on jetpens and other sites than here.
1:08 MinsDesigns are underwhelming. While some are pretty, none are remarkable or especially eye catching. Paper and designs are acceptable, but I would not purchase this set again.

I first read this book when I was in the third grade, 25 years ago. I instantly decided then that it was my favorite book and I read and re-read it many times. I loved it. I recently took on a research project involving children's and young adult stories and have a long reading list of Children's stories to read - I put "The Witches" at the top of my list for nostalgia's sake, not sure what to expect.As an adult, I can report, that it is simply a magnificent story. I can see why I loved it so much as a child. Dahl never dismisses the reader (children) as being inept. Like the Grandmother in the story, Dahl knows children don't require extreme coddling. He's not timid about using fear to tell a great story.Parent's strive to create a safe world for their children. But that illusion is one that all parents must slowly deconstruct to prepare children for reality. Fairy tales are an integral part of that deconstruction. In fairy tales, monsters can exist in a way that allows children face their fears and walk through those fears to the other side where strength, courage and confidence are found."The Witches" is a frightening, yet thrilling read for children. Dahl is a masterful storyteller and in "The Witches" he has weaved imagination, fear and courage into a fantastically fun story that has stood the test of time and remains refreshingly relevant  for each generation.

This product serves as a fine replacement to Comet or Ajax for those of us who dislike using bleach - it does absolutely everything that Ajax can do, and that is pretty groovy.However, it under-performs as a  replacement for ammonia-based oven cleaners. It does not equal a real oven cleaner's strength or efficacy inside the oven. In regards to those heavy layers of black backed-on chunks, it cleared out maybe 75 percent from my oven (which was not excessively dirty to start out with) and after that no amount of elbow grease or steel wool or extra cleaner was getting that last 25 percent off.Avoiding harsh chemical cleaners is a goal of mine and this product is great in the bathroom and on my stainless steal kitchen sink - but below par in the oven. That being said I'll keep using it in the oven to avoid the use of ammonia-based cleaner. Results were acceptable, but not astonishing.

This is an awesome product that works exactly like advertised. It was easy to apply and it works like a dream.My tub was quite literally a death trap, having taken a serious fall once, I purchased a 15 dollar rubber grip tub mat - which slipped and slid around the tub as often as I got in the tub and collected black gunk underneath it, and would take 5 minutes of scrubbing with abrasive cleaners to get the black soiled footmarks off of once a week. All that indignity and it never really worked!Motivated by yet another near-death experience in the tub, I researched and ordered this product. It is very clear and can be applied in an apartment, I'm quite sure your landlord will never know when you move that it's even there. It is slightly abrasive when you take a bath, I found it much more relaxing to put a towel down than have my backside exfoliated by its sandpaper grip. I bathe occasionally, but shower regularly and felt that its life-saving benefit outweighed its bathing irritation cost. I'm well pleased with the results and I will update this review if anything changes.I do want to point out that this is listed no less than three times on Amazon and the price point and shipping options vary on each one. When I ordered this it was $8.95 with prime shipping - but now it has a shipping charge. It is also available at varying price and shipping differentials here: Tub Grip Clear anti-slip bathtub coating and Tub Grip Clear Anti-slip Bathtub Coating - check them out and do a quick search to make sure your getting the best price.***********UPDATE 3/18/13*************I really loved this product when I first purchased it and originally gave it 5 stars, I am now reducing my rating to 3 stars. Eight months have passed and now many patches of the product have simply washed off and it will require a new coating. I could more easily accept the need to re-coat if the product was sold with several applications. However the amount sold is just enough to do the bottom of a tub with none to spare. With the new shipping charge the price has almost doubled since my original purchase prompting me to consider a new product.

I'm a big fan of reviews and the review process. It's one of the reasons I love Amazon so much, as consumers, the review process empowers us to share our experiences and make informed decisions on how we spend our money.This product has a fair amount of bad reviews and some of those reviews are truly horrid. Missing parts, damaged item, etc.However, I ordered this product anyway. Why? Its certainly not that I don't believe or put faith in the reviews, I do. Every product has lemons, and the cheaper the product, the higher the ratio of lemons. I discounted the lemon reviews because Amazon has always been faithfully easy when it comes to returns. Then I discounted the other negative reviews because I perceived that those reviews were written by people who were expecting to get one up on the system and score a great deal. Nothing wrong with that, I try to get great deals when I can - but this is not a great deal, you'll get exactly what you pay for.I read the reviews and looked at the pictures and knew that I was not going to get a deal, I was going to get what I paid for, which was 40 dollars worth of plastic and cheaply wallpapered press-board. But when it came down to it, I found I wanted the largest bookshelf I could get for the least amount of money, so I could spend more money on books. While I'd love an impressive and beautifully rendered bookcase that conjures memories and nostalgia, I don't have that kind of money and I'm more interested in spending the money I do have on more books to fill in the case rather than on the case itself.This thing is wobbly - I strongly urge anyone with young children to avoid this purchase entirely, it would be a falling hazard. It is cheap, the poles are lightweight plastic and while I was lucky and mine did not arrived damaged from the shipping process, there are actual design flaws and awkwardly placed seams (face 'em to the wall if you can). And most egregious of all, this thing STINKS. It smells like it escaped a paper mill - after two days, I come in the door and it is the first thing I smell (though I know it will fade out eventually), if you are chemically sensitive,  this is a purchase you should avoid.But all that said, it holds my books just fine and I know I would have paid 3 to 4 times as much for this much space on a quality shelf. So I am content with this purchase, but only because I knew what I was signing up for and got exactly what I expected. If you feel the same, I recommend it, if not, then I advise walking away.

There is a layer of rich splendor created in the cinematography of this film in its deftly applied attention to detail. A film critic's essay included with the Criterion Blu Ray edition notes that Merchant/Ivory productions had decades of experience in making the sets look authentic and lived in, and while having appreciated it to some degree in previous viewings on VHS, DVD, and even streaming  - these true details brought forth in such clarity in the Blu Ray version explode in a violence that took my breath away. Set in London's early 20th century, the film dresses its people and furnishings in subdued hues of browns, greys, beige, olive green  and powdered blues  - the shocking contrasts of colorific beauty are highlighted and segment the film when it switches to Howards End in its springtime glory, or Leonard Bast's nature walk out of London, or his wife Jackie's tacky fuchsia wardrobe. There is a level of intent from the filmmaker in these transitions and contrasts that becomes evident and meaningful to the story craft and is only fully appreciable in the Blu Ray.I've seen this film dozens of times and never before had I noticed how many beautiful and stunning scarfs and shawls Margret dons throughout the film. Let alone the glorious Wedgewood, China, and amazing works of art that inhabit all the sets.However, when I first started the Blu Ray I was horrifed and thought it was an exceptionally poor transfer. It was as grainy as a beach, with white dots littering the screen. I was able to resolve this by changing my TV's settings to appreciate the picture. My TV comes with a range of preset brights/huges/and balance controls - which of course you can use to set your own as well. I usually have mine set to "vibrant." However, this was too much for the delicate film work here and had the film screaming bits of grain and white flashes at me - a switch to my TV's "cinematic" preset made the Blu Ray brilliantly rendered. If you find the Blu Ray lacking, play with your picture settings. If you're like me, you have your colors and brightness up rather high and this film requires darker settings - I guess its like the equalizer settings on your stereo, you wouldn't use the same settings for rock-n-roll and classical. I'm not a techie so I don't know how correct my assessment is, but I do now that once I made the adjustments, the film was still in absolute high definition, and far more stunning and visually engaging than the DVD.Faithful to the book there is nary a detail left out, a few minor details are juxtaposed here or there for a tighter film fit - In my judgment this is the most faithful and positively perfect rendering of a classic book to film ever attempted. The script is expertly crafted, and it is cast under the divine intervention of kismet. Thompson and Hopkins have undeniable chemistry. The film is quite simply a masterpiece and it is a rare example of film's capacity  to harmonize with other art forms. The written word is brought to life, the soundtrack is exquisite, and the locations are teeming with exuberance and life.Yet this film is most certainly not for everyone, as evidenced by the  many "It's boring" reviews here. There is no instant fix, explosions or romantic endings.  Like any work of literary fiction, plot is not the catalyst here - the human experience is exposed through patient character development letting you experience E.M. Forster's most poignant commandment:  "Only connect."

Season Seven gets five stars for one of the best and most complete endings in science fiction history - but 3 stars for its episodic quality throughout the final season - which averages my Amazon rating to 4 stars.All of the Dominion war arc episodes and the finale are fantastic - few Sci-fi shows get to end with dignity and grace. DS9 finishes the race without years of space and a fan based letter writing campaign in between. It is a complete story in and of itself within its seven year run and that alone makes the show a diamond in the rough.Out of the story arc, episodically this season was a real downer however. ***@!Spoiler Alerts!@*** The death of Jadzia in Season six devastated the show and left the show hobbling toward the finish line. While she was certainly drop dead gorgeous, she was so much more than just another pretty face. She was an extremely competent actor who crafted a vivacious and irreplaceable character for 6 years. Her death in every way detracted from the final season of the show. Though it fits in with her character's alien story line, replacing her with the character of Ezri was an absolute mistake. Perhaps this would have worked had the show many more seasons to go, but with one season left - half of the last season is left to flesh out the addition of Ezri and more often than not it feels forced and just falls flat.The weird sub story of Sisko's mother being a Prophet was also unfortunate in my opinion. It was an entirely unnecessary. It was a dramatic indulgence and weakness on the part of the writers - "Sisko... I am your mother!" Puh-leeeze. The show was amazing for 6 years and in its final season it really begins to run out of steam and no longer dares to be so creatively original. Many of the non-arc episodes are as awkward and stilted as those from the first and second season.They simply pale in comparison to the Dominion war episodes. These are stellar and redeem the season. The transformation, redemption and martyrdom of Dumar was a brilliant move and that it is successfully executed is a testament to the writing and acting involved. This story is followed up in an amazingly well crafted story by the actor Andrew Robinson, who played as Garak in his DS9 novel: A Stitch in Time (Star Trek: Deep Space Nine #27). Dukat and Adami are soul-mates from hell and the tête-Ã -tÃªte between actor and actress is richly crafted and for the connoisseur, it is a real treat.If you've made it this far, well of course you'll keep going and want to see it through to the end, but when it's not working - just shrug your shoulders and move on to the next episode.Goodbye DS9 - I will miss you.

Each selection on Blunderbuss is steeped in a kind of 1970s mystique - This atmosphere is all encompassing from start to finish. Blunderbuss does the time warp and brushes against your ear with a nostalgic bliss. Some songs are downright lazy and won't be pushed or forced to a faster pace or conclusion.Jack White is entirely comfortable in this effort. Confidence reigns supreme in his vocals and you can tell he's creatively in control. It's a worthy effort, it's groovy, but I don't love it to death. I'm not on fire for the album but I am enjoying it.The album is growing on me slowly because there is no sense of urgency in any of these selections. Each musical moment pauses, examines itself and reflects. The album is slow paced. It's the kind of album that goes well with a hot cup of tea on a rainy Sunday afternoon. It's a kind of soundtrack you play when you wanna get lost in your own mind.Lackadaisically Recommended, to those who can relax and enjoy that which is not fast paced ;-)

Of all the brilliant, talented female musicians of the 90s - Fiona Apple would not have been the one I'd picked to artistically reign supreme in 2012. But Idler is a masterful LP and Fiona effortlessly takes the crown.I've watched and wept as Tori Amos has gutted her feminism by desperately clinging to her plastic surgery enhanced dolled up closeups. I've held my forehead in shame as Bjork recorded an album on her freaking I-phone, so out of touch she believes embracing elitist technology will keep her vibrant. And I've fallen asleep listening to Ani Difranco sing her ode to Occupy Wall Street.So ya know, really, if I hadn't suffered a romantic disappointment the very same week Fiona Apple (Unidisputed Goddess of the Break-Up Album) released her first album in 7 years, I don't really think I would have had the heart to download this after all the disappointment that's come lately from my posse of favorite females of the 90sWell, Gawd bless relationships that end in disappointment and Fiona Apple for documenting the misery that follows them in all its glory. If you've made it into your 30s, or 40s, perhaps even 50s divorced, never married, or not-otherwise-specified alone, ask yourself this question: Who exactly is singing our song? The formerly mentioned ladies are all confronting wedded bliss (and I wish them all the world's happiness) while the rest of us are marching on, facing the world alone, without a back up choir.This release is enchanting. I found myself tapping my foot, nodding my head, and singing along. Fiona has matured - This album is complete from start to finish. It is a complete work of art, spilling over the edge with creative juice - no room for filler tracks or incomplete thoughts. This is developed, mature, and different than anything else she's put out so far. Yet, it's a natural evolution from where she started. For a seven year absence, there is no anxiety here. Fiona is calm, calculated and serene."I can love the same man in the same bed in the same cityBut not in the same room, it's a pity, butOh, it never bothered me beforeNot 'til this guy, what a guy, oh God what a good guyAnd I can't even enjoy himAnd now I'm hard, too hard to knowI don't cry when I'm sad anymore, no noTears calcify in my tummyFears coincide with the towHow can I ask anyone to love meWhen all I do is beg to be left alone? "Her skill as pianist is formidable and she finally steps into her own as a competent musical rival to all of her contemporaries. She bends her piano to her will and holds it spellbound. Fiona's strong Jazz roots give this album a distinguished flair you won't find anywhere else in the last or the next decade. She is heart-broken, yet absolutely her own, a complete, and fulfilled human being who can't help but keep rockin' on. Taking the road less traveled has left Fiona to fine tune and craft a passion that her contemporaries traded in for settled stability - This album is riddled with bipolar angst that refuses rest or regret and therefore stays vital, restless and alive.Her trademarked confessional passion is here, but it is no longer a young woman's passion; honest and inspired, Fiona's talent has ripened, and it is so bitter-sweet it will leave you salivating and craving more with spit dripping down your chin.Pure Excellence - Highly recommended!

High Definition is to Twin Peaks what a great cup of black coffee is to Agent Cooper. Seeing this again in High Definition was like having your best friend from High School come home for a sleep over. You will fall in love with Twin Peaks all over again..I found the entire series at a yard sale on VHS 4 years ago and bought it. I watched it, appreciated and enjoyed the story and dialogue and didn't think too much about it. I'm not sure what made me stream this, but Boy Howdy, I am so glad I did. The cinematography is gorgeous! Story and Dialogue are only part of this wonderful love triangle. David Lynch's brilliance as a director shines complete in the first season. This is visually stunning. Having last seen in on VHS, for me, HD was all the more enchanting, enriching the story with all the eye candy Lynch could find in his actors and spectacular Northwestern landscapes.What a treat it was to see the Twin Peaks logo on the Sheriff's coffee mug, or that the daily special at the Double R was Split Pea and Lamb Stew, or the fact that the delectable Bobby Briggs (Dana Ashbrook) had a set of Frank Sinatra baby blue eyes, when broadcast T.V. and VHS had led me to believe they were brown.Beware, if you were ever a smoker, no matter how long it's been, this show will trigger a longing you thought you'd conquered. Not to mention a deep longing for huckleberry pie and a cup of hot black java.Twin Peaks is a dose of double-dipped nostalgia; directly from the 90s, yet the show longs for 50s film noir flair with every sexy breath it takes. Queue it up and enjoy the flannel clad bad boys, the bombshell blondes in saddle shoes, and the quirkiest law enforcement crew since the Andy Griffith show.
For a "fitted base layer", sizing on these shirts is very large. I weigh 160 pounds and size SMALL is loose on me. It works OK as a casual outer layer, but not so well as a base layer.

The product title says these are for men, but I got them for my girlfriend and she likes them a lot. The lenses are larger and clearer and more comfortable than her old goggles. The strap is comfortable and easy to adjust. They advertise that that the lenses don't fog up, but they still fog up after a few laps in the pool, just like her old goggles. The lenses seal well are very clear and easy to see through, but do have some distortion, though that isn't a big deal if you're just following the lanes in the pool.

I'm reviewing the 16,100 mAh model. As you can see from the product specs and as you should expect from the capacity, this is a big heavy power pack. Fortunately, it supports 1.9A input, so it should charge from 0 to 100% overnight, if you have a powerful enough wall charger (none is included). Output is rated at 3.4A, which is powerful enough for all the smartphones and tablets that I own. Quick Charging is not supported.A power pack this large is not going to fit in your pocket so you can charge your phone as you walk down the street. This power pack is more for long steady use, such charging your devices on long airplane flights or even weekend camping trips. 16,100 mAh will charge any tablet or phone multiple times. There are even 2 output ports so you can charge 2 devices at once (though the output charging rates is split between the 2 ports).Packaging is minimal. In addition to the power pack, you get one short micro-usb cable. There is no carrying case or wall charger. You can use the charger that came with your cell phone or tablet, if it is a usb or micro-usb type and is strong enough to charge the power pack at a reasonable speed (forget about those old 0.5A wall chargers).My package did not come with instructions, but using this device is simple. Use the included micro-usb cable (or use your own) to charge the power pack using any usb wall charger. More powerful wall chargers will be much faster (look for one rated at least 2A). I recommend using a high-quality name-brand wall charger and cables to avoid short circuits (some generic chargers and cables have questionable electronics). The 4 blue lights on the power pack show you the battery level. Use either of the 2 USB ports on the power pack to charge your smartphone or tablet, using the included micro-usb cable or your own cable (especially if you need Apple cables). You can check the power level at any time by pressing the button on the power pack.

I weigh 160 pounds. This shirt fits me well in size SMALL. Charcoal color is very dark; almost black. Construction quality is basic with exposed seams on the inside and lightweight fabric. $32 list price is a too high. Similar quality shirts sell for $10 to $15 at big box stores.
Seems comparable to other glocosamine pills. Note to people with shellfish allergies: these pills are made from shrimp shells.

Ordered this jacket for my girlfriend. The jacket is warm and construction quality is very good. Colors are brighter and more vibrant than they appear in the photos. She wears size medium in most brands and this jacket is half a size larger, despite the contoured design. Good for layering over a heavy sweater, but suggest sizing down for use over a snug base layer.
Red color looks more pink than red

Picked up a few of these during their last half price sale and have been using them for a couple of weeks. They do work as advertised. Not sure how long the battery life will be, but ours are still going strong, even in high-traffic locations like the bathroom and hallway. They work fine with rechargeable batteries, so replacing batteries is a minor hassle, but not expensive. We do not mind the yellow light, since we use them only as night lights. The round plastic design is kind of ugly, but not too noticeable since we mounted them near floor level. We do wish the sensitivity or timeout could be adjusted, since if you stand still for a minute, the light will turn off even though you are still there. Not sure if I would pay the full $13 price for these with the limited functionality, but can't argue too much for $6.

This tea is good, perhaps a little better than the Hime GenmaiCha that is also sold on Amazon. The pricing here is way out of whack, though. ThisUjinotsuyu pack is about $5 at local grocery stores (a little more expensive than Hime).

I've been using this cream on my chapped fingers. The cream is thinner than other medicated hand creams that I've tried. It applies very easily and cleanly (non-greasy), but it doesn't last as long as most other products. Bottom line is that it does help repair my skin.

This is a very small flash drive with no built-in protection to keep it clean and safe when in your pocket. It was clearly designed for people who leave the flash drive plugged in to their laptop most of the time and don't want any extra bulk sticking out to break off. If that's your purpose, then this is a good drive for you. Capacity is good. Speed is good if your laptop supports USB 3.0 (performance on a USB 2.0 port will be much worse).

This product is difficult to review, because I don't have the equipment or expertise needed to evaluate their claims. The product is easy enough to apply to your yard with a spreader. You don't have to dig it into your soil like with some water saver products. The product claims that it helps water evenly soak into hard soil instead of puddling and running off. After a week of use, I have seen no evidence that they are wrong, I hope that it does work as claimed in the long run.

I weigh 160 pounds and usually wear size medium in casual and athletic shirts. Bought this one in size medium and the raglan shoulders fit comfortably, but the chest and belly are much too loose for athletic use. For casual wear, a looser fit is OK, but this snag-prone poly fabric doesn't work well for casual wear.

We enjoy chocolate, but we're not connoisseurs, so maybe this product is not targeted at us. We think $25 for a 4 ounce box of candy is way too much for any kind of candy, but you may think otherwise. The candies are obviously well crafted, with multiple layers of chocolate and sugars in each piece. All of the candies are creamy with subtle flavors, not like the crisp dark chocolate and bold flavors that we prefer. As other people have stated, mail ordering something like this may not be a good idea since creamy chocolates do melt quickly, even at room temperature.We were given this box of candy in exchange for an honest review. At this price, this is not something we would have bought for ourselves or to give as a gift.

I weigh 160 pounds and normally wear a size medium T-shirt. This shirt in size medium is very loose on me. I suggest you size down. Shirt quality is pretty basic; comparable to popular T-shirt brands like Hanes (except for the sizing).
Wireless installation was quick and easy with our MacBook. All-in-one functionality (printer, scanner, FAX) works well and is a good value at this price. No problems so far.
Pretty mediocre. Thin fabric in the heel area is less sturdy and less comfortable than other Reebok socks.
This pork jerky is pretty tasty, with a nice sesame-soy flavor (not peppery). Texture is tender enough. Price is way too high for these small bags.

Tastes pretty good for a low calorie drink. There is a strong fruit flavor without the chemical after-taste that diet sodas have. Downgrading by 1 star because of the $2 per bottle price, which is way too much for something like this.

This non-fried instant ramen has 1/3 less calories than regular instant ramens (per pack) without sacrificing taste. I thought my local supermarket's price of a dollar per pack was expensive. I can't believe the price is 3 times higher here.

This is a nice looking sports watch. The 38mm diameter is large for a women's watch, but it has to be this large to see all the dials clearly. It is also pretty heavy for a women's watch, hopefully indicating sturdy and reliable construction. The rubber band indicates that this watch is intended more for sports use than dressing up.

Despite the mostly plastic construction, this is a heavy and sturdy trash can. The description says commercial grade and that may be true for a light-duty environment (like an office kitchen). The step-open lid works quickly and reliably, unlike the lids on most home-grade trash cans. This Rubbermaid does have an internal liner to hold your trash or to hold an trash bag. A 13-gallon trash bag will fit, though it may not reach the bottom of this trash can (maybe not a problem for home trash). We also have a Simple Human trash can and this Rubbermaid is much better quality. On the other hand, the Rubbermaid is much more expensive, so much more expensive that I'm knocking off one star because of the price.
Sapporo Ichiban instant ramen is much better than the 10-cent Top Ramen, but the price here is 5 times higher than local supermarkets.

I own this case and also own the official Samsung "Protective Cover" for the Galaxy S6 (which costs $13 on Amazon). Comparing the 2 cases, the OtterBox case does offer more protection since the thick rubber sides wrap all the way around the sides.  The Samsung case only covers the corners. If you drop your phone a lot, the OtterBox will protect your phone in more types of accidents. On the other hand, the Samsung case is much cheaper and much more attractive. The OtterBox is pretty bulky and relatively ugly as cases go. Despite the thick sides, all the pass-through buttons seem to work OK. The phone is easy to insert and remove from the OtterBox case since the case is pretty flexible (unlike the Samsung case). The OtterBox case does not interfere with any of my micro-USB charging cables.I'm giving this case 3 stars because I really don't like bulky cases on sleek phones. A fat case is not so bad on a fat phone with an extra strength battery. Samsung skimped on the battery for this phone to make the phone slimmer, so adding a fat case rubs me the wrong way.

This is a great bell for bicycles with skinny 1-inch handlebars (like many mountain bikes or hybrids). The bell is very loud and clear and the sound carries for a good distance on quiet bike paths. I could not figure out how to mount it on a road bike (with threadless stem and 31mm handlebars), however. The clamp has very limited adjustability.

I agree with some of the other comments that the steel used in these tools is low quality and will not last long. Don't buy this toolkit for regular use or for very tight screws. However, if you only need it occasionally or only for one light-duty project, then durability is not that big an issue. You can't buy a quality toolkit of this size for only $10.I'm not normally a fan of toolkits with lots of little bits that easily get mixed up or get lost. This kit comes with a reasonably sturdy case to keep your bits organized.Giving this kit an extra star because of the $10 price. Not great quality, but a good value for very light use.

These shorts were $5 when I bought them. At that price, they are a great value. The fit is comfortable and the cargo pockets are great for holding a wallet and smartphone. Fabric is like good quality sweatpants.

For $300, this is a great deal for cord-cutters with antennas. I replaced my 7-year-old TivoHD (with $130/year service plan) with this Roamio (with lifetime service). If it lasts 7 years like my old Tivo, I'll have saved a ton of money. The Roamio also has 4 tuners (instead of 2 like my old Tivo), 75 hours of disk space (vs 20 on my old Tivo), and more internet streaming options. If you want, you can very easily upgrade the disk drive to 2GB for less than $100, but realistically 75 hours is plenty if you're just recording TV over-the-air. The Roamio does work great, with easy-to-use menus and great video quality (for over-the-air HD recordings).Registration was pretty easy for me. I just called Tivo and they took care of it with one phone call. Tell them you bought it from Amazon and you want to switch the registration to your name. No problem.My only complaint is that the remote control seems to be overly sensitive (lots of accidental double clicks). The way the menu system is designed, this hasn't be a serious problem, fortunately.

This is pretty good packaged beef jerky, but is the price really $15 for 5 ounces? At that price, I have had much better beef jerky from local butcher shops. Locally made jerky is more tender and has a stronger beef taste and uses much less preservatives since it is refrigerated the whole time.

Back when I was using film in my camera, I carried half a dozen or more filters with me for various lighting conditions or special effects. Nowadays, digital cameras can adjust to most conditions pretty well, except for glare from polarized sunlight. The polarizer is the only filter I use regularly now, so I do want a good one.This B+W polarizer works great. As with all B+W filters, it has the trademark brass mount that resists binding to your camera like the aluminum mounts used on most other brands' filters. The traditional problem with polarizers is that they reduce the light reaching your camera by 2 stops (1/4), which is a huge amount, especially in lower light conditions where grain and camera shake can become problems. B+W claims that this filter does better in low light, though I suppose that really depends on usage and I am not equipped to measure it.

These are good budget cycling socks, especially for the current $2 price. They are thin and unpadded, unlike running or walking socks. The fabric is very soft, but still wicks well to keep your feet dry and comfortable. Better socks are more supportive and more breathable, but the difference is not super noticeable, especially for shorter bike rides (like a few hours).Amazon doesn't show a size chart for these socks. The label on the package says: medium = men's shoe size 6-8. large=8-10. XL=10+. I wear size 9 shoes and size large is comfortable on me.

I've been using Panasonic and Braun travel shavers for years. Both brands work well, but there are a few differences. This Panasonic model is water-resistant so you can use it with shaving cream if you want and then rinse the shaver out with water. Braun shavers should be used dry (or with shaving lotion), then you brush out the shaver afterwards. Braun shavers have pop-up trimmers which are really helpful for your sideburns and loose hairs on your neck; that is the main feature that I miss on this Panasonic shaver. Lacking the trimmer isn't a big deal for a day or two, but I do miss it on week-long trips. Both Braun and Panasonic are powered by 2xAA batteries, which you can find anywhere if they die (and they easily last a week or more of daily use). Neither Braun nor Panasonic will shave as well as a full-sized shaver, due to the smaller screen and less precise screen. I use them only for travel or for touch ups (leave one in your locker or desk or girlfriend's house).

These are not great earbuds, but for the $20 price, they are average. Soft ear tips and angled ear pieces are comfortable to wear for long periods. The volume and pause buttons work properly with my Samsung Android phone, unlike most headphone controls that only work on iphone. The flat wires don't tangle as easily as thin round cables, but are still lightweight enough not to bounce around uncomfortably when running. Sound quality is mediocre, however. Bass is strong, but midrange lacks clarity. For about the same price, there are more popular brands with better sound quality (especially midrange clarity).
Good protection and good adjustability, but about 40% heavier than higher end helmets (280 grams vs 200 grams). The weight difference is very noticeable on your head during long rides.

This kettle is better than I expected for this price, but you have to limit your expectations for a $18 product. The electronics are all in the base of the kettle, protecting them from your water. The upper part is almost entirely plastic. They say it is BPA-free, but if you're afraid of other chemicals in plastic (especially in contact with boiling water), then this is not the product for you.My biggest concern is the thermostat. This kettle very conveniently shuts off when the water temperature reaches a level that you set, but the company makes no claims about what the settings on the thermostat actually mean. I see some other reviews throwing out numbers about what their low-medium-high setting mean. I'm guessing that the thermostat is cheap and inaccurate enough that there will be significant differences from product to product. I stuck my digital thermometer directly into the water in the kettle right after it shut off. The temperatures I got are 172F for the low setting, 190F for medium, and 210F for high. The recommended temperature for green tea is 160-170F, so fortunately the low setting on my kettle is good enough. I do recommend that you test yours before using it if you care about the lower settings (many people care only about boiling).I'm giving this product 1 extra star because of the cheap $18 price.

Unlike most fleece shirts, the fabric on this one is kind of stiff, which makes it uncomfortable if it doesn't fit you perfectly. Sizing is kind of odd, with a very long body, wide chest, and narrow waist.

Not very impressed by this shirt. The body fabric is very light and breathable, but the neck is too heavy and stiff. They should have made the neck shorter and from the same lightweight fabric for summer use. Or make the whole thing heavier for spring/fall use. The mixed fabric really doesn't fit any season.

Not impressed by this jacket. It looks fine, but performance is mediocre. Compared to a common (and cheap) polar-fleece jacket, this jacket is heavier, less comfortable (because it doesn't flex and stretch as well), and less warm. Sizing is typical Russell, which is roomy in the chest and somewhat longer than other brands.

I'm not impressed by this lamp. The $110 list price is silly for this quality level. Even the $60 sale price is too expensive. Quality is pretty basic for  an almost entirely plastic lamp. The LED light does work and it is nice to have 2 brightness levels. The lamp arm hinges are way too loose and even the slightest bump will knock it out of position (no tightness adjustment).The smartphone charger is flawed in many ways. Most importantly, it seems very weak. I doubt that a modern smartphone will fully charge overnight using this thing. Also, the phone holder tray is terribly shaped. A larger smartphone (5.5 inch screen) will not fit in the tray. Why couldn't they make tray open on the sides to that you could place the phone in sideways? Even if your phone does fit in the slot, since most modern phones have the charger port on the bottom. You have to stick your phone in upside down, so you cannot use the slot as a phone viewer (my phone does not support 180 degree rotation).Not recommended, especially at the current price.

We loved this show. Sound quality is very good and most of the top Hawaii-based musicians of that era (year 2000) performed (just a couple of songs each). Evan a young Jake Shimabukuro plays one song, many years before he became popular on the US mainland.

This is a well made set of headphones. Around-the-ear design is comfortable for long periods. I had no problems using them with glasses. Sound quality is very good, comparable to stereo headphones in the same price range. I like that the amplifier is rechargable, since it does use a lot of power.My only complaint is that this is a pretty bulky headset and it would be nice to include a storage/carry case to prevent damage when not in use.

We're big fans of packing cubes. Roll up your clothes and stuff them in these lightweight cubes, then stuff your luggage with them. Your clothes don't get lost and come out with only minimal wrinkles. Mesh panels let you see what is inside and also let your clothes air out. You can also buy different sizes to color code your clothes (especially if you are packing for multiple people). These MEDIUM Amazon cubes are the same size as the old LARGE Eagle Creek packing cubes. Amazon is half the price as Eagle Creek for only slightly lower quality, which I consider a good tradeoff.

These are pretty good light-duty vinyl gloves. The vinyl is very thin, so you get a good feel of what you're holding, but the gloves are not durable and will tear if you're working with tools or gardening. They are fine for many indoor tasks. They are "anti-microbial", but also non-sterile, which is typical of medical exam gloves. I wear men's small-medium gloves and these fit me easily (size small medical gloves are usually too small).

I'm not a pot head. If you are, you might rate these bars differently. I think they are the worst tasting snack bars that I have ever tried. Could not even finish 1 bar. The rest are going in the trash. I can't believe they are charging more than $2 per bar for these things.

This is a pretty nice economy pack of toilet paper. The paper is really soft and absorbent, just like the TP in the expensive packaging. Most economy packaged toiled paper is not this nice. This stuff is core-less to lower cost and lower waste. Minimal outer wrapping reduces bulk and reduces waste. Core-less takes a few more seconds to install, but after that it works and looks just like a regular roll until you get to the end. Not sure what the price is supposed to be for this stuff, but I hope it is cheaper than the regular retail pricing to account for the simplified packaging.

These are good quality lightweight medical gloves. Sizing is on the small side. I wear size small men's gloves and these are too small for me. The fingers are too short and too narrow. Maybe they are OK for small women.

These briefs are much cheaper than other poly wicking briefs that I've bought from Amazon (Champion, Adidas, UnderArmour, ExOfficio). Compared to the others, the Hanes fabric is less stretchy and less comfortable, especially when you're moving (running etc). I'm giving Hanes an extra star for the very low price, though.

I bought both the "gold" and "clear gold" versions of this case. 5 stars for the "gold" version and 3 stars for the "clear gold". The clear gold case is made from a stiff plastic that looks great, but is just as slippery as the phone itself. The solid gold has a textured back to improve your grip. The solid gold case also fits more snuggly so I expect it will provide more protection if I ever drop my phone.

These are advertised as hiking boots, but make sure you read the whole description. These are insulated boots for cold weather, not year round use. The soles are Vibram for good traction, but also very flexible, which is not what hikers want for steep rocky trails. Sizing is on the snug side, which is typical of New Balance, but may be uncomfortable if you're wearing thick winter socks. One unadvertised feature is that these boots have GoreTex uppers, which helps keep the snow or freezing rain from chilling your feet during the winter.
These are very lightweight dish holders with only a minimal amount of insulation. Good for holding 200F dishes out of the microwave, but not 400F dishes out of the oven.

If your first Android smartphone is the Samsung Galaxy S6 and you need help figuring it out, this might be a good book for you. This book covers the main features of the Samsung S6 with very detailed step-by-step instructions. You probably don't want to read the book cover-to-cover, since all the detail makes reading very slow going. The book is better as a reference guide, where you can look up a particular subject in the table of contents, then follow the directions to use the feature.One complaint that I have is that the book always assumes that you want to use Samsung's TouchWiz apps, instead of more popular Google apps. For example, they use the Samsung Messages app instead of Google's Hangouts messaging app for text messages. They also use Samsung's photo gallery, music player, calendar, app launcher, etc. instead of the more popular and standard Google Android apps. Tutorial information on customizing your phone, eg using apps other than the Samsung apps, is very weak.If you're already familiar with Android and just want to learn the Samsung add-on features, this is not a good book for you, since the Samsung-specific material is sprinkled throughout the book and not easily located. I would have liked a separate reference section for the Samsung-specific features. Because the Samsung material is spread throughout the book, this book will be very confusing to people using non-Samsung Android smartphones.I would also like to see a section on what settings to use to optimize the phone for common use cases, eg. what apps to disable to maximize battery life or how to maximize security.

These bars are really yummy with a rich milk chocolate and almond flavor, but at $5 and 420 calories PER BAR, these are really for special occasions only. Fortunately, the bars are easily separated so you can share with your friends.

These candy bars taste pretty good. Not as sweet as a pure chocolate bar, but you do get an array of flavors of chocolate, nuts, and fruits. I call these candy bars instead of snack bars because you are getting 180 calories in a relatively small and not especially filling package. The price of more than $2 per bar is shocking to me. These bars are OK, but not for that price. Other fruit and nut bars that taste just as good (to me) cost under 50 cents each. Knocking off 1.5 stars just because of the price.

This is a very long extension cable (39 feet long) that you can use for connecting devices across the room or in another room to your computer. Don't use it for USB charging since you will loose most of your power through the resistance of a cable this long. However, the cable does have some electronic shielding trickery to preserve data signals (normal wire cables would destroy your signal). I have no trouble copying and streaming large files between 2 computers or to a printer using this cable.Construction quality is very good with a thick casing around the cable and heavy duty connectors. This cable should last for years, even if you lay it on the floor behind furniture, etc.
Poor build quality. The flashlight worked just a couple of times then died.

These are very expensive when you include the shipping (does not qualify for Amazon Prime). However, these are more slip-resistant (on smooth wet surfaces) than the $7 crutch tips sold in drug stores. Durability seems very good so far.
Poor build quality. The flashlight worked just a couple of times, then died.

This battery pack is expensive for the relatively low power capacity, but the build quality appears to be much higher than the cheap "lipstick sized USB chargers". I bought a couple of lipstick chargers with flashlights for under $10 each and they barely work with flakey controls and iffy build quality. This NOCO charger is solidly built and the controls are easy to use. According to my phone, the power output is close to the advertised 1A current. Flashlight is very reliable. My only complaint is that the power level LED has only 2 levels (green for 80% or higher, red for under), which puts you into the red level most of the time. I think 3 or 4 different levels would be a lot more useful.

I'm pretty disappointed by this case. Construction quality and appearance are below average for this price. Most importantly, there are 3 big flaws compared to other Android phone flip cases. First, closing the case does not automatically turn off your screen. If you accidentally forget to turn the screen off, your battery will drain until the screen times out. Second, opening the case does not turn the screen on. Third, the cover hides the notification lights, so you can't tell if you have any notifications. The official Samsung flip case has all these features, so they are technology feasible (and flip covers for most other Android phones also have these features).
Love this album, as well as John's 2nd album. Hope that 3rd album comes out soon.

Can't believe how much they are charging for these. These are thin plastic cups that warp too easily. Fortunately, I found some plastic food containers at my local dollar store that are much better - perfect fit for my shave ice machine and they have covers too keep the ice fresh in the freezer.

These are decent cards. The paper is midweight, not as heavy typical picture postcards, but they should be sturdy to survive the US Mail. Bright white matte finish is easy to print on with a laser printer (either color or monochrome). Print 2 cards from each sheet of paper (50 sheets in the box), so these are kind of expensive. The advantage of using these sheets compared to cardboard from a stationary store is that the Avery sheets are perforated, though using a paper cutter isn't that hard for this size. Also, Avery provides Microsoft Word templates to help you design your postcards on your PC before printing.
This is a decent genmaicha, but come on, this brand costs only $4/box at the grocery store.

Product description on Amazon says these are 100% synthetic socks. Packaging says 70% cotton. What's up with that? Not recommended at the current $10 price. These are no better than Pearl Izumi cycling socks that cost $5 each.

This is a really nice set of kitchen towels and oven mitts, especially for the $22 price. The towels are plush enough to do a good job of cleaning, but not so thick that they would take forever to dry. The mitts and potholders are flexible enough for smaller hands to use comfortably, but not as stiff and heat-resistant as heavy fire-resistant barbeque mitts. These should be OK for most baking needs.

GoPro is a small camera. This is a comparatively huge case. You can fit 3 or more GoPros in here with plenty of extra space for mounts, cables, memory cards, spare batteries, etc. This is not a pocket-size case for carrying your camera in the field, but does a good for carrying it in your car or storing your camera at home. There is lots of padding, including velcro-mounted internal padded dividers that you can move around to fit different types of camera or different gear.

This is my second Remington shaver. I have also used Braun shavers in the past. Remington shavers have larger heads than Braun, so do shave faster. Hard to judge which brand shaves the closest since blade sharpness makes a huge difference (don't compare an old shaver to a new one). They are close enough that I can't really make a judgement. This Remington has a bare minimum set of features. My previous Remington had a charging stand (this one just plugs into a wall cord) and a digital battery level readout (this one just has a single light). My Brauns usually came with nice travel cases. Of course, list price for this Remington is pretty cheap, so you get what you pay for. The trimmer on Remington's is much smaller and harder to use than Braun's.I see some people complaining about lack of replacement parts. I haven't needed a new head yet, but Remington heads do tend to wear out much sooner than Braun. I do see the replacement heads listed on the Remington web site, so you can always get them there if Amazon doesn't carry them. I haven't had any problems with this Remington yet, but my previous Remington lasted for a couple of years (on par with Braun) before the battery started dying too quickly.

These are very good quality full sheet shipping labels, suitable for printing pre-paid labels for USPS or other shipping services. They work great in my laser printer. Knocking off one star because the price is extremely expensive. If you shop around on Amazon, you can find generic full sheet shipping labels for around $11 for 100 (compared to $60 for 250 of these Avery labels). Quality difference is insignificant to me.

These sheets work well for baking breads. Much easier to apply and cleanup than old-fashioned greasing of a cookie sheet. These sheets are folded into fourths in the box, which isn't a problem for breads, but can mess up your cookies if placed on the folds.

I've been having trouble with very dry and cracked skin on my fingers, especially after using cleaning chemicals or even lots of soap. Tried a few different hand lotions with poor results. This one has worked the best so far. I'm not a doctor, so don't know how this works, but I'm satisfied so far.

I guess I read the description wrong because these "shipping tags" are not what I was expecting. I was expecting address labels that you paste on packages for mailing. These are actually paper cards attached wires that you use for labeling large objects. I guess you could use them to identify which rooms that furniture would go in after you move to a new house or the like. The wires are firmly attached to the cards via reinforced holes. You can write on the cards with regular pens or pencils.

I'm not impressed by this book. Who writes a reference book these days with no index? Granted, the book is fairly short, but an index still helps readers find specific material in the book. There are so many different concepts in website development these days that reference book really need to help readers find the material that the need.Regarding the material that is in this book, it focuses almost entirely on front-end development for PC web browsers. There is only one short chapter on optimizing for mobile web browsers, which is an area that is quickly growing in importance. There is only one superficial chapter on server-side optimizations. I think some material on database and application server setup would be very valuable to many readers, though perhaps too complicated to others. The most useful material in this book are the chapters on optimizing your CSS and HTTP, which is important to know.

This mug is a little better looking than generic coffee mugs, but not enough to justify the $12 price. Selling these as singles by mail causes an extremely wasteful amount of packaging. I can't imagine anyone buying just one mug in this small size; why not sell them in sets of 4 in one box? The mug is only 12 ounces, which is very small by American standards. To avoid spilling, you really can't hold more than 8 ounces in here, which is a very small serving of anything that I drink.

This pen is OK. The design is military camo, but they make no claims that this is actually military issue or military spec. The case is plastic, unlike other rugged pens that are metal and feel much sturdier. The clip is big enough to fit a pretty thick pocket, but that also makes it pretty bulky. Writing is smooth, but they make no claims that the ink is water resistant or the cartridge is pressurized, like the Fisher Space Pens do. Not very impressed for a $9 pen.

We've been buying Cottenelle toilet paper here on Amazon. We're trying to be environmentally-friendly, so tried this Scott Naturals TP. The tube-free design does eliminate a lot of wasted cardboard in the long run and this design is very popular in many countries other than the USA. The Scott Naturals also saves paper in several other ways: the sheets are single-ply instead of double-ply, the sheets are about half an inch narrower, the rolls are not individually wrapped (32 rolls in one large shrink-wrap plastic bag). and they claim 40% recycled paper content. Each roll of Scott has 400 sheets, compared to only 166 sheets for Cottonelle. Comfort-wise, the Scott tissue is noticeably less soft than Cottonelle, but better than average for a single-ply tissue. Single-ply is also better for septic systems or older sewer systems. Despite the pro-environment features of the Scott tissue, the price is about 40% cheaper (per sheet) than Cottonelle.

This internet security camera is quite a bit cheaper than the bigger names like DropCam. Documentation is mediocre, which makes using the product difficult. You need to read and follow the directions very carefully to set it up (including connecting to your smartphone and to your home WiFi), but the directions are not detailed enough to make this easy. Once you get the camera set up, it does work, though the image quality is not very sharp. The printed directions have no information about using the camera from a laptop (instead of a smartphone) and also no information about service plans (apparently 1 day of storage is free if you register from the app, additional storage costs big bucks). For the price, this might be a good starter camera before you decide if you want a more expensive system.

These can work if your ear wax buildup is not too heavy, but you have to be really really careful because obviously inserting them too far into your ear can damage your eardrum. The instructions give you no real guidance on how far you can insert them and even if you have someone help you, their visibility into your ear while this tool is inserted is very limited. I might give it more stars if there were better instructions, but have to give it an incomplete grade for now.

My girlfriend broke her leg and we bought this to help with her recovery. I carry it around when she's walking around town on crutches and she uses it to rest or as a footrest when she's sitting on another chair. The Coleman chair is very lightweight and folds compactly for easy carrying or storage. Still, it offers good comfort and support when you're sitting. The chair is tall enough for someone with limited mobility to easily sit and stand without assistance (unlike most other camp chairs). I weigh 160 pounds and this chair is comfortable for me, but I can understand how someone much larger might not fit in the chair (compare the width to other chairs that you own.) Other camp chairs are much heavier, bulkier, and more expensive. Very happy with this purchase.

This is my favorite IZ DVD. Great selection of performances from the prime of his career. Sound quality is great and video quality is good for live performances. His beautiful voice and singing really comes through. Just wish it were longer.

Very disappointed with these earphones. They paired easily with my phone's bluetooth, but sound quality is terrible. Midtones are muddy with poor clarity. Much worse than other $20 bluetooth headphones that I have bought from Amazon (MEE and MPOW).

I've bought several different poly quick-dry boxer briefs from Amazon. These Hanes briefs are less soft or strechy than Champion, less supportive than Adidas or UnderArmour, and less breathable than ExOfficio. On the other hand, the price is somewhat lower than any of the others. If price is really important to you and you're not using these for serious or extended workouts, then give these a try.

We're not too impressed by the quality of this product. Installing the batteries (not included) is fairly difficult. You need a small jewelers screwdriver (not included) to open a door in the bottom of the light. The battery compartment is mostly cheap plastic and we had to try several times before the batteries lined up properly to make the light turn on. Still, it doesn't go reliably on every time we shake the light. I'm guessing the cheap electronics are unreliable. Price is too high for this quality level.

I agree with many of the other reviews that the floppy brim is a big negative. The stiffer brim on all other bicycle caps allows you to flip the brim up to keep it from blocking your vision when you are riding. Floppy brim is dangerous. On the plus side, this cap is fairly large so it will fit large heads (I wear a size 7.5 hat and it fits well).
Really enjoy this CD. Great mix of Hawaiian-language lyrics and English lyrics with Hawaiian-style music.

This is a decent black tea. We use 1 teaspoon of tea leaves per cup using a tea pot with built-in strainer. The tea brews very quickly. Flavor is mild (not bitter), which is what we prefer. There is a mild fruit/herb flavor, but is not distracting. This will probably make a great ice tea; you don't have to add sugar with the built-in fruit flavor.

This is a relatively inexpensive snorkel set that works better than I expected for the $25 price. Field of view is very good. The snorkel isn't as long as I prefer, but works well enough. The valve keeps most water out of the snorkel when you go underwater. This isn't the best product on the market, but I can't complain at this price.

This bottle mostly works well. It is sturdy, easy to fill, easy to clean, and is mostly leak-proof. Kids have to push the button on the back every time they want to take a sip of water, which is easy for some kids and hard for others. If your kid has poorer than average coordination or strength, this may not be a good choice.

I agree with the other reviews that this trap is not nearly as powerful as the old wooden rat traps. Thank the CPSC for making these traps safer to humans, but less effective for their intended use. Still, this can work against smaller mice (not rats) and it does work better than the glue-type traps.

This sauce is more Americanized-Chinese than authentic Szechwan. Soy sauce and corn syrup as the main ingredients, with unidentified spices and "natural flavors" way down on the list. The flavor is typical of cafeteria or food court style Chinese food. Customers expecting real Szechwan restaurant flavors will be disappointed.

This skin moisturizer works as advertised and smells pretty nice. They advertise it as a huge time saver, but realistically, it doesn't save me much time. The product is cheap enough that you can try it for yourself and decide.

QUICK SUMMARY:  Good features, good audio at a very good price.WHAT I LIKED:- Headphones are very lightweight- The sound quality is perfectly adequate for gaming- The microphone records clearly and sounds crisp- The microphone is removable- There is a volume control on the headset which is easy to adjust, but not likely to get bumped and adjusted accidentally- There is also a mic mute switch on the cable- Short cable (ideal for connecting to a controller)WHAT COULD BE BETTER:- Not ideal for listening to music, the mid-range tones are a bit muted, and the low frequencies tend to get cut off- The microphone can be difficult to position where you want, as the boom is somewhat inflexibleWHAT YOU SHOULD KNOW:- The mic only goes into the headset one way, so you have to make sure the slot on the mic lines up properly to the headset.  It would be nice if it was like an Apple lightning cable which can be inserted without having an up or down side to the plug.- The cable is a 4 pin 3.5mm connector, so keep in mind that if your device has separate line out and mic in connectors, you will need a splitter to get both audio and mic functionality from the headset.CONCLUSION:  Good, inexpensive gaming headset won't cost you much, and will get the job done.

QUICK SUMMARY:  My teen daughter saw it, snatched it, and hasn't yet stopped wearing it!  Recommended!BACKGROUND:  I have several young ladies in my home, and also my wife.  When I selected this item, I didn't specifically have in mind which of my beautiful ladies in the home would like an item like this.  Turns out that one of my teen daughters saw this item firstly, took it out of the box, put it on, and hasn't stopped wearing it since.  She loves it!  Whether any of her siblings or her mother ever get to wear this necklace, neither I nor they can say.WHAT MY DAUGHTER LIKES:- She loves the design and overall quality which is good for relative to the cost- The clasp worked well, as expected- No issues with the way it looks or the way it wearsFive stars!  I may have to buy another necklace like this for the coming holidays.....

QUICK SUMMARY:  This item isn't a sweet spot for price-per-gigabyte, and overall performance is only so-so.WHAT I LIKE:- Inexpensive, but the better value (lower cost per gigabyte) is SanDisk Ultra 32GB Ultra Micro SDHC UHS-I/Class 10 Card with Adapter (SDSQUNC-032G-GN6MA) [Newest Version]- This item claims to be waterproof (but I haven't tested that claim, though it's reassuring)- My experience with other Sandisk products has been favorableWHAT COULD BE BETTER::- Benchmark testing wasn't impressive, only 24-27MB/s read/write speeds using 1GB data in CrystalDiskMark 5.0.2, so not particularly close to the 80MB/s claimed (using a Dell Inspiron 13 7000 Series)CONCLUSION:  Unless you are constrained by a very tight budget, move up to the 64GB card.

QUICK SUMMARY:  The router is designed with beginners in mind, but provides all the features power users could dream of.WHAT I LIKE:- The router has a very beginner-friendly setup page that walks you through the process of configuring the router to your liking- The directions that come with the router are also detailed and very easy to follow (one example of this is that the Ethernet cable that came with the router was actually labeled 'modem' to indicate that it should be plugged into the modem, then into the router, as per the instructions)- Despite its initial beginner's focus, the router has all the configurability you could desire, from port forwarding to dynamic DNS.- The router has a button that will disable its blue LED indicator lights (I wish all electronics had this function).- It has MU-MIMO, although I didn't notice much difference between it and our current router, which is a modern dual-band router with AC protocol.USING AMPED-WIRELESS SUPPORT:If you think you'll need help setting up a router, Amped-Wireless makes sure you know support is available.  I actually contacted their representatives twice during the course of my configurations, and had positive interactions both times.  The first contact was email, and I received a reply exactly 24 hours later with a detailed and accurate answer regarding my question.  The second experience was with their live-chat support.  A representative was able to solve my issue with haste and politeness.  I was very happy with Amped-Wireless's support!WHAT COULD BE BETTER:- A bunch of static IP addresses disappeared when I added them in batch, although the rules were still applied, I simply couldn't see the addresses I had assigned, although I could see the devices they were assigned to.  Full disclosure:  This issue could have been caused by my not unplugging the device (as the instructions said to do).- You can add rules to both the static DHCP table and port forwarding list without having to reboot the router.  However, when you remove a rule from either area (which you will do often, because there is no option to edit rules) you aren't given an option to delay a reboot, it just forces it on you.- When you are entering MAC addresses in the static DHCP screen, the MAC address values cannot have colons or dashes, or you won't be able to add the entire address, since the text box is fixed at 12 characters.  I would have preferred it if the router to enter the MAC in whatever form you saw fit, and then the router's software would convert it to whatever format they wanted to use.- This is a very minor gripe, but the port forwarding on this router only allows forwarding ranges of ports to an IP, rather than specifying an external port and an internal port.CONCLUSION:  Nice feature set, helpful product support, and good overall performance makes this a 4.5-star product, but the high cost of it knocks it down to 4-stars.  If you're thinking of replacing your dual-band AC router with this router, you may not find much of a difference in WiFi performance to warrant the cost.

QUICK SUMMARY:  If you're looking for a dirt-cheap, Windows-based netbook (or small laptop) that's very light and enough computing power for everyday computing -- and you don't care much about the color display -- then you've found your item!  But upgrading to Windows 10 is not a slam-dunk (but keep reading to learn more)....BACKGROUND:  For the new school year, my kids were clamoring for better computing devices, as we've made-do with laptop that are 8-10 years old, and netbooks that are 3-4 years old.  Initially, I went down the path of buying a single, mid-grade laptop, but when I spend $500 or more on a laptop, I feel compelled to buy some sort of a warranty and accidental coverage protection on it, making it cost at least $100 more, so, =>$600.  Then my college-aged son suggested this dirt-cheap Asus netbook / small laptop.  It comes with one year of Office 365 subscription, it's upgradable to Windows 10, has terrific battery life and with flash memory, it's got relatively quick read/write access.  The Wifi works on the 5Ghz or 2.4Ghz band (on the N protocol, not the newer AC).  The keyboard is what you'd expect from a <$200 laptop.  So I opted to get a couple of these laptops, figuring that if they last a school year, I'm good, and if they last two school years, I'm better.  No extra warranty needed; if it breaks, just buy a new one.UPGRADING TO WINDOWS 10:  You *have* to add extra memory to do the free upgrade to Windows 10 (Home Edition).  You'll want to add an SD card anyway, because the 32GB of flash storage is mostly consumed by the operating system and utilities, and the Windows 10 installer won't install without extra storage available.  A great solution is buying the SanDisk Ultra 64GB Ultra Micro SDXC UHS-I/Class 10 Card with Adapter (SDSQUNC-064G-GN6MA) [Newest Version] card, which is very low-cost but gives you ample room for everyday computing tasks.Upon initially starting this Asus laptop, Windows Update went right to work and downloaded Windows 10.  But when I tried running the update from Windows Update, the process failed at 19% overall complete (during the Copying Files task, which was 65% completed).  I shutdown the laptop (held down the power button until it shut-off, then pressed it again to boot up) and Windows restored back to Windows 8.1.  Strike one!So I tried putting an ISO file of Windows 10 on the Desktop (which I downloaded from Microsoft using my MSDN license), mounting it from Windows Explorer, and running the Windows 10 upgrade again.  This time, it got to 24% overall complete (still in the Copying Files task) before stalling out.  I rebooted, Windows restored back to Windows 8.1.  Strike two!For the third time, I still used the ISO file on the Desktop to perform the upgrade, but this time I said "No" to the question of whether I wanted to download the latest updates during the install process (which is the recommended option, btw).  This time, the installation worked.  After it booted up to Windows 10, I used Windows Update to get all the latest patches and fixes - no issues.  If you get this laptop and want to upgrade to Windows 10, my suggestion is NOT to use the "recommended" option of getting the latest updates during the Windows 10 install process (which is one of the early prompts you get when running the Windows 10 installer).WHAT I LIKE:- Overall, it's a great value for what you get, which is a cheap, usable Windows computer- The flash memory keeps it from feeling overly sluggish- The Intel Atom processor is miserly on power consumption- The battery life is reported at 12 hours.  Expect 8+ hours depending on usage and power option settings.- The keyboard isn't the worst chiclet-style keyboard I've used- For everyday computing (browsing the web, Word docs, email, YouTube, Netflix), it's fine- Office 365 one-year subscription is a great deal, too- Not a lot of bloatware, but there is some (the worst of which is McAfee anti-virus)- Super light, just about two pounds, so it's really easy to transport- The display size (11.6" diagonal) is nicely big enough to do basic computing tasks- I had no trouble using the touchpad, seems okayWHAT COULD BE BETTER:- The color display is a weak link.  Don't expect vibrant, true-to-life colors and great viewing angles.  Colors will appear faded if you're used to high quality color displays.  The color output achieves in-the-ball-park, okay-if-you're-not-too-picky color saturation.  Some colors, like reds and pinks, seem harder for the display to render accurately.WHAT I HATE:- I hate that vendors pre-install anti-virus solutions that are bloated and slow, and hard to get rid of, like McAfee.  After uninstalling McAfee (Control Panel > Programs & Features > choose McAfee and uninstall it), do a Google search for "McAfee Consumer Product Removal tool (MCPR) download" to download a utility that actually gets rid of McAfee off your system (well, it's better than just doing a Windows uninstall only, anyway).9/2/15 UPDATE:  My family liked these small computers so much, we bought three more of them!  The upgrade to Windows 10 went very smoothly on these other laptops when I chose NOT to use their recommended upgrade setting that downloads updates to Windows 10 during the upgrade.  Instead, we update to Windows 10 firstly, then after a successful upgrade, we perform all the updates.CONCLUSION:  What a great product if you're in the market for a reasonably capable, lightweight, inexpensive, Windows-based computer.
