**5 STAR REVIEW**Conscience is a continuation of Dissident, the story of political figures, Jack and Caroline. Caroline has been taken prisoner and is beaten and tortured beyond what our mind could possibly comprehend, all for information that is believed she has privy to. The hell she goes through is out weighed by the memories she has of her family, her husband Jack and friends. It is those memories, which help get her through the sick sadistic actions of her enemies.The story is done in flashbacks that take us to the past to show us how everything unfolded and how it became to be the America it is now. Thinking that they took all the right measures of sending their girls away and trying to prepare everyone else of what is to come, Jack and Caroline can only pray they did what they could for everyoneâ€™s safety. I know that sometimes flashbacks are a bit tricky, but Cecilia pulls it off flawlessly. It plays out in smooth transitions.The interaction between Ceciliaâ€™s characters play off of each other like a well-written symphony. The villains, hero, heroine and support characters interact in a way that truly bring the book into a full fledge motion picture in your mind. Needless to say, I am completely smitten with Caroline. She is a strong character and a true heroine that takes more than enough for the team.Conscience is still the awesomely written political thriller that Dissident was, however it is much more darker. The mental, physical and sexual abuse/torture that was brought in, depicted just how corrupted, deceitful and under minded the government had become. This book was a rollercoaster of emotions for the reader. If you did not feel exactly what the characters were going through, then you were half reading it. There was no escaping the hurt, pain, pleasure and frustration that was played out on the pages.If you are looking for all the answers in this book, look again. I hate to tell you, it has a bit of a cliffhanger. Politics has never been something I was interested in reading about, but Cecilia has changed that world for me. Conscience is a book that you simply canâ€™t put down. However, if you can manage to pry your eyes from the page, you find yourself breathing hard, sweating and just saying, holy crap! I am eager to read the next installment in The Bellator Saga series.This is one series I canâ€™t get enough of.[...]

Life had a plan for her and Dax to meet again but will they be able to hit it off?Being in law enforcement Dax was dealing with something heavy but when evil lurks in the shadow and puts Mackenzie in dangers path he knows he must do everything to safe her.Well Batch of Honor Series is a new series by Susan Stoker and like always this NY Times, USA Best selling, did not disappointed. She introduce to us this middle age Texas Ranger hottie that will melt your panties. Not only that but will leave you panting, for days to come.Mackenzie is not your typical size 0 heroine or this gorgeous girl but that does not make her feel bad about herself. She is funny, strong and smart. She is the girls next door and that is why you will identify with her.If how this story is any indication of the outcome of this series then we have one helluva series for the months to come.I without a doubt recommend this book and series, you will not want to miss this.Gifted by author in exchange for an honest review.https://www.facebook.com/BooksandBeyondFiftyShades

âœ°âœ°âœ°âœ°âœ°âœ° 5 STAR REVIEW âœ°âœ°âœ°âœ°âœ°âœ°After being rescued by Xan ( Alex), Georgie was buying time from Tatiana and her goons. She knew it wa a matter of time that she must leave again and start all over with a brand new identity. But staying close to him is something against her rules. Knowing her heart was at risk is something she will have to face when the time came to leave.Xan (Alex or Alexander) had made his personal goal to keep Georgie safe and at his side. He loved how he felt when she was in his bed but his demons will come to play a bigger part in this crazy relationship. But will he be able to keeper safe from the Russian Mafia?As I continue Xan and Georgie's crazy saga, I become more and more desperate to continue following their journey. â˜†â™¡â˜†â™¡â˜†â™¡ 5 STAR REVIEW â™¡â˜†â™¡â˜†â™¡â˜†Tara has learned that not only her dad is marrying Brad's mom but also he is an identical twin and she has committed the ultimate betrayal. Not only must she keeps her relationship from Brad hidden but also what she did with Brayden.Brad is happy to find out he will be closer than ever to Tara, but he's getting this funny vibe from her. Give this story a chance and at the end everything will make sense.I guaranteed it.I recommend this powerful installment and the whole series.https://www.facebook.com/BooksandBeyondFiftyShades

âœ°âœ°âœ° 5 STAR REVIEW âœ°âœ°âœ°Tara has been living the best days of her life, since her mother passing. But like always happiness does not last forever. She is sad summer is here and her and Brad will not be able to spend it together. When her father shared his good news with her Tara didn't know how to take it.When she arrived to her new home for the summer things will change everything but how can she and Brad survived this summer. How could Tara and Brad continue their romance when there is evil lurking in the shadows.Can Brad be the strong shoulder Tara needs to survive this new ride they are in for?As we continue following Tara and Brad's story, you will find yourself wanting more. The intensity of the plot will keep you searching for the next installment.The mystery of the story will leave some of you shaking your heads but don't stop there continue the story until the end and you will not be disappointed.I recommend this installment and the rest of the series.https://www.facebook.com/BooksandBeyondFiftyShades

*5 Star Review*Antoine Chevalier is different than the people around him. He has a secret that no ordinary person can possibly know. One night his world is turned upside down. Is it possible for him to come out of this struggle with the little that is left of his humanity? Will all his hopes and dreams be just a thing of the past?If you ever wondered who Antoine was before his life at the Les Beaux Arts at the Chateau DeRoche, this will fill in all the missing pieces. It is a short story that goes through history before Antoine was turned into his Vampire/Gargoyle hybrid.Lisa Carlisle does a fabulous job going through parts of Antoine's life that were never discussed in previous stories. Through Darkness Rising, we learn why Antoine is the compassionate person that he is, and we learned what made him that way.I loved the struggle for Antoine after he first was turned into a Vampire/Gargoyle hybrid. He could have turned and became a monster, yet, he was able to keep as much of his humanity as he could. That is what makes him so loveable throughout this series.If you want to learn about Antoine's past, I highly recommend this short story. It is a quick read, but definitely fills in all the missing pieces that make up Antoine!https://www.facebook.com/BooksandBeyondFiftyShades

âœ°âœ°âœ° 5 STAR REVIEW âœ°âœ°âœ°Marissa was determined to clear her dad's name. After finding evidence he was not crazy and that what he had said all along right before his death was true.She embarks in a journey to find what exactly he had seen but what she finds will change her life forever.Is Marissa ready to travel this journey or will she failed to do so?I will be very honest here, this is my first mermaid story besides The Little Mermaid, and I was captivated by this simple yet incredible novella. I wished it was long enough to continue reading more about Marissa and Dylan.Being the first book or novella that I had the pleasure reading from Author JM Miller I can tell you it is worth reading her books. You will become a fan just like I did.I recommend this novella, you will not be disappointed.https://www.facebook.com/BooksandBeyondFiftyShades

Fiona has mixed feeling for Gabe, knowing that she has everything on the line, her job, her heart and the opportunity to get out of that horrendous debt. But how far can she go before she is in dangerous territory with Gabe and her heart?Gabe is at the end of this thing with Fiona, but the thing is he doesn't know what exactly it is. He know the chemistry is fantastic between them but her insecurities are still there and they are making it impossible for him to see past that or is it?Can Gabe and Fiona make this whatever they have work without putting the research in danger and without her heart being shattered?As I continue to read Fiona and Gabe's journey it makes me want to continue reading this wild story. One minute Fiona is getting on your last nerve the next you are loving her. As for Gabe one minute you want to be under him and the next minute you want to slap him seven ways to Sunday!!This is one wild, lovable story and series and if you haven't yet starting reading it you are missing something good.I recommend this book and series and can't wait to continue following them.Gifted by author in exchange for an honest review.https://www.facebook.com/BooksandBeyondFiftyShades

â€¢â€¢*'¨`*â€¢.â˜†â€¢ 5 Star Review â€¢â€¢*'Â¨`*â€¢.â˜†â€¢Tara had always counted with her father since her mom passed away and no matter what she always missed her. So when she started her first semester of university she knew she had to do good to show her father his sacrifices were paying off.But she knew she would need a good lab partner in order to do well in her class the last thing she imagined have this smart and gorgeous lab partner.Bradley or Brad had always had it easy with school work now at home he always tried to help their mother since his abusive father walked out on him and his other two brothers.Finding a real friend on Tara was easy for him, keeping all the feelings that were awakening for her was not. Her mother is dying, her ex-boyfriend framed her in the bank robbery he committed with his brother. Knowing it will not be easy going against these criminals she knows he's in trouble. When her mother tells her to run she has no other choice but will she ever clear her name and live free?Blaze Marino is having a hard time tracking his new target so when she come to his rescue he thought it would be easy to take her back but the more he gets to know her the more the knows she's innocent however the only thing he is not sure is how he is feeling about her. âœ°âœ°âœ° 5 STAR REVIEW âœ°âœ°âœ°Diana thought this was her second chance with Leo, but boy was she wrong. She has been betrayed once before, but nothing hurts as much as being betrayed a second time. Her first instinct is to run; far away from Leo and all the heartbreak that comes with him. Little did she know that running would send her into the arms of Angelo; he's caring, and sexy. Could he be a solution to all Diana's problems, or will he just add fuel to the fire?Book 2 allows Diana the opportunity to start over; again. While it is not what she wanted in the beginning, her date with Angelo proves to be exactly what she needs to take her mind off Leo.At first, I was a little surprised with how easily Diana was falling for Angelo; then I began to understand how it happened. He is an extremely caring person, who only wants Diana to be happy, even if he only just met her.Olivia Rigal could have gone either way with Angelo, yet she chose to make him a character that helps Diana with all that is going on in her life. While at times he is very forward and pushy, it is nice to see a male character tell it like it is. Her relationship with Angelo is pure and sensual.Things between them move FAST, and that doesn't stop when Olivia hits us with an "OH MY GO" moment. If you thought Leo coming back was a shock in book 1, wait until you come face to face with the CLIFFHANGER in book 2. When it happened, I felt as lightheaded as Diana did. Thank you Olivia for making me sweat it out until I can read book 3!!Again, this is a novella, but in no way is the story between Angelo and Diana rushed. It is packed with excitement, as well as self discovery. I highly recommend this series and can't wait for book 3!https://www.facebook.com/BooksandBeyondFiftyShades

âœ°âœ°âœ° 5 STAR REVIEW âœ°âœ°âœ°Years after her heart was broken, Diana is still trying to piece it back together. With her friends there to help her, she thinks an invite to the most exclusive club in town is just what she needs.Diana's mentality is: new city, new men. That proves to be untrue when someone from her past comes waltzing back into her life. Is it fate? Or is it the worst possible surprise?What I enjoyed most about Lost and Found, is that the main character isn't a size 0; she is a woman that has curves in all the right places. Not only that, but she is proud of who she is. There are so many stories out there of women who are a size 0, when in reality, that's not how most women look.This story was relatable in that aspect, as well as the fact that Diana has a painful past that she just can't seem to shake. Most of us have been there; that one person you just can't stop thinking about no matter how hard you try.While this is a novella, Olivia Rigal has managed to jam pack it with action.This book is not for the faint of heart. The D/s sex scenes are intense, and RED HOT! The chemistry between characters is undeniable.This story is not just about sex, but about love, loss, and hope. I highly recommend this series. The cliffhangers will literally leave you wanting more!!https://www.facebook.com/BooksandBeyondFiftyShades

â€áƒ¦âœ¿â€¢*Â¨`*â€¢.Â¸5 STAR REVIEWÂ¸.â€¢*Â¨`*â€¢âœ¿.â„’â„´Ñµâ„¯.My Serenity will bring you to your knees, will have you reminiscing about your truly, madly, deeply first love. As always M.Clarke never disappoints her fans and she has proved it once again with My Serenity.The innocent love Josie and Seth had in six grade was so pure yet it was the so strong neither one of them realized how much impact their lives.Life was not kind to Josie, but like a strong woman she was going to be she faced her demons daily, her only salvation was when she was near her first, innocent love Seth. She would endure so much pain throughout her life, her only thing that kept afloat were the memories of her hero, her serenity that Seth represented to her.Seth was so sweet when he was young but he knew one thing he loved his Josie Rosie, like he used to called her. But when she was taken from him with no explanation he hurt but never forgot about her. This will make him the respectable, humble man he was today.Fast forward to the present day when fate had plan on reunite Seth and Josie, the two innocent kids that were now young adults with a love so strong for each other, that it was kept in their hearts awaiting to be unleashed once and for all. Josie's demons were lurking in the shadows and they wanted to prevent them for finally be together but will Seth and Josie's love be strong enough to face her demons? Will he continue to be her hero and rescue her like she had wished all this years?My Serenity is by far the most emotional book by M. Clarke, it will leave a permanent mark in your heart. With each and every page you read from this story will leave you with an understanding of how true love will stay alive no matter time, distance or any obstacle that will try and prevent from being with your love, your hero, your serenity.I want everyone to read this story, because books that leave a mark in your heart are worth reading over and over again.Gifted by author in exchange for an honest review.https://www.facebook.com/BooksandBeyondFiftyShades

I originally ordered these protein shakes for the mornings when my husband doesn't have time for breakfast...We love the Orgain protein powders so I figured these would be good for quick convenience. We'd give them 4 stars for flavor; these are yummy and we'd order them again if they didn't contain the ingredient Carageenan. If you aren't familiar with it, I'd recommend looking it up.My mistake for ordering in a hurry and assuming it was of the same quality that the other stuff is... Won't buy again or recommend to others. Hope this helps.After reviewing them (in the Vanilla flavor), I received a response as follows:Oct 31, 2015 11:38:59 PM PDTOrgain, Inc. says:Hi Mariam, thank you for your feedback. All of our products are now being produced without carrageenan. Please email us at info@drinkorgain.com for more information.Thanks so much.The Orgain Team... So here I came to try the chocolate flavor. Disappointed to receive another dozen shakes containing Carageenan. Time to email Orgain. Uploading some photos. Hope this is helpful!

How awesome are these GoPicnic meals?! Love these little race cars!! So much fun! I bought these styi (color: Pink/ Purple) back in July, after finding that numerous others didn't work on our Google Nexus 7, 2013 tablet...Previously, I'd purchased multi-packs that were a good value but didn't work on our tablet and, silly me, I'd have much preferred a pretty pink or purple too. Now that I've confessed my frugality and my priorities, lol...This works great on our HTC One M8 cell phones but like some other styli, it's just okay on the tablet. It's not a matter of brushing delicately or applying pressure either, with that device, it's just too annoying to want to use at all.Works great with every other device though. We've tried it with iPhones and Nintendo DS with no issues at all. Very responsive, no issues with drag or pressure, etc.This is a definite favorite because of the fine tip! Everyone knows what it's like dealing with a small phone and big thumbs, lol. This stylus makes it easy to make precise selections on a small screen, without constantly having to first zoom in. Much more efficient, in my opinion, than using a wider tip.I also love the weight of these! Not heavy per say but not as light as plastic. This doesn't feel like using plastic cutlery.The top has a tiny hole making it great for attaching to a lanyard. If you need one handy while working, this is a nice convenience!Love that Bargain Depot includes extra replacement tips! After 4+ months of use, my original tips still work as good as new but nice to have for when needed.Hate that the brand name is boldly listed at the top of these styli. Most seem to be labeled here now (and personal preference) but I don't want my bargain advertised, lol.After a few months of use, I did randomly have one tip fall off (not just the rubber part, see photo). When I finally found the missing part, I superglued it back together and haven't had another issue since.Functionality-wise, five stars, except for with our Nexus (and not many work with it!)! Four stars because they're not dual purpose in also being ink pens! ; ) Didn't knock another star for the fallen tip because I do think these are much better than just an okay rating overall.Another I'd also recommend although it doesn't have a skinny tip (but it works well with both our phones and tablet), gives you 3 for close to the same price currently, and also pretty, haha... Fenix - Pack of Three Purple Universal Stylus Pen with Matchng Purple Soft Rubber Tip for iPhone 4/5/5c/6/6+, iPad/iPad Air/iPad Mini, Samsung Galaxy S4/S5/S6/Edge, Kindle Fire, Surface Pro and Much More One lastly, I'd recommend, another favorite! Sold in a value pack, these are dual purpose, both ink pens as well as styli, unfortunately these also do not work on our tablet... They do work on every other device we've tested though, Stylus pen, F-colorâ„¢ Black Ink 2 in 1 Ultralight Capacitive Stylus and Ballpoint for Touch Screen Devices, iPhone 6 6 Plus 5 5s 5c, iPad, iPod, Android, Orange Green Blue Purple Red, 10 PackStill searching for the perfect (to me, lol) stylus...Â  Smile. Hope this helps!

The kind folks at Roybens provided me with this sleep mask in exchange for sharing my unbiased review...This sleep mask is a personal favorite! I've purchased a bunch of different types for my mom but only personally own one other style, Eye Mask Sleep Mask for Men and Women By Smarter Rest - Sleeping Mask for Night REM Sleep, Travel, Nap, Yoga, Meditation - Reduces Dry Eyes, Puffy Eyes, Apnea, Keeps Cold, Better Than Gel Eye Mask - Silk & Cotton, Memory Foam Ear Plugs, Free Ebook - Satisfaction GuaranteedThis mask is pleasing (like the other) in that the strap is wide enough to be comfortable and has a velcro closure, without any plastic or hard parts to rub the skin or hair.I especially like the thicker memory foam mask on this product! It doesn't feel hot (like memory foam pillows can get) and it's a nice firm foam that stays put, comfortably on my face. This product is made in China and (thankfully!) does not have any noticeable scent.This mask gives me nice coverage and is a perfect fit without it's velcro strap needing to be tightened or loosened from lining right up. On my husband's face, a little light is exposed at the bottom but it's so far below his line of site, he says it doesn't matter.Although this eye mask didn't come with a case, it did come with ear plugs (which I can always use!) and it is my first pick anytime I'm trying to shut my eyes during daylight hours. Since my husband's sleep apnea often keeps me up at night, this is unfortunately pretty often!I'd definitely recommend these to others and will update my review should my opinion on them change. I'd say they make an excellent gift except that the box they arrived in was pretty dented up. I'd toss the box and use a gift bag. (I didn't rate them down for that because I feel they are a 5 star product and the box protected them in shipping just fine.)I'm uploading some photos so you can get a closer look of just how thick these puppies are. You'll have to pick one up to actually feel the goodness for yourself though... Pretty nice! See tag in photo for wash instructions. Smile. Hope this is helpful!

The folks at Lightspeed NY were kind enough to provide me with this RFID blocking wallet in exchange for sharing my unbiased review...This is a really beautiful leather wallet! The only reason I rated it down a star is because I don't personally care for the logo engraved in the leather (definitely a matter of personal preference).This item is made in China. Delivered as pictured and described. The color is a nice, rich brown. The feel is supple and rich and it has the fresh smell of new leather.Arrived in a nice gift box and would certainly make a nice gift for anyone. It arrives carefully wrapped in tissue, wrapped around each fold of leather.This doesn't feel stiff like some new wallets that feel like they need to be broken in to become flexible.Considering this is RFID protecting, we were surprised that it wasn't thicker than most wallets. We found this to be a good size for practical use.The flap that folds out is a nice feature that my husband especially likes. Convenient for when you need to quickly show your ID and don't need to actually pull it out.We've had this wallet for over a month and would recommend it to others. Should my opinion on it change after more use, I'll be sure to update this review. Uploading some photos so you can get a closer look. Smile. Hope this is helpful!

It's okay... I keep buying this because it's convenient and a really good value when an added coupon is running here.My husband uses it when I buy it and I think it looks great but it's not his favorite choice. He'll only use it if there's nothing else, lol.I have thick hair and loads of it. Naturally wavy-curly. (I'm from Afghanistan, for reference.) When I go curly, I scrunch the product in wet and then let it air dry without touching it.I don't care for crunchy curls and this leaves a bit of that, the way I style my hair. I will say it's hold is good and it takes care of any fly aways.My favorite use for this is actually for DIY hair mascara, lol. If you mix a bit of this clear hair gel with a bit of matte eyeshadow that matches your hair color, it works great (with a mascara wand) for root touch-ups. Funny but it works between colors!My favorite product for soft curls is TIGI Curls Rock. More money but worth the soft results, no crunchy hair, and no stickiness. A little goes a long ways too.This Aussie isn't my first recommendation but I'd say it's definitely worth trying considering the price! I'll probably keep buying it between our favorite products, smile. Hope this is helpful!

The kind folks from Maximum Quality provided me with this travel money belt in exchange for sharing my unbiased review...My husband and I were really impressed with this item! It's zippers and design are similar in quality to one of my Baggalini bags, if that gives you an idea of the design! Super nice look and quality for travel or whatever your use might be!Love the size, flat look, and think it would be durable for travel. Being that I haven't had the pleasure of traveling since receiving this, I'll need to update this review after putting it to real use. We all know when traveling, some things can be worn out quickly.This item is made in China and is true to color as pictured. The gray gives it a nice modern look and I think this would make an excellent gift for anyone who travels. Thr pockets are perfect for many different sized items and are not lacking!It has an adjustable strap to go around the waist that seems well made and as strong as a luggage strap. The fit is wide enough to be supportive while a nice, comfortable fit. For reference, my hips are 38" and I can wear this low with room to spare.RFID protection is a nice added feature but I haven't tested it for that. I have had these sleeves in use for over a month though. Love that the card holders each have inspiring phrases printed on them! Smile. Shared with my mom and husband. They are thick and seem sturdy for our use. The larger one is for your passport.I think this would have good use even for while laying by the pool. Because it's waterproof, lies flat, and would easily wipe clean, it could easily lay under a beach towel to carry the few necessary items while staying at a hotel, etc.This would also on be perfect for use during a marathon or 3-day walk! Often times, on 60 mile marathons, it's super warm out, so people on the streets are kind enough to be spraying water at us to cool us off... And many of us use our phones for music, etc. This would keep funds and important items dry without the weight or bulge of a fanny pack.For currently under $20, I think this is an excellent value and I'd definitely recommend it to others. Uploading some photos so you can get a closer look. Smile. Buy with confidence. Hope this is helpful!

I haven't tried plain millet before to be able to compare this to another but I didn't personally caare for these Millet Puffs. The folks at EveryMarket US were kind enough to provide me with this backpack in exchange for sharing my unbiased review...When I initially ordered this backpack, I'd read a couple of reviews that recommended this bag, per the description, only for light use, maybe like a purse but not for anything heavy...I was quite pleasantly surprised with this bag! In the initial packaging, in all of it's cuteness, I'd have agreed but after over a month of use, I'd say it can handle my college work load!This bag's body feels thin but similar to my JanSport backpack, that doesn't mean it won't hold up! If you are familiar with JanSport, you know that it has a lifetime warranty and is built to last.What I love about this bag most are the padded shoulder straps. They are wide and comfortable. Carrying my notebook, some files, three textbooks, and supplies aren't light. Good straps are important for carrying a heavy workload comfortably.The mesh side pockets easily fit my Glasstic Shatterproof Glass Water Bottle - 16oz - Flip Cap Sports Water Bottle - Purple and have a bit of room to spare. When water bottles are in place though, they take away from the inner space of the body of the bag. It's nice having pockets that allow a decent size bottle standing up though!There are two zipper pockets on the outside that I wish were a bit wider. I use a photo case for supplies and it's just a bit too wide for these but fits fine in the body of the bag. It's from another retailer but similar to this one, IRIS Photo and Craft Case, 5 by 7-Inch Having two zipper pockets instead of one is nice though and they add to the depth of the bag.The body of the bag is another favorite feature for me. It's roomier all around than my JanSport and fits all of my books and files with room to spare. The padded pocket that safely protects an iPad is perfect for my Google Nexus 7 (new gen) tablet, again with room to spare. The added two slip pockets are perfect for a large cell phone like my HTC One M8 and some pens or other items you may need quick access to.The zipper pulls have the leather look and thus far I've not had any problems with the zippers. There are no loose seems and the bag appears to be well made. Should my opinion change later down the road, I'll be sure to update my review but I feel like it'll hold up just fine.Overall, I'd say this is a fantastic backpack that looks even better in person and is large enough for comfortable adult use. Highly recommended! Uploading some photos of the bag in use, so you can get a closer look inside. Smile. Hope this is helpful!

The folks at Advetic were kind enough to provide me with these compression socks in exchange for sharing my unbiased review...I do not have Plantar Fasciitis but I do deal with occasional foot pain. I have back problems so I shouldn't but I do occasionally wear high heels and consequently, I deal with foot cramps and sometimes my toes painfully locking up. When that happens, I use some toe separators that help them unlock (similar to these but don't remember where I got them, somewhere locally),  Flex Toe Stretchers - Pain Relief for Bunion - Plantar Fasciitis - Hallux Valgus - Hammertoe. Flex Gel Straightener and Separator Will Relieve Pain in Your Feet, Toes & Ball of Foot. Perfect for Quickly Alleviating Pain After Practicing Ballet, Dance, Yoga and Sports Activities by ToeTallees(TM)I don't deal with any swelling issues either but I do believe these would help for that. I've participated in a couple 3 day 60 mile walks and one 26 mile marathon run. Training for and participating in those, I wore compression socks that covered from my ankels to my calves and the tightness felt very similar to these. They kept me from getting too much swelling and helped keep my muscles warm to prevent injuries. So I know how valuable these things can be.What I've been most appreciative for since receiving these is how they keep my feet warm. Being that they're made in China and don't have any wash instructions, I hesitated to try them on but wanted to make sure they fit so I went ahead. They felt so good on, these are definitely keepers!I wear a size 7.5 shoe and ordered them in a Medium according to the sizing info in the product description. I'll wash them like my other compression socks, cold wash (in a lingerie wash bag) and hang dry.My toes are still cold, lol but the compression over the top of my foot, under my arches, and around my ankles does bring the blood up and feel nice and warm. After an hour or so wearing these, my feet feel wonderful and I take them off.I've always thought I might be a bit anemic but tests say my iron levels are normal. My whole body can be warm but my feet still freezing so I know my husband will be happy if these continue to help with that, lol. Definitely better than a thick pair of socks because of the compression but it would be nice if they came out with some that cover the toes too. Smile.Uploading some photos so you can get a closer look. I'll be recommending these to everyone I know with foot problems or general foot pain. At their current pricing I feel these are an excellent value. Hope this helps.

I originally learned about DampRid while in Property Management. I was living on a lake in a townhouse where my master bedroom and bath were in a loft...Although we were careful to use both our bathroom fan and heat lamp (fan pushes air out, while heat lamp dries the moisture in the air going out, so you aren't left with moisture build-up in your vents) whenever we showered, we still occasionally got some mildew on our bathroom ceiling.According to the health department, mildew or mold usually comes from how we live.  I opened windows whenever I cleaned and we lived pretty cleanly. The loft style apartments apparently made it harder to avoid since heat rises from the lower level and our being on the lake.After using bleach to kill off the mildew (1 part bleach and 2 parts water in a spray bottle is effective), using mildew resistant primer, and repainting (two times, months apart), the mildew still came back after some time...My maintenance supervisor finally mentioned DampRid and of course, for just a few bucks, if it helped at all, I was open to try it! I bought it from a local store before finding this two pack available here. I put one in my walk-in closet after reading more about it and one under our bathroom sink. We opened the cabinet door during showers and shockingly never had another mildew problem!It was probably a month before one began to liquify. The salts first start to harden and become one slab of hard goo, for lack of better words, lol. It takes a while before it all liquifies, maybe two plus months but it is effective. Since then, I keep one in each bathroom, one in a linen closet, another in a closet for shoes, and one in our bedroom closet. I only use the fragrance free one but haven't tried any others.Another recommendation by this brand that I also buy here on Amazon (which is scented), DampRid FG69LV Odor Genie, Lavender Vanilla It doesn't eliminate moisture quite like this but does make for a nice air freshener if you don't like anything that smells too strong. It is charcoal based and also available in other scents.If you've got a stale smelling basement or garage, a trick I learned that works well is to cut an onion in half and leave it on a dish there for a couple days. The cut onion will have absorbed all of the funky smell, it won't leave behind an onion smell, lol, and then you can toss the onion.  Or if you're brave and desperately hungry, you could eat it but I certainly wouldn't recommend it.Uploading some photos so you can get a closer look at how these appear at purchase vs after they've been liquifying (the last photo you can see the water level of one that's almost done). Weird but hey, hopefully this helps someone! Smile.

The folks from Aisxle were kind enough to provide me with this makeup brush set at a discount in exchange for sharing my unbiased review...Great makeup brush set for travel! I was a beauty consultant for over 10 years and used to manage a cosmetic department. These are not the best high end brushes I've experienced but they are nicer than the usual brushes at this price point.Good variety for different applications and nice soft feeling brushes. No excessive shedding of brush hairs when in use. Container is convenient for travel and for keeping them from being exposed to everything else in your makeup bag.Key to washing them, aside from washing gently (with good brush care product or small amount of natural soap and rinse well) is to air dry them on their side. You want the bristles hanging over the counter edge over night. Never dry them standing up because moisture getting into the handles (where the bristles are attached) causes the hairs to fall out.Nice set for the price! Should my opinion on them change after more use, I'll update this review. Smile. Buy with confidence. Hope this is helpful!

Uber good protein bars!!! I usually like to post photos with my reviews but every month when these come we are so focused on enjoying them, I always remember when it's too late and we've already eaten them all, lol. I'll update this review after our next order... Maybe.These are our favorite protein bars here on Amazon! We've tried a TON of brands and flavors too! If you've ever tried the carmel peanut Glucerna bars (made for diabetics), these taste pretty similar, in my opinion.Chocolate exterior and smooth filling. Reminds me a bit of a Reese's PB cup too. Oh yeah, and they're high in protein too! Smile. Subscribe and Save added savings make these a great deal for us.Definitely worth trying! Better than the double chocolate ones which were a better value but a bit too rich for our taste. Also better than the two Atkins bars currently available on Subscribe and Save and those aren't bad either, we think... Buy with confidence. Smile. Hope this helps!*10.7.15, Photos added~

Well, everything checks out to be fabulous, I'll just leave it at that. The folks at Luseta Beauty were kind enough to provide me with this shampoo and conditioner in exchange for sharing my unbiased review...Great shaampoo and conditioner with some good natural ingredients! Smell of the tea tree and peppermint in the shampoo smells like eucalyptus and is quite invigorating to the senses! Conditioner's peppermint is strong enough to clear up my sinuses if sick, lol. Very refreshing and awakening. The lavender is overpowered in my opinion, so I would stick to using this in the mornings vs nights but definitely a matter of personal preference!I only like to use sulfate free haircare because I have thick hair and loads of it; I don't need any added build-up just for better lather. This shampoo provides a nice lather though and you don't have to use a whole lot of it.I only use paraben free products (hand wash, face care, hair care, deodorant, body products, and makeup!) because breast cancer is on both sides of my family and parabens are found in tumors. If you're unfamiliar with them, they're usually towards the end of ingredient lists, like: methylparaben, propylparaben, etc. They are preservatives that make products have a longer shelf life, like 7 years, great for manufacturers but not for me because they are also hormone disruptors! They're actually illegal in many other countries but unfortunately not yet here. Many manufacturers are finally getting with it and removing them, thank goodness!! Off my soapbox, lol. These products are paraben free.My hair is left feeling the same as always after using these products (which is a good thing because I typically use similar good products). My only negative and hense my removing a star, is that the 2nd ingredient in the conditioner, after water, is cetearyl alcohol. Doesn't say a lot for how moisturizing it is when those are the top two ingredients! I will say though, it did not leave my hair feeling dull or dry.Overall, I'd recommend these products and feel they are a good value for the price. Should my opinion of these change after more use, I will be sure to update this review. Uploading some photos so you can get a closer look and see the ingredient list for yourself. Smile. Hope this is helpful!

My 10-year-old daughter saw this online and had to have it. She was checking the mail for it daily and was very excited when it arrived. The pendant is significantly larger than we expected: the "stone" (which is a hard resin) is about 1.8 inches wide and 2.5 inches from top to bottom, including the setting. Unfortunately the quality of materials and workmanship is fairly low - the thin copper links at the back of the chain break easily and one of the clasps had to be re-glued as soon as we got it. When I contacted the seller, they asked for a picture of the item and did issue a full refund.Overall, my daughter likes wearing this necklace - and it's inexpensive enough that we didn't expect perfection. But it's really not of the highest quality so we're not expecting it to last too long.

I picked these up at a local ACE Hardware store to match the Merry Garden folding Adirondack chairs and they match up perfectly (see picture). I believe the wood is Cunninghamia lanceolata, a.k.a. "Chinese fir" and I confirmed this with the company. It looks like pine but is a bit harder and it smells a bit like cedar, though not as aromatic. This type of wood is naturally rot-resistant, but if you're using these outside or in humid conditions, it's a good idea to paint them with outdoor paint or treat them with an oil or outdoor varnish. I used a Pecan colored stain and then three coats of MinWax spar urethane. I found it easier to stain and varnish the wood before assembly so I could get into all the nooks and crannies. Also, I hung the slats on a cord in my shed (through the screw holes) so I could varnish both sides of each slat at the same time and just let them dry on the cord between coats.In terms of the quality, they're quite good for the price. There was some wood filler on a few of the slats, which is annoying as the filler does not absorb stain the same way as the wood. But I use an artist's brush to paint stain onto the spots with filler in them so they're not too objectionable. Once coated with urethane, the ottomans look pretty good.Assembly is pretty straightforward. There are pilot holes where needed and the tops of the slats have recessed holes so the wood screw will be flush when tightened. I used a power drill set to the lowest torque. Even so, a couple of the screws went deeper into the wood than I would have liked. Ideally I would say use a drill or electric screwdriver with a Philips head bit to get the screws most of the way in, then hand-tighten the last few turns to get the screws tight without going in too deep. Also, I would say it's a good idea to screw on just the bottom and the top slats first with *one* screw on each side (leave one hole open on each side of each slat). Then adjust it by eye (or with a level or T-square) to make sure everything is square and the ottoman sits properly on the ground before you screw in the other two screws on the top and bottom slats. If you just go down the line screwing in each slat one at a time from top to bottom without stepping back to look at the big picture, the ottomans might get skewed to one side and they won't sit properly or mate well with the chair.Overall, these make a nice match with Merry's folding Adirondack chairs and provide a nice-looking and comfortable way to kick back and relax.

I picked up four of these on Woot for use on our dock and beach in the Adirondacks. I also picked up four of the matching ottomans from a local ACE Hardware store. It is important to keep in mind that the wood is raw and unfinished. If you're going to use these outside, you will need to protect them with outdoor paint or some type of varnish or oil treatment. I'd strongly recommend doing at least one coat of the paint, oil or varnish *before* assembling the chairs so you'll be sure to protect all the nooks and crannies of the wood.The chairs are not that difficult to assemble if you follow the detailed instructions. One thing that might be a bit tricky is that each of the 31 pieces of wood has a label on the back with the part number. If you stain or paint the pieces before assembly then you will most likely not be able to see the part numbers any more. Most of the parts are unique enough that you can tell visually which each part is and what direction it goes. Also, the front-facing sides of the slats and other parts have indentations in the screw holes so that the screws will be flush when assembled. This allows you to easily tell the front from the back on most of the parts. However, the top slats that create the backrest do look very similar to each other: specifically, parts C2 and C3, and parts C5 and C6 are nearly identical, except in length. To determine which is which, simply line the pieces up with the screw holes underneath (before screwing the pieces in) and visually check the top of the slats to make sure you get the rounded fan pattern. If you put C3 where C2 is supposed to go (for example), the slat pattern at the top of the chair will be jagged instead of the smooth rounded fan shape.My main beef with the chairs is that the quality of the wood parts is less than ideal. There is fairly extensive use of wood filler in areas where the wood may have been damaged during cutting at the factory. If you paint the parts with an opaque paint, this is not a problem. However if you use a clear varnish or if you use a transparent or translucent wood stain, you will see obvious light spots on the chair because the wood filler used does *not* absorb stain or varnish the same as the raw wood. I used a reasonably dark "pecan" stain and I ended up using a small artists' paint brush to paint the stain onto the sections that had wood filler. Once this dried, it was a bit darker than the rest of the stained wood (which I applied and wiped with a staining cloth). I found this to look more natural than just leaving the wood filler sections light. Out of 31 pieces of wood per chair, I'd estimate that 3 or 4 pieces in each set had some type of filler visible in various shapes and sizes. On the final product, it wasn't too objectionable but it is annoying to have to deal with this when you're putting several hours into staining, sanding, varnishing and assembling each chair as I did.I pre-treated the wood with MinWax soft wood treatment to assure that the stain was absorbed by the wood evenly. I then coated each part with Sherwin Williams pecan-colored stain. I followed this up with two coats of MinWax Spar Urethane, then I assembled the chairs and added a final coat of Spar Urethane after assembly (three coats total). Once assembled and varnished, I waited about 24 hours before putting them outside. My family says they look great and are very comfortable (particularly with the matching ottomans). The chairs do fold for easy transportation, but not completely flat. Also, with three coats of varnish, the parts rub against each other when folding and unfolding, which does remove some of the varnish. So I expect I may need to touch that up after a season or two. I'll attach some pictures so you can see how they turned out (and see the wood filler I mentioned). I'll also update this review over time when I see how well they hold up to the elements.By the way, for anyone who is interested, I confirmed with the company that the wood is Cunninghamia lanceolata, a.k.a. "Chinese fir." This wood is fairly soft, but harder than pine and has an aroma similar to cedar, though not quite as strong. The wood is naturally rot resistant but I do recommend treating it with a weatherproof coating if you're going to use it outside.

This was a big hit with my 10-year-old daughter. While she likes having the ability to defend herself against her brother (with his 3 Nerf guns), she is even more excited about the special "Secrets and Spies" message dart with the secret messages on it that can only be decoded using the included sleeve. The crossbow itself is pretty easy to assemble (she did that herself) and simple to load. It shoots with more force than some of my son's Nerf guns, but not enough to cause any real pain, though the darts do hurt a bit more than the standard Nerf suction cup darts.Due to the enclosed nature of the dart slots and their diameter, the standard suction cup-tipped Nerf darts or velcro-tipped "Dart Tag" Nerf darts do NOT fit in this crossbow. You can force them into the slots but the tips are too wide to fit through the barrel. You will need to use the Rebelle darts or N-Strike darts with this crossbow. Even properly loaded with the correct darts, it does occasionally misfire, but in most cases when this happened to us, the barrel did rotate to the next dart slot and the next shot worked fine so this wasn't too disruptive to play.We had a little trouble firing the crossbow at first. I think my daughter set and then forgot her "secret code." This three-digit code is set on numbered dials on the stock, just above the trigger. It allows the crossbow owner to prevent unauthorized use of the crossbow by an enemy (e.g. big brother). But discovering and then resetting the code is actually pretty simple. Only the middle of the three number dials needs to be in the correct position in order for the gun to fire. So if the trigger doesn't depress easily, rotate the center dial stopping at each number and trying again. Eventually the trigger will depress and you'll know the code. When it's on the correct number you can then hold in the little purple button above the right-most dial and rotate that center dial to a new code if desired (then release the purple button to set the code).Overall, it's a great little Nerf "gun" and my daughter now wants her friends to get some.UPDATE (8/25/15): Lowering from 5 to 4 stars. Three weeks later, my daughter still loves this crossbow but it does fail to fire the dart pretty often, which is annoying. We still don't usually have a problem with darts actually getting jammed (unless they are loaded incorrectly) so we can usually just re-cock it and the next dart fires as expected.

A toaster that's this expensive should look great and perform exceptionally well. Well, one out of two ain't bad. The KitchenAid KMT2116CU looks elegant, with a matte metal finish that resists fingerprints and smudges but its performance varies significantly depending on what you put in it. We found that the toaster worked reliably and toasted as expected when using plain white bread, but denser sourdough or whole grain bread from the local farmer's market came out looking virtually untouched at even the darkest setting. Really the KMT2116CU is a mixed bag. Here are our likes and dislikes:Things we like about this toaster:+ Nice looking, sleek design, aesthetically pleasing. The matte finish limits fingerprints and still looks good after two weeks of frequent use.+ 3 LED indicators on the feature buttons are helpful (see photo)+ Cord wraps under the base, limiting cord clutter on the counter top+ "Lift & See" feature allows you to check toasting progress and to raise smaller items out of the toaster when they're done without having to stick a fork inside and electrocute yourself.+ Beep that indicates end of toasting cycle is loud enough to hear, but not annoying+ Crumb tray is easy to remove and clean. You won't have to flip the toaster upside down, shake it, and have crumbs fall all over the place.Things we don't like this toaster:- Takes up too much counter space and is not ideal for smaller kitchens. The placement of the controls on the front (with the lever is on the side) means it sits lengthwise. Most toasters have all the controls on the side which allows them to take up less horizontal counter space.- Shade control numbers should be bigger and bolder if they want the product to appeal to baby boomers. "Honey, where are my glasses?"- Though the slots are wider than many competitive models, they still do not accommodate New York City bagels easily. Supermarket-bought bagels do fit.- Regular sliced white bread toasts well, but breads that are more dense are under-cooked every time. Our sourdough bread at the highest numeral setting (6) was still not toasted well (see picture). We toasted this same sourdough bread and English Muffins using the KitchenAid and a basic Proctor-Silex 2-slice toaster. Both were placed on the "4" setting and we got very different results. Both times the KitchenAid was done much sooner and the bread was under-toasted  (see picture).- It does not brown evenly. There are dark spots and lighter spots on the toast.- We had to toast English muffins on the "dark" setting and then twice more on the "2" setting before they were finally sufficiently toasted.- We used the defrost setting with frozen waffles and found that the browning was inconsistent. Sections of the waffles were soggy and under-toasted and one slot toasted much more than the other (see image)- ExpensiveIf you're looking for an elegant-looking toaster with sleek controls to grace your counter top, but will only use it occasionally, or only with plain white bread, the KitchenAid KMT2116CU might make a good choice. But if you want a toaster that actually toasts well and can handle many different types of bread, you're probably best off looking elsewhere.

My daughter loves erasable markers and pens so I asked her to help me review these. She says these are fun, easy to hold and easy to erase. She likes the color selection but would have liked to have an orange one. They do include green (her favorite color) so that was important. :) Colors include black, dark blue, red, light blue, purple, green and pink. I tested them as well and also found them easy to hold and very easy to erase. The lower section of the pen has a textured (rubberized) grip so they stay firmly in your hand while writing.Since they are extra fine points, they're better for sketching or writing than for coloring. In the picture you can see 6 hearts (drawn by my daughter) and some short sentences. I also erased the lower half of the bottom sentence so you can see how well they erase (with very little effort). And, as someone mentioned in another review, if you put the piece of paper in the freezer, the erased ink reappears as if by magic, which is a neat trick.

I picked this up to protect some unassembled/unfinished outdoor wood furniture (Merry Garden Adirondack chairs and ottomans, made of fir). It applied easily and dried fairly quickly so I was able to apply two coats to the wood before assembling the pieces into their finished components and one coat after assembly (sanding with 320 grit between coats). I've included a picture so you can see how three coats look on these inexpensive ottomans. I stained them first with a Pecan stain. The Clear Satin Spar Urethane produces a nice non-glossy protective coat and brings out the beauty of the wood. The furniture hasn't done any time outside yet, but I'll be sure to update this review in the future once we've seen how they fare after some time in the elements.On a side note, sometimes the cost of paint and stain products online isn't competitive with local stores, but in my experience, the MinWax Helmsman Spar Urethane was a bit cheaper at Amazon than at a local hardware store in upstate NY and comparable to the Home Depot price for the same item in New York City.Note: there is an alternate version of the MinWax Helmsman Spar Urethane product that is water-based (instead of this product, which is oil-based). The water-based version is much thinner in consistency and requires more coats (they suggest 4 coats if you are using it on outdoor furniture). I accidentally bought the water-based one after I'd already used a quart of the oil-based one. Since I don't want to mix and match the two, that one is going back to the local hardware store. See attached picture for the difference between this product (left) and the water-based version (right).  Thanks to commenter Athena Thor for pointing out the difference).UPDATE (August 19): I finished two of the chairs and am adding a picture. Will update the review again after they've been in the weather a while.

This was the hit of my 10-year-old daughter's spa-themed birthday party. All the girls wanted their Orbeez manicures. If you notice that the water flow is significantly decreased, check the batteries and also try clearing out the water spout with a toothpick. Sometimes small Orbeez pieces may make it through the drain and can clog the spout.

These little beads look and behave the same as Orbeez beads, growing to many times their size (from the size of a BB to a marble) after a few hours in water. But these ones are appreciably less expensive than Orbeez beads. My daughter loves using them in her Orbeez hand spa and play sets. By the way, the ones that look "black" actually turn out to be purple when grown. The color selection is great and they make a nice treat for Orbeez fans.

I was surprised to see caffeine as one of the active ingredients in a hair gel (or a waxy paste, to be more accurate in this case). But apparently there may be a very good reason for this, and it's not just to make your pair "perky" in the morning. Doing a little research, it looks like there have been some studies that suggest that treatment of the hair follicles with caffeine can actually slow or prevent hair loss due to AGA (Androgenetic Alopecia) which is a leading cause of hair loss in both men and women. I am not a doctor (though I am married to a nurse, does that count?) so I won't make any claims regarding the health benefits of this product, but it's certainly worth doing a little more research.As far as its primary purpose, this product works as advertised, keeping my hair in place for most of the day. My wife says it also has a nice scent which is "subtly masculine" (whatever that means). :) I normally use "Garnier Fructis Style Pure Clean Finishing Paste" which is similar in consistency, though the Dove product is slight stiffer and more wax-like. The Dove styling paste also has a dryer look than the Fructis paste. When I use the Fructis paste, people ask if I have colored my hair because the wet look makes my hair look a bit darker. The Dove paste provides longer-lasting styling than the Fructis without drawing attention to itself. If you put the paste on while your hair is wet, then it will retain the wet look for a little while but later in the day, it looks dry but still maintains its shape. In the late afternoon or early evening, if some of the hair starts going rogue, a quick touch-up with wet hands brings those stray hairs back in line. I have included a picture so you can see how it looks once applied (this was just after a shower which is why the hair looks wet).Overall, the Dove Men+ paste works extremely well and may have some hair health benefits as well. The only reason I rated it 4 stars instead of 5 is due to the price, which is a bit high compared to competitive products. But other than that, highly recommended.

How does one review cat food? Should I take a little nibble myself? Maybe make little sandwiches for guests and ask their opinions on the "lovely new brand of canned salmon?" Or maybe I should just ask Toby (our 1-year-old tabby) his opinion? I opted to go with that last option and although Toby didn't have much to say on the matter, other than, "meeeeeeow?" his actions have spoken pretty clearly.Toby likes it! He gobbled up the Sheba Perfect Portions Pate we served him for dinner one evening and has continued to devour it ever since. He doesn't always clean his plate entirely, though. On a couple of occasions, before I started breaking it up with a fork, I just let the whole portion plop onto his plate in one semi-congealed glob, and he (accidentally?) pushed a large chunk of it off his plate while eating. And he wasn't quite interested in it enough to retrieve it. But that was an anomaly. For the most part, he does seem to like it. By comparison, we tried feeding him some "Super Supper" (9 Lives), and he simply thumbed his nose at it. Not with an actual thumb... that would be weird, and painful to the thumb owner... but you know what I mean.The ingredients look good: its main ingredient is "responsibly sourced" salmon and it includes no corn, soy or wheat, no artificial flavors and no artificial preservatives.  So it seems to be a solid nutritional option, in addition to being a tasty one.In terms of the packaging, it couldn't be much easier to open. Just peel back the foil top and plop the serving onto a plate, break off the used side and toss it. Do peel the top off slowly however, to prevent spillage of the gravy. No worries about refrigerating an open can for later. And the portion size seems about right for one meal for an adult cat.It does bother me a bit that the container is not easily recyclable, at least not in areas that are selective about which types of plastic they accept. The container is not labeled with a recycling number so I contacted the company and they told me that it would qualify as a plastic type of 7 ("miscellaneous"), which basically means it is something other than #1 through #6. Some curb-side recycling plans may take it but it's not as commonly recycled as types #1 or #2.Although we received this free as part of the Vine program, I would definitely buy Sheba Perfect Portions on my own dime. I think I would try a couple of the other flavors and alternate them so the cat's palate doesn't get too jaded. Cat owners (or "companions," if you prefer) know how particular some cats can be. But our particular pussycat prefers Perfect Portions.

First, let me say I believe standalone GPS units are still useful. I know iPhones and Android smart phones are getting better for navigation (and many navigation apps include real-time traffic alerts, which this unit does not). But I like to use my phone to play music, maybe play games (when someone else is driving, of course), and potentially even, you know... make phone calls. If your phone is also your GPS, then it kind of limits what else you can do with the phone while it's helping you navigate.This is my first Magellan GPS, but not my first GPS (I've owned a few Garmins, including my current nuvi 2595LMT). Getting started with the Magellan was pretty straightforward. I stuck it up on my windshield with the included suction cup mount and started navigating with it, right out of the box. The POI search and address entry worked as expected, the virtual keyboard was easy to use (thanks to the massive screen size), and directions were clear and accurate. I did miss a destination or two as it didn't seem to provide an exact notification right as we had arrived at a movie theater (for example), but it did warn me that it was coming up in 1/8th of a mile, so I could have figured it out if I kept an eye on the distance to destination. The way the Magellan references landmarks "turn right just after the car dealership on the left" is pretty nifty, but I can see that being problematic if those landmarks go out of business and you don't update the map data often enough.After some local driving for a couple of days near my parents' house, I took the unit inside to do a map update in preparation for our 800-mile drive north... which took a while (the update that is).First of all, you'll need to install the Magellan Content Manager software which you can download from the Magellan web site. Next you'll have to plug the GPS into your computer using the included microUSB cable. When I first did this, I had no luck at all. While the cable did charge the unit, the Magellan Content Manager would not recognize that a GPS was attached. I searched for a solution online, found none, then rebooted my PC (when in doubt, REBOOT!). This did the trick: after rebooting, the GPS showed a message saying USB was connected (etc.). At that point, I was able to check for updates in Content Manager, found that the GPS unit was up to date, both for maps and its internal software, disconnected it and set it back on the window for the long drive home.Along the way, I compared the Magellan to my car's built-in navigation (Toyota) and to Google Maps/Nav on my Android phone. The operation of all three was pretty similar, as were the selected routes. I definitely missed having any kind of traffic alerts on the Magellan, particularly as I approached New York City. If not for Google maps and traffic alerts on my phone, I probably would have waited in Lincoln Tunnel traffic (which was backed up, at the time), instead of zipping over the George Washington Bridge which was pretty clear.For the most part, the Magellan GPS works well, however, there are a few caveats. First of all, this thing is *HUGE*. The 7-inch diagonal screen makes it very easy to see the map and instructions, but it can block a fair amount of your view. Personally, I think a 5-inch screen is a better option: large enough to see clearly, but small enough not to block much of your view. Also, I found that the unit frequently chimes in with "Make a legal U-Turn..." even when I'm following the directions to a T and no U-turn is required (this must be some kind of software glitch). One other odd thing: I didn't see any indication of state lines on the Magellan map. This is not strictly essential for navigation, but it 's a nice thing to know when you're crossing over a border. Also, though this is no big deal, I didn't see any way of modifying the icon which represents your car. On the Garmin, there are lots of fun icons you can pick (we're currently using a Star Wars Tie Fighter). On the Magellan, you're a big blue triangle. That's it.On the plus side, the 9400-LM does come with lifetime map updates, it does that clever landmark-based directions and it even includes an A/V input. The A/V input is for connection of the optional Magellan back-up safety camera ($149). This is a cool feature as it allows you to add a back-up camera to an existing car pretty easily (the camera hooks into the reverse light wires for power and wirelessly transmits the image data to the GPS unit via a small wireless receiver that plugs into the GPS). I imagine that the A/V input might work as a video input for other devices as well but I didn't get a chance to test that.Overall, I enjoyed using the Magellan 9400-LM for a few days but its large size and lack of traffic updates make it a bit less attractive compared to my current Garmin unit. Those who want or need the larger 7" screen and aren't as concerned about traffic updates would probably be pretty happy with this unit.

Really nice design. Works well to store wipes and keep them moist while providing easy access: one push to open the lid, grab a wipe and one more push to reseal it. The free dispensers that are included with the purchase of some wipes were frustrating to use as they never seemed to work well - more often than not, wipes would get stuck and/or tear when trying to pull them out. That's not the case with this dispenser from OXO. Recommended.UPDATE: a couple of weeks after writing this review, my wife left a Bath and Bodyworks Wallflower plug-in fragrance unit on top of the wipes dispenser. A bit of fragrance leaked out of it while it was on top and sat there for about a day. There must have been some kind of chemical reaction with the plastic of the wipes dispenser because the back hinge plastic cracked into multiple pieces the next time we tried to open the wipes dispenser. Irreparable. Could not be repaired. I'm not changing my score but I would caution owners not to use any chemical cleaners and certainly not to set a Bath and Bodyworks wallflower on top of this thing!UPDATE 2: When OXO found out about the above, they sent us a replacement. Great service from the manufacturer!

We've ordered inexpensive lightning cables in the past for iPhone and iPad and frequently get error messages and unreliable charging. This Belkin cable is MFI-certified (Apple approved) and works perfectly in the chargers and devices we've tested it on. We tested on an iPhone 5 and an iPad, no problems with either.  Construction seems pretty solid too. Will update this review in the future if it has any issues over time but for now, 5 stars.By the way, buy it from Amazon directly not a marketplace seller, if you want to get the genuine Belkin cable.Update - two months later: still working as expected on iPhone 5 and iPad 4, both up to date with latest iOS version.

This SONOS bundle gets you pretty much everything you need to do wireless 5.1 surround sound from your TV, plus the full benefits of the SONOS digital music discovery platform. You get the PlayBar, which covers the front left, right and center channels, the Sub which handles low bass, a pair of Play:1s which handle rear channel surround sound duties, plus a SONOS Boost which allows you to do high quality wireless streaming without having to rely on (or stress out) your current home wireless network.Setting up the Sonos system is pretty straightforward. You plug the Boost into your current network router, and it establishes a separate wireless mesh network in your home, dedicated to Sonos music streaming. Using a boost isn't technically required (Sonos speakers can also connect to each other over WiFi), but it is highly recommended as it will help to ensure that the system runs smoothly without synch issues or buffering. Once the Boost has established the mesh network, you plug in and add the various SONOS components to the system and link them all into a single room in the Sonos app. You then connect the fiberoptic cable (included) from the back of your TV to the PlayBar and that's pretty much it.On the app side, if these are your first SONOS speakers, then you'll also need to go in to add your accounts (Spotify, Pandora, etc.) plus set-up access to your digital music collection within your home network (assuming you have one). You can also search for and set up favorite internet radio stations in case you'd like to tune in to local stations from virtually anywhere in the world.While SONOS itself is primarily a multi-room wireless music system, which makes it easy to play your existing music and to find new music via the various apps, the PlayBar is a little different. It works like any other wireless SONOS speaker, but it also works as a soundbar (with surround) to enhance your TV sound. If your TV is turned on and a source is selected (cable or satellite box, built-in ATSC tuner or video streaming app), the PlayBar will automatically turn on and provide the sound for whatever is playing on the TV. You don't even have to hit an input button on a remote. It's smart enough to detect a signal and fire itself up to provide high quality sound.When you're done watching TV, you can route music to the PlayBar instead, all driven from an app on your smart phone, PC or tablet. And, because it's a SONOS, you can synchronize the music in your living room to other SONOS speakers in a bedroom, kitchen or bathroom (I currently have Play:1s in my kitchen and bathroom and it's nice to be able to listen to the same thing on both, or separate content on each).In terms of sound quality, the PlayBar is very good on its own, with clear dialog intelligibility, a nice soundstage and decent treble response. Its bass response is clean, but not very extended, but the included (in this bundle) SONOS sub greatly improves the low end.  And when paired with the Play:1s (also included) as surround channels, the system can reproduce a nicely immersive surround sound soundstage... as long as you can get it a true 5.1-channel source.And that's the real trick (and main limitation of the system). Because most TVs do not pass a 5.1-channel Dolby Digital signal through from a connected device out through the TV's fiberoptic output, much of what you will hear through the PlayBar is really just 2-channel sound, with matrix decoding to provide some basic surround effects. There are a few (very few) TVs that do provide 5.1 passthrough, but the latest models from Samsung and Panasonic (among others) do not support this. You will get discrete 5.1 if you use the TV's on-board streaming apps or HD tuner, but you won't if you use a connected Blu-ray player or set-top box.You can work around the problem by picking up a fiberoptic switch and connecting your set-top box or Blu-ray player directly to that, but then you've got an additional layer of complexity on something that's supposed to be super-simple. Also, even with the switch, the PlayBar cannot decode DTS sound which is popular on DVD and Blu-ray and even starting to appear on several TVs. If you're interested in reading more about the details of this, then view the PlayBar reviews, also on Amazon, or look up my detailed review on Big Picture Big Sound. But the bottom line is, by keeping the PlayBar simple (just one input, no DTS decoding) they've made it a bit less likely that owners will actually get to enjoy discrete 5.1-channel surround sound.Bottom Line: high marks for sound quality, simplicity of use and robustness of the SONOS platform, but one star knocked off for the difficulty most owners will experience when trying to enjoy real discrete 5.1 surround.

Note: I'm updating this review as I've now had a chance to spend some quality time with this "Diamond Luxe" Special Edition Blu-ray Disc (I got a copy directly from the studio a couple of weeks ago).Original review (pre-release):"Gravity" is an intense audio and video experience, and an enjoyable film overall which is enhanced through the use of both 3D and Dolby Atmos surround. So why does the studio make us pick one or the other? The initial release of "Gravity" on Blu-ray is available in 3D, but with only a 5.1-channel soundtrack. It's a great-looking and sounding disc, but lacks the immersiveness of Dolby Atmos. This "Diamond Luxe" edition of the film will have a Dolby Atmos mix, but is not available in 3D. Frustrating!I saw the film two nights in a row in theaters: first in Dolby Atmos (in 3D), then in IMAX (also 3D). Both were enjoyable, but the pinpoint precision of sound available in Dolby Atmos made certain scenes -- like the opening shot with the sound slowly growing out of the vast nothingness -- so much more effective.  Also, in scenes where there are layers upon layers of sound objects on top of the powerful score, Dolby Atmos helps to keep the mix sounding both coherent and immersive. Little details and spatial cues make it all very believable.As for the 3D, I know the live action shots were shot with a traditional camera and upconverted to 3D, but really that's only the actors' faces. The suits, backgrounds, ships, etc. are nearly all CGI creations, rendered in 3D. I would consider this more "real" 3D than "fake" 3D. Hey, if the director thinks 3D is essential to enjoyment of the film, who are we to argue? 3D is certainly effective at accentuating the peril when rogue satellites and space shrapnel are hurtling toward the viewer and when one of the astronauts is spinning out of control attached to a damaged space ship. 3D also heightens the feeling of claustrophobia in the tight spaces of the ships and space station, making the experience of what these people are going though more immediate, and more real.C'mon, Warner, let us watch "Gravity" the way Alfonso CuarÃ³n intended: in 3D *AND* Dolby Atmos!4/1/15 Update:Having watched this Blu-ray now a couple of times all the way through, and repeating several scenes, I have to say, my opinion hasn't changed much from the theatrical release: the Dolby Atmos soundtrack of the Blu-ray Disc is nothing short of spectacular, but I do miss the 3D. If I had to choose one, I'd pick the Dolby Atmos 2D version over a non-Atmos 3D version, hands-down. If you have a Dolby Atmos-capable system, you simply *must* get this Blu-ray Disc. I've said for a while that "Gravity" is the poster child of Dolby Atmos, and this Blu-ray reinforces that.Just sit back and watch the opening scene for proof. Deep bass and effects build to a crescendo as text on screen describes the utter inhospitability of space. The sound peaks at intense levels and abruptly ends, followed by a deep enveloping silence. Out of this audio void slowly come the sounds of radio communications among astronauts and mission control personnel. Only in Dolby Atmos can you pick out the individual voices as they span the entire 3D space, side to side, top to bottom.Comparing to my memory of the film in theaters (I saw it twice in Dolby Atmos), I think the home mix on this Blu-ray is an excellent representation of the theatrical audio. Switching over to the standard 5.1 "Silent Space" track, these same conversations sound jumbled. I've never thought of standard 5.1 surround sound as "flat" before, but it feels that way, compared to the wide open Dolby Atmos mix.Dolby Atmos is used to good effect multiple times within the film, including that opening scene, the initial bombardment of the shuttle with space schrapnel (at about 11:00), the destruction of the International Space Station (52:39), and the final scene with buzzing insects and the sweeping music (1:22:00). The sense of 3-dimensional space is conveyed well in the Atmos mix.As for extras, there is a whole separate disc of Special Features, but these are mostly carried over from the previous Blu-ray release (with 3 new exclusives, detailed below). The main new thing here is the "Silent Space" version of the film. This is a bit of a misnomer, as there are still plenty of sounds and effects (including Dr. Stone's deep throbbing heartbeat). The only thing missing is the music. It's basically what Dr. Stone would have heard from within her own spacesuit (or from inside the various crafts she enters). Frankly, to me, this is an interesting experiment, but not one that I'd enjoy for repeated viewings. The film's score  by Stephen Price is one of its highlights and I miss its presence. Without the music, the film feels a little more like a documentary and is, ultimately, less dramatic.Also exclusive to this release are three new videos, all in HD: "Looking to the Stars": a 42-minute homage to space-based SciFi films; "Gravity: The Human Element," an 11-minute featurette on what it takes to be a real astronaut, and "Sandra's Birthday Wish" a 3-minute birthday greeting from Sandra Bullock to director Alfonso Cuaron (complete with completely cheesy green screen-based visual effects). Pile on the special features from the original release and it all adds up to nearly 6 hours of bonus materials (including 90 minutes for the Silent Space version of the film). In other words, there's a lot to keep a fan busy, if you're into that sort of stuff.All in all, it's really an excellent release with top-notch video and audio. If they had included a 3D version of the film with Dolby Atmos, it would have been a clear 5-star Blu-ray Disc set, but even without that, it's still worth a purchase.

I ordered these "Bluecell" CR2025 batteries from Marketplace seller "hobbytoolsupply" ("Hobby Tool Supply") and received 40 pieces of "Tianqiu" CR2025 batteries instead. And what's worse? ALL 40 of the batteries received were completely dead or close to it (I opened every single one and tested it with a battery tester). To make sure my battery tester wasn't broken, I verified it on another (known good) CR2025 battery and that one tested fine. Also, I tried one of the received batteries in a pair of Samsung 3D glasses, and the battery was so weak that the glasses would not even sync to the TV.I am contacting the seller for refund, but since this is the item I ordered, and this seller is still listed as a marketplace seller for this particular item, I thought a warning review would be appropriate here.In any event, with a quantity order like this, I would recommend spot-checking a couple of the batteries to make sure they are good. The battery tester I used was the SE BT20 9-Volt Battery Tester and is available on Amazon for under $5.

I can't attest to the suitability of this suit for HazMat use, but it does make a great costume if you want to be Walter White ("Breaking Bad") for halloween. Pair it with the 3M Professional Multi-Purpose Respirator and some gold-rimmed rectangular aviator style glasses and you'll be channeling Heisenberg in no time. The 2X size was a little baggy on my 6 foot/220-pound frame, but I suspect XL may have been slightly snug. It does get hot (particularly if you wear the hood) so you might want to peel it off for a break if you need to wear it for extended periods.By the way, the big round TyChem logo on this is just a transparent decal which comes off easily.

Works perfectly in a Galaxy Note 3 phone. I copied over the contents of my previous (32GB) card to the SanDisk and all my apps, including the camera and music players, worked perfectly after the switch.
