First off I want everyone to know that I recieved this DVD in exchange for an honest review, and that being said I wasn't sure if this documentary would be good or not.  I'm glad to report that Ryan's adventure far surpassed my expectations, but more importantly really impressed me of how well it was made considering that the entire production was self produced and published.  The Documentary follows Ryan Pyle and his brother on a Guinness World Record motorcycle road trip around China that covered over 18,000km in 65 days.  During their ride they managed to capture excellent vistas and the vast diversity of culture in the country, which I didn't realize until I watched their DVD.There are six episodes in total on two DVDs that are about 25 minutes each.  So, The Bottomline is if you like unique documentaries then I'm sure you will like the Pyle brothers adventure.

The first four Limited Edition sets of Ranma 1/2 have goon far beyond my expectations, and have proved to me a must own for anime fans.  Since this is the fifth season I'm going to assume that if you're reading this you know what Ranma is about, so I'm just going to list some product features that fans might want to know.  Another thing to note is that the dub voice of Ranma changes in Season Four, but that's not a big deal, because the sub is better any way.This special edition includes a full-color art card and a 32-page booklet with episode summaries, all housed in a premium chipboard artbox!Contains episodes 93-115.Special Features: "We love Ranma" Part 5 - We Love Collecting, Next Episode Previews, Clean Openings and Endings.Spoken Languages: English, Japanese, English subtitles.Just in case readers are wondering that Kanji on the box means five in Japanese.

Rightstuf just put this edition on their site for pre order, so here is everything you should know about this awesome set.This collector's edition comes with a 296-page storyboard and settings art book, a 32-page booklet featuring comic text by Yoshikazu Yasuhiko, and a 12-page special booklet, all in a storage box illustrated by Yasuhiko. These extras are in Japanese only.Special Features (Japanese audio only): Audio Commentary, Trailers, TV Commercial.Spoken Languages: English (DTS-HD Master Audio 5.1ch), English (Linear DTS 2.0ch), Japanese (DTS-HD Master Audio 5.1ch), Japanese (Linear PCM 2.0ch), English subtitles, Japanese subtitles, French subtitles, Korean subtitles, Traditional Chinese subtitles (Taiwan), Traditional Chinese subtitles (Hong Kong), Simplified Chinese subtitles.

Lately comic book fans have been treated to excellent shows based off of the books we love, and Gotham is no exception to that awesome fact.  I just love the way that Gotham has adapted it's characters to to the Batman universe in it's own unique way.  The thing I love most about this series is that nothing is as it seems, which is great, because the series keeps you guessing each episode.  On top of that the cast was chosen perfectly, but more importantly each actor nailed their roles in a way that went far beyond my expectations.  Bottom line is that I can not recommend this series enough, but especially if you love Batman and origin stories.  Like I said earlier this is one of the best comic book shows in years, so you will not be disappointed.Update: This is just a spoil free review of the show, but I keep up to date with product information, so I will update this review when I learn more.

It's been years since I've watch a super hero show as good as The Flash.  Every episode feels fresh and fun with a prefect mix of all the elements fans expect from a TV show like this.  That being said, I love the fact that they've introduced the Reverse Flash early on, but he's not the only character that I'm happy made a big appearance.  The first season even introduced the classic Flash vs Green Arrow fight, which was interesting, but I feel they need to bring him back, and I'm sure he will come back.  So the bottom line if you love super hero shows you should feel right at home with The Flash with no disappointments.  On top of that I highly recommend The Flash if you've liked shows like The Arrow and Smallville.Update: 6/18/2015Special Features:The Fastest Man Alive!Creating the BlurThe Chemistry of Emily and Grant Screen TestBehind the Story: The Trickster Returns!DC Comics Night at Comic-Con 2014 Presenting Gotham, The Flash, Constantine and ArrowAudio CommentaryDeleted ScenesGag ReelContent:Pilot for airFastest Man AliveThings Your Can't OutrunGoing RoguePlastiqueThe Flash s BornPower OutageFlash vs. ArrowThe Man In The Yellow SuitRevenge Of he RoguesThe Sound And The FuryCrazy For YouThe Nuclear ManFalloutOut of TimeRogue TimeTrickstersAll Star Team UpWho is Harrison Wells?The TrapGrodd LivesRogue AirFast Enough

If you're looking for a hidden gem comedy anime then D-Frag is what you're looking for.  Kenji is somewhat of a delinquent, or at least he think he his.  He and his buddies are on a mission to rule the school.  That's until he is forced to join the Game Development Club run by four pretty psychopaths.I can't remember the last time an anime made me laugh so much, but on top of that the animation style is one of the best I've seen in years too.  There's just so much color in it that matches the situations in a prefect way every time.  Furthermore, each episode is packed with hyperboles and innuendos, but are never over used.  They are so well placed that all the hyperboles have become one of my favorite parts of the show.  Even the characters all flow together perfectly, which makes them all very likable, especially Kenji and Koka.  Bottom line is if you like comedy anime that exaggerate on almost everything then you'll probably like D-Frag.This Limited Edition Blu-ray release of D-Frag! features all first season episodes presented in 1080p with English and Japanese Dolby TrueHD 2.0 lossless audio tracks and English subtitles.Extras include:Actor CommentariesPre-Air TV CommercialsThe New DVD/BD CheerThe New DVD/BD Cheer (Funabori Version)A Commercial within a CommercialMobile Rally CommercialTextless Opening Song ''Stalemate!''Textless Opening Song ''Minna no Namae wo Irete Kudasai''Promotional VideoTrailersPublisher - FUNIMATIONGenre - ComedyMedia - Blu-ray DiscFormat - HybridAge Rating - 14+ (More Information)300 Minutes

You can't beat a value like this two disc set, but on top of that these two movies are some of my favorite comedy films, especially Clerks II.  I still remember how hard Jay and Silent Bob made me laugh the first time I watched Clerks II.  Furthermore, Seth Rogen is one of my favorite comedy actors, so I never miss any of his movies, and Zack & Miri is no execution.  So, the bottom line is if you don't already own these two films on Blu-Ray this is a great option to get them for cheap.

After being disappointed with the last PokÃ©mon strategy guide I was a little hesitant about picking up the guide for the new Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire games, but it turns out I'm actually quite pleased with it.  That being said I'm still not 100 percent satisfied with this guide!  I just wish that they would had included a full PokÃ©mon Index instead of just an PokÃ©mon Native Index to the Hoenn Region.  Furthermore, I don't understand why the full Official Index guide comes out so late!  It's not released until March 2015, and by that time I would had already completed these games.  Now that the Index issue is out of the way lets get into what you'll find in this guide, the pros, and of course the cons.What's In The Guide:ï¶ Detailed Interview with the Creators of Omega Ruby, and Alpha Sapphire.Hoenn Regional Mapï¶ Detailed walkthrough of the two games that include training, routes, cities, and gyms information.ï¶ Belief PokÃ©mon Index of the Hoenn Region.  This Index shows you the PokÃ©mon's type, egg group, ability, hidden ability, and main way to obtain them.ï¶ Adventure Data: Gives players information about items in the games, and and their effects.ï¶ And much more that's too much to list here.Pros:ï¶ Very Detailed Walkthrough with tons of information, and useful tips.ï¶ Detailed maps and images of the games.ï¶ Tips on completing your Indexï¶ Thick book with lots of helpful information.Consï¶ Doesn't offer players a complete PokÃ©mon Index, and the full Index is released way too late.  The missing Complete Index is really the only con, but it's a big one!Bottom line:This guide is a nice addition to the two games, but it's missing some critical information about the Index, but at the same time the walkthrough itself is very useful and is filled with other important information.  I just wish that Nintendo would release the PokÃ©mon Index a lot sooner.  That all being said this guide is still worth getting if you're a completist and want to find every little thing PokÃ©mon Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire has to offer.

I'm loving Far Cry 4, but this Limited Edition Collector's Strategy Guide looks sweet.  On top of that it looks even better in person, and the colors just pop right off of the cover.  Definitely a wonderful addition to go along with the game, but on top of that this book is very useful.Below is what you can expect to find in this edition:ï¶ Includes 32 extra bonus pages that gives gamers an exclusive behind-the-scenes look at the creation of Far Cry 4.ï¶ Detailed walkthrough that includes fully-labeled maps, and step-by-step tactic tips.ï¶ Explains  where to find every tower, every outpost, and every fortress.ï¶ Helps you find every collectible.ï¶ Full stats of in-game weapons.ï¶ Mobile eGuide:  So you can access on a second scene.ï¶ Bottom line: Not all players may need a guide for this game, but it's a very nice addition as a collector's item, and will help a lot finding and unlocking all the little things.Update:I just wanted to let other players know that this book also has mission tips, caution, and notes that has helped me complete missions faster and easier.  On top of that I found the tower tips to be helpful.  The book gives you step by step tips on the best way to take over each tower.  It even tells you exactly where the chests are, and where enemies will spawn.  Lastly, everything in this guide is organized very well.

First off, the cover art from this premium strategy guide looks very awesome, but I just wish they included some concept art in this book.  Other than that everything else is great, and I am glad that they included additional pages of Behind The Scenes' content, interviews from BioWare, and a Making Of with the Dragon Age team.  There's even an added bonus about the development of Dragon Age the anime, which has a little bit of concept art from the series.Below is what you can expect to find in this edition:ï¶ Full-size poster of the game map.ï¶ 3 digital in-game items.ï¶ Mobile eGuide: Access so you can strategize on another screen.ï¶ Help :Identifying paths, classes, tactics, hidden caves, creatures, combat advice and much more.ï¶ Bottom line: If you plan on playing Dragon Age Inquisition, this Guide will be very helpful and useful.  The only difference between the two edition is that the premium edition has extra digital content and additional  "Behind-the-Scenes", and interviews. Other than that the paperback has the same useful walkthrough content inside.

I had a blast playing Far Cry 3, so naturally I couldn't wait to pick up the fourth installment.  I'm pleased to say that it's holding up to my expectations with all this game has to offer to gamers.  Right off the bat, Far Cry 4 feels fast paced with an excellent story, and of course a crazy bad guy.  Secondly, once you get a chance to explore the landscape you easily tell how large the map is, and I personally already feel myself becoming immersed in the world of Far Cry 4. There's just so much to do, and explore!  Not to mention all the awesome animals, vehicles, and weapons.  On top of that I love how fast things blow up and catch on fire.Weapon and Item Customization: I was very impressed with the amount of items, sidearms, primary weapons, and weapon attachments are in this game.  There's even maps available in the game to unlock some areas.  Far Cry also allows you to craft new items, you make sure you skin the animals you kill, you'll need the pelts.Skills and Tactics: Fry Cry 4 has a vast amount of skill upgrades that will be very useful throughout the game, as well as tips and tactics that the game teaches you as you play.Graphics: Overall the graphics are pretty good, and didn't disappoint me at all, especially how detailed the mountains, and water looked.Other Things I Liked:  I found the radio to be very funny while I was driving around.  Secondly, it's pretty awesome being able to ride an elephant or using them to distract the enemy.  I'm not sure what I like more, rising the elephants, or scaring them so they attack the enemies.  Lastly, although waypoints were in the last game, they are very helpful in finding your way around in the new game.  The map is huge, and without them I know I would get lost searching for my objective.Bottom line: If there is one Ubisoft game you're going to get this month then I highly recommend picking up Far Cry 4, but even more so if you've played the third game you will not be disappointed with the forth.  I can't say enough of how good this game is.

Although I love the first two seasons I do have a couple problems with season three, but that's only for the English dub.  For starters, the English voice actor for Ranma changes halfway through this season.  Secondly, I really don't like the Hawaiian principle who has an Jamaican accent.  I just don't understand why he has a Jamaican accent when he is Hawaiian.  He's just super annoying, and feels only like filler content.On the other hand the Japanese audio gets 5 stars, and deserves to be in your collection, especially if you own the first two sets.Ranma Â½: Set 3 does have a complete restoration with a frame rate of 4:3, and is presented in 1080p with an English and Japanese DTS-HD Master Audio 2.0 tracks.  The special limited edition set includes a premium chipboard artbox, full color art card, and 32-page episode summary booklet.Extras include:We Love Ranma Part 2: The AppealNext Episode PreviewsClean Opening AnimationsClean Closing AnimationsTrailers

I recently bought this NetGear router after my old router was getting slow.  I also was experiencing many dead zones throughout my house, so I clearly needed a new router.  The good news is now I no longer have any dead zones in my house with my new router.  Although a strong signal throughout my house was import, it was just as import that it had high speeds for online gaming, and easy to setup.  I can't say enough of how easy the setup was.  All I needed to do was to plug in my Ethernet cable from my computer to my new rounder and follow NetGear's easy 5 step setup process.  On top of that there's no CD needed for set up.  The days of losing the setup CD are over!The thing I like most about this model is that I was able to setup two WiFi signals.  One I solely use for my Xbox Live Account, and the other I use to share with everyone else's devices in my household.  Both WiFi signals have have pretty good speeds.  On average I was getting download speeds around 30 Mbps with the first signal, and over 50 Mbps on the 5G signal.Once you have installed the router, you can view everything in NetGear's Genie program.  From here you can view all your network activity (who and what devices are on your network), router setting, Parental Controls, AirPrint, and Network Support.  It's very easy to change your setting, passwords, and WiFi names from here, which is very important to me.Bottom Line: If you have many device, game online, and want an easy setup, then I highly recommend using this router.  You will not be disappointed!
These are very tasty sunflower kernels, and make a great snack.  On top of that they are Gluten Free, All Natural, have no cholesterol, or Trans Fats.

I use to use only regular salt for all my cooking needs, but now I use a lot of Kosher Salt.  I find it adds a lot of extra flavor, especially on meats.  So, the bottom line is if you cook even a little, then Kosher Salt needs to be in your pantry.

Tonno is by far my favorite canned tuna.  Tonno puts olive oil in their tuna, instead of just water.  It really adds a lot of extra taste to plain old tuna, and I can't see myself going back to tuna in water.  These canned Premium Yellow Tuna are packed with protein, and Omega-3, which are a wonderful extra on top of the awesome taste.

Colavita is by far my first choice when I'm looking for an extra virgin olive oil.  It has a smooth and rich taste to it, and is great for pan frying meats.  Although it might be a little expensive I truly believe that it's worth the price.

Wow, this hardcover strategy guide is packed with helpful information, plus on top of that the images in the book look awesome.  Not only does this book have an exclusive cover art, but it also has an extra 32 pages of concept art of cast and environments.I'm finding this book helpful in completing all the little things Assassin's Creed has to offer.  It gives players good information on all Main, side, and co-op missions, and all optional challenges.  Furthermore, this guide tells you how to unlock all achivements, and secrets in the game.The Collector's Edition Guide also has some valued extras that include statistics, diagrams, expert analysis, story analyisis, and an extra degital copy of the guide.

Finally the cult classic is almost available on Blu-Ray.  Although the film is a little corny and outdated it's still a great film that's worth owning.  I got a good laugh at all the corniness the film had in it.Here's some extra product information that buyers might want to know.Special Features:Reversible cover of both these art workBrand New on camera interview with star Caroline MunroBrand New on camera with Director Kevin ConnorAudio commentary with Kevin ConnorOriginal Trailer

I had a blast playing Assassin's Creed Rogue.  Although the campaign was a little short with only seven main memory sequences, it was still a very enjoyable game.  When it comes down to plot, this game was a little better than Unity.  The main differences I noticed were that the controls were very different, and instead of using medicine to heal, your health just recharges.Rogue also was very much like Black Flag in quite a lot of ways.  The first main similarity was that you travel a lot by sea, and of course you battle with other ships when you travel. Second similarity was fort battles.  With these battles you must breakdown the fort's defenses before moving in and killing its captain.  If you've played Black Flag then you know that you done this in Black Flag too.  Remember to collect supplies at sea as well, so you can upgrade your ship.  Over all rogue feels like Black Flag 2, but of course on the side of the Templars.Graphics: The graphics were very good for being on the 360, and not Next Gen.  On top of the graphics being good, there were no glitches that interfered with them, and everything ran very smoothly.  I'm actually very impressed with what Ubisoft has done with the 360 version.Story:  I know my favorite part of the Assassin's Creed franchise is learning more about the Precursers, and Rogue doesn't disappoint in giving the player more background about them.  Although the plot was very good, I did feel that the chacacter development was a little bit better in Unity, but don't get me wrong Rogue's characters aren't bad by any means.Bottom Line:  if you've played other Assassin's Creed games, then you will not be disappointed with this installment, and there's actually a lot to do after you completed the main story, so just give it a try.Update: I recommend playing both games for the main story, because they both are connected to one another.

First off, this is an excellent value for your buck.  I've beaten all three of these games, and all three have amazing stories.  If you've never played Assassin's Creed before then this would be a great place to start the series.  Each game has a unique historical perspective that are very entertaining, and on top of that Assassin's Creed has great controls and gameplay that does not bore one bit.  So bottom line is that this value is best for first time players, or those who don't have a PS Vita.

Fairy Tail is one of the best animes in recent memory, and it is by far a must watch.  This series has a little bit of everything from likable characters, good action, magic, and of course good humor.  These collections are a much better value than the pervious volumes, which only had half as many episodes.Contains episodes 49-72.Special Features: Episode Commentaries, Textless Songs, Trailers.Spoken Languages: English, Japanese, English subtitles.

High School of the Dead is a great series that deserves to be watched.  The only objection I had with this series is that it was too short, but that's the only con this series has.  I just wish that it went for at least another season. When it comes down to the actual series It's packed with awesomely gory zombie killing action, plus some much needed comic relief that truly makes High School of the Dead stand out among similar animes.  The bottom line is that if you like action, gore, zombies and a little comedy to go all that, then you will love High School of the Dead.This collector's edition contains episodes 1-12 plus the Drifters of the Dead OVA and a special Book featuring Illustrations and short novels, a bandana, a parking sticker, 4 Postcards, and a premium chipboard art box!Special Features: Clean Opening Animation, Clean Closing Animation.Spoken Languages: English, Japanese, English subtitles.Publisher - SENTAI FILMWORKSGenre - Action/HorrorMedia - Blu-ray DiscFormat - HybridAge Rating - 17+ (More Information)315 Minutes

Yura Yamato thinks she has finally arrived at her dream school, but it turns out that it's nothing like she imagined.  In fact the girls of Stella Women's Academy much rather participate in war games then traditional school activities.  It's quite a funny series, especially when Yura starts to daydream.  Her daydreams are overly exaggerated, which will give you a good laugh.  There's not much action in this series, and relies more on the characters and humor to keep the story going.  The bottom line is if you like comedy animes, and girls with guns then you might like Stella Women's Academy.This anime is subbed only, so there is no dub available.  Unfortunately, Section23 Films doesn't provide dubs, so if you're looking for a dubbed anime, this isn't for you.  I personally preferred subbed, so this isn't a problem for me.  I feel that sometimes dubs take some of the personality away from the series.You can watch this anime on both Hulu and Crunchyroll.The Blu-ray release of Stella Women's Academy High School Division Class C3 features 1080p video, lossless Japanese audio and English subtitles. Extras include:Clean Opening AnimationClean Closing Animation

I just bought an Amazon Fire TV today, and this was one of the first apps I downloaded.  The recipes in this app look quite good, but not all are simple and some recipes require some experience.  Most of the videos are very well made, but a few are made by amateurs, but that doesn't mean that those videos are bad.  Bottom line is that this app is free and has some good recipes in it.

If you like over the top mecha animes that don't take themselves seriously, then you will love Gurren Lagann.  Every episode feels fun and exciting, and truly separates itself from similar animes.  Gurren Lagann takes place in the distant future, and mankind has regressed to living underground, but that's only until our two heroes decide to challenge that belief.  Now, I understand that this set is very expensive, but it's also a limited edition, and looks super slick and nice.  Amazon doesn't carry this edition, but you can find it at Rightstuff.com right now, but I'm sure it will be gone soon.I just wanted to add that I'm a little disappointed in the packaging.  Although this series is great, the packaging is very thin in person compared to the image on Amazon.  I was expecting the packaging to be a little thicker and streadier, but it's very thin and not very strong.Contains episodes 1-5 plus a double-sided poster and a 16-page booklet featuring creator interviews and an illustration gallery!Special Features: Textless Opening and Ending, Episode 5 Preview (On-Air Version).Spoken Languages: English, Japanese, English subtitles.
I really liked this key chained, but unfortunately the chain comes off very easily.  I had it less than a week before it broke off, and was lost.

I bought these boots at Nordstroms, but will review them here.  I have now worn them around 15 days and feel comfortable giving them a review.  I live in LA, so these were partially bought for 'looks', but I travelled to Seattle when there was rain, and to Denver/Aspen when there was snow (my flight was cancelled because of the snow).  So I feel comfortable reviewing them from all viewpoints.Wool:  I have seen lots of questions as to weather the wool runs through the whole boot.  The first 3 inches on the inside have the same white wool as normal Uggs.  Then the white wool ends, and the rest of the boot is lined with a dark grey wool similar to the exterior of the top of the shaft.  So there is wool throughout, but not the white wool as in normal uggs.Material:  The shaft has a dark charcoal grey speckled wool material that ends at the buckles.  The area around the foot is leather.  It is interesting - the toe part is a shinier leather and the remainder is like a brushed or oiled leather.  It is not shiny, but matt.  When I first wore them I could easily see the difference, but now I don't, as the shininess of the toe has dulled down.  Lastly this is not a really 'black' boot.  It is more of a really, really dark charcoal grey.  But it is fine with black leggings or jeans.  It is just something to be aware of.Warmth and Waterproof:  These boots are pretty darn warm.  When I wore them on a 'cool LA day' (e.g., 70)  :)  my feet were too warm and I was ready to take them off.  But anything around 65 degrees and less was fine.  They were great in rain.  And when I was in the snow I had really nice traction (I was surprised at how good the traction was given that there is no tread) and my feet were perfect.  I have not been in less than 30 degrees with them yet - so I can't vouch for "really cold".Size: I have a pretty normal foot - average width and a size 9, but it tend to buy shoes a bit bigger to allow room for my low profile 3/4 orthotics.  So I bought these in a 9.5.  There is plenty of length.  But it is a bit snug on the width.  I wear these with thin socks. They did stretch out on the width just a bit and now I don't notice the snugness.  So I would say they are true to length but not a "wide" boot.Getting them on: they are NOT easy to get on.  The area where the buckles are does not have any give.  So it does take me around 10 "real" seconds to shove my foot into the boot.  So I wouldn't want to wear them shopping when I would be constantly taking my shoes on and off.  But that said, I don't mind, because everything else about the boot is pretty good!Looks:  as I mentioned, I live in LA, so I want to wear these partially for looks with skinny jeans and leggings. When it isn't snowing or raining I unzip the boot to the buckle is so that it flairs out a bit more to balance out the boot.  This is not a fancy boot, a snazzy boot, a polished boot or a dressed up boot. This is a casual boot.  A run around boot.  If I lived in a mountain town where everyone dressed pretty casual I would probably wear these every day.  They do 'scuff up' because of the brushed leather.  And after all the traveling and being in the snow, although they are well made, they do show scuffs, so it does make them look even more casual.  That said - I get compliments on them!Summary:  These are a great, casual, warm (but not bulky) boot.  I will update when I have worn them longer - but so far I can absolutely recommend them!  I hope this is helpful to you!

I saw all the good reviews - so I was disappointed when I received this product.  Here is why:Quality: They are cheaply made.  For example, the noses are not centered and the tuft on the boy's scarf is literally hanging by a thread. Their hair/bangs is cut unevenly (longer on one end than the other - I was actually thinking of giving them a haircut!)  And finally their ears don't stand up as pointy as they do in the picture.Not Made for Playing: I have 4 year old boy/girl twins (which is why I bought this set).  I was thinking of giving this set to them to play with at Christmas time.  However, it is so cheaply made, they would destroy the dolls in 30 minutes - they are just too fragile for playing with.Not like "Elf on a Shelf":  These dolls don't have anything in the limbs or torso to hold the pose.  So the only way they will sit is if they are leaning on something - otherwise they will just fall over.Cute:  Having said all of that - they are cute.  I got them on a lightning deal for $14.  And for $14 they are just worth it.  I guess based on all the other reviews I was expecting a better made doll.Summary:  If you buy them to put out as decoration only, and don't look at them too closely, and place them on a shelf where they can "lean" - then they are pretty decent, because again, they are cute.  I guess it is all about setting expectations - right?  :)I hope this is helpful to you!

Wow, these are comfortable!  I have a couple pairs of NYDJs and I think these are the most comfy.  The corduroy is really soft and stretchy!Color and Material: the winter-white is a nice cream color that I would feel comfortable wearing after Labor Day.  In fact the ribs on the corduroy are small enough that from far away it doesn't look like "corduroy", it just looks soft.  So I would feel safe wearing these all year long (I live in Los Angeles) because the white is not "too white" and the corduroy is not to "corduroy'y" (that would be the first time in my life I have written the word "Corduroy'y!!!")  :)Size:  I normally wear a 12.  With NYDJs I always wear a 10 (they say to do a size down with NYDJs).  But with these pants, I accidentally bought a 12.  And I am glad I did.  The 12 fits perfectly.  So with these pants, go true to size - don't buy one size down.The "Posterior":  I do not have a 'well defined or accentuated posterior'  (like how I said that?  in other words - "flat")!  But these pants gave my rear a nice shape.  Both my husband and I liked how it looked!Bottom:  The bottoms of the pants are not like leggings where they are snug on the ankle as well - instead they flair out a bit.  Not like a boot-cut, but like a straight jean.  Which is surprising given how snug the rest of the pants are.  I am tall (6'), so the bottom pants with the flair hit me in the wrong spot.  I folded them up, to make a long capri, which looked cute.  But normally I would wear these pants with boots in the winter.  Which will be a little tougher because I will have to fold the pants into my socks to have them fit well in the boots.  The sizing says the inseam is 31".  I did not measure them, but that seems about right (no pun intended!)  So if you are on the shorter side, the flair will probably hit right and you could wear them as shown in the photo.  Personally, I wish they made a "tall" version of these or made the ankle snug.  But again, if you are on the shorter side, you won't have a problem with these pants.Washing:  Haven't worn or washed them yet.  So I will update after having washed several times.I hope this is helpful to you!

I have two other pairs of Cobb Hill sandals (the Gina and the Aubrey) - so I was excited to try this cute boot.  I ordered the exact same size as the sandals (size 9), and I could barely fit my foot in the boot.  It was too tight all over!  I actually looked at the small tag on the boot to confirm that I had actually received a 9 - because it felt exactly like a size 8!So, if you are used to wearing a certain size for Cobb Hill - order 1/2 to 1 size bigger for these boots.  What a shame!I hope this is helpful to you.

I have two other pairs of Cobb Hill sandals (the Gina and the Aubrey) - so I was excited to try this cute boot.  I ordered the exact same size as the sandals (size 9), and I could barely fit my foot in the boot.  It was too tight all over! My sectional couch slides on my wood floors.  It was so irritating to be constantly moving the couch back into place.  After researching the issue here on Amazon, I purchased the "Dura-Grip Heavy Duty 3/8" Thick Non-Slip Rubber Furniture Floor Pads".  I cut them to fit the legs of my couch but inevitably the legs would come off the pads.  To solve this problem, I had to leave around an inch of space on each side of the couch leg.  Which leads me to my complaint: the Dura-Grip pads looked UGLY on the wood floor.  But I dealt with it... For 2 years I dealt with it.  Until now...I was offered to review this product.  And because of the ugly pads I had been looking at for 2 years, I jumped at the chance.And here is what I have learned: these Metric pads keep my couch from sliding just as well as the Dura-Grip - without the ugly pad sticking out the sides.  I am THRILLED!I will update when I have used them for a while.  But in the last 2 weeks my couch has not slid at all and the pads are much more discreet and better looking than the Dura-Grip.  To sum up - I would absolutely recommend these pads, not just to protect your floor, but for me (more importantly) to keep furniture from sliding.  I hope this is helpful to you!

I have an average sized 4 year old.  When he saw this set he was pretty excited.  However, the excitement did not last long.  Here are the issues:Sword: the sword is hard foam.  Which is good for not causing damage.  However, the sword broke in half at the base of the blade/top of the handle after a couple of days of use.  We tried gluing it, but it didn't hold.Cape:  it is a bit too tight at the neck.  There is maybe an inch or two of play.  Which is not that much for a kid running around.  He excitedly put it on the first time, thought it was too tight and hasn't worn it since.Sum:  If you are giving this to a boy with a thin neck that is very gentle with toys - then this is a great set.  However, for the rest of the boys out there, it would be better if the neck was an inch or two bigger and maybe if there was a more solid layer under the foam to keep the sword from breaking easily.  I hope this is helpful to you!

I bought both the 'silver' and 'gold' version of these earrings and kept both.  I have had them for several months and here is why I like them:They are lightweight.  And they are comfortable and don't interfere with phone use or other things against my ears.They are both classy and fun.  I can wear them professionally to a work meeting, as well as out dancing.  They can be dressed up or down.  Basically this is a versatile earring that works for most outfits and occasions.Lastly they are a bit unique.  I get compliments on when I wear them!  In sum - this is a great earring and I would recommend them.  I hope this is helpful to you!

I have used this bag for over a month. And here are my thoughts:COLOR - I actually bought the black, sand, ambrosia and periwinkle colored purses because I wasn't sure which bags I would want to keep. The colors are all true as pictured. But I ended up keeping the black and sand colors just because they are the most versatile. That said - the colors are all nice - so choose the one you will wear most.SIZE: I can fit my iPhone 6, my smallish wallet, and some other small items (lipstick, pens, small bottle of advil etc.) but I am unable to fit my sunglass case or anything bigger. So I can't rely on this as my everyday purse when I will need to carry more items... Instead I use this bag when I am out for the afternoon or evening and don't need to carry a lot. But I use my big purse for everything else. Also something to note, when I am able to stuff more in the purse, it gets too weighted and the thin strap hurts my shoulder. So this purse really is meant to just carry the bare essentials.HANGS: This purse is meant to hang cross body. When you hang it on your shoulder and let it hang straight down, it doesn't really hang right, it kind of hangs on an angle. So this bag can be hung straight down, but it will feel more comfortable hung cross body.LENGTH: I am 6' tall. I have it on the longest length and it does fit correctly. There is around 6" of play, So this purse will work for most women,LINING / POCKETS: The pockets are nice (I like keeping lipstick, pens in the front pocket; feminine products in the interior pocket; and receipts in the outside back flap). And the lining is cute.SCENT: of the 4 bags I purchased, 2 of them had a strong smell (maybe from the glue?) when I opened them up. But after a couple of days the scent went away.SUM: At this price-point ($30-$50 a bag), you can buy 4 bags for the price of one of the "nicer" bags. That is why I felt totally comfortable keeping 2 of them to wear with different outfits. I wish the bag "magically" held more, but in reality that would just make it a bigger bag. It is both cute and classy, and I am glad I bought it. I just wish they had designed the bag so it would hang straight when I don't wear it cross body. I hope this is helpful to you!

Wow - take a look at my attached photo.  That is a gallon size ziplock bag (approximately 11" x 9").  That dusty dirt filled up almost half of the bag and weighed a pound or two, from just 2 rugs!There is so much hype regarding this Shark vacuum that I decided to actually compare.  I vacuumed 2 rugs in my house with my old Hoover vacuum.  And then I vacuumed the exact same 2 rugs with this Shark.  HOLY MOLY!  (And I don't know if I have ever written the words 'holy moly' before!!)  LOOK AT ALL THAT DIRT!!!  (I have 3 year old twins and to be frank it is kind of grossing me out that they have been playing on all that dirt this whole time!)This vacuum is AWESOME!Before buying my vacuum I called Shark to find out about all the differences between their vacuums.  "NV" is their normal prefix before their model number.  But like a lot of manufacturers, when they sell items at Costco they give it a different model number.  So at Costco it is a "UV560".  Apparently the 750 series is the exact same as the 650 series.  (There was a recall on some of the 650 vacuums.  People got nervous about the 650s even though Shark had fixed the problem.  So as a 'marketing strategy' they now also have the 750s.  Same product, same price - it just makes people feel more comfortable....)  Those are their "flagship" vacuums.  But they are also a couple of hundred dollars more.  When I brought up this UV560 at Costco, he looked up the product and all the accessories.  He said that this UV560 at Costco (current price of $199) is a GREAT deal.  He said I would be getting more than a $100 in accessories, the vacuum has the same "power" and "suction capabilities" as the 650/750  and he said I really couldn't go wrong with this 560.  And he was right!I will update when I have used it longer.  But so far I am thrilled - who knew I could "love" a vacuum!  I hope this is helpful to you as well!

My husband bought this case - and loves it.  BUT buy it in brown!He spoke with the folks at the Apple Store, and they said the brown wears down the best.  Because the cases are leather, they do scratch and show dirt.  But if you buy the brown, the leather wears down the best and will look 'purposely scruffy' over time (like when people buy worn in looking jeans).  Whereas the other colors will just look dirty and old.Also, at the time my husband bought it, it was around $45 at the Apple Store (which is cheaper than the price being sold on Amazon), so you may want to compare pricing before buying.UPDATE:  My husband has now been using this brown case for a year.  His phone is still completely protected (despite numerous drops, daily use and kids handling his phone) and he still loves the case.  The case is now an "espresso" color instead of brown.  But again - it looks good - I looks like it is 'supposed' to look that color.  So, after a year of use - he can absolutely recommend the brown case.I hope this is helpful to you!

I was looking for a rolling pin for my 2.5 year old twins to use with play dough.  The problem with most children's rolling pins is that they don't roll:  the pins are connected to the barrel in one piece.  This rolling pin is different - it is just like the one I grew up with - but smaller.Here is the best part - I use it too!  Both for cookies and pie crust.  Now it is not ideal, because it is smaller (so it takes me a bit longer to make everything smooth and perfect) - however, because of the small size it fits in my kitchen drawers nicely, whereas the big ones don't fit in a drawer with other utensils.  Therefore, I would gladly take the tradeoff of the smaller size for its convenience.Therefore I recommend it both for play and for real cooking.  I love this rolling pin and the totally reasonable price!I hope you find this helpful!

I bought these for my 2 year old twins - I figured if they are going to throw balls in the house, that I want them to be soft so as not to cause damage.  And they are soft!  And they would cause minimal damage.However, the foam they are made of is so soft that when my kids bit into the ball (as my 2 year old will do) they bit off huge chunks of ball. Therefore, unfortunately, these balls were thrown right into the trash.Therefore I would not recommend these balls for dogs (they will be shredded in an instant!) or kids that are still putting things in their mouths!I hope this is helpful to you!

I have 3 year old twins - and they love this 'jumpy-jumpy' (as they call it)!Here is what I have learned from using it for the past 3 months regarding the noise factor and folding it up after use.Noise:  We put the bouncy house inside for its first use (it just barely squeezed into our living room).  Because it is fairly noisy, and because the bouncy was in a smaller room, the noise was too much for our normally adventurous son.  So after that initial use he shied away from it (until a couple weeks later when the fun his sister was having got the best of him).  So I would recommend, if your kids are at all sensitive to loud noises, to do a couple of things:  - use it outside instead of inside where the noise will not be so 'noisy'  - if you use it inside, try to block the noise of the blower (e.g., place the blower in another room or a closet with the door popped open just enough for the air tube to fit through, but also to buffer the noise a bit.)  - if the noise is too much outside, we did the same thing with the garage door - we put the bouncy right next to the garage door, put the blower inside the garage, and propped the garage door open by 8 inches with a box - this allowed the air tube to work correctly, but the almost-closed garage door buffered the noise a bitStorage: As others have said, it is super easy to set up and take down.  We keep it in our garage covered by a tarp: we have the tarp under the bouncy, we fold the bouncy, and we cover the top of the bouncy with the tarp (picture a pita bread sandwich).  We then just slide the tarp into the garage when we are done with it.  When ready for use, pull the the tarp out, uncover it, leave the bouncy folded, plug it in, and the thing just pumps itself up.  The tarp protects the bottom, allows for easy sliding, and keeps it clean in the garage.We love this bouncy and can't believe the fun our kids are having with it - and what a great way to burn off some of their extra energy!!!I hope this is helpful to you!

I purchased these socks for my husband.  He has a large foot (size 14.5) - but the sock still worked for him.  They are great looking - snazzy but not over-the-top.He wears them either with suits or jeans, and either way the socks look just perfect.  Basically, they have just the right amount of 'fun'!He says they are comfortable.  And after 5 washes they still look brand new.  I would recommend these socks!(And after he has worn them for a couple of months I will update this review.)I hope this is helpful to you!

I purchased both this original version as well as the compact version over 3 years ago - and they are still as good as the day I bought them!I have had problems with my tailbone (coccyx) and went through 6 months of horrible pain.  Upon suggestion of a physical therapist I purchased these pillows - one I leave at home and the other I brought with me to work, on airplanes, to the movies, etc.  (That was how bad the pain was, I carried the darn pillow with me!!!)Between using this pillow and rolling up a small towel for lumbar support, I immediately noticed a small improvement in the pain level as I was sitting.  And over time (2-3 months or so), the pain went away!I still use them at home while watching TV even though I am no longer in pain.  And they still are as supportive as the day I bought them.Some others mentioned numbness (that does not happen with me) or making you sit too high (I am 6' tall and that has never been an issue for me either).In sum, these pillows have been wonderful, look great after 3 years and are just as supportive.  They absolutely worked for me!I hope this is helpful to you!

I bought these plates at IKEA, so I am not reviewing the seller or the price (which is much cheaper at IKEA - $4.99), just the plates themselves.I am the mom of 2.5 year old twins. It came as a shock to me that a vast majority of those plastic / melamine plates for kids are not microwave safe. I heat up leftovers etc., in the microwave. So I spent a LOT of time searching for microwave safe plates.I found a couple plates by other brands, but they seemed so 'cheap' feeling. (There is also another plate/bowl/cup set made by IKEA that is also microwave safe - however, I didn't like that set for the same reason - too thin and 'cheap' feeling.)After using this set for 4+ months, I can officially say that this set is great!Pro's:- The plastic is thicker and more 'substantial'.- They have a nice 'lip' to keep the food inside the plate- They are dishwasher safe (up to 158ºF)- They are microwave safe (heat food up to 212Â°F)- BPA Free- The colors are gender neutral- They have matching bowlsCon's  -  No non-slide bottom  -  No matching simple cups (just the training cups - I would prefer a simple plastic cup with matching colors)  -  Because the plastic is 'soft' (not hard like melamine), if you use a sharp knife it will leave a small groove in the plateOther than those 3 con's (and none are a 'deal breaker'), these plates are great - and I highly recommend them.I hope this is helpful to you!

We have twins and have been using this IKEA highchair for 1.5 years now, and here is what I have learned.If you buy it at IKEA you have to buy the tray and the padding separately, but all said and done I think it was $30 per set-up (highchair, tray and padding). I did not buy this highchair from this particular seller, so I am going to review the highchair and not the seller or the seller's price.I really like the Antilop. It is neutral colored, it doesn't take up a lot of space (or visual space if you know what I mean) - basically it blends, which is good in our smaller kitchen.It is also really easy to clean. Sometimes I just lift the chair up and pour all the cherrios right into the sink. Or there was one particularly messy time I took the chair right outside and hosed it off! Cleaning this chair is easy!Also, because it is light, I will carry it outside for bbqs - or carry it wherever we are eating - it is highly transportable. In fact we have been using the chair without the tray and pushing it right up to our dining room table - it is the perfect height for the kids to sit with us for family dinners.One thing to note, it is NOT easy to take off the tray, you basically have to use some strength and yank the thing off from the front corner. (Put your hands on opposing corners, brace the back corner and yank up the front corner.) You feel like you a breaking it, but you aren't. Because of this, I leave the tray on always and only take it off for serious cleanings and/or when we bring the chair right up to the dining table for a family dinner. I never take the tray off when the kids are sitting in the high chair. Therefore you are not relying on the tray to keep your kids from standing up - instead you are relying on the straps. So make sure the chair you choose has straps and as the kids get older, that you use them (because without the straps my kids will stand up in this chair - luckily they have never fallen).My kids are now 2 and are 95% for height and 75% for weight and they are still very comfortable in this chair (we no longer use the padding) with plenty of room for more growing.I have been very happy with this chair and would recommend it!

I have been wearing podiatrist-made orthopedics for years because of Plantar Fasciitis - I need both a good heel cup and a high arch.  The problem is, I am constantly switching them between shoes and am forever worried I will lose them (and boy are those podiatrist-made ones expensive!)  So, I decided to buy a pair of these to act as a 'back up' to the podiatrist insoles, and just keep them in a pair of shoes (without switching them out).  And to my pleasant surprise, they are GREAT!I have worn them everyday (for at least 4 hours a day) for the past 6 weeks, and they have hung in there - they still provide great support and are almost as good as the ones my podiatrist made from a mold of my foot and charged me $200!In fact, they are so good, and such a good 'bang for the buck' - I have bought one pair for each of the shoes/boots I wear a lot (e.g., they are awesome in Uggs and other non-supporting shoes).  I currently have 4 pairs (and have bought 2 pairs for my 78 year old mom who has the same issue).On a side note, I also bought the Full Length Envelop Orthotics from Amazon, and I don't like them nearly as well!  The heel cup is less supportive and the arch is not quite as high - so I have not used them at all.Also, if you have not worn orthotics like this before, please know that they do not have a 'slim fit' - for example, I can wear them in leather shoes/boots with a 1.5" heel, but I couldn't wear them in a narrow dress shoe or a shoe with a high heel.  Also, because I have been wearing orthotics so long, all my shoes are around 1/2 size bigger to accommodate for the orthotics.  But if you are new to orthotics, and your shoe is already snug, then these (and any other good orthotic) may make your shoe too tight.I don't know how long they will last with consistent, daily use, but so far - they are doing great!!! (I will update in another couple of months).I hope this is helpful to you!

I needed this for bean bag filler - and this is NOT the right product. I had a hard time finding a description to help me make my decision, so I hope this information will help you:Bag: dimensions = 4" x 7" and around 1.5" - 2" thick. This is NOT a lot of beans - just around 3 cups!Beans: these beans are not the softer styrofoam type of bean that has a lot of static - these are hard plastic - imagine small (3mm) bb gun pellets made of plastic instead of metal.This product is best used for dolls, or weighted bottoms, or (as others have said) to hold up make up brushes or even at the bottom of a fake flower vase. Then this product is perfect. But it is the wrong thing for a bean bag.

We have been using this brush for doing dishes for a month - and I think it has been one of the best ones I have purchased!We have had other OXO scrub brushes (the kind with the soap stored in the lid), but I like this much better, here is why:- The handle is solid - it has a nice 'weight' to it- It cleans well - I can use it on a dirty pot and it works better cleaning than other brushes I have had.- The bristles are more sturdy - so far none have bent or look beat up.- After a month of use it looks the same as the day we bought it - no wear and tear.- I don't like the type of brush with the soap stored in the top - the dispenser never works quite right, I can't control the amount of soap, and they always seem to leak just a little.  So I prefer something like this where I just squeeze the amount of soap I want right onto the bristles.Therefore, I would really recommend this product!  (And I will update in a month or two.)I hope this is helpful to you!UPDATE:  We have now been using this every night for 5 months - and it is still my favorite for all the reasons I listed above.  Every once in a while I put it on the top rack of my dishwasher to give it a good cleaning.  And now the bristles are starting to look a little more worn - but it still cleans great and it looks like it will last another 5 months!  This is my all time favorite brush - I highly recommend it!!!!UPDATE:  I have decided that we are finally ready for a new brush.  This little $4 brush lasted 10 months of daily use!!!!  I will be buying another one for myself (and one for my folks).  To sum up, this is a great little brush!

I bought this as part of the Black Friday sales, so it was inexpensive ($9.99).  However, I feel like it is worth $5.  There is no bottom and it is very light (a pound or two) so when my 2.5 year old twins get into the hut and move around just slightly the tent moves around with them and ends up just falling off them or pushing over.  I note that other people received tents with a 'floor'.  Ours doesn't have one...In addition, it is not a plastic type fabric, but rather a paper-based fabric, which looks like it will last for a couple of days at most.  Basically it is so flimsy that my kids got in it a couple of times, they tent just fell off them, and they have given up using it (despite the fact that they love the Mickey Mouse Club House).Therefore, I would not recommend this unless you get it really inexpensively, you only have one child that will get in it, and when they do enter it they will just sit and not move.I hope this is helpful to you!

I am bummed! These looked so cute in the picture, but they are not great on my foot.  Here are the issues:(Let me begin by saying I do not have a big or wide foot.  I am have a size 8.5-9 foot with a normal width.  I ordered a size 9.)- The toe box is very narrow.  You can actually see how narrow it is on the photo to the left (I think it is the bottom photo).  It looks narrow in the photo and it really is narrow on the foot.- There is not enough room for the height of my foot - do you see right beneath the bottom lace, where the 'sock' part meets the 'suede' part - that part is REALLY tight.  So basically it is pinching the top of my foot about 3" back from my toes.- The laces just seem huge when spread out to accommodate for your foot/leg.  I felt like the laces are sized to fit a Sorel snow boot.- The 'sock' part is 'floppy'.  You really need to lace it tightly to keep everything in place.- It does not seem well made - if you look at the inside, at the seams, there are pieces sticking through.I am bummed because the other reviews are so good, so I was expecting to love these...Now, if you have a very narrow, low profile foot, and you decide to buy these, you should know that they call the boot 'grey', but the photo is the correct color - it is in the beige family (not the grey family).I hope this is helpful to you!

I needed colored duct tape.  So this was perfect!  However, it is not as strong as 'real' Duck Tape.  It does look similar (plastic with the threads woven in for strength like Duck Tape).  But it tears almost as easily as masking tape.  And although it is decently sticky (more sticky than masking tape), it it not nearly as sticky as Duck Tape.For some people it may be fine that it tears more easily and isn't super sticky.  In fact, that may be more helpful to you.  If so, please note the colors are accurate but not quite as bright as in the photo (just a hint duller).  And for the price, it is a good 'bang for the buck' compared to individually purchased rolls.That said, I wish I would have known how it compared to Duck Tape before I spent the money, since unfortunately it won't work for my needs.  Therefore, I hope this information is helpful to you.

This product looked very similar to another set sold here on Amazon (as of Nov 2014) with the label of "Grunwerg - 4 pcs Child Set - Windsor" for around $13.  And the reason - it is exactly the same set!  This set is distributed by Grunwerg (an English company) but is made in China.  Now granted prices fluctuate here on Amazon, but when I bought it, this set was just under $10 and the other set is just under $14 - so I am loving the $4 savings!Also, other reviewers have spoken about the sizing of the spoons.  The 'big spoon' is 5ml or 1 teaspoon.  The 'small spoon' is just a hair over 3.75ml (I used the syringe to measure infants medication to figure it out).  I like that the 'big spoon' has a slightly deeper bowl than the teaspoon that comes with my flatware set.  It makes it easier to keep food in the spoon and out of their lap!I like the look and the feel of this set - I have 2 year old twins and bought two sets to decide if I like them - and I do - so I am going to order 2 more sets.I hope this is hopeful to you!

Before buying this wheely I spent a LOT of time reading through all the reviews as to whether to get the small or large wheely for my 1.5 year old boy/girl twins.  And I made the WRONG decision - so I am hoping I can help others.I have big kids (95% on height) so I figured I should buy the big one so they can grow into it.  When I first bought it for them they pushed it around with their hands, but quickly got bored because their legs were too short to ride on it.  Now that they are 2.4 years old and their legs are long enough, they are more excited to ride a tricycle or a scooter, and this is too 'sedate' for them.So this is what I would recommend.  Measure the inseam of your kid's legs.  If they are 14" or longer, then buy the large size.  But if their legs are shorter and you want them to ride on it now, then buy the small size.Now, something to think about - I keep the wheelys outside - so my kids have a lot of options of things to ride on.  So they hardly ever choose the wheelys.  If this was an 'inside toy' with no other exciting options to ride on, then they would probably use it more.So, to summarize: - legs (inseam) shorter than 13" - buy the small. - legs (inseam) longer than 14" - buy the large - if your kids are already on tricycles, scooters or anything that goes a bit faster, they will be bored with this outside - and I would plan on it being an 'inside toy' where it will be used more. - if you are going to use it inside, then I would buy the smaller one because it will take up less space and will be more maneuverable. - Basically I should have bought the small so they could have used it when they were younger and not yet ready for faster toys.I hope this is helpful to you!

I put these onto my old enamel tub more than 2 years ago - both to prevent me and my 2.5 year old twins from slipping.  I bought 3 packages and used most of the turtles - but I wanted them fairly close together so we wouldn't slip.I followed the directions - and they have not peeled off at all!  No corners are up...  No edges showing wear...  They look as good as they day I put them on!  (I saw that some other reviewers complained that their stickers had come up - I wonder if it makes a difference as to the type of tub you have?  The sticker's adhesive is still strong on my old enamel tub, so I wonder if the people that gave it poor reviews had a plastic tub?  Or, in the alternative, I cleaned it really well (rubbing alcohol and all) before putting down the stickers, so I wonder if that made a huge difference?  I am just trying to figure out the reason for some of the other reviews....)Some things to note - I tried using the lysol wipes to clean the tup after one particularly messy toddler experience, and the bleaching agents on the wipes dulled the color of one of the turtles - so I wouldn't recommend using a cleansing product that has a bleach component.And sometimes when my kids have been playing in the tub for a while their rear is a bit red from the texture of the sticker.  Now granted, they have sensitive skin.  And I would assume it would be the same with all tub stickers, because you need a texture on the sticker to keep from you from slipping.  But just FYI, you may notice your kids skin may get a bit red from too much sliding on the sticker.  I figure their slightly red skin from sitting on the sticker is the lessor of the evils compared to falling!To sum up - these have been GREAT for us.  They are super cute.  They look perfect after 2 years.  And there have been zero slips or falls.  I hope this is helpful to you as well!UPDATE:  My kids are now 3.5 - which means they have been on the tub for 3 years.  And they still look just as great, work perfectly, and have not come up.  I am thrilled with these little tub tattoos!

I bought another Schylling tin tea set at a museum's gift shop and thought it was cute.  But after a LEAD scare, I figured I would review it here to help out others.I have 2 year old boy/girl twins.  And they both love playing with these tin tea sets.  I took away the little tea pot lid because it doesn't sit securely (and I figured it would get lost) - but other than that this set has been great!  The set has been a good purchase and I am happy I bought it!The problem is that my kids put the spout of the tea pot in their mouth and I noticed that some of the paint was missing because they had scratched it off with their teeth.  This set is made in China (with different health restrictions).  And then I saw other Amazon reviews mentioning that lead used in the product.  Of course this got me worried!  So I did some research.  Here is what I learned.Some Schylling products used to have lead.  In 2001-2003 they made children's products that contained lead.  They were recalled in 2007.  I don't know if this tea set was one of the recalled products - but it certainly made me nervous.  But upon further investigation I found this:http://www.healthystuff.org/departments/toys/product.details.php?getrecno=1352To summarize, HealthyStuff.org tested the tea set and found ZERO lead (or arsenic, or cadmium, or mercury, etc).  And they labeled this product 'safe'!And just for kicks, I had a 3M Lead Testing Kit (that I bought to use on another toy that I had learned had lead), I used the kit on the Schylling tea set I bought, and it had no lead!Given that my kids have ingested a bit of the paint, that makes me feel MUCH better!  I hope this helps you too!UPDATE (Oct. 2015):  Every once in a while I confirm that the link to the Healthy Stuff website is still working.  However, the last time I checked, the link to that part of the website had been removed.  I contacted the company and they said they would look into why the link did not function, but I have not heard back from them.  I still think the tea set is "safe" and I am still letting my kids play with it because I don't believe the contents of the tea set have changed or anything is different.  But in the interest of being as 'thorough as possible', I thought I should put a note that the link may not be active.

I bought this tin tea set at a museum's gift shop (but without the case) and thought it was cute. So I did some research.  Here is what I learned.Some Schylling products used to have lead.  In 2001-2003 they made children's products that contained lead.  They were recalled in 2007.  I don't know if this tea set was one of the recalled products - but it certainly made me nervous.  But upon further investigation I found this:http://www.healthystuff.org/departments/toys/product.details.php?getrecno=1352To summarize, HealthyStuff.org tested the tea set and found ZERO lead (or arsenic, or cadmium, or mercury, etc).  And they labeled this product 'safe'!And just for kicks, I had a 3M Lead Testing Kit (that I bought to use on another toy that I had learned had lead), I used the kit on the Schylling tea set I bought, and it had no lead!Given that my kids have ingested a bit of the paint, that makes me feel MUCH better!  I hope this helps you too!UPDATE (Oct. 2015):  Every once in a while I confirm that the link to the Healthy Stuff website is still working.  However, the last time I checked, the link to that part of the website had been removed.  I contacted the company and they said they would look into why the link did not function, but I have not heard back from them.  I still think the tea set is "safe" and I am still letting my kids play with it because I don't believe the contents of the tea set have changed or anything is different.  But in the interest of being as 'thorough as possible', I thought I should put a note that the link may not be active.

I bought another Schylling tin tea set at a museum's gift shop and thought it was cute.  But after a LEAD scare, I figured I would review it here to help out others.I have 2 year old boy/girl twins.  And they both love playing with these tin tea sets.  I took away the little tea pot lid because it doesn't sit securely (and I figured it would get lost) - but other than that this set has been great!  The set has been a good purchase and I am happy I bought it!The problem is that my kids put the spout of the tea pot in their mouth and I noticed that some of the paint was missing because they had scratched it off with their teeth.  This set is made in China (with different health restrictions).  And then I saw other Amazon reviews mentioning that lead used in the product.  Of course this got me worried! I hope this helps you too!UPDATE (Oct. 2015):  Every once in a while I confirm that the link to the Healthy Stuff website is still working.  However, the last time I checked, the link to that part of the website had been removed. We have twins and have been using this IKEA highchair for 1.5 years now, and here is what I have learned.If you buy it at IKEA you have to buy the tray and the padding separately, but all said and done I think it was $30 per set-up.  I did not buy this highchair from this particular seller, so I am going to review the highchair and not the seller or the seller's price.I really like the Antilop. It is neutral colored, it doesn't take up a lot of space (or visual space if you know what I mean) - basically it blends, which is good in our smaller kitchen.It is also really easy to clean. Sometimes I just lift the chair up and pour all the cherrios right into the sink. Or there was one particularly messy time I took the chair right outside and hosed it off! Cleaning this chair is easy!Also, because it is light, I will carry it outside for bbqs - or carry it wherever we are eating - it is highly transportable.  In fact we have been using the chair without the tray and pushing it right up to our dining room table - it is the perfect height for the kids to sit with us for family dinners.One thing to note, it is NOT easy to take off the tray, you basically have to use some strength and yank the thing off from the front corner.  (Put your hands on opposing corners, brace the back corner and yank up the front corner.)  You feel like you a breaking it, but you aren't. Because of this, I leave the tray on always and only take it off for serious cleanings and/or when we bring the chair right up to the dining table for a family dinner. I never take the tray off when the kids are sitting in the high chair. Therefore you are not relying on the tray to keep your kids from standing up - instead you are relying on the straps. So make sure the chair you choose has straps and as the kids get older, that you use them (because without the straps my kids will stand up in this chair - luckily they have never fallen).My kids are now 2 and are 95% for height and 75% for weight and they are still very comfortable in this chair (we no longer use the padding) with plenty of room for more growing.I have been very happy with this chair and would recommend it!
