I love Garden of Life products and bought this vitamin based on all the great reviews.  However, I have an adult family member that has low level anxiety (not enough anxiety to require a prescription) - and this makes his anxiety worse.I just gave him 2 pills in the morning, and he tells me that within an hour he can feel is anxiety level raise.  So I think what ever the components are in the vitamin that gives everyone else 'energy', are the same components that makes him feel more stressed and anxious (if he drinks too much coffee it is the same thing).So if you have anxiety, maybe start with just 2 pills in the morning and see if it gets worse for you.  I wish I would have known about the possible connection between his anxiousness and the vitamin beforehand so I would have stopped giving him the pills earlier...(Btw, we also bought the Vitamin Code - Family Vitamin, thinking that may help, but it didn't, it was the same result.)

I buy these at Costco for $14 (Although please remember Costco's prices fluctuate). But will review them here in case you would like to buy them on Amazon.Packaging- These are small packages with around 4-5 bite sized pieces in each bag. You will open the bag and think 'this is it???' But those 5 bites are perfect!- Because they are individually packaged I leave a couple extra in the car for my kids when they get hungry. It is a simple and super satisfying snack.Ingredients- Each bag contains 150 calories, 11g fat, 10-12g carbs, and 4-5g protein- 100% vegan / no dairy- No cholesterol- Gluten free / wheat free- No preservativesBlueberry Pomegranate: almonds, cashews, pistachios, pure cane sugar, rice syrup, blueberry, pomegranate, sea salt and natural flavorsCashew Crunch: Cashews, pure cane sugar, rice syrup and sea saltCranberry Pomegranate: almonds, cashews, pistachios, pure cane sugar, rice syrup, cranberry, pomegranate, sea salt and natural flavorsFlavorThey are bite sized nut squares that are sweet (with a little salt to balance the sweetness). Cashew Crunch is the least sweet with a nice pleasant flavor. The blueberry and pomegranate flavors have a distinct berry-ness and are sweeter. I like all 3!To sum up: I love that I can look at the ingredients and recognize every word! I love that they are delicious and my whole family gobbles them up (including my 2 year old twins). And I love that they are in small packages for easy snacking and to control my eating (so I don't eat too many). If I could request one thing, it would be that they are organic (because we try to eat as clean as possible). But that said, I have already bought 5 boxes (one box on each trip to Costco) and will continue to buy more. Because they are great!

I have 2 pairs of Paige jeans in dark blue (the same fit - Hidden Hills Straight).  What I love about those dark blue jeans is how flattering they are - I actually feel 'thin' (or at least 'thinner' than my other jeans/pants).  So I decided to buy the same size and fit in white.  Wow - just not flattering when I first put them on!  I can actually see the dents of my cellulite (sorry if this is TMI).  Such a shame!!!!!!  Now, I am not fat, but I do have a lot of cellulite - so if you just have a bit, you should be fine.  But if you are like me, then these white jeans are probably not the ones for you - UNLESS you buy one size bigger than you normally would or have very thin legs so the material is not stretched/snug.Update:  I kept the tags on and wore them around the house.  And like any jean they stretched just a bit and I don't see the orange rind any more - much better!  I will keep them and just keep them away from the dryer!  So, when buying, if you wear Paige jeans, buy the size you normally wear and let them stretch a bit before you make the final decision.  For those of you that haven't worn Paige jeans, if you are in between sizes - go one size up (unless you are really skinny - in which case I am jealous!  :)

I use these pencils for work - I write a lot, so I need it to be comfortable.  I love controlling the thickness/darkness of the pencil line with the different leads - so I choose the .7mm (over the .5mm pencil) to give a wider/thicker line (and I buy a softer lead to make the line dark without pressing hard on the paper).  And the eraser works great.  I have been using these pencils for 10+ years and used to pay $7 per pencil -  so this is a great deal for a great pencil!

In reading all the other posts, some complained that this comb does not hold enough hair; others say it is perfect.  So I didn't know if it would work for me - it doesn't, but it does work for my mother!This comb is small - around 1 3/4" x 7/8".It is too flimsy for my hair - I use the Vidal Sassoon Medium sized combs, and they work for my hair.  I was going to use this in a smaller section of hair, but it didn't hold.My mother, on the other hand, wears her hair in an 'up-do'.  She uses bobby pins (at least 15-20 of them) to hold her hair in place.  She liked using these combs instead of a bobby pin in certain key areas of her up-do - it gave her the right amount of 'lift' to the hair.So, the moral of the story - if a normal size bobby pin would work for you, then one of these combs would replace one bobby pin.  But if one bobby pin wouldn't hold your hair sufficiently, then this comb will be too small and flimsy for you.Because it feels flimsy, I can see it working in a baby or toddler's hair, in VERY fine hair, or in an up-do (along with other bobby pins and combs).  But for everyone else, I would probably suggest the medium size instead.I hope this is helpful to you...

I was trying to figure out what size to buy for my babies, so I looked up the info on their website.  Here is what I learned:It is recommended to get the swim diapers according to weight, not age.  (You will notice that the age and weights below do NOT match up.)  If you baby has bigger thighs, and you are in between sizes, then go up a size.  It is supposed to be snug around the thighs to keep in solids, but you don't want it too tight.Here is the sizing from the Manufacturer:12 months = 10 - 15 lbs18 months = 15 - 20 lbs24 months = 18 - 25 lbs2T = 20 - 30 lbs3T = 30 - 40 lbs4T = 40+ lbsI hope this is helpful to you as well.

I love the idea of this hat, but it took me a while to figure out the difference between the Infant vs Baby vs Child vs Youth sizes.  Here is what I have learned:Infant - does NOT have the mesh on the sides or the sizing adjuster on the back (it does have a break-away strap) - 18-20"  (PLEASE SEE 9/14 UPDATE BELOW)Baby - does NOT have the mesh on the sides or the sizing adjuster on the back (it does have a break-away strap) - 19.5-21.5" (PLEASE SEE 9/14 UPDATE BELOW)Child - does have the mesh on the sides and sizing adjuster on the back (some colors have a break-away strap) - 20-22"Youth - does have the mesh on the sides and sizing adjuster on the back (does not have a break-away strap) - 21-23"I have 18 month old twins.  I have read from other posts that the infant and baby sizes are too big.  Therefore even though the Child size is supposed to be for 2-5 years, I bought the Child size.  When I adjust the Child hat to make it as small as possible, it is 19.5".  Given the sizes of the Infant and Baby hats - 19.5 works!  I want to be able to adjust the hat, and the 2 inch margin is just too large on the Infant/Baby hats without the adjustment!I used these hats on a 2 week vacation at the beach.  My kids will fight any hat.  When I first put them on, they fight me, but then they forget they are wearing it.  I was worried that the break-away strap would be too 'flimsy' but it wasn't.  It stayed secure when the kids tried to pull their hat off.  Just like the kids initially fight the hat, they also fight sunscreen.  And I really appreciated that they didn't get their face/head/neck burnt at all during that 2 week period - even when the kids 'won' and weren't wearing sunscreen.Now, having said all that - I received a 'defective' hat.  I might not have even known it was defective, except for the fact that I bought two.  On the 'good hat' the strap does not have any loose ends.  On the defective hat, the strap end is not sewed up and away.  The impact: in order to adjust the size of the strap I have to take the hat off and play with the straps to tighten or loosen the strap; and the strap just dangles and hangs under the chin.  Versus on the, good hat there is no dangling and I can adjust the strap while it is on their head.  Can I live with it because I don't want to deal with sending it back?  Yes.  But I am slightly irked...  I bought the defective one for around $14, and I am wondering if that was the reason for the price difference?9/30/14 UPDATE:  I just spoke to a Customer Service Rep at Sunday Afternoons - here is what I learned:  They are discontinuing the Infant hat (specifically because it doesn't have the adjustment in the back).  Therefore if you find an Infant hat, it will probably be on sale.  By 2015 there most likely won't be many Infant hats left.Instead they have added an adjustment to the Baby hat.  So now ALL of their play hats have adjustments on the back!!  That is great news!  The main difference now between the Baby hat and the larger sizes is the mesh on the side.  The Rep said there is no mesh on the sides of the Baby hat to give better sun protection.That said, it is possible if you order a Baby hat online that you may be sent an old version of the Baby hat without the back adjustment, so you may want to contact the seller first to confirm it is the new version with the adjustment and they aren't selling you an old version.

I am particular about my socks.  I hate when I can feel the seam near my toes, and this seam is comfortable.  I wear these socks daily for work.  Because I give lectures where I am standing all day, my feet need to be comfortable.  And lets face it, if you are thinking about your socks something is wrong!  These socks stay up, never bunch or have hot spots.  And because they are a liner, they are not thick and they keep my feet a pleasant temperature - not too hot, or wet or smelly!  After a year or two of daily wear they start to get thin at the heal, so then I go buy five more pairs!  I have been wearing these socks for 7+ years - they are awesome!

I have 16 month old boy/girl twins.  I really like the brush for my son, in fact when I go to brush his hair he sits very quietly and really enjoys getting his hair brushed!However, my daughter has slightly longer (not yet at her shoulders), very fine hair that tends to knot in the back from sleeping, so she wakes up with knots at the back of her head.  This brush does not touch those tiny little knots.  I need to use my brush to get rid of the knots so they don't get worse.So for hair that does not knot, it is a pleasure, but for hair that knots (even little knots) this brush is not sufficient.

I have 16 month old boy/girl twins that are in the 95% and I was hoping these would work given the other reviews.  They kind of do, but the fit is still too large.  At the top there is almost an inch gap between their head and the headphones.I would recommend measuring your child's head where the headphones would rest and looking to see if their head is close to 14 inches from ear to ear, if so, this should fit your child well (as it will expand as they get older).(I used a cloth measuring tape and put the measuring tape where the earphones would be along the top of their head for a correct measurement - if you don't have that, you could use a string, see the fit, and then measure the string.  When I measured the headphone, I did it from the center of each earpiece, i.e., the center of the ear.)We can use it now, but only if the kids sit quietly and don't move their head, because when they move their head the headphones fall off.

I have bought the horse barn, the puppies and the tree with the forest animals.  Kids love these.  I saw the negative reviews for the kittens so I called the manufacturer before ordering.  Here is what I learned:- The photo here on the Amazon website is still incorrect (as of Oct. 2013).  The photo shows short-haired cats and they have pointy faces (some other reviewers said they looked like rats).- Because of the complaints the manufacturer changed the product.  Their fur is now longer (around 1/2 inch) and their faces and bodies are fuller.- They are slightly bigger than the puppies and the horses- The carrier now has a back-door- Apparently there are some retailers that may still have the older model, but most now carry the newer model.Things to know about the carriers for all the animals:- When the carrier arrives it is slightly squished - I just stuffed in some clothes and let it sit a day or two, and when I removed the clothes the carrier was fine.- The velcro on the back door isn't great, I wish they used more to keep the back door shut properly.  But my kids were fine with it.To sum up:- If you are giving it to a child that likes kittens, then they will love this.  Likewise, horses to a horse lover, puppies to a dog lover.  Between the puppies, horses, kittens and tree with the forest animals, if I had to choose, I guess I like the kittens the least.  However, again, a child that likes kittens will really like this product!

I have been giving this product to my twins (upon a raving recommendation from the WholeFoods guy) for 6 months or so.  I like that they are getting both Omega 3s and Vitamin D3 (which is great for their immunity).  As others have commented the flavor is great, but some don't like the 'oiliness'.  Therefore, I add it to their yogurt.  In fact, I mix this into plain yogurt (for me I use organic greek yogurt) and the flavor from this product actually flavors the plain yogurt!  And that way there is no oily affect and the yogurt tastes even better.  It is a win-win!

I highly recommend the 12-cell battery sold and shipped by CWK TECHNOLOGY, from the state of Washington because :(1) It fits my HP laptop with no problems.(2) It is roughly twice as thick as my OEM battery keeping the rear of laptop higher to allow more cooling by air.(3) It allows me to use my laptop for up to 12 hours (8800 mAh) compared to 6 hours for the original battery (4200 mAh).(4) It costs less than my OEM battery from HP.(5) It has no problems in charging or holding a charge.I have only used this battery for 4 days and will update my experience in the future.

The picture looks like the all-white hepa filter made by RPS Products.Do not buy the all-white hepa filter made by RPS Products because :(1) Very strong cancer-causing chemical smell despite letting the filter air on the outside balcony for 2 weeks.(2) RPS Products Inc in Hampshire, IL stopped making this hepa filter for Honeywell air purifiers about 2 years ago. This filter is at least 2 years old. RPS does not sell  or make these filters any more.(3) This RPS hepa filter does not have a soft gasket for the top and bottom openings. The whole hepa filter is white with white hard plastic instead of soft green or soft black gasket. Dirty air just leaks past the top and bottom of the filter.Please click "Yes" below if this review was helpful to you.

I highly recommend the polyethylene gloves P2121, 100-pack :(1) Loose fitting. Easy to put on or take off. Ideal for food preparation.(2) Economical. I throw them after multiple uses each day.(3) Clear, colorless, transparent, thin.(4) Do not use for any liquids you do not want contact with skin.(5) Made of polyethylene, safe for contact with food.Please click "Yes" below if this review was helpful to you.

I do not recommend the replacement hepa filter made by Kaz (under the name Honeywell under license) or RPS Products:(1) Kaz does not make a one-piece hepa filter, it makes a hepa filter HRF-F1 which you buy in 3 pieces"separately" and stack on top of each other leaving a 1-inch gap. You fill the gap with the black porous foam supplied with the hepa filter.The filter emits a strong raw smell after 2 to 3 months because of molds and has to be thrown away.(2) RPS Products stopped making this replacement hepa filter over 2 years ago but the hepa filters are still being sold on Amazon, Ebay,etc.The hepa filter emits a "very strong chemical smell" for many weeks while being used. The chemicals are most likely "cancer-causing". The top and bottom have no gaskets, just hard plastic.Compromise : You can buy a original Honeywell hepa for $93 at honeywellstore or a generic hepa with soft gasket for about $63 from iallergy. Both these 2 have soft gasket seals and little or no SMELL.

I recommend 3M Particulate Respirator 8271, P95 (Pack of 10) because :(1) It costs $2 a piece, is economical.(2) It is much easier to breathe through than P100 or N100.(3) It does not create folds on your skin as bad as the  P100 or N100. These folds can take up to 3 days to smooth out.(4) It is a lot cheaper to replace these filters than your lungs.(5) They are white filters with blue woven, elastic spandex bands which last longer than the neoprene or rubber bands.Please click "Yes" below if this review was helpful to you.

I am neutral on recommending HealthSmart 4-in-1 Pill Cutter, Pill Crusher  because :(1) It can only cut pills which are round or spherical (like a ball) in shape in 2 equal halves, but not other shapes.(2) It cuts one pill at a time.(3) It cut pills which are cylindrical, oblong, etc, in 2 unequal pieces, not 2 equal halves unless you position the pill with tweezers.(4) It is easy to drop and lose the pills from the cutter to table, floor, etc.(5) It holds water good for one sip.Please click "Yes" below if this review was helpful to you.

Do not buy the HRF-F1 HEPA filters because :(1)Kaz Inc bought Honeywell home air purifier many years ago and uses the Honeywell trademark under license. (stated on the box).Kaz does not make a one-piece HEPA filter.(2) It is a "3-inch" high circular filter. I stacked 3 of these for my Honeywell 50250 HEPA air purifier leaving a 3/4-inch gap . You fill the gap with a very porous dark foam provided in the box, like the one used for shipping small appliance.The foam provides a BAD seal. All 3 of my hepa filter became moldy with a strong smell after about 2 months and had to be thrown away.(3) I have to use the black foam supplied with the replacement filter to fill the gap. The gasket is made of an 1-inch thick, 2-inch wide roughly circular very porous foam like the kind used inside boxes to protect the contents during shipping. You can easily compress it to 1/4 inch or less with your fingers. This gasket is so porous it allows particles 50 micron or bigger to pass through. The air purifier is no longer "true HEPA" which filters out 99.97% of particles 0.3 micron or bigger.(4) I recommend buying a one-piece generic HEPA filter because you get a much better seal than porous foam against dirty air and a lower price than the price of 3 HRF-F1 filters. You can search "honeywell hepa filter replacement" on Amazon or google.Just make sure the filter is HEPA and fits your air purifier by comparing the replacement filter with the original filter.Warning : Honeywell sold its home air purifier business and Procter & Gamble sold its "Pur" water purifier business to Kaz many years ago. The brands "Honeywell" and "Pur" are still used by Kaz under license.Please click "YES" below this line if this review was helpful to you.

(stated on the box).Kaz does not make a one-piece HEPA filter.(2) It is a "3-inch" high circular filter. I stacked 3 of these for my Honeywell 50250 HEPA air purifier leaving a 3/4-inch gap . You fill the gap with a very porous dark foam provided in the box, like the one used for shipping small appliance.The foam provides a BAD seal. All 3 of my hepa filter became moldy with a strong smell after about 2 months and had to be thrown away.(3) I have to use the black foam supplied with the replacement filter to fill the gap. The gasket is made of an 1-inch thick, 2-inch wide roughly circular very porous foam like the kind used inside boxes to protect the contents during shipping. You can easily compress it to 1/4 inch or less with your fingers. This gasket is so porous it allows particles 50 micron or bigger to pass through. The air purifier is no longer "true HEPA" which filters out 99.97% of particles 0.3 micron or bigger.(4) I recommend buying a one-piece generic HEPA filter because you get a much better seal than porous foam against dirty air and a lower price than the price of 3 HRF-F1 filters. You can search "honeywell hepa filter replacement" on Amazon or google.Just make sure the filter is HEPA and fits your air purifier by comparing the replacement filter with the original filter.Warning : Honeywell sold its home air purifier business and Procter & Gamble sold its "Pur" water purifier business to Kaz many years ago. I do not recommend dextrin, in Equate Fiber Powder. They prevent constipation."Viscous" soluble fibers like in Psyllium reduce your LDL-cholesterol level in blood. This lowers your risks of stroke, heart diseases, etc.. But non-viscous soluble fibers like dextrin DO NOT lower your cholesterol. That is why the FDA does not allow bottles of "non-viscous" soluble fibers to state that they lower cholesterol.Equate is a brand name of Walmart, so you can buy for a lot less money at Walmart.Please click "Yes" below if this review was helpful to you.

Pros :(1) Excellent for preventing constipation.(2) Gritty textureCons :(1) Very high in oxalates like other brans like rice brans, oat brans. Oxalates combine with calcium to form insoluble calcium oxalate in kidney stones, joints, etc. Because calcium oxalate crystals have sharp edges, kidney stones and crystals in joints can be "very painful".The pain can be BAD enough to land people in the emergency room.Doctors suggest eating high-oxalate foods with high-calcium foods at the "same time" to "reduce" the absorption of oxalates into the blood and urine, some of the insoluble calcium oxalates can then be excreted in the feces.(2) I take "dextrin" powder like in Benefiber, Equate Fiber Powder (16.7oz for $9.5 at Walmart), etc.. Dextrin is tasteless, sold with no other ingredients added. It prevents constipation.Please click "Yes" below if this review was helpful to you.

You can not buy this at Walmart, Home Depot, Target etc, Lowe's etc.(2)Turn your central cooling/heating system into a high-volume air purifier. $20 for a filter is much less expensive than spending $150 to $600 for a good high-volume air purifier with a200 CADR or more. I do not recommend Honeywell brand HRF-AP1, HRF-APP1 or 38002 because :(1) Prefilters HRF-AP1, HRF-APP1 or 38002 (all made in Mexico) are thinner and much lower quality than the original prefilter that comes with the air purifier or the generic ones made in US, Korea or China that I bought before. 38002 is basically the same quality, thickness and porosity as HRF-AP1 except for the higher price. Oreck ProShield is not recommended, not rated by Consumer Reports magazine.  The removable assembly of metal plates and wires is called "Truman Cell". The cell has wires to ionize the air particles which are then captured by electrically charged metal plates.I do not recommend Oreck ProShield because :(1) Cell produces ozone, which is converted to oxygen by the non-removable zeolite panel after it. This panel gets clogged with dust after 6 months and stops converting. Vacuuming does little good.Ozone increases in concentration inside your house, damages your lungs and can cause lung cancer. Ozone is an air pollutant and health hazard reported daily by the weather service.Search on the internet about ozone generators. The instructions will tell you to "close off and vacate" the area to be treated. "Make sure the unit has been turned off for about an hour" before reoccupying the space. That is, people or pets should not be in areas with much ozone.(2) Cell "must" be washed with cleaner and water every 2 to 3 weeks or whenever the red light comes on or when "annoying" sparking occurs. A dirty cell lets the dirty air pass through it with little filtration.(3) Cell must be "completely dried" after cleaning, for 6 to 24 hours, depending on humidity, otherwise the air purifier will not start.(4) Cell captures a smaller percentage of particles with each pass as fan speed increases.(5) Percentage of particles captured by Cell varies from 0% to 80% depending on how clean the Truman cell is. A "true" HEPA filter captures 99.97% of particles 0.3 micron or bigger, even when dirty.I recommend buying a "true" HEPA air purifier made by IQair, Whirlpool, Honeywell etc. No cleaning every few weeks. No drying for 6 to 24-hours. No downtime. No hazardous ozone.Please click "Yes" below this line if this review was helpful to you.

I have had several brands of Goji berries and Healthworks versions are near the top.  These are very flavorful, not at all stale, and the packaging is ideal.  A quick rip of the top and you can get into the bag while counting on the zipper seal to tighten things up again when you've gotten what you want from the bag.The berries are fresh from this year and properly and uniformly dried.  I'd have to guess about 10% moisture remains, giving them a nice chewy texture while keeping away any potential to go bad.  I use this product in my green smoothies to add some earthy notes and to pack in as much high quality nutrient food as possible.  These are amazingly high in antioxidants and other nutrients.  Truly a super-food.  I will also take these things along on a hiking trail.  You can get a lot of nutrients in just a few handfuls and a couple of ounces.For those who complain about the stickiness, that's just the nature of the product, and not much different than raisins or dried cherries.  Complaining that these are sticky are like complaining that water is wet.  It just is what it is.

This is a really nice little dog collar.  I wasn't expecting much because it's very seasonal and you might not expect such a thing to last long.  However, this one is far better than anticipated.  I got the middle one in the product picture with the gold border for our Jack Russell terrier, and we have already sized and adjusted it so that it can go on right after Halloween.The bow is a bit much for me, but my wife likes it so it will probably stay.  If not, it is easily removable by human hands, though not at the whim of the dog.The buckle is strong and will take abuse.  It's a snap lock like you'll find on most dog collars and camping gear.  The strapping is strong and will take a lot of abuse, and overall it's very attractive and will stand out to be noticed.The only semi-con that could be said is that the tag ring seems a little lightweight.  I don't think it will break under normal use and it's hardly worth mentioning except for those who might be tempted to put the collar on a big dog that lunges on a leash.  Short of having a Pit Bull or Rotty that hits the end of the chain hard, it should hold up.

I got this one for myself, but I know there will be several more given away for Christmas presents.  This is one of the nicest I've seen and better than the Young Living version that I've had before.Within seconds of turning this on, there was a nice flow of mist coming from the unit.  It just happened to arrive on a day when we had some people getting sick and so I started the unit using Thieves Oil to help fight off infections.  It holds 300 ml of water and uses 2-3 drops of aroma oils per use.  There are a total of 4 timer settings including an always ON setting, so you don't have to worry about leaving it on at night.There is also an optional LED night light.  I normally don't care for those, but this one is pretty soft and relaxing so it's nice.  It's bright enough to be well seen in a room with the lights on or during the daytime, and yet serves as a very nice nightlight as well without risking waking you up.  And because the light shines through the water, there is a water ripple effect that plays rather peacefully in the room and makes you feel like you're in an aqua zone.  There is also a very relaxing white noise sound that comes from this unit, and it sounds like air flowing with some bubble sounds.I don't know if the seller intended it or not, but there's also a slight output of negative ions.  You can feel it when you are close to the unit and if you know anything about negative ions, you'll understand that they are beneficial for your mental and physical health, helping to remove contaminates from the air.I received this unit as a promotional allowance for my evaluation and review.

This is a fantastic bed for our 13 yr old Jack Russell terrier.  He's a mix so fairly large in size and therefore we got the large version.  That plus our family is a "dog family" and all our kids bring their pooch in during visits.  We wanted one that all the dogs could take turns laying down in the bed and they do.  One gets up and another one slides into place.What we didn't anticipate was how humans love this as well.  We got it in while 2 of our grandkids were in town visiting, and I walked out in the living room to see a 3 yr old and a 6 yr old all cuddled up together in it sleeping.The fabric is both plush and yet very durable.  And we have found that the hair from our dog vacuums right up instead of getting stuck in the fabric like the other beds that we have had.There is also a zipper on the back of the mattress portion and the inside can be pulled out and washed if necessary.I didn't think that the pillow would be worth much or that any of the dogs would like it, but it is a prize possession.  We did however think that should our daughter's pit bull get her teeth on it, that she'd shred it.  To our surprise, this hasn't happened.I've never bought a dog bed in this price category before, but this one is worth the extra money.  It is highly recommended and that's my best rating and recommendation.I received a sample of this dog bed for my assessment and review.

I wasn't expecting anything so nice when I ordered this watch, but it far exceeds my expectations.  I was quite pleased when I opened the shipping box to find two surprises.1) A very nice gift bag in case you are buying this as a gift for someone else.  It's got a great feel to it and has a quality closure cord.  Add a gift tag, and you're all set.2) A very attractive hair clasp.  It has nothing to do with the watch but my granddaughter loves it.  It's a bit small but strong.But on to the watch:The overall look and feel to this watch is very nice, and something I would have expected to pay more for.  It has a nice heft to it making it feel like quality, and the overall look to it backs that up.  With a leather band and a perlescent finish dial with a slightly oversized face to the watch, this is something you can wear every day but can also wear with a suit.The watchband is black, has very nice stitching, and it feels like it should last a year or two.  The face markings, hands, and rim are silver colored and nicely polished, probably chrome.  The bezel [back of the watch] appears to be stainless and has the key slots for a jeweler to be able to remove the back and fix it if it ever becomes necessary.When I first got the watch it wasn't running.  This is because it is an automatic watch that depends on movement.  It also has a winding stem to get it cranked up and into the automatic mode.  Within 3 spins of the stem, the watch was functioning normally.  According to the instructions, 30 twists of it [10-15 seconds], it will be wound up for the next 36 hours, even if it is sitting on your dresser.  When it's on your arm and so long as you are a relatively active person, it should not need winding again.Setting the watch is easy and has some nice features, though it is different from any other watch that I've had.  Fortunately, there is also a very well written and nice looking set of instructions that also comes with it.  Once you learn a couple of secrets, it's no big deal.  There are 3 positions on the watch stem, and this is how you set the time, the day, and the date.  Days are also in both English and French, making this a great watch for Canadians.So far this watch has kept absolutely perfect time.I generally include any cons that I see for a given product, but so far this one doesn't have any in my opinion.  I'll write back more after I've had this watch for awhile and give updates.I received this watch sample from the seller for my evaluation and an honest review.

This is a beautiful mug with an incredible polished finish both inside and out.  The overall weight of the mug and obvious thickness of the material was far greater than I expected. I was expecting to see something that looked nice on a shelf but had no real user appeal. However, I have no hesitation in using these mugs for a variety of purposes.  Every mug sits flat and are perfectly matched with each other, which is a no small feat with handmade products.There are essentially 3 parts to this mug. The outside body which is copper and at least appears to be seamless, which is important over time since it can not leak. The inside is a nickel or nickel allow that is designed to protect the copper and prevent corrosion if you leave acidic drinks inside, and the handle which is made of brass. Overall, it gives quite a sophisticated appearance of something that could be sold for much more than this gem retails at.The rim or lip of the cup is rolled which means that there is no sharp metal exposed to your mouth. This is a critical factor that is sometimes not even noticed until it is too late. The other feature I've seen here is that the connection points for the handle are very solid, but they are neither spot welded or do they go through the wall of the cup. Others that do the latter will inevitably lead to leaks as acids play havoc on welds.This is perfect for either hot or cold drinks, though super hot drinks will get that handle a bit warm. However, I make coffee at 205 degrees and while the heat is noticeable, I've had Starbucks cups that are harder to handle.  However, as with all copper mugs, this should not go in the dishwasher as it has the potential to damage the finish.I received a free unit to evaluate and give a fair and honest review

I personally like the hammered copper look best of all.  Though there's no intent to make it look antique, the hammered finish does impart a special antiquey kind of feel, and it just feels nice in your hands.The overall weight of the mug and obvious thickness of the material was far greater than I expected.  I was expecting to see something that looked nice on a shelf but had no real user appeal.  However, I have no hesitation in using these mugs for a variety of purposes.There are essentially 3 parts to this mug.  The outside body which is copper and at least appears to be seamless, which is important over time since it can not leak.  The inside is a nickel or nickel allow that is designed to protect the copper and prevent corrosion if you leave acidic drinks inside, and the handle which is made of brass.  Overall, it gives quite a sophisticated appearance of something that could be sold for much more than this gem retails at.The rim or lip of the cup is rolled which means that there is no sharp metal exposed to your mouth.  This is a critical factor that is sometimes not even noticed until it is too late.  The other feature I've seen here is that the connection points for the handle are very solid, but they are neither spot welded or do they go through the wall of the cup.  Others that do the latter will inevitably lead to leaks as acids play havoc on welds.This is perfect for either hot or cold drinks, though super hot drinks will get that handle a bit warm.  However, I make coffee at 205 degrees and while the heat is noticeable, I've had Starbucks cups that are harder to handle.I received a free item to evaluate and give a fair review.

This is a great idea.  Now I can leave one cord at home when I travel because this one serves multiple purposes.  It is APPLE CERTIFIED (MFI) so you don't get those nasty messages popping up saying the cord isn't supported, you don't have to wiggle it around, and you don't have to be concerned that it may damage your appliances.  This would be good enough for me at this price, but there's more.Pros:  One cable - two ends.  It has both a micro-USB end and the MFI lightening end, meaning that it covers a lot of what you might carry around.  Even if you don't have multiple units, chances are that like me, you get asked by family and friends to help them out with a charge.  Problem solved.The ends on this are VERY solid and they aren't going anywhere.  The cord is staying put, the ends will not be separating, and it will take quite a bit of abuse.  The cord is also pretty tough.  It's a braided silver fiber cord.  It's tangle-free and crimp-free, won't get tied into knots that are hard to separate.  It's a little stiff, but still not hard to work with, and that keeps it safe from minor incidents.  Being silver, it also looks pretty cool and matches your equipment far better than most of those white and black cords.A nice little feature is the little pouch with a drawstring.  It's just enough to hold this cord and help keep it from from any other cords that might be in your bag or to keep it from unwinding.Cons:  None that I can see at this timeOverall, this is a very high quality piece of equipment and I have paid bigger prices for a lesser cord.  Overall I give this my highest rating.  I received a free sample of this product for my evaluation and review.

This is a really nice set of lights, and perfect for installation around steps or those random dark spots where footing or other security might be an issue.  I installed this on the steps going down to the driveway where the area is shielded from other lights by a tree and part of the deck.  It has been a little treacherous for my wife who doesn't have great night vision.These lights are auto on and recharge, meaning that I don't have to bother with them.  However, I have learned from similar lights in the past that it's a good idea to wipe down the solar cells that recharge the battery.  Pollens, general debris, and pollution will land on them and make them hard to charge, and that stuff can be acidic and shorten the life of the solar cell.The lights put out more light than what I thought they would and more than other similar solar recharge lamps that I've had.  They installed easily and I see these things lasting me for a very reasonable amount of time.I received this product free of charge for the purposes of evaluation and review.

This review is of the Xulis 13.3 Inch Portable Laptop bag.  While listed as a laptop bag, it's a bit small for my laptop and will be better suited for carrying other electronics such as my tablet and Kindle, with plenty of room left over for various cords and accessories, and even a couple of magazines for light reading.It is a classy looking unit with a brown leather exterior [love that leather smell], heavy woven straps and leather handles, white heavy duty accent stitching, and a cream colored accent edge on the bottom.  The zipper on it has cloth edges and a very fine tooth comb that gives a smooth feel when you open/close it.  The zipper grip is also accented with a leather and white stitch strap.  The inside is a woven vinyl product that doesn't pucker or bunch and is designed to allow things to move in and out very easily.Most of the case is just one big open area with no dividers.  However, there are a couple of small pockets on one side that are big enough to hold a couple of small cords or flashdrives.  Better than having bigger pockets though is the fact that they include a second case for cords and chargers.  It also is made of leather and seems like it will hold up.  This will start making some trips with me and is easily worth all 5 stars and a very high recommendation.

This review is for the iNeibo Kitchen Olecranon Decanter.The purpose of this product is to introduce air into the wine right before service, and thus improve the flavor and the bouquet.  With varying wines, you will get varying results, so your experience may vary from bottle to bottle.  I find it much more beneficial for red wines than white ones.Whatever the wine, it will not hurt your wine experience unless you let the wine sit too long.  By lifting those aromas and flavors out where they can be experienced, it also exposes those same things to exhaustion.  Left too long, an aerated glass of wine will start to become flat.  That's where this unit comes in handy.  Rather than decanting an entire bottle of wine, you only aerate that which you will be drinking shortly, thus preserving the flavor of that left in the bottle.Tip:  Prior to inserting the aerator into the bottle, put just a drop of a very light flavorless oil on the rubber part and run your finger around it to distribute it.  I recommend grapeseed oil as it doesn't change anything.  While there isn't a need to do this for lubrication to get the aerator into the bottle or back out, it will help to seal it off so you don't end up with a leak around the rim.The aerator also comes with a sleek looking base to store the aerator on your counter.  It's nice, but not necessary for the unit and mine will probably go in the drawer instead.  The only reason for deducting a star didn't have anything to do with the function, but instead with the appearance.  While it looks okay, I think it would take very little effort to really class it up with a band of silver or gold.  Otherwise, it's a very nice unit and one that will be used well around my house.

This review is for the iNeibo Kitchen Meat Claws.It's a bit difficult to get a relative size for these just by looking at the picture, but they are big enough to allow my fairly large hands to fit very comfortably.  My wife has fairly small hands, yet she also was able to grip them well enough to lift a roast as well.  Grip ridges on the bottom of the handle help to prevent them from turning when in heavy use.The inspiration from these things had to come from the design of a bear claw, and that's the very thing you think of when you're holding one.  It's nature's perfect design for holding and shredding meat.  Living in NC, I've pulled many a pork butt over the years, but none so fast as I did with these.  However, there was also a surprise in store when just naturally and while using them to cross shred against each other, they nicely separated out some of the fat we like to get rid of.  The real test came in how it works with some of the bark and chewier pieces of meat that carry so much flavor, yet they don't rip very easily.  These meat claws made quick work out of them, ripping them down to nice little chunks ready to be blended back in.Wash up is easy.  30 seconds with a bit of dish detergent and they are all clean.  But of course if you're not so inclined, dropping them on the top shelf of your dishwasher does a great job too.These are well packaged for gift purposes as well.  They come together in a cellophane envelop and the whole thing is then put in a very attractive rustic looking box.  For this price, it's just one of those things that everyone that operates a smoker or a grill will appreciate and even having a second pair around would be welcome.I received a sample to evaluate the product for a review.

These potholders are incredibly versatile and belong in every residential and commercial kitchen.  This is a very nice assortment of colors that I can see assigning specific tasks based on colors, or just to liven up the presentation.  Unlike the old fabric ones, these are the kind of utilitarian pieces of equipment that you can bring out when company comes and not be embarrassed by their shabby condition or dirty appearance.Why?  Because no matter what you do to them, they clean up like new.  Silicone is amazing stuff and it bounces back, stays fresh looking, and it washes up to look like new in just a few seconds.  Or just toss them on the top shelf of the dishwasher, hook the hole onto one of the prongs and let the dishwasher clean them up for you.On the old style, if you got them wet with a bit of gravy, they didn't protect you anymore and you had to go through a wash dry cycle for a few hours before you could use them again.  And they looked messy.  With these, all the water essentially runs off and it wouldn't matter if they are wet.  They still protect your tender hands just like they were dry.  If you mess them up, a quick rinse running water with just a drop of soap and they are clean and fresh looking.  If you leave them out to get full of food that dries on, it's still no problem.  Again, toss them on the top rack of the dishwasher, and they will come out looking like new.But of course, what's a hot pad if it doesn't protect from the heat, right?  Well I use nothing but antique cast iron pans, and those handles get very hot, and they are sometimes hard to grip if the pan is heavy and my hands are soiled.  iNeibo pads the rescue!  Where other pads still allow you to feel the heat and you have to make a judgment  call as to whether you want to pick up that pan, these have no such deficiencies.  The pan can be a screaming sear pan and your hand will never know it.  They are also serious grippers.  Even oily, the gripper pads on these things allow you to maintain control.That's not where the function on these pads end either.  If you've ever tried to open a jar of pickles and found yourself beating it with a knife handle and still your hand slips, give these a try.  Obviously they don't add any torque to your arm, but they do allow your hand to grip that lid so that at least slippage isn't your issue.  A set of these will be going in Christmas stockings for my adult kids this year.I received a free coupon for a complimentary sample provided so that I could test and evaluate the product.  However, I was not asked nor do I offer to write reviews that do not reflect my opinion and I don't recommend products that I would not buy. This is not a barter deal. I have no financial or personal connection with anyone selling this product or their employees.

This is a very nice little tea bell that adds a twist and a bit of decoration to the typical stainless tea ball/bell.  It's silicone handle is securely fastened to the ball and has no risk of falling in like those with the chain.  Silicone does not react with food and doesn't not get hot no matter how hot the food or liquid that it comes into contact with.For myself, this is a great little unit to keep on my desk at work.  It has a little silicone drip pad to allow it to drain and it has little risk of rolling anywhere or getting papers or the desk wet.  I also happen to be a mug drinker for tea and so need something that holds a bit more than your average tea ball.  This fits that bill.I'll predict this one sells quite a few and especially for stocking stuffers for Christmas.  Already I've had a couple of work associates notice it and ask where I got it.I received a free sample of this product for my test and review

This is a very flexible oven mitt.  I have one other one but this one does a far better job and it allows you to grab pans much easier than the one that I've had.This is a one-size fits all, but with my large hands and my wife's very small hands, it doesn't really make any difference.  It's all good!  The little grippers on both sides mean you can grab a hold of just about anything without any risk of getting burned.  It also means that you don't have to pay attention to how you're putting it on and which side you use.My grill grates were low level red hot tonight and even putting my hand on that grate for a few seconds caused no discomfort.  However, I will note that the fingertips of the glove are not as thick.  Normally this shouldn't be an issue, because this part doesn't come in direct contact, but it is a point worth noting.  It's the only place where the glove got warm on the inside.  But again, this was a red hot grate, which is far hotter than you'd normally use.There are a couple of other uses that you might also wish to consider that aren't normally thought of with an oven mitt:1)  The grip is so good that you can honestly use this to get a good grip on a jar lid to twist it off.  No slipping plams.2)  Use it on your table or counter to avoid heat caused surface damage when you have to put the screaming hot pan down.  It's not fancy like a trivet, but it gets the job done nicely.

Basically and as far as I can tell at this point, these are high quality replacements that fully meet my expectations and more. Both of my current lights had been installed for a number of years and one had recently gone out so I was glad to get these. At first, I only replaced the one that had gone out and had decided to use the other as a backup. However, I immediately noticed that it did not match with the original bulb on the other side. the LLCJ was probably twice as bright and a bluer tint that is quite noticeable.  In the end, this is the bulb you put in if you want people to really notice that you are turning.So having replaced the other light now, I have two very bright brake lights that are LED and should therefore last a very long time. The materials they are made of are easily just as good quality and I will look forward to many years of use. This is a tough bag to be sure.  That's the first impression and the one that sticks with you no matter how long you work with it.To be fair it's not absolutely perfect for everyone.  Up front the cons if they are cons for you... though these don't apply to me.1) It's not extremely supple.  Think inner tube tough and texture.2) It's not extremely light as bags go.  It weighs 800 grams/28.2 ounces.  If you are looking to shed every gram, this might not be the right bag.That's it... now the pros:1) Did I mention it is tough?  Sure you can put a knife through it, but why would you?2) It has padded adjustable shoulder straps for carrying3) It will carry several days worth of clothing and dry gear.  This is the bag I'll be using next time on the Colorado River when we are out for a week.4) It holds substantial air... or not... at your choice.  After the bag is folded over and buckled, you can choose to release the screw on air relief valve and mash it like one of those space bags.  Or leave the air in to protect delicate things or to keep it (or you) floating if the raft capsizes.5) In addition to the buckle on shoulder straps, there are handles on each side.  If you're in the water, wrap your hands through these and secure it to your body.6) I also envision this thing working well in the inverse.  If it keeps water out, it would also keep water in.  And it's black.  Most of you know where I'm going with this, but for those that don't, imagine how great it is to wash up with 80 degree water instead of 45 degree water right out of the river.  That's right, this is a perfect camp solar water heater, and the fact that it holds about 7 gallons of water is going to make for a happier clean up.Overall, this bag is more than recommended.  Getting it is highly advised.I received a free coupon for a complimentary sample provided so that I could test and evaluate the product. Most jack cable tend to be a bit flimsy and I fear damage when they are used in the car and can get pulled.  I have no such fear about this cable.  This is the most solid 3.5mm jack cable that I've seen, bar none.It's laminated braided cable is solid, and perhaps even almost too solid.  It's not something you can just wrap up and stick deep in your pocket.  But that's good because it's tough and it will be the cable that is left when all your other ones have been crimped, cut or the ends come loose.The 3.5mm ends are solid and well built, encased in ends that have a fair amount of finger grip.  These ends aren't coming loose, even if you foolishly yank on your cords.  You may damage your device, but not this cord.  The jacks also fit extremely well into several devices, snug enough to stay with no slop and yet not too tight either.  Just a perfect fit.My other concern was how well these super ends would work with a phone case.  My iPhone sports an Otterbox case, and this sometimes doesn't work with connectors that bump into the case.  The ends worked just perfect and while there was no gap between them and the case, it wasn't an effort to get it in there either.

This is a really nice braided cable.  Granted, it's a bit stiff, but not so that it affects performance.  In fact that slight bit of stiffness due to quality construction may well help it to be more resistant to abrasion and other potential damage.  Fit to appliances was tight, ends are well build with much to grab onto, and there is zero risk that the cord will separate from those ends with even some rough handling.But of course what's important is how it performs when used.  I tested this running various units to a 55" TV.  I was concerned because I've had similar cords in the past of such length that the signal tended to be a bit grainy and weak and needed a booster.  This is not a problem with this cable.This cable is highly recommended.I received a free or discounted coupon for a complimentary sample provided so that I could test and evaluate the product.  However, I was not asked nor do I offer to write reviews that do not reflect my opinion and I don't recommend products that I would not buy. This is not a barter deal. I have no financial or personal connection with anyone selling this product or their employees.

I wasn't sure what to expect for quality with this GoPro camera handle.  The price is low enough that it could have been far less, but I was actually pleasantly surprised.The handle is light but solid.  And yes, it floats... I checked.  It also has a nice adjustable wrist lanyard on it that allows you to fit it to your hand, making that a truly valuable part of it.It's the standard GoPro connection and that screws onto a 1/4" bolt on the handle.  I was concerned that it might not stay tight as such parts often tend to slip.  However, I discovered a bit of genius in the design that prevents this.  Both the connector and the handle interface plates have microgrooves the are reminiscent of the old vinyl records, only finer.  They are in fact "friction plates".  When these microgrooves come into contact with each other, it provides enough friction that you don't have to crank it to tighten it, yet it can break free when you want it too.  Such a seemingly insignificant thing can make a huge difference in functionality and the enjoyment of this product.This comes highly recommendedI received a free coupon for a complimentary sample provided so that I could test and evaluate the product.  However, I was not asked nor do I offer to write reviews that do not reflect my opinion and I don't recommend products that I would not buy. This is not a barter deal. I have no financial or personal connection with anyone selling this product or their employees.Papadoc

This review is for the Comsun Universal Bicycle Bike Mount Holder.  I've had a couple of bike mounted cell phone holders before, but none were quite this nice, so I was a bit surprised when I opened the package.  I also didn't expect several of the features for the holder because they aren't included in the description.The only downside to this product is that they don't include any instructions other than what's on the box and that isn't really sufficient.  However, this is a small thing because it's overall pretty easy to figure out if you just stop and look at the unit.  Also for the record, while they specify certain phones that this will fit, this cradle will fit just about any cell phone out there because it's highly adjustable.The unit is comprised of two separate pieces that fit together, plus an allen wrench for installation.  The attachment piece comes apart and must be fit around the bike handlebar and then reassembled using the allen wrench.  This is basically a one time thing.  Also on that part is a tension screw to allow you to position the phone where you want and then tighten it in place.  There is also an elastic cord that acts as a backup safety device for the phone when it's put in place.The other major part is the cradle itself.  What they don't tell you is that there are two swing out feet that secure it on the bottom and that pressing a switch on the back allows the sides of the cradle sides to expand.  Open up the cradle, put your phone [including any phone case you have] in place, then compress the sides to where it grips the phone.  They are on a ratchet system so there is some clicking as it goes into place.  As a last step, just wrap the elastic cord over the top as a security measure.  Now, loosen the tension screw, adjust the phone to your desired angle and tighten it.If you want to just run into a store or take a phone call, you can simple lift the entire cradle off the mount, do what you want, and then just click it back in place.The only question I have is how long the mechanical portion of the cradle will last.  It seems pretty solid for now and I can't complain about the overall quality, so I won't speculate further.  Whatever I find out on that issue will eventually become a part of this review.  However, at this price, it's kind of hard to fault it if it doesn't last forever.I received a free coupon for a complimentary sample provided so that I could test and evaluate the product.  However, I was not asked nor do I offer to write reviews that do not reflect my opinion and I don't recommend products that I would not buy. This is not a barter deal. I have no financial or personal connection with anyone selling this product or their employees.

This review is for the Protectif RFID blocking bi-fold leather wallet for men.  The stated technical purpose of this wallet is to thwart identity and credit card thieves from using RFID scanners to read vital personal information from new credit cards that contain the RFID chip.  Attached are pictures to reference my notes and review of this wallet.I received this wallet in a very nice presentation box.  There are no markings of country of manufacture anywhere on the box, and the only printing anywhere on the wallet is the stamped name, "Protectif" both on the outside and inside lower corner.  Overall impressions right from the start are that of a high quality leather wallet that will last many years.  Protectif technology against reading RFID chips is buried somewhere in the wallet, and not visible or destroying the outside visible appeal.  RFID blockers use something called Faraday technology that essentially foil the ability of electronic readers to affect or even see what's on the other side.  Getting this into a wallet will increase the cost of the wallet, but compared to what losing your credit card information can do, it's not much.Opening the box, one of the first things you notice is the great smell of leather.  Single stitching is found around the perimeter and well matched with the color of the wallet.  Stitching is further bolstered in corners where the greatest potential for wear and abuse occur.  Inside the wallet, there is room for up to 8 credit cards, though I suspect that with some effort, at least a few of the slots could manage to hold more than one.On the left side is a fold over flap with a window pocket in it designed for driver's license or ID.  Fold it out to present it to a clerk, then back in and again and close the wallet when you're done.The inside of the back of the wallet where the bills go is lined with a vinyl fabric and it has a bill separator to allow you to keep large denominations separate from smaller ones or as I do it, to keep receipts that I need separate from bills.I typically look for cons for every product or at least things that I think some people may not care for.  I can't find anything that even picky people wouldn't care for.  Overall, I would highly recommend the product and as a man, suggest that it's one of those gifts that you're pretty safe on for most of us.  Even if we have one that's relatively new, it is still something that we know we will eventually need.  And with the RFID protection, there are probably few people that already have one in their pocket.I received a free coupon for a complimentary sample provided so that I could test and evaluate the product.  However, I was not asked nor do I offer to write reviews that do not reflect my opinion and I don't recommend products that I would not buy. This is not a barter arrangement. I have no financial or personal connection with anyone selling this product or their employees.

These are great medium size jars.  It's hard to get a perspective on size, so I included a picture of one in my fairly large hand.  While the bottom fits in my hand quite easily and securely and with adequate grip to support a full jar, it would be a bit more than an average size female hand could handle.The glass jar is exactly as seen in the Nakpunar photo and are reminiscent of old style ceramic bean pots.  To avoid confusion, the little side lips on the side of the jar are there for gripping and do not have holes.  That would be a bit of an optical illusion in the photo.  The lip handles do however, help when gripping the jar on the side, particularly if you had wet or otherwise slippery hands.The glass is pretty heavy duty, and about the thickness of a mason jar, though I don't believe these were designed to afford the same level of duty.  I'll suggest they would be more than adequate to be used with hot syrups and jellies, but I don't think I'd water-bath them and I definitely wouldn't put them in a pressure cooker.  The lids aren't really designed for that anyway, as these are commonly known as gold lugs.  Gold lug lids are typically what you find on pickle jars.The glass has got a bit of a blown glass look to it, giving it a bit of look of antique glass, kind of like you see in windows in old buildings.  This makes it look a bit more special than the standard utility jars that you'd buy food in.  This is definitely something that doubles as both a utility and a presentation piece.  There are two seams in the glass, but you don't see them unless you look hard.  For those who might put a label on this jar, there is enough of a flat surface going up the side, between the two lips that it could hold a 1.5" label and have it lay flat.These gold lug caps have a non-removable plastisol liner that is perfectly designed for sealing off the jar from contaminants including air.  When cinched in place, the liner seals the jar perfectly.  To remove the lid, a simple turn of about a half inch is all that is necessary.  While  these lids will hold a vacuum, this particular lid doesn't have a vacuum button on top, and that probably wouldn't be appropriate for the average use of this jar.Ideal uses for this jar would be for those making candles, sauces, packing large volumes of dried herbs, potpourri for gifts, candies, trail mix, or anything you want to give to someone and have just a little bit extra flair.  I'll be putting some homemade toffee in these as Christmas gifts this year.These jars were received as part of a promotion to help me evaluate them and write a review.

This review is of the 10pcs 23" Premium Polyster Neck Lanyard and it was provided to me free of charge for my review.I have quite a few lanyards from various  events over the years, but these are some of the better ones.  There are a total of 10 in the pack in a variety of colors.  The lanyards arrived in a zip open pack, neatly folded, and along with a nice and separately packaged cleaning cloth that will be going into my camera case.There are several reasons why these are better.1) there is a very strong quick release buckle like one that you would find on a backpack.  With a quick pinch, you remove anything that is on the end of that lanyard for temporary purposes without having to take the thing off your neck.  This is pretty smart thinking by someone who has been in one of those situations where someone needs your badge for a second, but you're wearing winter jackets or carrying a bunch of stuff and it is a bother to put it all down.  When the need has been fulfilled, it's just a quick snap to hang it back on the lanyard again.2) There are two attachment mechanisms on the end.  The first one is a J hook on a swivel that has a very strong spring for security and a large access lever for people with big thumbs like me.  The J hook would be ideal for hanging a camera, phone or whatever.  The second is a strong loop cord attached with a second quick release buckle, and this one is probably more ideal for a name badge.  Unhook the quick release, string the cord through the badge hole, and bring the buckle end back through the string to attach it, and then push the buckle back onto the lanyard.One review concerned me about the strength of the loop cord.  Even though this is probably never going to hold much weight, I tested it for strength.  I attached a 20# weight and bounced it a few times with no problems.  That's good enough in my book.  Note that the picture attached not only tests the strength of the looped cord, it also tests the two quick release buckles.

I acquired a couple of these things about 2 months ago and have used them through some of the hottest parts of the summer, and I am quite impressed.I was worried about the potential for the straps to break on these, but the straps support the entire bag, and are not just sewn to the top.  Where they join the bag from the handle, they are sewn to the bag with a crossed stitch for strength, but then the stitching continues down both sides of each strap, so that the bag it self rests in and is sewn to the straps that are basically forming a sling for extra support.The inside of the bag is silver lined, plastic impregnated woven cloth that wipes out wonderfully if there's ever a spill.  Also provided is a transparent and removable plastic insert that lays down on the bottom and provides some extra support.  It wouldn't absolutely be needed but, its there just in case.The zipper on the bag isn't extremely strong, but it probably doesn't need to be.  If the bag isn't overstuffed to the point where it pulls hard on it, I think it will last as long as the bag, which should have many years of service.So far I've had about 25# in this bag and it carried easily.  And keeping foods cold and frozen has been easy.  Normally the ice cream is soft by the time I get it home.  However, I had two containers in one of these bags with no secondary source of refrigeration, and in the middle of summer temperatures, there was no appreciable amount of melting in those containers after an entire hour.I also take a fair number of hot meals to people who are sick and some are 30-40 minutes away in heavy traffic.  In most cases, when I pull the container out, it is still too hot to just hold onto and within food safety zones of 140+ degrees.

I received this assortment of glow sticks in exchange for an honest review.  However, just because something is free doesn't mean I won't be critical of problems.  This wasn't a concern with this product because this is a wonderful addition and they will go well at any celebration where there are kids or even older kids like me.  I love these things.There are a total of 100 of them.  The colors I received were hot pink, yellow, green, and orange.  Just snap them, shake them, and watch them light up instantly.  They are only about 8 inches long which I initially thought was a little short because you see others that are a couple feet long.  However, I realized that this is a perfect size for kids of all ages because with the connectors, they can turn these into chains, necklaces, etc.  And they are small enough to fit around even the smallest kid's wrist as a bracelet.  The one caveat is to watch the connectors around little kids as they could be a choking hazard.  It even mentions this right on the box.About 10 minutes in, most of them had lost some of the initial glow.  This is not uncommon with these.  As you can see in the third picture, the ones on the inside were snapped about 10 minutes prior to the ones on the outside.  However, then the brightness stabilized and they are still quite bright well over an hour later, as shown in the last picture.  Now two hours later, these things are still bright.  Kudos to the folks who put this package together.

This review is for Norwegian Fish Oil Premium Omega 3 Complex.  I received a sample bottle in exchange for my honest opinion.  However, just because it's free doesn't mean I'll hold back if there's anything about it that I don't like.I currently take Omega 3s  for cardiovascular reasons and to control cholesterol and triglycerides.  In doing so, I have dropped my cholesterol from 259 to 119 and triglycerides from 389 to 146.  While I've been successful in doing so, I simply won't take anything that is less than a pure product or that I might have trouble digesting.So far this product has passed all my tests.  I've included pictures so that you can see the size of the capsule because Omega 3 capsules can sometimes be a little large and hard to swallow.  These however, were on the small side of medium, very flexible, and easy to swallow.  I have put a sample capsule right next to a pen cap and an M&M for comparative purposes.The capsule itself is a one piece unit so it won't break or leak.  On hitting the tongue, it has a very slight sweetness to it, but not sugary.  I probably wouldn't notice if I wasn't purposely tasting it.  It's just enough to get a slight bit of saliva going to make it easy to swallow.I also held it in my mouth to determine if there was any fish oil flavor at all, and there is none whatsoever.  Also, despite taking it on an empty stomach, there's been no gastric reaction such as burping or any flavors coming back up.  Overall, it's quite a success and I suggest this will probably be a strong seller.

I received this set of marbles as a test in exchange for an honest assessment of the product.The marbles come in a net bag along with a shooter marble that is about 3-4 times the size of a normal marble and a velvet bag with a drawstring to store them in.  The marbles are a good solid weight, made of solid glass, and there aren't very many bubbles in them, so they are fairly solid.  That said, they are glass so they will break.  One was broken upon arrival but it didn't shatter or anything dangerous - it was just broken in half.  That actually is a good sign to me because glass that shatters would be a problem to have around kids.All the marbles roll quite well including the shooter.  Though there is a slight surface defect in that shooter, it doesn't affect performance and it will probably still outlast me.  This is going to be a treat to teach my grandkids how to play an old school game that doesn't require a power source.

I use Healthworks Cacao about 5 times per week as an addition to green smoothies.  The flavor is consistently good from package to package, and the quality of the product can't be beat.  It's a much deeper richer flavor than many other brands out there and there's none of that woodyness that you'll find in a few.The grind is consistent and very fine in order to yield the perfect flavor.  The product doesn't seem to absorb moisture and clump like some products, but I find no trace of nor is any flow agent specified.  Regardless, I keep all packages closed until I'm ready to use that package, and then dump the contents into a air sealed jar to avoid contamination and contact with oxygen in order to retain the flavor and nutrient value of the product.Overall, this product is highly recommended and I will continue to purchase for myself and my family.

I'd been trying to find wheat to grow in small trays for the purpose of the grass to be used in smoothies and had little luck.  However, when purchasing some Palhouse Brand garbanzo beans, I noticed this product as well.  This has an excellent sprout ratio and my first sprouts were visible in about 10 days in my inside tray.  The first harvest was ready about 7 days later and I've found that it's got about a 5 day regeneration period.  In other words, I make my cuttings and 5 days later I can make a second cutting.  The third cutting came about 8 days later, and the final was just pulled up from the roots and ground whole.For planting purposes I acquired Soil Moist pellets that absorb water and release it as necessary and just mixed the wheat seed with it after soaking it overnight.  Doing it that way allowed me to have the seed constantly have moisture available and in contact without dealing with washing soil off the roots at the end.  The Soil Most was then rehydrated and used with the next batch.

I needed a saw that just cut wood and that I could drag from place to place without being concerned that it would break down when I needed it, yet still not spend a lot of money on it.  I didn't need LED lights, digital readouts, or a lot of settings that I'd never use.Presenting the B&D JS515, an uncomplicated model that sells for under $25.  One gets the B&D brand value and you don't have to dig deep.  So far I've had this saw for over a year now and probably used it 100+ times without a hitch.  It uses the standard blade or the T type at your preference.The power is more than adequate and I can go through just about anything but cement board, though I've done that as well in a couple of emergencies for cutting a couple of holes.And while this seems like a small thing, I like the orange color on the job, as it's easy to spot in a room full of other stuff.  It also comes with a perfectly adequate canvas carry bag that keeps your extra blades handy and eliminates risk of scraping yourself on the edge while loading/unloading stuff from the truck

We have a medium coat shedder of the Jack Russell line, and he produces a lot of hair.  Typically we use a horse rack on him to remove the hair and it does a fine job, but doesn't get the last 10% or so.  Within hours, he will be shedding again, but just in smaller volumes, and we decided for the sake of those who watch him whenever we travel that we needed to make some adjustments.The MIU COLORÂ® Pet Deshedding Tool is a great thing, but like anything else has its limitations and needs to be used properly.  For us, it clogs up quickly and pulling the hair out of the teeth takes a second hand and some time.  This adds up.  What we found is that we should continue to use the rake to get rid of that 90% and then use the MIU COLORÂ® Pet Deshedding Tool to clean up the balance.Doing it this way gives us an very well groomed furry friend with a lot less hair to dump all over the house.

Frontier does it again!  Stevia powder comes in a mylar bag, perfectly dried, ground, and sifted.  If there are stems in there, they are so finely ground up that they can't be detected.  Stevia doesn't attract moisture like some other products, but it's still better to keep it in the mylar bag until you are ready to use the product.  Then pour the contents into a glass canning jar with a lid to keep the oxygen out and the freshness in.This isn't stevia extract - the white stuff.  That stuff is an amazing product, but the process of pulling the sweetness out of the natural product like this is.  The white stuff involves dissolving the natural product in resin, and that's where they completely lost me.  I'll stick with the nice green product which is nothing more than stevia leaves that have been dried.Use about a half tsp of stevia per gallon pitcher of your product and work from there.  Don't drink it immediately as it takes about an hour for the liquid to fully pull the sweetness into the drink.  Once that happens, the remaining part of the plant will sink to the bottom and join the dregs of the rest of your product.  If you try to drink it right away, the sweetness won't be there, but there will be a bit of flavor that reminds you of dry wheat grass - not particularly pleasant.  After an hour, there won't be that flavor any more.

I've recently been cooking some gluten free items for a couple of members of our family who recently discovered may have problems with gluten.  I found some great gluten free flour at Sams Club, but you need gluten or a replacement for it when making bread.  I won't say this is a perfect replacement for gluten, and it is more expensive, but it does get the job done and it makes a very acceptable product at a lower cost than some of the other alternatives that are out there.It wasn't until after I got this however, that I discovered what a great thickening agent it is.  I used to be strictly a flour and cornstarch cook, but have switched over to arrowroot and now have xanthan gum as an alternative.  While it does an amazing job in thickening things like gravies, it's not a perfect replacement for flour there either.  But it's a different product so I don't expect it to be exactly the same either and it makes it no more deficient than stevia is deficient compared to sugar.  It's just different and has some amazing properties of its own.

For the money, you can't ask for a better little lock box.  We got this one for our daughter who lives in an apartment with roommates.  Despite the fact that you try to avoid having roommates of ill character, one never knows if someone will be tempted when seeing a bit of cash or other valuable items just laying around.  The idea behind this isn't that they couldn't break in if they wanted to, but to create a substantial barrier and avoid offering that temptation.  Because it isn't burglarproof, we advised her to keep her cash and valuables in it and store it under a blanket in the closet, out of sight.  It would also be quite useful for anyone who had a small side business where having a little cash around to make change is needed.  It will fit in most drawers and again would simply be a barrier to sticky fingers that would otherwise try to lift a few bills without being noticed.The lock on this isn't like the one you had on your diary when you were a kid.  It's a real lock and just pushing and prodding on the box itself isn't going to open it.  It really is a lockbox and it does require a key if you aren't going to force it open with a prybar.And of course for this kind of money, you certainly shouldn't expect that this is either water or fire proof. Both would damage the contents, and it says so right on the package.Buy this for the right reason, to basically be a lockable storage area that is a barrier to other people putting their hands on your property.

I am now on my 4th bag.  Starwest has produced yet another fine product worthy of their name and reputation.  Some have claimed a bit of an ocean taste to it, but I don't see it that way.  To me it's is a bit sweet and very easy to digest.Now that's not to say that I eat it straight - that's just ridiculous.  Those people who complain about it while eating it that way get what they deserve.  This is a dehydrated product that is meant to be mixed in with other things.  You wouldn't eat a handful of dehydrated minced onion, and you don't do it here either.I get my kelp in two ways.  I will add it in about 10% ratio to the flour in baked goods.  Other than a slightly darker color and a bit more of an earthy flavor, you can't tell it's in there.  But since I don't know what heat might do to the nutritional value, I also consume a fair amount of kelp as an additive to my daily green smoothie.  Here it adds some sweetness and again, some earthy tones.
