This product has some tragic flaws. First the controller area has four flat sides, with only one side with the buttons. But they're not really buttons as much as they are keypad type areas. YOu need to do it by feel. Second, they're poorly marked and cannot be viewed as the markings are in black, which means black on black. Third, you push one button once to pause, twice to advance, and thrice to go back. Good luck getting it to differentiate two from three pushes.Finally, the louder button is at the bottom, lower button up top. Not a big issue, but counterintuitive (sort of like a light switch that is ON in the down position and vice versa).I cannot recommend this product to anyone.

Large, well insulated, does everything a lunch box should. I bought a second for my wife. The outer pouch is great for keeping napkins dry. I'd buy a third but my son is grown and has moved away. Maybe next Hannukah??

These are awesome tasting treats. Put them in bowls for a party and you better have lots of bags because they don't hold that many treats, and everybody will be stuffing themselves on these. And not too much sugar either. I LOVE these things.

This is an amazingly realistic looking fake camera. I liked it so much, I bought three more. It mounts with three drywall screws (not included) and will scare away the bad guys. One tip: If you install it, it's easiest to remove the camera from the base, then reattach it after you're done. There's a thumb screw at the bottom for this purpose. Also, I glued the black wire into the hole so it wouldn't come loose. I used Gorilla glue for this. And at $9, it's a steal. Strange to get a steal on a device designed to prevent thieves.
Great for the slip on fins. It keeps my feet warm and allows me to walk on the docks without splinters. Not designed for walking on rocks if that's your insert point, however.

Perfect way to carry my dog. With five holes (includes one for his tail), this is a very secure way to carry Fido. I use it to ride my bike with my 17 pound Cockapoo. He loves speeding around for 2 hours as I provide the pedal power. He especially loves going down big hills. He has never been even close to falling out. One tip: I had my shoemaker put snaps on the tops straps to reinforce the velcro closures.I had a small size when he was a puppy of 6 lbs. Now I have the XL. I don't think this would fit a dog over 23-25 lbs in the XL size.Great for cycling, motorcycles, walking, etc. A great idea and very reasonably priced.
Our dog loves these treats after his walks. It is a strong smell like pepperoni, and Bentley knows that.

We got this for doggie poop bags. It works well. The only problem is the deodorizer retainer on the underside of the pop-up lid does NOT fit snugly and kept falling into the bag below. I now use duct tape to hold it on. It's very convenient, and with the proper deodorizer, keeps the flies away from where it sits on the porch outside our side door where we take our dog for his walks.

The concept of humidifying your room requires micro-mist water droplets.This device produces MACRO droplets, which are so heavy they shoot out of the spout and promptly fall to the floor. Within five minutes the carpet around the base was soaked. Literally water logged. I returned it the next day.

Makes my dog's stool is more solid since starting these. I cut them in half to make the bag last longer, as my dog is <10lbs. He loves the tasty chews as well. The nutritional content is outstanding as well.

This is my favorite music of all time for my kids. I had the VCR tape when my children were small. I just got this CD because I liked the music so much that even though my kids are in their 20's now, I still enjoy listening to the music. I wish they had converted the VCR to DVD as the video was amazing, and great lessons for my children growing up. Marlo Thomas is a Saint.

This noticeably softens our shower water. I replace it every four months. YOu may need to do it more or less often depending upon your water usage. Kind of expensive at 30 cents/day, but what the heck, I"m worth it.
Our dog loves them. I cut the small circles in half and use them as treats for Clicker training my dog. These are his favorites.

This book is a good look inside the peloton, and George's history is fascinating. If you want to find out more about Lance, then look elsewhere as details are few. But about George? Very nice story line with great anecdotes about his cycling history. A good one day read for the beach or slope side.

These are great bars with few carbs, great for diabetics. These taste great and have more protein than any other bar I've found. I use it as a meal replacement for lunch on the go. I love all the flavors as well. You probably will as well.

Simply the best razor I've ever used, electric or manual. It conforms perfectly to my face with each stroke. The search for the perfect razor? It's officially over. This is worth every penny, and then some.
Good way to entertain Fido until he punctures the squeakers with his sharp puppy teeth. They lasted about a week each, but I ordered more because he found them so much fun to play with.
This is more grease than oil, and makes food smell horrible. My dog refused to eat his food with even a teaspoon on it. I certainly wouldn't want to eat this stuff.
This uses soft pins to comb. My dog likes it because they also massage his skin. Good deal for the $.

I tested this with the wind shield on.  This mic picks up your voice loud and clear but ignores background noise! Here's an uncompressed and unprocessed raw WAV sample file that I recorded using this microphone going through Audacity.  If you open the wave file in a sound editor, you'll notice that the background noise virtually zero despite the fact that I'm in a noisy room with a loud refrigerator echoing off a hard wood floor.  My other handheld microphones pick up much more noise in this same environment.http://bit.ly/1vwGifX

UPDATE - I contacted the seller and they're telling me all their products have ugly logos.  Yet they continue to advertise shirts without logos which deceives Amazon customer.  I will file a complaint with Amazon.The product photo is deceptive and shows no logo, but what I got has an ugly Tesla logo.  I ordered the product code TM-R01-BB_XL which is black with no logo but they shipped me TM-R34-BLY_2XL with an ugly Tesla logo.  I've had people ask me if it's associated with the car maker.I'd be pretty happy if they shipped me the product I ordered.  I even tried ordering two more times and each time they shipped me the wrong product with the ugly logo.Too bad because the product isn't bad.  Think of this as a very nice fitted tight outfit.  Don't expect it to compress much and don't expect it to hide any fat rolls you might have.  If you have a very fit body, this thing looks awesome.  For me I don't always want the compression and it allows blood to flow freely.  The material is soft and smooth and breathes fairly well.  Great for indoors or warmer outdoor weather.  Don't expect it to warm you on a cold day.
Good coverage because of its directional pattern. Reasonably clean recordings.
Nice enough fitted fit to make Sarah Harbaugh happy.

I just bought my nephew who is going to college an HP Stream 13 for $230. Beautiful and powerful computer, but it took me 90 minutes to remove all the stickers and all the crapware & adware.  I still need to offload the recovery partition to a flash disk to recover the SSD storage. It has a total of 32 GB SSD storage so every bit counts.  I'm also waiting for a 64 GB MicroSD card http://www.amazon.com/dp/B00IVPU7AO so I can expand the storage.Removing the crapware and adware took 2 hours plus another hour to install Windows update.  I removed all the browser extensions and add-ons in IE and then installed Chrome. Then I installed CCleaner and removed McAfee anti-virus so that I can just use the free Microsoft AV. Also removed a bunch of bloatware like Cisco wireless networking utilities like LEAP and Apple Bonjour. Removed the Realtek card reader software since it slows the card reader down. Then downloaded fresh Realtek card reader driver and manually installed the driver without using their setup program.UPDATE - I had to remove all the HP tools (support and registration) as well.  They were intermittently hammering the CPU to 100% and other people in HP forums were complaining about this problem.  Once uninstalled, the CPU usage problems went away.  Something else that caused some mildly high CPU usage during media playback was the Realtek DTS audio processing service and I've disabled that and the system performs better.  It was not needed for playback quality and it was actually detrimental to audio recording quality.The thing that slowed me down was that I had to gather my nephew's personal info to create a Microsoft account for him. It was mandatory since this is the free version of MS Windows 8.1 (with Bing). But the MS Account allows him to use MS Office online for free so it's worth setting up.  I also had to carefully remove 3 stickers on the keyboard rest. Intel sticker was tilted. Now it's a beautiful clean system and it boots very fast and loads everything fast. It handles most computing tasks just fine and now I'm loathed to give this away.Some people will complain about the 2GB of RAM which is not expandable, but I never have any problems with 2GB RAM because I don't leave a 20 browser tabs open.  You're not going to use this laptop for 3D intensive gaming or 3D rendering so the RAM shouldn't be an issue.  I have a desktop computer with 8 GB of RAM for running games and virtual machines and content production and no one should expect the HP Stream 13 to perform this role.  It runs fewer than 10 web browser tabs just fine and it's extremely snappy running Microsoft Office Online or Google apps.I ran a Youtube 1080P on Chrome browser. Google is screwing all of us now by forcing their VP9 codec on us which forces this computer to use software video decoding. This dual-core CPU is pegged at 100% utilization and forced to overclock to 2.58 GHz and it will still hiccup if a youtube ad shows up.  Of course this is just chewing up the battery.  By comparison, I tested a 1080P H.264 .MP4 video downloaded from Google and the CPU hovered around 8% during smooth playback. Google needs to shove their VP8 & VP9 codec where the sun don't shine.  But thank goodness for "Magic Actions for YouTube" (a Chrome plugin) letting me disable Google's VP9 HTML5 crap.  Now Chrome runs Youtube in flash mode with H.264 hardware decoding and the CPU hovers around 20%.  Here's a screenshot of the CPU pegged at 100% with VP9 software decode [...].  Here's the CPU hovering at 20% using Flash mode with H.264 hardware decode [...].I've been hammering on this system with tests for over two hours. The Intel N2840 2.16 GHz processor is being forced to burst to 2.58 GHz from all the work I'm throwing at it. Windows Update is hammering the IO and CPU. The brightness level is even set to 60% and the battery level still reads 79% with 4 hours 24 minutes remaining.After all the tweaks and cleanup I've done, the slim HP Stream 13 3.42 lb laptop is running smooth as butter. The 13.3" 1366x768 non-glare matte screen is the perfect compromise between viewabiliy and compactness.  Would be even nicer if HP could sell us a 1920x1080 13.3" screen but probably not at the $230 price point.  Another small gripe is that the bezel is a little bigger than I'd like.The Stream 13 has a 720P webcam, but I wouldn't even call it 360P quality. It's incredibly grainy using indoor lighting, but what were you expecting for a $230 laptop?  It's certainly not going to look like the camera on the MacBook Pro. Get yourself a $66 Logitech C920 which has awesome image quality and 1080P hardware encoding if you want a nice webcam.  Even a $29 720P webcam will look leaps and bounds better.On the audio output side, the HP Stream 13 has good sound output from the TRRS jack.  It can drive my large 808 headphones with authority.  By comparison, my Lenovo ThinkPad T430 business laptop couldn't push my 808s at all!  The audio recording on the other hand stinks in the default setting.  The integrated microphone sucks like most integrated microphones on laptops. It is very laggy because of all the noise cancellation algorithms they apply to it. The recorded sound (using Audacity) is noise free but it is extremely unnatural due to excessive noise reduction.  I don't like the recorded sound at all.UPDATE - After disabling the DTS Realtek audio processing, the playback quality was still just as good.  Recording with the internal microphone actually improved a lot.  The internal microphone in the HP Stream 13 actually isn't too shabby.  It is surprisingly usable quality for VoIP or Video Calling.The Stream 13 also has a 3.5mm TRRS phone connector port for headphones and earbuds with microphones. That means you can use the same earbuds with mic that you use with your smartphone. The problem is that while it sounds a lot more natural than the integrated microphone, it's a faint yet noisy signal. The input volume was set to 100% with a 10 dB (fake software preamp) boost and it's still only reaching 20% peak sound levels in Audacity.  My Nexus 4 and Samsung S4 on the other hand produce extremely good quality recordings with the same earbuds or headphones with microphones.  To put this in context, my Lenovo ThinkPad T430 from work has the same audio recording quality problems with the integrated mic and TRRS port.If you want to work around these sound recording issues, buy yourself a $34 Samson GoMic.  It's the best money you'll ever spend on a USB microphone.  The other option is that you can get a bluetooth headphone with microphone since the HP Stream 13 has bluetooth capability.The trackpad on the HP Stream 13 is large and usable.  It supports gestures like two-finger scrolling.  But if you really want a good experience, buy a bluetooth mouse and use the integrated bluetooth in the Stream 13.Lastly, here are the disk performance results for the internal 32 GB SSD storage. It's one of the slowest SSDs on the market, but it's still around 15 times faster than a normal hard drive when it comes to small file transfers.[...]Conclusion:This is a superb mobility laptop for the money, but only if you remove all the crapware and apply all the optimizations I performed above.Summary of crapware removed and optimizations performed.* Apple Bonjour.* Cisco LEAP and EAPFAST* McAfee AV* Realtek cardreader software (note that you need to download just the new drivers and then just install drivers manually without software.  Don't remove if you don't know how to install new drivers because you'll lose the card reader)* HP Tools registration* HP Tools support* Disable Realtek DTS audio effects.  Just type DTS at start screen and the program will pop up.* Install Chrome* If you use Chrome, install "Magic Actions for YouTube" plugin for Chrome to disable ads, pick the default resolution, and force Flash mode instead of HTML5 mode.  Flash mode uses H.264 MPEG AVC video which supports hardware acceleration for very low CPU usage.

Extremely good quality mic for the money.  It's probably the best USB mic you can get for less than $50.  The raw sound without any noise cancellation gimmick is very clean.  Some USB mics or cameras incorporate noise cancellation in their drivers but it's not a good natural sound.  Cleaned up audio isn't the same as audio that's clean to begin with.You can operate this mic in Omni mode which covers 360 degrees if you're trying to record multiple people.  Omni mode is inherently more noisy but the quality is still surprisingly good.  If you use this mic in cardioid mode, it's even cleaner.  I had to set the input level to around 50% at 20 inches from my mouth.  It's even cleaner if you record at 10 inches and set the level to 25% because it won't pick up as much background noise.This isn't just a microphone, it's also a USB sound card.  You can not only monitor yourself from the Microphone in real-time with the 3.5mm headphone jack, you can concurrently play audio without it being recorded.  This is no small feat!  When I tried to do this with a normal sound card and a normal mixer, I can't play music and record just the mic.  I have to record the background track and the microphone vocals into a single track.  I had to get a second mixer to record only the microphone while monitoring the mic and listening to a separate background track.The Samson Go Mic even comes with a nice hard carrying case.  The only nit pick is that the case can't carry the cable, the mic mount nut, or the plastic cable manager clip.  The cable is also very long so if you're using this clipped onto your laptop, you get a bunch of extra cable in the way.  I'd suggest that you buy a short 1-foot USB-A to USB Mini-B cable to use this product more efficiently with a laptop.Here's a sample I recorded in the three recording modes. It has a 3-way hardware switch. The product drivers install automatically in Windows. I've bought much more expensive solutions (mic + mixer) that don't do half what this thing does.  http://bit.ly/1quPvzVOne minor downside is that this Mic can only be used with a computer.  I was hoping to power it with a generic USB power adapter and use the 3.5mm as a line level output so that I could use this mic with a conferencing speaker phone.  It will not power up if you plug it into a power adapter.

The omni-directional version picks up way too much noise. That might be the nature of this type of microphone, but it's too much noise to be usable for me.  I need something that picks things up all the way around but not above the mic.

Mic quality sucks. I recorded a wav sample into Audacity with the Line Level output.  The audio quality was terrible and the base station still needs all separate power and line level wiring.  You're much better off buying pro audio condenser boundary mics.

Very disappointed with bass. I'm no "basshead". I love all kinds of music from popular to acoustic to classical.  The bass in the AKG K240 drops off severely below 50 Hz and is nearly inaudible at 30 Hz even though the product description claims 15 Hz.  Any attempt to boost the bass will result in fluttering sounds of driver excursion. I personally prefer to leave my music source flat and I don't like using bass boost, but I want to hear natural sounding clear and sufficiently loud bass.Here's a spectral plot analysis of the acoustic music video "It's Time" from "Imagine Dragons". http://bit.ly/1nbufm8Even though it's acoustic music (they don't even use true bass instruments), there's a lot of music between 30 and 70 Hz.  So contrary to the opinions of music elitists who frown at "bassheads" and the bass heavy products, we really do need good bass reproduction for all sorts of music.  What the elitists who give this product a high rating call "flat" or "neutral" is misleading.  Flat should mean the frequency response is flat throughout the music frequency spectrum.All that said, I will say that I like the build quality and the detachable cable.

The connector on the female end which connects to the Microphone is very loose!  2 out of 2 units I bought are loose like this.  Better off paying a few dollars more for the GLS Audio cables which have a much higher quality connector.  I'm happy with other Hosa cables that don't involve XLR connectors, but I will never buy Hosa XLR products until they switch to a higher quality.

0:25 MinsThe solution is a transparent gel with a subtle smell of reminiscent of vanilla.  It evaporates does not smell within a minute. I found it helpful for a small burn I got on  my hand from touching a hot skillet.  It immediately soothed the pain and by the morning my hand did not hurt at all.  I tried it on sun spots, and it does not seem to change their color (2 weeks so far).  Perhaps it needs more time, but based on my experience don't expect quick results.The bottle is small. With the cap on it is 4.75" tall and slender.  On the positive side it is the size that could be carried along without having a bulk of bigger bottle.I like to see a list of ingredients on products, especially if they claim to be all natural.  Since I was not able to find ingredients on Amazon description or even the company web site so I copied  the list of ingredients from the bottle:Aloe Vera Gel, pentadecanoic acid, octadecadienoic, omega 6, linoleic acid, Ascorbic acid, Hydroxy ethyl cellulose.I received a sample for testing from ASTI. The manufacture does not use animal for testing so they enlisted me as one of the human test subjects.  In terms of brightening dark spots I am not seeing noticeable result after 2 weeks.  I found it to be effective on light burns.Ali Julia review

1:55 MinsI used to see a podiatrist a couple of time a year to grind down a callus on the bottom of my foot that bothered me when I walked for a long time.  Then I discovered these little callus removers and they work as well as my the tool my doc is using. I used it dry, it is not painful at all, it removes dry skin in a very thin layer. I can see skin coming off in powder-like state. I work a few seconds at a time checking the result so I don't remove too much skin.I have tried other callus removers such as files, pummis stone, and chemical solutions. None of them worked well enough to avoid visits to the podiatrist. This grinder is more effective than anything I have tried before, I don't see the need to go back to the podiatrist.The package include the callus remover, a spare grinder roller, a brush for cleaning the grinder.  The grinder runs on two AA batteries, which are not included.This is not my first callus remover, some of them are not as well made as other - some of them did not fit well together.  This callus remover fit well together, all parts lined up well.  It comes with a nice manual - it is in English and has a lot of images that demonstrate how to connect heads, insert batteries, and so forth.This grinder is unique because it also has a nail clipper.  It was a little scary to stick my nail into it for the first time, but nothing bad happened when I did. However, I do not like the way it feels on my nails and I am not planning on using it on regular basis.  The callus remover, however, is great!I received this callus remover for testing and review. I really like the callus remover, the nail clipper feels "funny" on my nails, but your millage may vary.Ali Julia review

I really like these gloves but the description of sizing is not right.  It is certainly not XL men gloves.  I am a female with small hands and the these gloves are a good fit for me. I normally wear size small gloves.When measured on the outside the glove is 9.5" long and 4.3" wide at the palm (measured just above the thumb). But the gloves are pretty thick.There is about 1/2" of space at the tip of the fingers. My hand is 6.5" long (so the there is room for 7" long hand from the wrist to the tip of the middle finger).  The width of my hand is 3.25" and it feels roomy without being way too large, guessing there is bout 1" of slack on the inside.The gloves come with rechargeable batteries and a special charging cord.  The back of the gloves has a pocket with a connector for the batteries.  There is no on/off  switch, the heating element begins working as soon as the battery is connected.  I was pleasantly surprised that the heat was not only in the back of the hands but in the fingers as well.  The heat was pleasant (i.e. not too hot).  I can feel the battery in the back of my hand, but not the heating elements  in the glove and in the fingers.The back of the gloves has a Velco strip it can tighten the fit of the glove and it happens to be over the battery and prevents the battery from moving around in its pocket.My hands get really cold in the winter, so I am looking forward to being more comfortable this winter. I will post an update if the gloves do not last through the winter.I received these gloves for testing and review as part of a new product introductions.  So far they look promising! They are comfortable, well made, look good and the warmth is at a good temperature.Ali Julia review

I just finished  my preliminary tax return and happy to report that I have not encountered any problems.  Overall, the interface looks very similar to last year.I've used H&R Block's tax software (formerly called TaxCut) every year since 1995. Several times when I saw a promotional deal I purchased both H&R Block and TurboTax to compare. I found that both programs satisfied my needs but H&R Block costs consistently less. I have been buying the Deluxe version of H&R Block because it covers it the mutual funds sales and cost basis calculations are included (Schedule D) and the form for Foreign Tax Credit from mutual funds is present (Form 1116). To get this functionality in TurboTax you need to buy the Premium version of the software.The price on this package changes often and you can catch some great discounts. I use a nice tool that shows history of Amazon prices. If you enter "Amazon price history alert" in Google it will come up at the top, my favorite has the word "camel" (repeated 3 times) in the name. You can set up the tool to send you an alert when you desired price drop is reached. During the last tax year season the price fluctuated between $20 and the list price of $44.99, and was on the gold deal special a couple of times.' INSTALLATION~~~~~~~~~~~~~' I had no problems with my install. However in 2013 I helped a friend resolve an install problem on a Windows 8 PC us installing from a CD. I am including what we did again as I know a few people told me in helped with 2014 install. Normally the automatic install runs a file called "tcauto.exe". This file in turn calls another program located under "installers" directory which actually does the work. We were able to by-pass the error by executing the exe program in the installers directory directly, this year it should be called "HR_Block_Tax_Software_2015_Deluxe__State_-_Windows_CD.exe" (it is the only file in that directory).' If you encounter issues with display, such as not seeing selection boxes, check your screen resolution. Both Windows and Mac minimum requirement for the screen resolution is 1024 x 768 pixels or higher. At a lower resolution H&R Block software will have problem with display such as not properly displaying selection boxes. Screen resolution can be changed on your control panel by change PC's display settings.' If you are using a digital download you will need a key-code to install the software after you dowload it. The key-code can be located several ways.Option 1:  In the past when my download finished the install started automatically and offered me a choice of two links "View Keys" and "Install".Option 2:  This year the install did not start automatically so I clicked on the install program myself, and on the first screen it asked for "Activation code".  When I purchased the software Amazon sent me a message which included a Product Code (note that they did not call it Activation code) which is the number I needed.Option 3: You can locate it in your Amazon account:1) Log into Amazon2) Select Your Account at the top right of the page3) Select Games and Software downloads which is towards the bottom of the long page you see when you log in4) Then under H&R software entry you will see the key-code that you need to enter to unlock the software' If you have a virus scanner it will generate an alert the first time you run the program, change the permission to "Permin Always" otherwise the program will be blocked.' Does H&R allow to install the software on two PCs?I found the answer on H&R Block web site FAQ under the topic "Installing Software on Another Computer"I quote the FAQ answer below:"There are just a few steps necessary to re-install the H&R Block At Home program from the CD you received in the mail. Follow the steps below to re-install the program or install it on a second computer.Insert the H&R Block At Home CD into your computer.Click the Need to Re-install? link on the menu bar at the bottom of the screen.The Frequently Asked Questions page will open to the first FAQ titled, "Can I install the software on a second computer?"Enter your activation code and last 4 digits of the credit card you used to purchase the program initially and click Activate.You can find your activation code in your purchase confirmation e-mail.Follow the on-screen instructions to complete the installation."' WHAT IS INCLUDED~~~~~~~~~~~~~I purchased H&R Block Deluxe plus State. This version entitles me to 5 free federal e-files. It allows me to print and mail as many returns as I want, there is no limit on printed returns.One state software is included in the package but the package does NOT include free e-file for the state return (see one exception below). If you want to e-file your state return you will need to pay a fee of $19.95 to e-file each state return. Alternatively, you can print all the forms and mail them using US post office without any additional fees. If you need to file taxes for an additional state, each additional state is $39.95 plus $19.95 e-file fee.Note: NY state residents can e-file state returns for free if you income is $60,000 or less.' GENERAL~~~~~~~~~~~~~I just finished my preliminary tax return and below are my observations. Note: the forms are not final until mid January of 2016.' Pet Peeve: H&R Block starts the interview process with an annoying up-sell pitch, recommending an upgrade from Deluxe to Premium even when it is not necessary. In my opinion, they should wait until the person enters this year's data and suggest the upgrade only if there is something about the return that can benefit from the Premium version. That would have been useful.What is the difference between Premium and Deluxe? The Premium version offers advanced tools for self-employed and rental property owners: cost basis of home sales, dividends, gifts, and inheritance assets. It has advanced schedule C guidance to maximize deductions for self-employment income. And finally it has guidance for rental property income and expenses. The rest of the Premium package is the same as Deluxe.Note that the Deluxe package has support for self-employed income as well as stock sale cost basis calculations.' Pet Peeve: Help is not context sensitive. For example, when you click on "learn more" about a particular topic the general help window opens but it does not show help topics for the specific topic that you were working on. Instead you need to search and know which key words to use locate the relevant topics.' H&R Block provides you some guidance for completing Form 1116 (foreign tax credit, for example foreign tax paid by mutual funds). However, you need to keep switching between whole-form view to enter data and then back to interview to read the instructions. Even though the form where you can enter data is visible at the same time as instructions you cannot enter data into it until you switch into whole-form view. This is cumbersome, but at least there is some guidance for this form.' DeductionPro (which helps you put value on your charitable donations) is integrated into H&R Block software running on your local PC.  It suggests reasonable prices based on condition of the donated item and it is nice not to have to come up with what is reasonable on my own.' Pet Peeve: I don't use the default location for the tax returns due to how I set up my backup software. The H&R Block software does not initially remember this new location on the second start of the application, it told me I have no returns. I needed to pick the return manually from the File menu, as it did remember recently used files. The third time I started the software, it finally knew the location of the tax return file.' For folks trying to download State Forms. The state forms are not available as of 11/20/2015. H&R web site says they will become available in January.  To see the latest status you can go to H&R website, click on Dowload software, then hover over  "Download Software" on the top banner and select "State Editions". Currently it says "Coming soon in January 2016".When the state forms became available and  teh state software can be downloaded directly from the program.' At the end of the interview process there is a check step (which you can run at any time, but the interview ends with this check). This step flags problems (e.g. missing information) and potential audit alerts (e.g. unusual deductions) with red flags, and reminders (e.g. things you marked tentative) with yellow flags.' Sometimes I want to return to some section of my return. The best way to jump to any section directly without navigating through other pages is to use "take me to" button which is displayed at the top of every page, on the same line as H&R Block banner.' Does H&R has the ability to import TurboTax data from previous years?Yes. TurboTax files have a .tax extension. Use the Browse button within H&R Block application to navigate to the folder you need and it will import the data from TT return.' The final tax return can be saved in a .PDF format for future reference.' IDENTIFY THEFT AND TAX RETURNS~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~'  Last year there were many reports of thieves filing fraudulent tax returns using stolen social security numbersIf this happens the person who tries to file their own  tax return gets the following error:IRS records show the spouse's Social Security number (SSN) on this return is the same as the primary taxpayer's SSN on another return already filed this year. Double-check your spouse's SSN. Fix any issues and e-file again. Otherwise, you'll have to file a paper return.What to do if this happens?1. Call HRB told them of the issue (1-800-472-5625)2. Call IRS (1-800-829-1040) had them flag the SS#IRS states that people need to mail completed return, a copy of police report or Form 14039 Identity Theft Affidavit http://www.irs.gov/pub/irs-pdf/f14039.pdf, copy of Drivers License or passport or SS card.3. Call Equifax and have them put an alert on the SS# (They notify Experian and TransUnion as well)4. Call Social Security Administration and notify them (1-800-772-1213)5. File with FTC https://www.ftccomplaintassistant.gov/Information#crnt&panel1-16. File a police report of a possible identity theftI have been a H&R Block/TaxCut user for many years. I keep coming back because it works well for the tax forms I need to do and it is less expensive than TurboTax. If you have a question I have not covered leave a comment and I will do my best to answer it.Ali Julia review

1:02 Mins Nice small labels.  They stick well and come off clean when needed without leaving sticky goo.Ball point pen does not write on these labels, but felt pen works very well. The labels are small and have different shapes and sizes.  The largest label is 11/16" square, the smallest is 1/4" oval.  Their size works on small bottle and containers or just color-coding.I received a sample for testing and review.  They do exactly what I expected - stick well, peel off well, and come in many colors and shapes.Ali Julia review

The entire book is only 76 pages.  It is written succinctly, with examples to illustrate major points.  All chapters are short and written in a simple language, I was able to read it in one sitting.The book helps to answer questions such as when it makes sense to take early retirement (never if you can effort it), how much income you can earn in retirement before you start losing your benefits, what is the difference between suspending your benefits from not filing for benefits until full retirement age, and many more.The book ends with a clear and politically unbiased explanation of the problems facing Social Security and a long list of possible solutions with pluses and minuses of each option.  The author does not make a conclusion on what options are best, rather he leaves the reader to ponder the issues associated with each option.Thank you to CladeBank media for providing me a review copy of this book. This book contains the basic information, but I found it clearly written and succinct. Even though this basic information is available in other places this book is well organized so I could digest it in one sitting. It would be particularly helpful for someone like my mother who has no internet access.Ali Julia review

0:17 Mins These are basically knee high.  They are made out of 95% acrylic and 5% spandex.  Because of the materials they are very stretchy and expand to accommodate even athletic calves.  However the top elastic is pretty tight.  They reach right up to the knee and grip on with the tight elastic.  I hope it stretches out a bit as I wear it, I  would have like it to be just a little less tight.  The height of the sock it can stretch from 15 inches to 17 inches. The fit like size 9-11 socks.  On my small foot (size 7) they are a little lose but not too bad (typical fit for a size 9-11 fit on me).These socks are designed for attractive look rather than warmth, the knit is very lacy. I got the black color and the top is decorated with white lace.I received a review pair of socks as part of the new product introduction to test the fit of the sock for the American market.Ali Julia review

0:25 MinsThe solution is a transparent gel with a subtle smell of reminiscent of vanilla.  It evaporates does not smell within a minute. I found it helpful for a small burn I got on  my hand from touching a hot skillet.  It immediately soothed the pain and by the morning my hand did not hurt at all.  I tried it on sun spots, and it does not seem to change their color (2 weeks so far).  Perhaps it needs more time, but based on my experience don't expect quick results.The bottle is small. With the cap on it is 4.75" tall and slender.  On the positive side it is the size that could be carried along without having a bulk of bigger bottle.I like to see a list of ingredients on products, especially if they claim to be all natural.  Since I was not able to find ingredients on Amazon description or even the company web site so I copied  the list of ingredients from the bottle:Aloe Vera Gel, pentadecanoic acid, octadecadienoic, omega 6, linoleic acid, Ascorbic acid, Hydroxy ethyl cellulose.I received a sample for testing from ASTI. The manufacture does not use animal for testing so they enlisted me as one of the human test subjects.  In terms of brightening dark spots I am not seeing noticeable result after 2 weeks.  I found it to be effective on light burns.Ali Julia review

1:55 MinsI used to see a podiatrist a couple of time a year to grind down a callus on the bottom of my foot that bothered me when I walked for a long time.  Then I discovered these little callus removers and they work as well as my the tool my doc is using. I used it dry, it is not painful at all, it removes dry skin in a very thin layer. I can see skin coming off in powder-like state. I work a few seconds at a time checking the result so I don't remove too much skin.I have tried other callus removers such as files, pummis stone, and chemical solutions. None of them worked well enough to avoid visits to the podiatrist. This grinder is more effective than anything I have tried before, I don't see the need to go back to the podiatrist.The package include the callus remover, a spare grinder roller, a brush for cleaning the grinder.  The grinder runs on two AA batteries, which are not included.This is not my first callus remover, some of them are not as well made as other - some of them did not fit well together.  This callus remover fit well together, all parts lined up well.  It comes with a nice manual - it is in English and has a lot of images that demonstrate how to connect heads, insert batteries, and so forth.This grinder is unique because it also has a nail clipper.  It was a little scary to stick my nail into it for the first time, but nothing bad happened when I did. However, I do not like the way it feels on my nails and I am not planning on using it on regular basis.  The callus remover, however, is great!I received this callus remover for testing and review. I really like the callus remover, the nail clipper feels "funny" on my nails, but your millage may vary.Ali Julia review

1:23 MinsThese TotalCarePro insoles provide no arch support.  It is not for people who have flat feet or seek arch support. The insole are made out of material that looks like neoprene.  It is a thin neoprene insert that provides some minor cushioning.  Inside I can feel 6 metal disks, they do not hurt or interfere with walking. The insole is large but have cutting lines on the sole so they can be cut to the desired size.  The guidelines are larger than women sizes, but I used them for the first cut and then used the sole of the shoe I want to wear them in to trim for a perfect fit.The slight cushioning they provide is comfortable, but there is a problem which prevents me from using the insoles  at this time. The insoles have a strong chemical scent (not unusual for the neoprene products).  I put them in basement to air out.  So far it has been two weeks (15 days to be exact) and they still stink. My experience with neoprene mouse pads that had a similar scent is that it can take many months to air out.I received these insole from TotalCarePro for evaluation with a request to provide an honest review. Getting a free product does not influence what I say.  This is my honest evaluation and I included both pluses and minuses of my experience.Ali Julia review

This is my first experience w Mr. Beam lights.. but I  am impressed..I was looking for some  security lights to go on my patio .when I saw these I thought ..." Let give them a try".. sure beats getting a electrician  out to wire the patio The back of the house is a dead zone re light and an open area behind  so It is always a concern not to have some kind of security lighting out there..well install simple and all I needed was some batteries to get up and started.. After install waited for the evening hours to better angle the lights. I installed one on either end of the Patio deck... but after seeing how they work I  may have to get more for the side of the house as well  The range of the lights is about  30 feet or 1/2 of my deck.... with the install on either side It is easy to tell if some one or something is walking the deck..very Pleased w this product and would recommend it to others that need a simple lighting solution

Ok this looked like a pretty  cool waterproof  bluetooth speaker........... I tried this to out pool side.. ( always an area i am fearful to take a bluetooth speaker ) but due to  its nice water proof property and solidly secured plug on the rear.. It was a no brainer to  take this little guy outside .......I know it is listed as one for the bath or shower but I seldom spend that much time there, so pool side or  beach side is where this little guy will get  testedFirst it has a nice little hanging handle...So when I took it to the beach.. I hung this on one of the rungs  of the umbrella's... so we had a nice spread of sound over both of us.... This allowed me to  safely secure my cell phone so no chance of an unexpected DUNK in the pool or a splash from the  waves...Set up for this little guy was Simple... follow the well written instruction and pair the music source to the speaker.. and  you ready to enjoy.This little guy does several useful things that I really, really like:When I am floating in our pool  my cell always RINGS.. no way am i busting out of the pool to answer a phone.. but w this little guy sitting poolside. I can FLOAT over to the side and hit the PHONE button and answer it without ever getting out of the water.!!,,My second favorite thing about this unit is I love to listen to audio books will FLOATING in the pool........and it works perfectly to READ to me....Nice clear spoken words.and then when I want to Spicy Music to do my water exercises .......... it is again easy to float over to the side..  switch UP the  sounds from Book to Music  and get my MUSIC to exercise too..Now I would call this unit a sport unit......... is has a nice LOUD volume  but the base is a little on the soft side but that is just find for me.. Again  the spoke word is PERFECT  for my audio books ... and clear sound for phone calls.  and music sound FINE.Now ,I have not tested it to the LIMIT but the written documentation that comes w this says it has a WHOPPING  25 HR  RUN TIME!! ( before recharging is needed ))Honestly, if it even comes close to 12 hours.. I will be thrilled......This one is a definite item going into the suitcase for my nx tripThis item was provided for review.Happy ...........oh yes......... I like this Ivation  speaker...and.. it will be my POOL companion all summer long ....

Selfie Stick (for non techie types!)Gave this to my friend (( non techie ) to try..while she was visiting as she is so NON- tech is isn't funny So I figured if she could use it anyone could.........she was very skeptical  I watched as she read the direction and  set up the cell phone and attached to the selfie stick.. and with in a few minutes she was SNAPPING away..  you had to see the look of delight on her face... to appreciate how neat this item is...She would never have  pursued the learning curve to use the bluetooth paring etc. of a traditional selfie stick.......... but with this item she can get the Results  where she would never have attempted or purchased a traditional bluetooth unitWe have a load of fun.. shooting all sorts of things.. from  People in groups, shots shooting DOWN onto the group......... and even taking photos of feet and sm bugs...... we had a delightful afternoon with this stick............and she did all the picture taking...It securely held the cell phone in the correct position.. We were both delighted at how light weight and how small it retracts so it is an easy item to take along to the beach or the park or the  kids games. ...............She took hers to the grand kids birthday party so this time she can be IN the photos rather than just being the photographer all the time.  And i took mine to the beach..So if you want a  perfect  and easy to use selfie stick...........this is the one. I like this unit better than fussing around w the bluetooth as my one phone's bluetooth isn't always steady......now I don't have to worry about it and  this fits my needs perfectly......This item was provided for a reviewSo if you are  like me ,  and want a low tech seflie stick..This is the ONE to get , sturdy, easy to use and it WORKS>

you  need a selfie stick but OH SOOOO MUCH FUN to have..and make Wonderful Memories !!I gave one of these to my sister in law.. who is new to smart phone.. she was up and running in less than  5 minutes and snapping away. ... Now she was delighted as she can be in the photos w her grand kids rather than always being the photographer.There is very little learning curve to using this item.  Once you understand how to set up the blue tooth on  your phone/camera  and pair it with stick.. you nearly DONE..One thing I like about this stick is  is folds nicely and easy to take along  when going out to a park or  picnic or some casual sporting event..One Nice thing that most forget is this can be used as a simple monopod ( similar to a tripod with only one leg).. This can stabilize your cell phone camera to get the best still shot or  videos...  as it really minimizes camera shake when you us it.It securely holds you  cell  so you can raise the stick into the AIR to get an over head shot.....or extend the stick to the  right or left to get beyond a crowd  of people ... One of the nice shots we were able to get was when we used it ground level to get s picture of a frog... close up and right in his face !!So it just expands what you can do with you photography when you use this stick...Well worth the money to  have this much FUN  and get some great photos as wellThis item was proved for a review but I bought 2 more  for  gifts after testing it out.Have FUN and get the MOST out of your cameras on your phones... get a Selfie Stick !!

Why  do you need a this Francois et Mimi  french press coffee maker ?.....First let me say if you have never tasted french press coffee you have never tasted coffee........The French Press uses pressure to force coffee to the bottom of the pot after brewing, capturing the all the yummy concentrated  coffee flavors. This results in  coffee in its purest form. The results are deep; dark and full flavored.This is a coffee you make and consume...Not only will your coffee stay hot with this double walled thermal model , but it will do so in style........... no hanging around on a burner............and this particular french press  lets you savor the drink for a bit longer than normal due to the double walls that retain the temperature.Now lets just forget that this pot is PRETTY.........and.... looks beautiful on you table and looks so pricey.  but it performs perfectly!!Now  this item  does not having any glass or plastic parts.so. it should last .. Easy to clean of any residual coffee oils that might taint your fresh cup of coffee......rather than like my other french press w the glass body...  One careless moment and my lovely french press was in pieces.............I am so delighted to have this  Francois et Mimi........... I love love love it..Try french press coffee .. you will be so surprised at what flavor you will get with it and you may never go back to any electric brewer again.

I have just discovered the wonders of Steam cleaning after buying a floor steamer for hard wood floors...when I saw this item I was tickled to  put it through it  various uses.......... First it is an easy to handle hand held unit  w multiple tips  to give me more options to clean all sorts of nooks and crevices in and around my homeJust fill it up and plug it in and wait for the steam MAGIC to start.........The first item i used it was to clean the seal around a freezer we have in the garage .. after many years it has some grunge on it .. and after just a few minutes w this hand held steam it  was clean and looks like a brand new seal..  yeah.Then I tried to clean my  smooth top stove........ again w just a few minutes of the steam head to the stubborn spots OFF they cameThen into the bath room to clean the tiny accumulation of mold in the crevices of the shower that not amount of scrubbing w a brush and Harsh cleaner was able to remove..  and again .. after just a few seconds of direct steam on the sites ...........the MOLD just rolled out and I wiped it away..Now I was having FUN finding  all those  places I could never fully clean ...  around the base of handles in the bathroom... and the runner on the sliding shower door..If I had know how good a hand steamer worked I would have had one YEARS agoSo Happy with my little  blue cleaning machine....I was provided w this item to review but  would like to get another one for my sister.. at this price point it is a real bargain.would I recommend it YUP......  if you want to get thing really clean around your home.

This item is not going to work for the majority of  people that would most need it,  positioning the magnifier is not easy or even possible if one is trying to use this for the feet. There is only a tiny magnet that  attached the magnifier to the clipper and it won't stay secured as it flips and flops all around.. You cannot position it to give a visual of the nail so you can safely use it without clipping the skin on the foot.This could be dangerous if the person is a diabetic .or has vascular issue of their lower extremities.I am glad I tried this out before giving it to an elderly family member.. This would NOT work at all  for dealing with their feet.Works only marginally better for the hands.I would not recommend this product in its present configuration.

I like this light.......I wanted it to use in a very dark closet and it works perfectly for that need. After placing the 4 batteries in side and deciding the length of  glow time ..i.e 30-, 60,- or 90 seconds . Just place it where you needed it and Motion will activate it when needed....... What makes it work for me is the Hanger you can either hang it using the attached hanger hook or not that is up to youThe hanger hook makes it so easy to place and replace if needed else where. Now that I think about it I am going to tuck this away in my suitcase on my nx trip. Always hard to find your way in the dark in a strange house or hotel roomHang it on a towel rack.....when you walk into the bathroom  TA DA.... the light flips on  and stays on long enough.you have the choice of  glow time from 30 seconds, 60 seconds or 90 seconds. The  6 lights are more then bright enough to clearly see in a darken closet or safely navigate  a strange bathroom or stairs.This product ws provided for fair reviewI will be sure to hang this in the guest bathroom when we have  visitors.Just to make them feel safer as wellI might need to get another one for  another closet  It is inexpensive but effective....and I like this darn LIGHT>

I wasn't sure what to expect from  a carpet company  but Boy was I in for a Pleasant surprise with this bath rug.This is the NICEST bathroom rug I have ever had.......... super soft, woven very well, NOT STIFF  and with a really really good nonskid backing.And On top of that it is PRETTY.......I have bought so many bath rugs only to be disappointed over and over again.. They look pretty in the store or package but once out and on the floor, they are stiff and  difficult to manage, let along try to wash them.And of all the throw rugs you have in your home, the bathroom rug is one that really needs  washed regularly.The last one I bought looked so nice but the backing was terrible.. if even a sm amount of water got under it, you were slip-sliding all over the floor.That one ended up in the trash promto>>>>> NOT with this Stainmaster .. it is solid on the ground, and w one member of the family that walks w a cane, that is a really important feature. My only negative re this rug it that they don't have a complete bathroom set to purchase and they don't have a long 60' version to put in front of a double bathroom sink. I would be snatching that up ASAP........Otherwise  2 thumbs UP for this one.I am really impressed.. and will be looking for more Stainmaster carpets  Hopefully I will find more in the near futureVery very pleased with his bathroom Rug

UPDATE 9/16/15: I am liking this unit more and more ........We took it on vacation... set up near our beach chairs and listen to beach music while floating on our  pool floats.. for HOURS and HOURS....... never skipped a beat.. perfect function and the battery was still going strong after nearly 6+ hours . Several other guests  commented on the pleasant sounds from it .. and asked for the name of the unit.. VERY HAPPY with this speaker.............................................Now this Ivation Acoustix Blue Tooth Speaker  is the unit I  have been looking for ...........  Can I say" not too small  , not too large ........but just RIGHT."........  the size is  sm rectangular box  w 2 retractable handles.. The  access ports are covered by a thick, cover to make the speaker water and dust safe.Several things makes this particular bluetooth speaker  SPECIAL for my use.1.)  the SOUND...........wow.. I wasn't expecting the WOW sounds that came out of this sm speaker..  Now my bench mark for speakers is my Bose Bluetooth.. and this Ivation speaker is on the same level only much less pricey. and w Extra's........I really didnt' expect to hear the full tones and base that came out of it.. I had a friend visiting and she was shocked.. she kept asking  " was that sound really coming out of that little speaker ? "  >> YES. it was ........... If I didn't' see the speaker I would never  had thought that a small footprint  unit, like this Ivation,  could produce that SOUND.2.) an Unexpected Treat.........this unit has a FM RADIO.......... now I wouldn't have expected that would have been a big thing but it is ......... what a nice Extra to be able to use the same unit for multiple functions..3.) speaker Phone....... my particular cell phone seems not to have the best voice capture so this function has been a particular bonus  for me.. I made a call last evening and was so nice to have this function available to use4.)  ahhhhhhhh listening to Audible  books.........one of my guilty pleasures when being outside.. I can read and  do some yard work or  float in the pool...... what a  nice, full  sound  of the voices of the  readers .came out of this machine.  Making  listening to audio books so much nicer.Now for me  living near the beach and Pool , the fact that this unit is Waterproof & Dustproof  is a HUGE  selling point........ And having a FM radio on this unit will be very nice as I prefer not to have my cell  phone or tablet near water or sand.This was super easy to pair via bluetooth......... but this unit also provides a Line IN port..  when you prefer to save you battery on your tablet or phone.It has a nice SOLID feel, .. (You can almost feel the quality of the product)... a non slick bottom so it won't slide around on the smooth surface.  and One of my personal favorites a VERY CLEAR and EASY TO READ.  LED screen to tell you what is going on.. i.e Bluetooth, FM radio and the station.  etc..So in a side by side  w my Bose Bluetooth this Ivation Acoustix speaker is  a  solid performer .with MORE options and  security.. I would NEVER take my Bose to the beach or pool side..........but with the security of this waterproof and dust proof unit( and the awesome Performance ) .. It will be my companion for fun in the Sun.  YIPPPPEEEI can't think of anything this speaker doesn't do to make my listening a treat..  and at this price point it is a real  DEAL.This unit was provided for a HONEST review. and that is what this is.........I won't provide anything but honest reviews.I have a  birthday event coming up and, am thinking  this will be the perfect gift for  her.....so need to order one for her.. I have to say I am more and more impressed with this little guy the more I have used it and it will be a welcome item to enjoy my tunes and my Audiobooks for a long time to come. I have several trips planned over the nx few months and this little guy will be easy to pack for my trips..Very pleased w this product....and Highly recommend it  if you want a  wonderful listening experience

This was exactly what I was looking for only better.  I wanted  to use this in the bathroom to try to keep the  damp  items OFF  the  floor or in the hamper. This rack works exactly as planned. It fits easily over th door and give me ample room for  robes or  towels etc.Installation..............no brainer.. just hang it over the door.. and this item has  6 hooks which makes it a perfect fit for my use. With the non-slip hooks you can get a evenly spaced item.  And it is not overly  large, cumbersome  or Unsightly, as I have seen in other over the door hangers.  I should have know if Oxo  made it, it would be a good functional product  and they didn't miss the mark on this one either.  I am very pleased w this item and plan  to get another one for our 2nd bathroom and get those  towels and robes placed properly.Good Job Oxo......... I can always trust you .

I was very pleased to get this very nice blue tooth speaker in my hands Right out of the box it looks NICE and feel NICE too ..Several things about this unit makes it a winner for me-First it isn't a wimpy piece of plastic . It has a nice solid feel w some weight to it with a nice aluminium case. I come w a usb charging cable and Line in cord.-Second it has a very nice appearance. about the size of a small rectangle box w a cute grill on the front. The buttons to control the functions are easy access on top of the unit . Several of them perform multiple functions .PLEASE READ THE INSTRUCTIONS. on how to control the volume, chg the stations and accept Phone calls-Third It has one item the most bluetooth speakers do not have.. a LINE IN port .. so if you want to use that vs sucking up your power on your cell phone you can direct line in with the INCLUDED LINE IN CORD ( yeah !!) I also tried this with audio books.. which was very very nice I like to listen to books on audible while doing house cleaning or kitchen chores. This speaker was clear and made the listening very pleasant .. I could even hear the voices very well over the sounds of meal prep-Forth Pairing was simple w voice cue's-Fifth ...........THE SOUND............Wow was I surprised.. I didn't' expect the nice clear, crisp sounds to come out of this little guy and produces some very nice bass. Now I have a Bose Bluetooth speaker and really this is very close in sound quality.. I played a variety types of music with it and was impressed w all of them..From soulful ballads, to hard rock , contemporary and classical ...........and what is most difficult instrumentals ( in my opinion ) all performed well with good base and clear sounds I can't stress that more .how. CLEAR a sound you get, not muddled or muddy sounds.-Sixth Volume...................WOW. it can really crank out some Sound........much better than most any blue tooth speaker I have used to date.-Seventh Battery life ........ well after playing i for about 7 hours .It still had JUICE.................. This was unexpected but much appreciated.I was provided the product and asked to provide an honest review.I have to say I am more and more impressed with this little guy the more I have used it and will be a welcome item to enjoy my tune and my Audiobooks for a long time to come i have several trips planned over the nx few months and this little guy will be easy to pack for my trips.. That will be FUN.

This is just gorgeous Luggage.. and i have  never said that about LUGGAGE before!!!!!.And even though it is beautiful  it is so efficient.The tote is ample size to handle most one would need for a weekend.. w ample pockets on the outside and inside  and  it even hold down straps in side so things do not slip around... WOW................ I love them..........love them Super Comfortable...... which is a difficult thing to achieve in ear buds. as well all know.The sound is great the FIT is comfortable... I would never guess these were not the $$$ priced model.... I am sooo pleased I can hardly contain my pleasure.set up was simple.. quick to charge and then easy to pair............ and then sweet sweet MUSIC........... I spent a better part of an afternoon with Mpow bluetooth ear buds while working..all the while listening to a audio book......what a treat.. got a ton of work completed and still got to finish my BOOK.I found them easy and comfortable to wear and use. I have had some high priced both wired and wireless models and eventually then ALL started to feel uncomfortable after a few hours of use....... but I have not found that to be the case with these Mpow's........ They don't seem to exert as much pressure on the ear canal and surrounding area .. but they do still give good sound and reduction in ambient sounds....... all this and Comfortable as well..I was provided this unit as a review item but plan on buying another set for a family member.. I am really delighted with this product.If there are any suggestion I would provide, it would be to the manufacture, is to EXPLAIN how to use the sm bag of additional ear bud modifiers... there is no explanation on how to add or when it would be better to use them or not... a simple one page in the instruction manual would work.. Otherwise many people will toss the bag or worse yet not know what to do w the items and return the product as they can't get it to stay comfortably in their ear... Please.. fix this ..Otherwise I am very happy Camper... and look forward to lots of hours of music and audiobooks.

UPDATE 7/10/15:  I have had this fan for several months and  it is  working exactly as expected.  It is super quiet, we have  it in our living room and  you can feel it but it never makes a sound to interfere w our video watching.  I love love love the remote..... Living in a very warm climate it is so nice to be able to adjust up and down as the evening progresses.. and room temperature changes..  Very Pleased w this fan.-----------------------------------------------------------well I do like all the options this fan offer........from the timer, speed adjustment and MOST Loved, THE remote.what I didnt' like was the assembly......I am not an overly technical person so for me I rely on the instruction.WHoaaa...  that wasn't much help but after struggling and w the aid a a school age child I was able to get this put together. Not because it was difficult but because the directions were poor..First it is a rather light weight product so this item is easy to move around or from room to roomNow  living in Florida I use fan's regularly in all rooms.. This fan will be nice to use in one of the our bedrooms to adjust the fan during the night  when we are just too darn lazy to get up and turn the fan DOWN.. Now we have a remote to take care of that .  ( SMILE !!)) After we got it together, I think we will be enjoying this as the Florida heat come on  I also was impressed  at the very low sound it makes, not like most fan's that sound like a sm jet engine  but it pushes the air around very well.I also like that this unit can be converted to a table top unit as well as a floor stand. unit.  I will use that when working in my kitchen as it can get mighty hot in there during the summer months.My only con is I wish this thing had come put together or at least MORE put together ... otherwise I am pretty darn pleased w this fan..I will be enjoying it  for manyyears  to come..

The Inventiv Shower Speaker:  was a pleasant surprise. First didnt' realize I NEEDED  shower speaker.. but what I found out  .. was this is so nice to have in the bathroom to use while grooming,  or putting on makeup etc... I know this is advertised as a shower speaker and of course it will do that  but I just enjoy it as a  bathroom speaker.. This is much nicer than bring a cell phone in to the bath area.It comes w an over sized  suction pad.. that fits nicely. The whole unit is the size of  your palm.  After  charging it up, connect it to  your phone re  bluetooth and away you go>>>> Oh and you can take phone calls as well <<<<< again nice when you are in the bathroom, where I prefer not to take my phone for a variety of reasons.  One reason is  electronics  too close to WATER is not a smart idea.Now this isn't a Bose Speaker but a nice pleasant easy to use speaker with more than decent sound.  This would make a Nice gift and am sure any one that likes music would appreciate this  little speaker. I even used it in the kitchen stuck to the wall.... again so  my cell isn't anywhere near water  or flour  etc.  Easy to accept a call  when I am  busy and not have to go running to fine the cell phone.The item was provided as a review product....This item  has more function than just as a shower speaker... I am sure this can be enjoyed out side on the patio,  as wellHonestly this is  nicer than I expected..........and am happy to have it.

I love using  streaming videos for our entertainment,so was very pleased to try this Nexus Player...... I am a long time fan of Nexus products so was expecting  a WOW productWell ........ lets just say it is a work in progress...... and I now understand why they pulled it right after they released it a year or so ago......and Just released it this fall.  It has a sm flat footprint. round in design, that sits  near the TV... no real way to  conceal it... It has  2 inputs. One for  an HDMI cord and the 2nd for a standard USB.In the box is the round flat Nexus Player,,the size of a sm dessert plate.,,, a very simple remote and  2 batteries..... no instructions  nor HDMI cable.......After connecting to the WIFI in the house...  you need to connect to your own Google account...........  once completed.  up pops the  interface on  the screen...  The primary focus of the unit is Google movies, music..etc..... w a sm selection of alternative apps at this time.. i.e  Netflix,  Hulu Plus, Pandora... are examples. but the list is very limitedOnce you select a  app . it is very very speedy...much faster than any other streaming  units I currently own... i.e Roku, Amazon Fire, Chromcast.With no instructions .. is is sort of  a trial and error trying to figure out what works and what doesn't .. I went looking for an instruction tutorial  Appears adequate but I would have preferred a written instruction manual vs trying to find it on line..juggling reading it on a tablet and trying o do the set up.........seems a poor decision in my opinion.Now the remote is super simple..... w minimal function.  It appears all the focus is on the  microphone to allow voice search. with minimal function to the rest of it... I also was  unable to find any way to connect my Nexus tablet or such to the unit. even though it indicates some Casting ability..  but with no instruction.this ...again stymie  my actions.So now I need to do more searching to find out how to access that function......... again a simple instruction manual would have been a very welcomed addition.I am sure I will grow to love this player more and more over time but right now. it has limited access for my needs.. and as I stated before. It appears to be a work in progress. but I do trust Google and expect this to be a shiny example I would love in a few months.

This is a sm battery for the Battery in you cell phone. and In my opinion a absolute necessity if you travelI find these backup batteries to be a real comfort to me when I am out all day.. Always ready to give that extra boost to my rapidly draining cell phoneThe power charger is about the size of a sm handheld double flashlight.I comes w one  dual cord. one end is for a standard USB and the opposite end is  micro USBAfter opening package I promptly put it to charge as know they seldom come charged in the package.. The power cord is approx 10-12 inches  and I found once plugged in a multiple blue lights can be seen w the upper most one  blinking  Once fully charges all the blue lights disappear and are replace by RED lights.. After reading the instruction. it indicated a RED light would show when fully charged  . I used my Amazon long charging cord.It took several hours to fully charge the power bank.Otherwise.. the power cord fit into my cell phone.. but it should be noted its micro plug is a little Longer than normal.. No idea why. but just to be sure one is aware of this designIt promptly charged my cell with out any issue. which of course is why we would buy this product. harging from approx 30% to 100%  in approx 1 hr. It is light weight and easy to carry with you.I would have liked o see some sm cloth bag or such to carry both the charger ad power cords otherwise I have to devise something myself so they aren't flopping around on the bottom of my purse.My feeling is if you have a cell phone you NEED a back up power bank.. With this size battery I can get a full  charges out of it for my cell phone. but all phones vary.I like the unit and feel I will get some peace of mind carrying it with me on my travels. Depending on what you need  to power this unit would work well w a cell phone and might top off a sm tablet but  it won't fully  charge a tablet.This is a standard 5200 mAh charger.This product was provided to me for review.

Update #2 we have now had this unit for 6 months and we are still delighted.. the subtle sounds in the back ground and sounds that are emitted  out of the sides of the unit.  may viewing a  great  movie even MORE  fun... so happy to have this  unit in our home.UPDATE: #2..3 weeks later......... and I am enjoying this speaker system more and more.. I was recently watching a movie and I swear it sounded like total surround sound system........ the squeaky door to my left.......... the sounds of dry leaves being stepped on.my right........ A door bell rang and I could have sworn it was MY DOOR BELL.............. The sounds that come out of this unit are wonderful !! I am so delighted to have this sound bar ............ makes watching movies and TV and real experience.#1 ..well it is now 2 days later after install and I am HAPPIER than ever..Just in case you are wondering as I was.. I have a Amazon FIRE stick installed in the back of my tv. My TV is also a SMART tv w lots of apps.. with the OPTICAL cable install directly into the tv.. every thing WORKS>>>>>>>.. and works WELL...... I am more tickled than ever.SO HAPPY with this SOUND BAR !!!.................................................................................................................................I have been wanting to get a sound bar to improve my Samsung TV viewing in the living room. I tried another brand sound bar, Vizio .. and was very disappointed and returned it. So I was pretty certain I knew what I wanted in a sound bar from that bad experience.I was thrilled to have the opportunity to use the NEW to me . Orbitsound M9  SOUND BAR....... ...First thing right out of the Box,  you will NOTICE  that this isn't some wimpy unit just  by the weight of the sub woofer. It has a main unit has a nice sleek looks that will fit nicely to the side or below a tv. It is more the size of a shoebox vs a long skinny sound bar I have in  our family room that takes  up the whole front of the TV Well I found this Obitsound bar is a great unit that does everything I wanted  and MORE.. it even includes a Blue tooth connection so I can stream music from my tablet or phone.SET up right out of the box( which is usually the nightmare process most purchasers dread ) was SOOOOOOOOOO EASY even if you hardly read the direction you would get it right.. It  includes an Optical cable.( the preferred method of connection) and optional cables if you don't' have a optical access to your TV.  So it is one simple connection between the bar and the TV........ plug in subwoofer to the  distant wall plug ... turn on the power.>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Viola.. SOUND, sweet sweet SOUND>>>>>>>> and all the volume you could want. and Wonderful BASSThis set up was sooooooo nice as we have satellite TV and I was concerned that it wouldn't access  the unit. Now  I haven't found the way to control the sound using my satellite remote rather I need both the satellite and the Obitsound remote to manage my TV watching but it isn't a big deal.....Oh and the batteries were included in the REMOTE. .......Thank You.Now I tried out the various options adjustments to the treble and Bass using the REMOTE.......... EASY  and will get great ROOM FILLING EFFECTWell the PROOF is always in the performance.. well tuned into reg Network viewing which was nice and we  immediately noticed SOUNDS  that  weren't  evident w just using the TV speakers  i.e. squeaks of the door being opened  and  back grounds sounds...( like you hear in a reg Movie at the theater ).... but it wasn't until I turned on the FIRE TV and started playing some of the Trailers for the coming Movies. that the truly  Beautiful Sound came out of the Orbit......WOW.....  it nearly knocked me out with the quality of the SOUND....... let me tell you Frozen Never Sounded so GOOD.........!!!..Then turned on Les Miserable. Holy COW ! That HOOKED ME... I was a FAN. after hearing that music and voices..Then onto a SyFI movie and the monsters were right up CLOSE and PERSONAL they sounded like they were in the living room. !!There are adjustments you can make to the sub woofer which also is simple to do with clearly labeled knob on the back of the Unit  but I keep it on the ' NORMAL" setting. Now if it has a  negative it would be that I cannot use my bluetooth connection from the remote.. You have to go to the unit and hit the button..too connect to bluetooth unit..I also feel that a simple piece of added  directions would  have been helpful for the placement of the wireless speaker. ......i.e how far away from the main unit. or on the side of behind the viewer .......I also could find nothing about that on the Orbitsound website ( not all of us are experts ))Honestly  there isn't a better option for a sound bar IN MY OPINION.
