I like the magnetic part that keeps the headphones from slithering off my neck when I remove them from my ears. I really wanted to like these, they fit, look and the sound I could hear that was smooth, was great.It boils down to this, a fully charged set of headphones stuttered more than they played smoothly over a 15 minute test, giving me a headache. I do not recommend this model based on the product testing I was able to perform before a migraine began trying to push my eyes from my skull. Bear in mind that the product I receive might or might not be a good representation of the overall quality of a product. I could have been sent a perfect or an imperfect unit, you might receive a better or worse working unit and your experience might vary greatly from mine. I can only base my review on what arrived for me to try out. This set was a dud.I don't this is a case of "you get what you pay for", I think this is a case of not every set is going to be made perfectly. Some mistakes slip through. The problem is, if this was a set I paid full price for, and they showed up not working, would I pay to ship them back? What about the shipping money I would have lost if I didn't have Prime? I am sorry to the people who are down voting the helpfulness of this, and as always, I make the following offer to the seller.. Offer me a second pair that is fulfilled by Amazon (so I get the same headphones anyone else would receive when ordering) so that I can test the second set. This set is malfunctioning.

I was offered this bra to test and review. The following is my unbiased review based on product testing.The bra fits like a minimizer. My breasts were not cradled by the cups as I had hoped they would be. Instead, the cups are slightly smaller than they should be for a C cup. I am doubtful that a size up would have helped. The way the bra cups are shaped, this bra feels overall uncomfortable. My breasts felt compressed, and it wasn't because the fit was small, it was because of the shaping.Overall comfort of the bra was okay, but not fantastic. The left strap seemed to be sewn slightly off kilter. Adjusting did not help, it was positioned on my shoulder slightly too far off my arm, over my shoulder joint. It made for a very odd feel.I was going to wear the bra today to test how it held up and felt after a day's use, but I decided against it after trying it on and disliking the way it felt. It was not a flattering bra in feel or in comfort. I am guessing that I received one that flunked quality control as the other reviews appear to be positive.

I received this for free for testing. The following is my unbiased review based on testing this waist cincher.I consider a true corset to have lacing, this does not have lacing. The boning is lacking in stiffness, it flexes with my curves. I could feel it almost rolling up as I tried bending. The boning bends in half with no pressure. If you purchase it and are too large for it, it will most likely cause the boning to tear through the fabric.The first thing to note is this is latex, spandex and cotton. It smells of latex. Do not order this if you have or suspect you have (or your partner has) a latex allergy! The corset is heavy with the the fabric weight, this says it is four seasons, I wouldn't trust the breathibility of the fabric if you are prone to overheating.This is a decorative cincher that will not provide waist training. It will provide support to help keep your extra weight a bit flatter. Remember, the boning bends, it is not going to make your size 12 body resemble a size 8! It won't compress your body like a true corset or waist trainer. This is a body shaper garment.This is a longer line cincher, but with the bendable boning that can be good and bad. You could end up with destroyed or rolling boning if you purchase a size that is too small for you. Order your true waist size, not what you are hoping to achieve.This product is a good piece of shape wear. Have patience and work up to wearing it for longer than an hour or two at a time at first. It can cause a back ache if you normally slouch. If you cannot wear a girdle, this will be uncomfortable also. Use common sense when you purchase.If you must have stiff or are a plus sized lady, spend the extra at a custom shop to purchase a corset. If you are looking for a photo shoot costume, fantasy play or a way to make a pretty dress fit more smoothly, this will fit the bill

I received these changing pad liners for free or at a deep discount. The following is my unbiased and honest review based on having tested the liners.I have never used this type of liner before. I have always used thin receiving blankets or cloth diapers. I didn't realize I was missing out by not investigating this type of liner before.These liners are nice. I like the fact that despite the waterproof backing, there is no plastic smell. I am very sensitive to odors and these arrived fragrance free! I like the bamboo being used,  bamboo can make a great fabric.The liners are thin enough to be used in several different ways. They are thin enough to be tossed a diaper bag or even rolled up and put in the glove box. They can be used as a bib for an older child, or used as a place mat. I hesitate to mention it, but I used one this weekend as a liner for a cat carrier for a young kitten. (It worked great to keep food contained! Kittens walk and crawl in their food dishes!)These liners clean up fast, no stains, not even stains from the squash baby food that dripped on, and was left on over night in the diaper bag. It came out with a wash, no bleach or stain removers needed!The liners are soft to the touch, absorbent and handy to keep around. They are large enough to place a child on them for changing, even for those "maybe we better just wash the kid down outside with a hose" messes.Five stars for versatility.

This was sent free for evaluation. The following is my unbiased review.This is a dual sided grinder. It arrived in a plain unmarked box. No directions were included, but I was able to find directions by searching on line. Annoying because I had no idea how to fill it.This opens on each end by unscrewing it. One side can be filled with salt and the other with pepper or two kinds of pepper if you prefer. The grinding attachment is adjustable and it takes a small twist to adjust.This is an inexpensive grinder and the grinding parts are inexpensive. It will grind your pepper or salt for a year or two before it needs replacing.The one flaw I see is that it is a pain to have to pop the end caps off and put them back on after grinding. I would prefer these were not needed, but it does keep the counter and the grinding apparatus clean by leaving them on.

I was offered this set of headphones for free to test and review. The following is my initial review after testing the item out, my review is unbiased and reflects my honest opinion. This and all my reviews are subject to be changed if my opinion changes or the device has issues at any time during testing.The first thing I am going to say is that I am waffling between a three and a four star review due to functionality. Let me explain my reasoning. These headphones are designed to fasten around my neck like a circle. That's okay, I don't mind that part. That keeps them from getting lost, too many headsets slide off when out of the ears, this is a bonus. The neck cord does not flop around too much for power walking or jogging.The buttons are in an awkward spot on the cord. There is a way to pause the music or sound, but the buttons are small and hard for cold fingers to find. Or I have to miss a few seconds of audio book to remove them from my ears and click them together. I am not impressed with that. Finding the volume control buttons is also awkward, it requires me to stop walking to find them.The sound is clear and crisp for music and other audio. Bass is moderately good. Not as strong as it could be, but not limp either. Skipping happened around once per hour for 10-30 seconds at a time. The skipping increased as the battery wore down. (Expected.) I was able to listen to music for 7 hours and 20 minutes before the battery died. I was able to wander into another room and the headset kept connection.These headphones do not have "bleed through noise." On high, with the headphones hanging around my neck but not clicked together, I cannot hear the sound. That means no one else will be able to hear my music either when they are in my ears, even if (and I don't) I choose to listen at top volume. It means that if you like loud music, no one on the bus or subway will be listening along with you. This is a bonus.The directions for using the headphones are mostly clear and easy to read. Everything is broken down and is in decent though not perfect English. The only thing that is not made clear is the warranty period.The headphones are not as comfortable or as easy to use as I was hoping. The buttons need to be made slightly larger and the commands for use need to be made easier. Pushing the multi function button to pair the device, turn it on, turn it off, etc... is not easy to use while around my neck. Granted, it is slightly easier than if the buttons were on the earpieces vs. hanging slightly down on the cord, but it would be easier if it were lower on the cord.The microphone is in the same spot as the buttons and I found that people were having trouble hearing me properly. I gave up after two calls and placed my phone against my ear.  Persons on the other end said they were getting wind noise and background noises, and said that my voice was cutting in and out. I could hear them without a problem. I tried calling from inside but apparently my voice was still not as clear. That means that for me, as a blue tooth calling device, this headset is useless for business calls. For casual or brief calls where I ask the client to hold momentarily while I switch off blue tooth will work. I am often outside and need a good quality headset for speaking to clients, this one is not going to work for that.All in all, these have a few more cons than pros for me. These are going to be tested for the next two weeks but then will be passed on to someone who is not as picky as myself. I wish I could leave a better review for the first review written on these headphones, but I write honest reviews because I do not ever want someone to buy something that doesn't work as hoped.For music and audio listening, these are a 4. For phone use, they are a 3. I cannot give this set a solid 4 in good conscience.

This backpack was given to me for free to test and evaluate the usability of it. The following is my unbiased review after testing the backpack.I received the color â€œnew blackâ€.  The pack arrived in a plastic zip lock bag, and was zipped into a â€œbackpackâ€ looking shape. There is a small handle for carrying or to clip it to my luggage, bike rack, etc.This backpack is rated at four stars because of the following bonuses I found when examining the pack.*Several pockets and places to stash goods. There are two mesh side pockets. There is a front zipper pocket, a main compartment and a small pocket inside the main compartment.*The bag is well sewn together. I found no loose threads, no missed stitches. Everything was sewn properly, and will hold up.*The bag is light weight. This makes it easy to stow and carry with me before use. It can be packed into a suitcase or thrown in the back of the car for day trips.The straps are lightly padded, they wonâ€™t protect against a heavily filled pack, but this pack is not designed to stuff full of heavy objects. I will not be using it to carry more than 10 pounds of stuff, whatever that stuff might be.The zippers are all working, none are jamming. They should hold up to handling.All in all, it is a good light use pack that can be taken along on trips, or used for errands. I love bags that fold up, it makes it easy to grab them when going on tourist excursions or day hikes.

Offered this bracelet for free, I instead accepted free shipping and paid full price for the bracelet. The following is my unbiased opinion.This is not the same bracelet as is pictured. These beads are either smaller or the cable length is far longer. There is at least 1.5 inches of bare cable. There is the exact amount of beads shown in the picture and in the description, minus any gold beads. (They meant silver.)There are six beads on one side, the heart in the "center", and seven beads on the other side. They should make the sides even in amount. People who need symmetrical objects will be annoyed.The beads are beautiful but the overall look is not as shown, the colors are pink vs red & pink, which is fine, but the vast amount of bare cable is displeasing. I am not happy with the look. The beads are beautiful but marred by the overall look. This length of cable needs more beads to make it look completed. Now, it looks as if they ran out of beads.The lack does show even when on my wrist. This is a beautiful bracelet that needs extra beads, the larger bracelets must look even more bare.The latch closes firmly and is not easily bumped open. The safety chain will keep the bracelet from slipping off by accident. This could be a fantastic gift by adding a few more beads. Or slightly larger beads.

I was offered this backpack mat bag for free from Gecko Active to try and evaluate. The following is my unbiased review based on trying out the bag.Update: This has become my new favorite bag. I love all the pockets! I can organize everything neatly!The bag is very impressive. It is a well made backpack, made from heavyweight material. The bag feels substantial when hefted before it is filled. I carefully checked all of the stitching points and found it to be correctly sewn with no sloppy stitching. The backpack passed their quality control checks with flying colors. All zippers function smoothly without catching on fabric or snagging on themselves.The straps that hold my yoga mat or even my rolled jacket, are easy to fasten snuggly without being too tight so that my mat has marks. I was concerned about that at first, wary that the straps might compress my mat too much, but that was not an issue.The main compartment of the backpack is ample and sized to fit many different things. I can fit a spare change of clothes and shoes, to be able to change out of my work out gear if I desire. I liked that my stuff did not feel crammed inside.The outer pocket is almost large enough for my walking shoes for after class, I could make them fit by not zipping it all the way closed. The smaller zipper pocket will hold my cell phone and a wallet plus my keys nicely.The cross body strap is ideal, I do not feel choked and my neck is not being rubbed against, this is a problem with some cross body bags. It was easy to adjust to fit me.This is a very well made backpack and I can see that it has many other uses besides a yoga bag.

I was offered this set for free. The following is my unbiased opinion based on trying the shampoo and conditioner as labeled.The shampoo and conditioner both have light fragrances that have almost a honeysuckle scent to them. I found the smell to be pleasing.The shampoo was great. It lathers, it felt as if my hair was well washed after using it. I had no complaints in this department. The shampoo is worth using. I would give the shampoo 5 stars.The conditioner is the problem. I used the conditioner, leaving it on for five minutes and using a copious amount of it as my hair tends to tangle depending on the type of conditioner. It rinsed out entirely. The problem was, my hair tangled as if it was felted wool. I had to spend nearly twenty minutes detangling my hair, normally this is a three minute process of simply combing out the tangles. After using the conditioner, my hair was a mass of snarls. I combed it out and the next day it was tangled just as badly. I will never use this conditioner again.The good side of the combo was that my hair had no fly away pieces and looked shiny. The bad side was the tangles. I cannot use a combo that is going to leave my hair in snarls.

I have been using MidNite for several years. For the most part it works and helps me drift off to sleep.There are some nights where my own brain will not turn off, those night, nothing helps other than prescription anti-anxiety or other prescription medication to turn off my brain. I have learned the difference and can take what I need to help me sleep.With MidNite, as promised, there is no problem with next day drowsiness. I wake up and feel as if I slept. No drugged feeling, no sluggish morning (unless I waited until 1 am to take it and wake as usual at 4 am)The pills are lightly flavored, nothing heavy to stimulate my taste buds or set off my heart burn. They dissolve and are gone quickly when I put them in my mouth.

I was offered this door stop for free for product testing and evaluation. The following is my unbiased review after testing the product.This door stop has grip. The rubber pieces go all the way around the door stop so that it can be used on either side. The rubber grips the tile and kept my door from slamming closed. I was skeptical due to the light weight, but it held fast and did not allow the door to slam shut. This does the job and is not ugly. The rubber will keep the metal from scratching my floor. (Metal is rounded and not sharp.)The lack of a star is for quality control problems. The rubber was cut sloppily, there are several jagged pieces not removed from the straps. This is petty, but I feel items shouldn't be sent out looking less than perfect. Either sell slightly imperfect ones at a discount or return them to the manufacture for replacement. If no one speaks up, the assembly line won't slow down long enough to ensure perfect specimens are being sent off. The scraps left behind do not affect anything except aesthetics, but aesthetics are important also. Yes, even for a door stop. The second issue with aesthetics is one of the rubber pieces is placed on slightly crooked. Again, yes, it matters because a product put together in a sloppy way makes me wonder if it will hold up long term, or if the metal quality was skimped on.

This quick charge USB cable and plug was sent to me for free to evaluate. The following is my unbiased review based on testing the unit.This seems to be working great. The plug itself is a slim-line plug so it fits into power strips without taking up two or three spaces, that is a major bonus as I dislike plugs that are bulky.The USB cable works great with my Samsung S3 and S6. There were no problems with either phone. Both of my phones charged as quickly as they normally charge, and they charged without the dreaded errors. I also tested the cable in a few other devices, including a Bluetooth headset, a set of headphones and a small night light that all use the same adapter. Again, no problems, the cable charged all devices.As with all of my reviews, I base my review on the sample provided to me and not on what the manufacture claims it can do. I test all products and leave them in testing for several months to ensure that the product working was not a one week fluke as items do fail. When they fail, I return to my original review and update. (I also try to leave updates if the product is still working as expected.)

I was offered this bike pump for free to evaluate.Sadly, the pump is being given the "it's okay" rating of three stars. This is not a horrible rating, but it does mean that I found a few issues with it while testing it.This is made of alloy aluminum so it is very lightweight. It is a compact size as well. These two things combined to mean that it isn't perfect. It takes quite a bit of pumping to get the tire pumped up. It also takes a bit of effort to make the seal tight enough to actually pump up the tire vs letting all of the air out of it. Once everything is connected properly, the pumping must begin.I am used to larger more efficient pumps. This is not one of those, this is a small pump that will allow you to add a small bit of air to an under-inflated tire. This took me 10 minutes to connect and pump up an inner tube. I felt as if I were trying to blow up the Goodyear Airship for all of the effort it took.This bike pump looks great and it very light, but for function, it isn't as good as I hoped. It will pump up the tire once you get it connected correctly, but it takes more effort than I expected.

This bra was sent to me for testing and evaluation. The following is my unbiased review.I fall within the range of the XL 36ABC cups so I ordered this size. I was worried after seeing that others said it would not fit.This bra fits my 36C body fasten in the tightest loops. The support is non-underwire, but it works well for support. I am not sagging. The cups provide full coverage of my breasts without them bulging out the top or under the sides. The overall feel is comfortable.This bra is true to color, the dark blue and the polka dots are very cute. I did not find the lace to be scratchy at all. It is soft and did not show through my thinner shirts.There is an extra extension included with the bra so that in case it did not fit, this would add an extra inch to the bra band. Thankfully, I do not need the extension.The bra cups are made with enough padding to keep cold nipples out of site and there are places to slide in absorbent pads if those are needed.This is a cute bra, it's not a "sexy" bra overall, but it is a good looking bra without the matronly looking of many nursing bras on the market. The polka dots and dark color make it just flirty enough to be fun, though the dark color means it needs to be worn under darker shirts to prevent show through. (Needs to be said, I see many women who don't think to look at their bra being on display under their light colored shirts.)

I was offered this lock for free to evaluate. The following is my unbiased review after trying out the item.The first thing that struck me as hysterical about this lock is that it arrived with the keys firmly attached to the hasp. I had to remove one key from the split ring in order to open the lock. Seems to be a silly way to ship keys, and I have not purchase a padlock of any type where the keys were attached like this.The padlock itself is obviously not for use in locking up anything of value as it shows the pins inside. Anyone with a bit of lock picking skill could pick it. (That being the point.)The lock is easy to use and rather fun to practice on. The biggest problem is that the lock opens so fast, it is a blur of motion. When the pins are exactly right, it's open in a flash. I would have liked to be able to see the lock open in slow motion so that I could watch it in action more precisely. That would make it easier for a beginner to learn.This lock is well made and seems to be durable. It is going to be fun to learn the craft of picking a padlock just for the heck of doing it.

Product recieved for free with understanding that I would evaluate. The following is my unbiased review.This supplement is very well made. It is what I look for when I seek out turmeric, it is 500mg curcumin.These pills have worked well for me as an anti-inflammatory as I hoped they would. I will not make my claims here as this not allowed. They do work for me and that is the main thing.The one thing I will note about properly made supplements is they give me heartburn. My stomach dislikes it and that is the first clue I took high quality turmeric vs something that won't work as well.These pills have no taste, strong but not overpowering smell, only a touch of aftertaste due to my heartburn that results. These pills are providing the anti- inflammatory response I was hoping for. The lowered inflammation equals less soreness for me. It is a noticeable difference and I put up with the mild heartburn to reap the benefits.

Recieved for free to test and evaluate.Quality control overlooked a flaw. The back right strap is missing half of the reflective stripe. It is a very obvious mistake. The box arrived opened and the item seemed to be stuffed back in tangled up.The rating of okay is given because the best will work despite the missing reflective stripe. The buckle is easy to use and study.It literally took seconds to adjust the sizing to fit. That is a bonus.other than the obvious quality control check miss, the straps are durable and well sewn. There are several Un-clipped threads noticed on all the stitching. It makes for added head shaking at the lack of quality control.

Given this product for free or nex to free for trial. The following is my unbiased review.I am not impressed. The first bag arrived crumbled. The replacement was just as bad. These are supposed to be dosed "X number of treats" but there is no standard sized treats.These are getting an okay label because the treats do not have a foul odor, and the dog did eat the one I offered. Both of those count, a bacon flavored treat could smell like carcass, these treats thankfully do not.They are useless as crumbs. I have no real idea how much to give as over the top of food dressing since feeding as a whole treat doesn't work. Even the whole treats were mostly crumbled and all different sizes.I vote no. My dog voted yes with his enthusiasm for the taste, but for now, I am holding off adding these to the must have list. They need to be properly sized and shipped correctly.

I received this item for free from the vendor for product testing. When the grater arrived, I examined it, tried it, then gave it to my cousin who is a chef to try out.This is the combined opinion from both of us. The grater is a great one.The grater has several small extras that many other graters do not. This one is all metal. All stainless steel means it is less prone to rust and less prone to breakage. (Why do they sell plastic graters? Graters are pushed on and abused!)This grater has a good handle for pressing down on and helping to hold it steady. The rubber bumper on the bottom keeps the grater from sliding across the counter. It also helps to keep scratches off my cousin's marble countertop. (He says he is "a man and he doesn't always have time to grab a cutting board.") The non skid is especially useful for me because it means it stays where I am holding it. Having a grater slipping around means that I put my hands at risk for being grated.This grater has one flaw in my opinion. I prefer a smaller zesting side and a wider small holed grater. I tend to use the small grater more than the large or the zester side. The sides are ample and I have no problem grating on the smaller side, but it seems out of place. I am nit picking to be sure, but my brain wants the small grater on the larger side instead of the zester.All in all, despite my perceived flawed placement of the small grater holes, this is a grater that is a must have for a kitchen.

I was offered these nipple clamps for free, but declined the code and paid the asking price for them. Why? Because I felt like doing so.I am going to get the con out of the way first. The chain in the center is not quite long enough, it should be a bit longer so that the center of the chain can be placed in the bottom's mouth to give a bit of an extra tugging sensation if wanted. Nit picking, I know, but it should be a few inches longer.These are not a high class set of clamps, they are not meant to be, hence the term "beginner". They can be adjusted to make them tighter or looser which is important for those who are just starting out. The clamps can be made moderately tight, true masochists will want them tighter, but for beginners, it is important to start lighter. Too tight can turn a bottom off of nipple play in a hurry if they do not have a good pain tolerance. We call that breaking our toys and it's not a good idea. (It can also get you thrown in jail, play safely and sanely, if both of you are not saying yes, it's no longer consensual. I don't give a darn what they print in books like Shades of Gray. Consent is a MUST, period.)These have padded rubber on them that helps to alleviate the "bite" or "pinch" somewhat. The tightest is still not as tight as other types of clamps which is good for beginners.They are an inexpensive set as expected by the price, but still are quite nice and for the amount of use a beginner will be giving them, they will hold  up nicely. They are metal but light weight. (Needs to be light weight for beginners or there would be too much of a tug against the nipples.) If heavier clamping/more weight is desired, the person can move up to a better quality set.One other minor flaw to note is that they are for small nipples, not the nipples found on larger breasts that are larger than a lady's pinky nail. For bigger nipples and a beginner, the clamp must be placed slightly behind so that they do not pinch unmercifully.

I received this item for free to test out and evaluate. I have no prior connection with the company, and was not coerced into any type of review.Not very sexy, a shower hose, I know. But needed because who can feel sexy when they aren't clean. (Okay, I guess some of you are into that.)This hose comes with just what I needed to hook it up. Gaskets are included, I just needed a roll of plummer's tape. (I actually didn't even need that, this hose fit correctly with no places spraying water around the threads, but after initial testing, I reinstalled it with plummer's tape as I was taught that this is the correct method of installing shower hoses.)This hose is properly threaded so the water actually goes through the hose, not out the threads. The hose holds securely and screwed in place without cross-threading. The hose allows for good pressure but also have enough space that I could add a flow restrictor (CA drought) before screwing on the shower head.This hose does not tangle easily which is a bonus, and it seems as if it will hold up to lots of showers, dog washing (Boxer won't fit in the laundry sink) and is long enough to use to rinse the shower and tub or wash my hair.All in all, it is a good hose and I am hopeful that it will last.

I received this hand held sprayer nozzle for free to test and evaluate. The following is my unbiased review.I truly enjoy being able to write honestly good reviews. I try to only accept items that I can use. This is something I have needed for the laundry room sink for a while. I decided to agree to accept it, after all, if it turned out to be junk, I could toss it in the trash.It is not junk. This little sprayer is great! I am a happy girl to have it attached to my sink. (I rigged up a dual attachment so that this is attached to one side with a hose and the other is free to use as a regular faucet. My garage is dark and cluttered as are most garages so I didn't take a picture.)This sprayer has more power than I expected it to have. There are two modes, one is press on the handle for short use or for washing the Chihuahua, leave it in "always on" mode. (Got to, the Chihuahua is like washing three angry badgers at the same time, I need extra hands to wash him.) I can now use my laundry sink for good rinsing of dogs or delicates.I can also wash the sink properly. My sink functions as the washer drain which means that there is a lot of dirt and who knows what else going into the that sink. I like clean sinks. With this attached to a short hose, I can now rinse the entire deep sink after scrubbing it out with my magic blue cleaner. I was rinsing it before with a small bucket, which was a pain in the neck.This is a plastic gadget that seems to be sturdy enough (ignoring the tooth marks from the angry dog) and it has enough pressure to rinse sinks, dogs or delicates without blasting the skin or lace off any of the above. I am happy with this little sprayer. My only small complaint is that it is a bit small for male hands and is more suited towards smaller hands.

I was given this shower head for free to test the quality. The following is my unbiased review.This shower head is plastic. That doesn't worry me because the shower head I am replacing is plastic, it lasted for years.  I am not sorry to say that I slammed this Purelux model around a bit to see if it broke easily before I installed it. I drop things, this is going to bang on the tub, smack against the tile, get grabbed by the dog while he is being washed, it has to hold up! It passed my dropping tests, no dings. Drop test passed, I installed it.This has power! My long hair needs pressure and this shower head provides it. I was able to wash my hair without standing there for five minutes rinsing. The massage feature is nice, and it is easy to change between them or go half/half. My roommate was impressed. He said that there is enough pressure that he only needs to turn the water half on to get the same pressure as the other shower head. (Not me, I use it full pressure. I have long hair, I need pressure! It's why I replaced my old shower head, the mineral deposits were building up.)This is a good shower head for my needs. It is plastic, but I am not living in a picture perfect home, so I do not mind like some would. This has good pressure and was easy to install. Those were the things that mattered to me, not the name brand or a metal shower head. Function and cost efficient is more important. I have used some of those uber expensive shower heads at friend's houses and haven't been impressed with the pressure. Sure, they look gorgeous but this shower head spiffs up with a microfiber towel, vs fighting the water spots and fingerprints on the fancy metal ones.The shower head spigots/nozzles (? what are the spots where the water comes out called?) are easy to rub minerals off so that they do not build up on the head, stopping the flow and the wonderful pressure.

I received these bulbs for free to test them out. I tried them in a desk lamp, the following is my unbiased review.I wish I could say "they are light bulbs, how hard is it to review? Who cares about a light bulb review?" I care.Light bulbs are supposed to work as promised and I would be angry if I purchased a dud set. Thankfully this set is not a dud.I tested each and every bulb. Yes, really, I did. I had to make sure that the first and second bulb were not a fluke. Every bulb in the batch worked as promised.The light is clear and free from shadows. (Seriously, I have tried bulbs that cast odd shadows due to bubbles in the glass!) I do not have a watt tester to ensure that the wattage listed is spot on, but I will say that the bulbs cast the light I expected for a non led 20 watt bulb. These were tested in a desk lamp.The product says they will last for 20 years. I am not sure if this is true or not, I did not receive them 20 years ago. I have had one of the bulbs in use for 12 hour days for 3 weeks, not close to 20 years, but a good test for me to say that the bulbs are lasting as I expected them to last. They are at least not burning out after one or two days or even after two weeks of steady use.These bulbs only fit in sockets that have pins. They do not fit in any other socket. Be sure you are purchasing the correct replacement bulb.

I received this item for free to test and evaluate. The following is an unbiased review from a newbie to yoga and straps.The straps arrived. I looked at them dubiously. I did not see a PDF with instructions, nor did I receive one. I was baffled regarding how to use these straps.Off I went to the Internet for guidance because I was not going to ask a yoga guru what must be a newbie question. Information was granted. Armed with my new knowledge, I began to use the straps.Here are my thoughts about the straps, coming from the perspective of a newbie. The straps are soft enough to use without chafing my skin and are comfortable to hold. They made it easier to stretch while following the instructions on the webpage I found.The straps are very well made, the stitching is firm and they appear to be made from good quality fabric. I don't think they are going to fall apart anytime soon.The downfall to these straps is the buckles! These buckles are hard to use. I gave up trying to use the buckles, it shouldn't be as frustrating as it is to buckle them. This is why I downgraded them from a 4 to a 3. The buckles being hard to use are keeping me from being able to fully use the straps.I am going to be looking around for a set of straps that have easier to use buckles. These straps are good for helping me stretch, but are not good for cinching. Hats off to those with patience to fasten them, I am not going to take my time to fuss with the buckles.

I was offered the WineCubby free to evaluate and test out. The following is what I found when I tested it.This is an interesting item. It is one of those things that at first glance, you think "Why?" Then, as I began to look at it and think about it, I realized why.This consists of three parts. There is a teeny funnel that is amply large enough to use for transferring a bottle of wine into the cubby. There is the cubby that has a screw top to keep the wine inside the bag. There is also a bag that is designed to go around the cubby.Let's talk semantics for a minute. Pour the wine into the bag.. Sounds easy enough, right? Nope. Add me, a klutz of the first order. Trying to hold the bag, hold the bottle and manage to pour wine into the funnel should have been videotaped. Thankfully, I know that I am less than graceful and I set the cubby in the sink for filling. After I poured about half a cup of wine down the drain, I put the wine cubby in a tall vase for support. Now I could hold the funnel in one hand, the wine bottle in the other and not make a mess. Filled bag. Done.The outer bag has a very inexpensive zip-lock type of fastener. Air can be squeezed out while it is properly closed. I won't be relying on this to keep any spilled wine inside, so I am not going to use it. It needs an upgrade to make it easier to seal and needs to seal properly. I do not expect it to last more than a few uses, the seal reminds me of the dollar store storage bags. It's not really that important for the overall function of the WineCubby.The uses... Wine, water, juice or even mixed drinks that do not need chilling. This can be taken places where glass is not allowed or wanted, such as around the swimming pool or at the beach. It can be taken on picnics, backpacking or packing by horse/mule back. The only real limit is your imagination. Real wine aficionados will want to skip it because half the point of expensive wine is uncorking, inspecting the cork, verifying the name on the bottle. If you don't care about that, and just wish to carry your favorite wine along, this is an option.There is a bit of a bonus here as well. Use an aerator to put your wine into the bottle and presto, you have wine that has breathed and is ready to go when you arrive at your destination. (Don't leave it packed for days and it will be fine.)As you can probably tell, I do not drink bottles of wine that cost more than $50 or I wouldn't be agreeing to cart it around in this WineCubby. I am above Two Buck Chuck and Wine in a Bag (wait, THIS is wine in a bag!) but not in the 25+ year old exclusive stuff either. This WineCubby will suit my needs fine and goes nicely with my set of silicone wine glasses. It can travel to the lake and bounce inside a cooler strapped to a jetski on the way to the distant shore. (Yep, I tested it!)

I received this digital scale for free to evaluate. The following is my unbiased review after testing the scale.This scale is typical of most sold. The directions state that it is not a medical grade scale. It also says not place more then 11 pounds on it.This scale is easy to read and easy to use. I was able to quickly cycle through the different displays to find the measurement I wanted. (grams, ounces, pounds, and even cups and milliliters if I want to measure liquid.)As a person who is beginning to get into bread making, measurements are vital. Until I began weighing flour, sugar, etc, I had no idea that one cup could be so different in weight. Or that an egg's volume actually makes a major difference in the way a recipe turns out!This scale is large enough to hold my mixing bowl or measuring cups securely so that I can measure my ingredients. I didn't realize that size matters with digital scales until I began testing this one out. My bowls are not balanced on a surface that is better sized for weighing letters than items inside bowls.This scale is easy to tare out so that I only measure my ingredients, not the bowl also. (Amazing how much a plastic bowl weighs and how much of a difference being off by just that much under the amount of flour will matter.)The biggest flaw I can find is due to its size it is hard to find a place to store it. I have a gourmet cooking brain, forced to work in a condo sized kitchen. Storage cannot be under anything and it cannot be stored on its side. I finally decided to store it on top of the fridge. This is too nice a scale to give up!

I was sent this wallet for free to evaluate. The following is my unbiased review.The wallet arrived. I opened it and looked it over. The first thing I noticed about the wallet was that there was residue on a half inch section from something, perhaps a price or quality control tag. I was able to clean this off using a small drop of leather cleaner.The inside of this wallet case has lots of pockets and space inside. It easily held my phone. The one thing I really dislike and that would keep me from using it, is the wallet does not unzip so that I can open it completely. It is built so that it opens and I can look inside, like an accordion folder, it does not open and lay flat like a file folder. It would be more useful to me if it opened flat. Other people might not care, I mention it for those who do care.This leather is thankfully tanned correctly, there is no foul odor as there sometimes is when improperly tanned leather is used.. It is a pretty wallet and the bright pink color is uniform with no dull patches or odd marks.It is a good wallet, though I was less than pleased with the sticky substance on it. This tells me that at least this one wallet skipped proper quality control checks.

I was given this "camping lamp" for free to evaluate and review. This is my unbiased and likely unpopular opinion of this lamp after testing it.UPDATE: 11/8/15 my handyman took it. He was greatly impressed with it. He said it was perfect for using in dark corners and it provided enough light. He didn't mind the design.First mark against it, a lack of directions. This package doesn't even say what it does or should do. There is a panel that says "levels". The levels are Normal, Dim, Bright, Supernova and Blinking Flash.I surmised by the included cable that this is charged via a USB cable. There is a red light that comes on while it is being charged. The red light goes steady when it is charged is my assumption.The light comes from the side vs from the end as a flash light would. This struck me as odd but I do note that the light is not prone to rolling around. when I set it down, it stays with the lighted side pointing in the direction I place it.The "normal" light is not very bright at all, like a dim nightlight. The dim is even dimmer. Each click of the switch makes it brighter and brighter, then it turns into a blinking light.The side panel shows that it can be used for camping, hiking, bicycling, fishing, reading, walking at night, "inside the house" (picture of a house at night) and for working on the car. Reality is, this light would be okay to help change a tire, as an emergency light inside a house and for inside a tent camping.It is not a flashlight, it isn't bright enough to use on a moonless or partial moon night and it turns itself off after being on for around 20 minutes or so. I am unsure how it would work under the hood of a car, unless you attached a tiny cord through the little bitty holes. It might work as a reading light, but I am not sure that it is going to be fantastic at that, it would bother anyone sleeping beside you as the light is not focused enough. If you carry it in your hand, it is easy to cover up the light bar. It simply is not for walking except perhaps in an emergency situation.It has a few specialized uses, and is not nearly as versatile as the package proclaims it is. All in all, despite it being well put together, I do not find any real uses for it other than as a temporary light to use in the event of a blackout.

I offered this for free to evaluate and test out. The following is my unbiased review.This arrived and I was surprised to see that it was longer than I expected. It has netting on both sides for air flow.The packing cube is well sewn. The zipper works just as I expected for them to work, with no snagging. It is smooth and does not catch on anyting when opened or closed. Tugging on the sides and overstuffing the cube did not cause the zipper to hitch nor did the zipper separate.There are no loose threads and the workmanship seems to be good. If you do not use packing cubes, you are missing the helpfulness of them. I find that by using them, I can do several things at once. I can separate certain types of clothes from others. Undergarments or socks that would normally manage to drift to the bottom my suitcase will stay where they are easily reached. It can also be used to stow electronics inside so that they are easily corralled in my case, again, not drifting between folds of clothes when my luggage is tossed about on conveyers. One more thing that is nice about packing cubes is that it can help keep my clothes from becoming too wrinkled to wear. My clothes are kept in the neatly folded stacks that I place them in, vs sagging to the bottom of the bag when the bag is placed upright for dragging through the airport and hotel corridors.I used to scoff at packing cubes until a friend used them to pack for a trip and I did not. Her suitcase and belongings were neat and tidy when we arrived. My belongings looked as it a weasel had been playing in my bag during the journey.The sample provided to me of this slim packing cube was a very good one. I am pleased with it and will be using this for my upcoming vacation days.

I was sent these sliding door locks for free to test and evaluate.Do they work? Yes, moderately well. They are child resistant, not childproof. Here is my unbiased assessment of this product.They arrive in a package that is translated from another language into English. This renders the directions impossible to follow, you must use your own instincts to install these gadgets.Installation consists of peeling off the protective covering from a piece of strong double sided sticky tape. You then place this close to the place where the doors overlap. By popping the latch into a triangle position, you keep the overlapping door from opening. The latch stops it. To open the door, you gently pop it out of the triangle position and slide the door over it. You must make sure before installation that there is enough space for the overlapping door to slide over the flattened latch. (Otherwise, if you want to open the doors, you must pry the double sided sticky tape off and remove the latch from the door. Test for clearance before sticking it down.)This should not be used instead of another form of break in proof fastening for sliding windows or doors. This is not an overly secure latch, a good jostle can open it. I will take great care if I use it on furniture that could have the finish or paint damaged as this is not easily removed. It will likely pull paint off when I take it off.If you are looking for something to keep a supervised child from using sliding doors or windows, to keep fingers from being smashed or even broken in the overlap, this will work. If you are looking to prevent break-ins or to keep medications/poisons from being accessed by toddlers, rambunctious puppy or extra smart cat, these should not be trusted.  These are for making the cupboards child resistant, not inaccessible.They are made well enough to prevent casual access, but a determined child/puppy/cat/thief could open this with enough shoving and wiggling, these latches do not hold up to stress or strong jolts.

This book needs editing. Beat to required smoothness means nothing when telling how to make cheesecake.Ingredients are left out of directions. Several recipes skip explaining where to add a listed ingredient. That is frustrating when combined with no pictures or descriptions, the reader is left wondering where to add the strawberries or Oreos and whipped cream, or whatever.Mug recipes give no hints for how to cook in a mug, what size mug to use, what mug types to avoid.A good edit and some basic directions that are complete would help. These recipes look yum. A few tips would help. Explain cheesecake batter smoothness, etc.

This was given to me for free to evaluate and test. The following is my unbiased review after testing the mouse.This mouse works using Bluetooth. This means that either the device needs to have Bluetooth or there needs to be a Bluetooth adapter/dongle to make it function. The mouse paired quickly with my laptop. No problems there.The mouse fits my hand nicely, that was a bonus. Now for the bad news. The mouse action is very jerky. I went into my settings and changed the mouse setting to try to make if function more smoothly, but it didn't help. I tried a new battery in case it was a malfunctioning battery. Twice it stopped talking to the Bluetooth. I had to restart it. I finally gave up and put this mouse back in it's box.I might have received a poor sample, I can only base my review on the sample provided to me for review, not on what the description claims it will do or should do. I will retest if a working sample is sent to me. Technically, it does work, and it fits my hand nicely. I wish it were not so jerky. I was able to get my work done, but it was frustrating.

I was offered this small 12-LED UV light for free. The following is my unbiased review.This light is not quite strong enough to use except in a very dimly lit room. Total darkness is best for using this light to make sure that everything is found.Speaking of everything being found, what I found was horrifying. My carpet next to the washer is disgusting. I am including a picture of the carpet with and without the light. The carpet has mild stains that are visible, but with the light, they pop out in color. The carpet cleaner has been called to help. I am going to have a talk with the housekeeper. I believe these stains are dripped detergent or other cleaning products. I will be putting a small throw rug there to catch future drips. What looks like mildew in the unlit picture is not glowing.I also found the source of the cat urine smell, a chair was doused according to this light. I will ask the carpet cleaner to clean the chairs also while he is here.The other thing these lights can be used for and another reason why I like having one at home, is some forms of ringworm and fungus luminesce. It isn't fool proof, but pets with ringworm need to be quarantined (all should be quarantined for 14-21 days when entering new house, no matter what) and extra precautions must be taken to prevent humans or other pets getting it. With this light, it is easy to quickly scan a pet for glowing and catch some of the problems ahead of time.It can be used to find the spray marks from cats on walls. (Males and females can spray! Altering does not always stop the problem.) It is hard to clean up what you cannot find. I had one piggy cat who was too lazy to find the box all the time.Going out to a club? Use this light in a dark room with a mirror to spot check yourself. Some clothes don't work under black lights, find out before you leave for the club.

I was offered this iPhone 6 case by Rinker to test and evaluate. The following is my unbiased review.This case is a scratch resistant case for the body of the phone. It is not drop protection, or at least not what I consider "drop protection". It will protect it from scratches and minor dings. That will protect the resale value by keeping the case looking pristine.The case is a pretty color and it looks to be the same color I saw on my monitor. I love that it allows my hand to grip the phone without feeling as if I am going to drop the phone. The buttons and camera cut outs fit neatly around the phone without gaps or overlap. It was made with care.

This unit was provided free to me via promotional coupon. The following is my unbiased review.Thermometers are like potato chips, you need more than one. When I was offered this one, I agreed quickly. Thermometers have a tendency to be sent home with ailing friends or in the case of my household, get used on a critter. There have been days where I could find three in the pet first aid drawer but none in the people shelf. For some reason the family feels perfectly okay snatching the human thermometer from the bathroom but don't reverse them. (All pet ones are magic markered for id)This thermometer is waterproof, but I never plunge mine under the faucet except for the probe part that is washed with soap and warm water. Waterproof really isn't a bonus with me, I am not checking the temperature of underwater creatures nor do I plan to use it in the jacuzzi. This one is accurate temperature wise.There is no backlight. That is the one flaw, the backlight really does help to read it. The numbers are as large as they normally are on a digital thermometer, but the backlight makes a difference.This is a reasonably priced thermometer. This one works in under fifteen seconds depending on if it is used rectally (according to directions) or orally (6-9 seconds, tested).

The first thing I do with any textile is launder it first. These were washed without fabric softener and dried without a dryer sheet. I find that helps with absorbency. They washed as is typical, the edges curling a bit, Very minimal shrinkage. I expect my microfiber towels to dry a bit crooked so it never bothers me if they end up that was as these did, slightly off square.They are for washing dishes, not for drying dishes. They are not super absorbent. I will use the green one for wiping down the bathroom sinks, and toilets. When I tested it, it worked with no problems. The ridges distinguish them from other microfibers I use. (Color coding at my house.)These are easily washed and are durable so far. I trade dish cloths for clean ones every other day or immediately after washing greasy items.I am loving the scrubby side. I wish I had videotaped cleaning the waffle iron. The waffle iron lives on top of the fridge next to the stove. My roomie cooks with grease. Grease drifts up to coat things on the top of the fridge and dust coats the grease. End result is a sticky mess. I wet the dish cloth in hot water and using the scrub side, effortlessly wiped the grease and dust off the outside of the waffle iron. My roommate stood slack jawed and watched, asking where I bought "those amazing rags." Even I was impressed, these are as good at many tasks as the magic erasers, except these can be used over and over.

I received this product for free to evaluate. The following is my unbiased review.The bra fit as I expected it would fit. I am not currently nursing, but this is a bra that can be slept due to it being comfortable, that is why I agreed to evaluate it.The bra I chose is in nude which disappears under clothes, even white semi sheer blouses. The cups are soft and there is no wire to press against my chest/underarms. It is comfortable enough to sleep in if I wanted to nap in it. This is a comfortable bra, not one that I am eager to remove the second I arrive home.The bra, being a soft cup bra, is not as supportive as an underwire, so it does change my silhouette slightly when I wear it. If I want a more professional profile, I need to wear an underwire.I hand washed the bra as per the directions, but I see that it could probably be put into my bra ball and washed in the machine. (I dislike hand washing anything.)

I was offered this probiotic for free to evaluate. The following is my unbiased reviewed after testing it out.This probiotic requires refrigeration. I understand why it does, but the recommended refrigeration means that it is in the kitchen downstairs and not upstairs with my other medications. This makes it hard to remember to take it. It also means swallowing cold pills, something I find abhorrent. It's a personal pet peeve of mine and has nothing to do with the efficacy of the drug.Refrigeration aside, I put a note by the door to remind me to take my meds as I don't venture into the kitchen before work except to turn off the porch light.. The note is helping make sure I take the pills.The probiotic is working. I have not had a gastric upset from it, despite the small amount of guar gum added. I do not have a dairy intolerance so the small amount of dairy doesn't matter to my system. So far, so good, I am a week into the new bottle and my system is sensitive enough to begin sending up flares within 36 hours if I am intolerant of a product.The product was shipped with a small ice pack to keep it cool and it was inside an insulated bag, I feel this was a nice touch and made sure that the probiotic bugs did not arrive ineffective. (I once received a batch from another company that was pretty much dead on arrival.)I would like to see a pill count vs just "30 day supply". There are two dosing schemes, one requiring one pill daily, one requiring two pills daily. Tell the consumer how many pills are in each bottle. I would never purchase this item on my own due to that omission. If I am paying $30 for a bottle of pills, I want to know in advance what is considered a 30 day supply! I have removed a star due to that factor. I feel that sellers need to be transparent to their buyers. A 30 days supply sounds like a good deal until you consider how many pills that actually means. If you are on the two pill a day routine, it could mean purchasing two bottles. $60 a month vs $30 a month is a big difference.

This light bulb was sent to me for free as a sample for evaluation and review. The following is my unbiased review.Please note, this is not a regular sized light bulb. This bulb has a base that is designed to fit candelabra type fixtures. This bulb is not a standard based bulb!This bulb fit in the candelabra over what used to be my dining room table but is now my desk. It fits perfectly. The bulb dims or brightens by turning the dimming switch.One thing I will note is that this bulb is very bright due to it being an LED. I find the light from this bulb to be brighter and clearer than the other 3 non-led 40w bulbs. My OCD is not going to allow me to leave one bulb brighter, I had to remove it until I purchase three more.It's a light bulb that goes in your candelabra base, it is a small diameter base so be sure that you are purchasing the correct bulb or you will be disappointed when it arrives.I like this bulb, no cons that I could find, it works exactly as it is supposed to work.

I am so very happy the author let me know she had written this sequel. The first book was charming, the second book is equally charming.Taking a rabbit camping can (and is) done but when it is not planned for in advance, it can be a comedy of errors. I laughed my way through this book because I imagine all of the issues happening when there are no plans in advance.The characters are true to life, the stories are believable and it is an enjoyable read. It also shows rabbit owners what they should be doing vs what they are doing. Rabbits can be a great source of frustration if you don't know how to live with them. They sure have their quirks.I will say this, the book shows why parents need to be sure they are involved in the double checking of the pets before vacation to ensure there are no unexpected stowaways.

These natural shoe deodorizers do work. They suck up the moisture and seem to be helping with the odor.My roommate insists that sneakers should be worn without socks because socks bother her feet. The resulting sweaty feet syndrome was making me stay out of the living room after she comes home from work. I could not handle the odor. She was embarrassed by her sweaty feet but didn't know what to do. She was going to buy a pair of odor eaters when I found these.She would take her shoes off and sit them under the end table which is right next to my chair. The smell of the shoes was gagging me. I decided to try these out to see if they would help. I have her used to stuffing these into her shoes as soon as she gets home. These are helping.They are not magic, they aren't ridding the shoes of every single bit of stink, but they are taking away 80% of it. I need to buy a second pair as I made sure she had a second pair of sneakers. She alternates the sneakers so that each pair gets a 24 hour rest between wearing, that helps with the odor problem also.

I was sent this light for free in the mail to test and evaluate. The following is my unbiased review.I put this light outside to charge for around 3 hours in the sunlight before I mounted it on the wall outside the garage door. I wanted to test it first, before I put it up to be sure it was working.The test worked brilliantly. Just in case you missed the directions, there is an on/off hole on the light. Peek at the directions to find it on the side that has the leds. You can use the little tool they sent or you can use a paperclip. Either way, press in until you feel it move. You can now test this little light in the bathroom or in another dark spot as it is light sensitive. It will not turn on when in bright light.I installed this lamp right beside the garage door. There is ample sunlight in that patch so it will stay charged.The lamp has a motion detector which makes it great for walking from my garage, across the patio and into the house. The patio is dark and if the roommate moved something, that can mean banged shins, stubbed toes and even a fall! This light sensed me and turned on, lighting up the patio enough to see obstacles.The lamp dims itself when there is no motion detected so it is a continuous light. I like this better than the fixtures that are only on when there is motion. This could be placed on a porch to provide porch light. I get people who arrive late at night after the sun has dropped, and my regular light is a motion light. This means my porch is dark until they approach it. Because this is solar, it is not costing in electric bills and it didn't need to be wired into the electric system.This lamp is easy enough that a 5 year old could turn it on or off by poking the little paperclip like wire into the hole. The off button is nice for those nights when you do not want it lit. If you wish to use this function, be sure to install it in an area where you can easily reach it, or can reach it with a step stool.All in all, it is easy to install, bright enough to provide ample light when it on, and it provides a steady dim glow when there is no one around. This light can provide a deterrent for thieves as well as prevent you from tripping over anything that might be in your path.

This Ultrasonic Aromatherapy diffuser was sent to me for free to test and evaluate. The following is my unbiased review after trying out the unit.The first thing I found very nice is this is a beautiful looking diffuser. It is elegant enough to leave in many places around the house. It is also harder to spill the water than in some other ones I have tested.It does not leak. (Whew, not much is worse than having essential oils and water soak into a nightstand or desk before you notice!) It is easy to fill and the directions are easy to follow.This has several modes as the description says, I like that I can have the mist intermittent or continuous or only use the lights for mood lighting. (Note, this will not take the place of a lamp, it creates a dim light that is enough to see in the room but not enough to read by.)I tested the auto shut-off and it does work, so I am less worried about it burning down the house if it runs out of water and the components catch fire. (I put all items like this on a timer so there is a second back up, just in case something malfunctions internally with the unit.)This works, it is pretty, it appears to be sturdy and is quiet. I did not hear it running at all which is good as on the nights where I am having trouble falling asleep, I need everything to be very quiet.

These snaps do just what they are supposed to do. The snaps click on easily and are removed easily. My tens leads fit in the wires with no problems.I wouldn't change a thing. Short review, but there isn't much to say. They work!

This holder was offered to me for free to evaluate and review. The following is my unbiased review.I was skeptical. I am used to a different style of holder, and this was different. My skepticism was unfounded.This holder has a unique way of holding brooms, but it works well. I am happy to say that this is not something I would have purchased, but it is something I will keep.It seems to be well made, time will tell if it stays as sturdy. If not, I will be back here updating and removing stars. It was easy to install and easy to use. I am giving it five stars.

I was offered this item for free via a promotional coupon to try it out. The following is my unbiased review.This item was unusable. The odor coming off of it was part PVC, part acetone-ish. Within seconds, I had a splitting headache.What I found in the brief look before the odor scrambled my brain was the following... The eye mask will not work for me. It is a strange velvet like fabric, slightly rough. This is on both sides and it was not comfortable against my hands. I wasn't going to try it against my eyes. I think it would keep me awake from the distraction.The pillow had the same odor and fabric. Due to the odor, I did not attempt to blow it up. There is no way I can use this pillow as long as it has such am strong odor.I will be leaving everything to air out while I am gone for a week on my trip. (Ironic that I cannot take it on my trip, isn't it?) I am sorry I cannot recommend this to anyone. The reason I review is to help people avoid spending money on items that have problems.

This was sent for free to evaluate and test out. The following is my unbiased review and opinion based on trying them out.This is a set of duplicate files so you have a spare or one to give as a gift in a spa basket. I found the handles easy to hold even for hands that are arthritic. My aunt tested it for me because her feet are rough. She said the handle is easy to hold and she doesn't have to bend over as far to use it.I watched her grinding away on her feet. She was raising dust with it!These are a great pedicure tool. They wash up fast with a bit of water and soap. These are well made and each one should last a few months if they are kept clean.

I received these lights for free to evaluate and test. The following is my unbiased review and observations.These lights arrived and I rushed to charge them. On two of the sunniest days in Southern CA I had trouble finding a sunny patch. That is ironic. I got these charged up and tried them.The light is a pale glow, not bright enough to read under but bright enough to look pretty. The light looks much like the picture shown in the description, a diluted vanilla color. These lights would define a path at night or decorate a railing. I put them around the pond to define it at night.The lights charged quickly, and after charging they stayed on for around six hours. They can be turned off manually many they can be made to blink.They are very beautiful in looks when off or when on. This is a major bonus, no ugly barren fairy lights, these look exotic due to the little effervescent like bubbles inside the globes.Four stars because I wish they were a bit brighter.

I received these chalkboard vinyl pieces for free for evaluation. The following is my unbiased review. Free does not equal a fabulous review. I review because I enjoy testing products and helping people steer towards great products and purchase less than five star items with open eyes.These are thick vinyl pieces, eight of them. They stick on fairly easily but be warned, they pull paint off when removed. Do not stick these up if you can't afford to repaint after removal. (Thankfully I tested this inside a closet.)The chalk included did not erase easily, I had to press slightly harder than expected to write. This caused indents on the vinyl. I tested a liquid chalk marker, that erased as it was supposed to erase and left no indents.This would be more practical cut up to make tiny chalk boards for jars or as little chalkboards on notebooks for messages written with liquid chalk. I will not be putting any more on the wall. I will be looking into sticking them on with removable tape which is a better option if I want to repurpose the wall later. I am using one on my fridge, held on with magnets for a easy shopping list. Again, only using liquid chalk markers.I am only giving three stars because it does not work as expected. It is still a good product, but it has limitations.

I was offered this backpack for free in order to evaluate it and write an honest review. If you have read my reviews, you will find I am sometimes brutally honest about flaws. When I give five stars, it was deserved.Update: 9/30/15 pack is crammed with a 15.3 laptop, charger and a few other things like my ipad. Total weight inside is about 10 pounds. The straps adjusted to help keep the weight centered on my back. A friend saw me with it when she drove me to the train, said liked the look and needed a good sturdy back pack. She hinted strongly that she wanted it. Laptop is a snug fit, but very easily done. Padded pocket helps protect my pack.This pack is cute, it is a nautical type of theme. The pack is made from thick canvas like material that is heavy. I tested a backpack several months ago that looked the same, but in terms of quality, this one wins. This one is much thicker material. The other one was equally cute, but this one is the sturdier of the two. Like buying jeans and jean leggings that look exactly the same, this one is the winner of the two packs.The pockets are great. I can fit everything from a camera to a sports bottle in them. The inside will hold books or clothes. Take it to the beach, use it as a trendy carry on bag. Front pocket holds an iPad mini in an otterbox case for size of the pocket idea. The front is a magnetic snap closure, not a buckle. That could be important to some of you.The bag is well sewn, I don't think it is washable except by hand washing and it might bleed blue onto white. I will stick to spot washing.

I was sent this free for testing and evaluation. The following is my unbiased review.This fastened to my shower stall easily. It held fast without budging but it is not a universal holder. My nozzle handle did not fit. Be sure that yours will fit before purchase. This looks as if it is made out of plastic, no problem for me but if you have a stylish bathroom, this will clash. (If you have a stylish bathroom it is unlikely you will be purchasing aftermarket shower head holders.)I wish this were more of a hook than a nozzle holder, I could use a strong hook to hang my scrub cloth on for drying.

This cooling pad is larger than many, but is a fair price. Reality is, most of those cooling pads are made of the exact same material, they are simply different sizes.This one is no different from others I have tried that do not say they have "phase change material". Phase change material is a fancy name for something that absorbs and releases energy. It is what most of these cool pads are made from, even if they do not use the fancy terms.These are not designed to stay cold long term, unless you are using one that is connected to electricity or to a cooling unit. These are designed to feel cooler than the ambient temperature in the room. Because they feel cooler than your skin, they feel as if they are "sucking heat from your body". It feels that way because it is doing this in a round about way. By the way, don't make the mistake of "touching it with your hand" and deciding it isn't cool. Put it on your skin for a few seconds, trust me, it is cool.The problem with many of these pads is that the heat from your body goes into the pad as you press your warmer temp against it. It does not take long for your body to heat up the pad, sometimes in as short a time as ten minutes. (Think of a nice hot day. The pool is 83 degrees. When you first jump in, it's freezing! Then you adjust to the temp and it feels good. This is a good explanation of why these pads are initially so cold feeling but warm up fast.) When this happens, the pad no longer feels cool to the touch and is not as refreshing as it was. The pad needs to be traded for a second pad that has been allowed to reach room temp. Putting the pad in the freezer for an hour or two or even in the fridge can help cool it down faster and keep it cooler for longer periods of time.This pad has "sections". That means that the sections heat up, but the rest of the pad does not heat as quickly. The way I use it is as follows.. I only rest on one or two sections at a time, then I can turn the pad around and rest on one or two other sections while the first two begin to cool back off by dissipating the heat into the air.  This is a larger pad so there is room to do this if you are not resting your torso on it.This pad does stay cooler for a longer period of time, I never reached more than 30 minutes per section, but that 30 minutes was ample time to stop a hot flash, cool me down enough until the a/c kicked in, or cool me off if I was waiting for a fever reducer to kick in. What amazes me is that this pad feels freezing even after sitting in a room that has a temp of 83 degrees. When placed against my body, it can make me shiver at first. Often, if you are a "leg out from under the cover" type of person, you can put your leg or a foot on a pad to help cool your body off. I keep mine where I can place my forearm on it if needed.These pads work great for hot flashes because they provide instant coolness. If you keep three of them, then you have one that in use, one that is warmer and cooling off and a spare cool one. This will allow you to switch between them and it is what I do when needed. Don't fall under the assumption that you only need one and it will keep you cold all night. You need at least two. Purchase one and try it. If it helps, purchase a second one.These are not "soft" like pillows so if you have a problem with sleeping on anything that isn't pillow soft, try using it under your shoulder/neck, under your arm or under a leg as I suggested above. They are a firm surface that isn't very yielding. They aren't stiff like plywood, they are more like carpet without padding, they have a slight amount of give.

I was sent this power bank for free for testing and evaluation. The following is my review after testing the unit. I am writing my review based on the performance of the unit sent to me. I base my evaluation on the asking price at the time I am sent the unit.First thought is that it is way too heavy to carry around with me. The whole reason for having a power bank in most cases is that it is a portable power source. This unit weighs just over half a pound. That is heavy. It is not going to be carried comfortably in my tote, is too heavy to take backpacking and really is too heavy for a carry on for airport travel. If you were planning on taking it along with you, be sure you plan on it weighing half a pound. Seller says it only weighs 9.5 ounces so I should revise saying it weighs half a pound because I don't understand. I stand corrected, it is slightly over half a pound. I weighed it in grams also, because the seller wrote back protesting that I was misunderstanding and should weigh it in grams, not ounces. It is still equal to slightly more than half a pound. It is a lot of power and that is why it is heavy. I am not arguing that more power requires a heavier unit, but I am not going to budge on my saying it is too heavy for me to consider it portable.Second thought was, it took a very long time to charge. I plugged it in and there are four blue leds that tell how much power it has. Two of those were lit. I plugged it in at 8 am and when I left the office at 1:30 pm, it was finally charging the last blue light. (Indicated by blinking.) I left it plugged in overnight. I arrived to find it apparently fully charged this morning. The seller wrote to tell me the cable included could be substituted for one that charged faster.This is a device that is currently costing around $20 at the time of my posting. At this price, it is fair deal. Is it a great deal? That depends on your outlook. This is not a lightening charger. It requires around 6 hours to charge the power source and it charges items as slowly. I am currently testing it on my mini iPad. So far, in 4 minutes, despite saying it's charging, my ipad has budged from the 75% it was at when I started charging to 76%. If it continues to charge at that rate, it will take 1.5 hours to reach 100% charge from 76%. Too long in my opinion. FYI, I was using the lightening cable that came with my iPad to charge it when I tested it.All in all, I will pass on this. It is going to placed in the SHTF bag because it is not practical for routine use. For routine use, I do not have time to wait for my phone to slowly charge to make a call. In an emergency, I would not have time to wait. This battery is too heavy to carry around. Unless I need a battery back up while I am sitting at home or at the office and the power is out, this isn't a good choice for me personally. It has a lot of juice which is good but heavy. It makes it impractical for travel that requires checking bags. I am not wasting 1/2 a pound on a charger when the airlines charge too much extra now for overweight. I prefer to throw several smaller chargers in my bag.With more strength comes more weight. Choose wisely Grasshopper. You will have to carry this around with you. There are better chargers that cost more, but are lighter and charge more quickly, if you don't mind having less charges per back up battery. I can't justify this one for myself. Slow rate to refuel the power pack will eat up emergency power is forefront in my mind. This would be something I would use until it ran out, then would not recharge it using emergency power. (Used to teach emergency preparedness, I am versed in this stuff. Shelter in place and all that. This recharges devices slowly, even using a faster cable. I will plug my devices in before they are low on power, and only charge them in airplane or off mode to reduce the energy output while charging.)

I was offered this unit for free via promotional coupon. My unbiased review is offered below. If at any point during use I find the collar is not holding up to the quality I feel it should, I will update immediately.The collar arrived and has directions that are clear enough to understand. The directions are easy to follow.There are (as is standard) several sizes of "prongs" so it is suitable for long or short furred dogs. This is a unit for a medium to large sized dog, not a dog under 20-25 pounds.I like the fact that there are three options. Tone, vibrate and shock. I find that using the least amount of either is more effective for distraction. The vibrate can stop my dog from barking long enough to hear "leave it". The distraction of the vibrate can be used for stopping other behaviors as well.
