And, it can be used to train.The vibrate, when used correctly can be a signal to the dog that he did it right when he can't hear my clicker. The static shock is high at the strongest level. Personally, I will be refraining from shocking my dog. There is no need with proper training. Shocking has it's place, but I won't discuss that here. 90% of the general public don't need shock aversion to train their dogs.The collar has suited my uses and I am glad to test it.

It seems like it's helping a bit with digestion. The pills are easy enough to take and I have a good history with Jarrow products. They're one of the brand names that I feel better about when it comes to supplements.

It seems to absorb well and isn't showing any signs of causing an unfortunate skin reaction. So long as I'm careful about how much I apply, it gets into my skin nicely enough that I could easily wear makeup over it. It seems to be able to do good things for perking skin up a bit as well, though it's a little on the early side for me to say for sure. I would definitely say that the early signs seem positive, though, and I'm optimistic.

The commercials are funny, but the product is for real. My family has actually be using this for a family member who just had surgery, and temporarily needs to use a bedside toilet (the kind that basically has a little bucket in it). Putting some water in and using this helps to keep the room smelling much better.
It's roughly equivalent to the Apple cables I use. It works fine. It doesn't do anything extraordinary, but there's no sign of anything going wrong with it.

If you use this well, it'll be very valuable. You should basically sit down and work your way through problems and develop a stronger sense of when you tend to make mistakes. Then, you'll know exactly what you should be looking up and studying to improve your performance. The GRE isn't really designed to be incredibly advanced, but it tests a broad range of material and it may be things you haven't seen in years. You could waste a lot of time just studying on your own, so it really helps to have something that allows you to narrow your attention down to the issues that'll really cost you in the exam room.

I haven't noticed it making a drastic difference in the dog's breath, but the dog at least doesn't seem to mind that it's there. Considering that she can be very fussy, that's impressive. I'll trust their research that it's capable of keeping a pet's mouth a bit cleaner, and since she's willing to drink it I'm happy.

This is really handy for review because it drills you on a lot of different topics and offers a lot of practice. It's not actually designed to teach you, but with sites like Khan Academy, Udacity, and edX out there, there are plenty of free resources that you can use to go back and review things once you get a feel for which questions you're missing. What most people really benefit from is a big pool of questions to help identify what you don't know, and that's exactly what this book (and the online service that goes with it) provides.

This is a fun twist on ways of flinging pet toys. The dog doesn't care too much about whether we use the sling or just throw stuff, but it's fun for us and I think kids will particularly enjoy it. Thus far, it seems pretty sturdy and I expect that it'll hold up so long as we're not too rough on it (which means that probably kids will be the ones to break it...)  It definitely takes some getting used to, but I kinda enjoy that it challenged me to pick up a new skill of sorts, even though it's not one I expect to use anywhere else.

it's a good looking mouse, it's comfortable to hold, and you can adjust the weight of it. If you're thinking about it as a gift, the fact that you can do the weight adjustment and it glows will probably impress plenty of kids who love gaming. It's also nice to be able to adjust sensitivity to match your comfort level.This isn't an over the top gaming mouse, but it has a solid set of features that should be plenty for the vast majority of people, plus it looks flashy.

I'm a fan of taking probiotics ahead of actually developing any problems. Not constantly, but a few times a week to help make sure a good population keeps going while I'm not always doing as well as I should at keeping the healthier bacteria well fed and starving the rest by avoiding junk food. These are a reasonable size to swallow, they come from a reputable company, and 25 billion is a pretty big dose to help keep your intestines in order.

They're okay, but not extraordinary. They seem to be well made and are holding up so far with no problems, and the fact that you can toss them into the washing machine to be cleaned is nice. They're just a bit on the thin side as well, though, so you wouldn't want these to be your first choice for a situation where you're going to be holding onto a very hot dish for a while. As something to just pull pans out of the oven quickly, though, they do well.

My skin is very sensitive and easily dries out, so I pretty much always have a supply of at least one product intended to help keep it from driving me crazy with itch. This is pretty good stuff. It moisturizing well and I'm really glad that they didn't decide to load it up with perfumes. So far I think I don't like it quite as much as the Aveeno eczema cream that has been doing me a lot of good, but this is going to be a good extra option to have in the arsenal (perhaps to use on the REALLY bad days, though I try to avoid those by loading lotion onto my skin several times a day).

This ended up being not quite as nice as I'd hoped. I think it's pretty tough for Otterbox to excel on the Galaxy S6 Edge specifically because their usual niche is "Our cases are kinda big, but they protect like crazy!" but the shape of the Edge doesn't really lend itself to this style of case. The cases usually come out forward of the screen to protect the screen from impacts, but doing that with the curved sides on the Edge would probably end up looking ridiculous.Anyway, it just didn't seem like it could offer the level of protection that usually makes me choose Otterbox as my daily cover option, and so I ended up buying a different case whose looks I liked a little better.

This feels a little stronger than I would want to use routinely, but your experience will vary depending on your tolerance for similar products. Worth using, though, when it's time to make a big push for serious progress!
These are as good as I'm used to seeing from Nature's Bounty. Reasonable sized pills, not too hard to swallow, and sealed up well. Definitely worth it if you want astragalus.

For the price this is definitely a very nice money belt. The pocket is decent, and I really like the fact that you don't have to worry about RFID readers being able to pick up on any cards or passports in the belt. All around worth having if you're going somewhere that you need to be able to keep a few items safe.
It's soft and comfortable, and they ditched the inner roll so that it can take up less space and be less wasteful at the same time. There really isn't anything I can see not to like about it.

This is actually very nice. A lot of products that are designed to moisturize well end up feeling greasy and uncomfortable on my skin, but this soaks in well and feels good, and yet still feels like it's getting the job of moisturizing done. I have to give it a lot of credit for striking a nice balance between being effective and being irritating.

This seems really nice thus far. The pieces are well made and don't feel like they're going to fall apart after just a little bit of playtime, and I really like the way that it's designed so that you can totally rearrange the house and decide how it should look from day to day. I like the art style as well, with the bright colors and reasonable looking characters.I've seen dollhouses that you can redecorate before, but I really like this extra step in the direction of a house that can be totally rebuilt. I'm going to have to seriously consider buying some of the other items in the same product line so that there are even more pieces available to combine and potentially build things the original designers never thought about.

It's a pretty nice book overall. It's interesting that there's even a trend toward writing guides that give people advice on how to get pretty specific jobs, but this should be useful to a lot of people who are graduating with a high school or associate degree that includes some networking training. It probably won't be quite as valuable to people at bigger schools with stronger career service departments, since they'll have a lot of resources already. This would probably also be pretty handy to someone who wants to change jobs.

This is just what you'd expect. It's a working lightning cable, properly certified by Apple, and it connects to an iPhone or iPad to charge it and transfer data. It's very short, which is handy if you plug your phone in right next to an outlet or your computer, but not so useful if you were planning to plug it into the wall while you lie in bed.The build quality is good, as Amazon Basics stuff tends to be. I don't like it overall quite as much as a Belkin cable that I have, but the Belkin also retails for more too, and really either one will get the job done just fine. It's not as if using a device usually involves a lot of time spent staring at the cables.

I would take the 'starters' that it says on the front seriously. These are attractive and their shape does keep them from rolling away (which might be handy for anyone who has some dexterity issues, not just little kids) but they're also hard enough that they don't write as smoothly and as comfortably as other colored pencils that I've used. I definitely don't think they're a good fit for someone who's serious about art or looking to pick up coloring as a relaxing activity; the bit more you'd have to spend for a more premium and adult-oriented colored pencil will probably be well worth it.These, though, are nice for little kids because they won't break too easily, the fact that they're mechanical should keep them from being easily broken in half altogether, and they have an unusual and attractive appearance as well. So take the 5-star rating as only being for a pretty specific target market. I'm not recommending these to everybody.

There really hasn't been any noticeable effect that I can point to, but my heart was already in pretty good shape so there might not be a lot for it to do. What I can say on the bright side is that the pills are okay for swallowing, and there's no taste or smell that makes it a horrible experience to be taking them. There also haven't been any notable adverse effects.

It's effective, but you should definitely think about how tolerant you are to stimulants. This stuff will kick your body into high gear, but it does it enough that if you have any sort of heart issues at all that could be a bad thing.If you're looking for something to help maximize the value you can get out of a workout, though, this is definitely a project aimed squarely at that target.

My dog likes this stuff! That's saying a lot, because she's a picky little thing who's been offered a wide variety of fancy and expensive dog foods that she either gave a lukewarm reception to or did her best to ignore. For this, though, she ate up the portion that we gave her immediately and then started nudging around to try to see if there was any more under the plate.For some reason she also enjoys Cesar dog food (always been baffling to me that I've struggled so much to find higher-quality foods she'd accept...) and I did the math and the price actually works out to be about the same. She's not actually a large breed, so she can get 3 meals from a can if we're feeding her an equivalent amount to one container of the Cesar stuff, and therefore cost per serving is actually very close. I was a little worried that the size of the chunks in this would put her off since she likes her kibble very very small, but she seems perfectly content thus far.I'm really happy to have found a better food that she'll eat without significant coaxing. (She's spoiled, I'll admit it!)

This looked silly at first glance (mainly the idea of a bow you could use indoors), and then caught my interest a little more firmly, and ultimately turned out to be pretty fun.You really can get some decent flight range out of it once you get a feel for how it should work, and it's made for kids so there isn't a ton of force required. I can't say I'm brave enough to use it anywhere near a lamp, television, or anything else breakable that I don't care to either live without or replace, but I could definitely see doing something like turning a hallway into a miniature shooting range for fun. The fact that the arrows light up is a very nice bonus, both making them more interesting and much more usable if you want to have some summertime fun outside in the late evening.

It seems like it helps to perk you up a bit, but it's tough to pin down what's really the pills and what's the expectation that comes from taking the pills. I'd definitely try to consume some pepper alongside them, for the sake of maximizing absorption of the curcumin as much as you can. If you have a meal you like that involves a lot of pepper, these would be a great accompaniment.Otherwise, the pills were in good condition and didn't seem to be falling apart in transit, and I found the size reasonable for swallowing and in line with the size of many other supplements.

So far, it seems like it might have promise. I'm sort of experimenting as I go. I have to be careful because this isn't quite so appetizing to my dog that she'll necessarily go for it if she's already picked up on the idea that something is going to happen that she doesn't like, and I don't want to turn these into a cue that makes her nervous because she's noticed that every time she gets one, something bad happens. So far though, there are indications that she's a little more settled when she's had it, and I think it's well worth trying for very nervous dogs who could see a big quality of life benefit from something that helps them relax.

This kit works well for me, but it's worth noting that I think that's partly because salicylic acid in general works well for me. Some people don't do well at all with that and end up always using benzoyle peroxide and that kind of thing. On one hand, that means this is gentler and won't likely cause more acne due to irritation. On the other hand, if you need really strong stuff, this may not do the job very well.Beyond that, it's nice to have everything together in one kit so you kind of have a whole instant skin care regime going. That's particularly helpful because if you're using products you bought separately, it's easy to overdo it and end up irritating your skin with too much medication. I'd say that if you haven't already ruled out salicylic acid as a good option, this is worth a try.

This is a really nice building project with enough pieces to make it an evening of family time. Once it's built, you have a pretty cool truck with enough figures along with it to allow kids to have a lot of fun playing at battles, whether they've seen the movie or not. I'm actually thinking this truck would make a good combo with some of the Call of Duty themed sets, because they have a sort of similar gritty war look to them, and it could be fun to see robots and zombies team up to attack the truck next time we're ready to play with it.Difficulty will depend a lot on your experience with these sets. I think the age range they give is pretty appropriate for a solo build by a motivated and fairly mature kid, but other kids (or younger ones) will need some help and guidance. That's not a bad thing, though, since building something really is a great family activity. It's a situation where no one goes into it knowing what they're doing exactly, so everyone's having an experience of learning and experimenting together.

Barefoot yoga is relatively common, however, it is not something that I would want to do within a studio/classroom setting. The reason is simple: I really do not want to contract athleteâ€™s foot or a fungal infection within my toenails. Yet, socks can slip and slide across the smooth floors of many classrooms, and wearing tennis shoes is rather uncomfortable (not to mention can be damaging to the surface of a yoga mat). Fortunately, there is an option out there: YogaAddict Non-Slip Socks, no doubt influenced by those lovely blue socks that you get in the hospital.ConstructionThe YogaAddict Non-Slip Socks feel well-made. The fabric is thick and heavy-duty: these socks are premium quality. The ankle band is a bit padded, with a â€œVâ€ notch on either side. When worn, this band hugs the leg snuggly, with the padding preventing the usual indentations that some elastic socks can leave on the skin. The sole of the socks are also soft, providing a gentle cushion for your feet as you move about. Finally, the tacky dots and infinity symbol on the soles are noticeable as you walk, but soft enough that the socks are not uncomfortable.FunctionThe YogaAddict Non-Slip Socks will keep your feet nice and toasty as you pad about your house or yoga classroom. The socks will remain firmly in place and not shift around as you switch yoga positions. The tacky dots on the soles perform well: your feet will not slide on any smooth surface, including a yoga mat. The thick cushion of the socks also add a bit of comfort that certainly helps near the end of a grueling workout. Other benefits include:1) The socks will help to protect your feet from bacteria and fungi that can hide on gym floors, including Athleteâ€™s Foot and yellow toenail-causing fungi infections.2) Conversely, these socks will hide any embarrassing infections that you may have, as well as reduce the likelihood of spreading them to other yoga practitioners.3) The cotton does breathe, allowing your feet to sweat and wicking away that moisture.4) Bonus: you can make both fashion and safety statements.5) If you flip them inside-out before you wash them, the tacky surfaces on the soles will last longer. With that said, I have washed these socks at least 30 times and have not noticed any deterioration of the dots.Final SayWhether you want socks for warmth, to protect your feet from potential infections, or just safety as you work out on smooth floors, the YogaAddict Non-Skip Socks will not let you down. They are high-quality in their construction, and perform the Non-Skip portion of their function with flying colors. In short, if you want comfy, durable, and very functional yoga socks, then you canâ€™t go wrong with these. 5 stars of 5.**Disclaimer: This product was sent to me by the manufacturer at no cost to review. While I do not feel that this influenced me in any capacity, I am legally obligated to disclose this fact so that you can come to your own conclusions about the merit of this analysis.**

While snack baggies do a respectable job of keeping foods contained and separated within your lunch bag, they do not offer much protection from the contents being crushed, nor are they really a great method at storing liquid. Sure, the ubiquitous Tupperware® product lines are one potential solution to this dilemma; however, finding containers that fit into a lunch bag can be frustrating, especially if you want to use more than one TupperwareÂ®. Thus, undoubtedly in an attempt to resolve this conundrum, MIRA developed a three-piece set of Stainless Steel Nesting Bowls. But, do they work?ConstructionUpon opening the packaging for this set, you will first see the thick blue lid of the largest bowl. Peeling back this lid Ã  la matryoshka-style will reveal the light-blue lid of the middle bowl of the set tucked neatly inside; repeat this step for the third (and smallest) bowl.The bowls are relatively lightweight, and the rubberized lids are stiffer than those found on most TupperwareÂ® containers. In fact, I would go so far as to say that the lids of the MIRA Stainless Steel Nesting Bowls are of a higher quality than most TupperwareÂ® sets. True, the MIRA lids are less flexible and a bit tougher to remove, but overall this is a minor issue and does more to increase the quality of the MIRA products than as a detraction. Finally, each lid secures to the top of their corresponding bowl tightly, and when inverted they prove to be leak-proof.UseAs mentioned above, finding storage containers that fit inside a standard lunch bag or box is not difficult; the problem is being able to fit more than one without sacrificing space for other things (such as a sandwich). The other issue is durability: sure, TupperwareÂ® makes rigid plastic containers, but they can crack. The disposable containers offered in their product lines are simply a waste of money, not to mention that they are usually too big for lunch bags. Thus, without further ado, here are the perks of the MIRA Stainless Steel Nesting Bowls:1) No more stains from tomato-based products! The MIRA SSNBs will not discolor or stain.2) The lids are leak-proof and secure tightly, even if jostled about heavily.3) The bowls will not scratch. No more bacteria hidden in the scratches of plastic bowls.4) More than one bowl can be fit into a lunch bag, allowing for a variety of meals.5) Hot, soapy water with the occasional light scrub is all that it takes for cleanup.6) Storage is a cinch, taking up little cabinet space. Oh, and no more lid hunting!While the above six points are most likely enough for most, there is one major drawback to the MIRA Stainless Steel Nesting Bowls: they are not microwaveable. Thus, if you hope to bring a food to warm up at the office, you will need to swap containers. For this reason, I strongly recommend investing in a ThermosÂ® or other insulated container for your hot food needs; aside from more space, you wonâ€™t have to fuss with a microwave at all.Final SayIf you are in the market for a moderately-sized set of nesting bowls that are perfect for snacks, lunches, or myriad other storage uses, I strongly recommend the MIRA Stainless Steel Nesting Bowls. The quality is excellent, the lids are secure, and they store neatly in a cabinet or drawer. Since the lids fit each bowl as it is nested in another, you will no longer have to hunt down a properly-sized lid. Finally, they are much more sanitary than their plastic cousins, and cleanup is a breeze. Being unable to place them into the microwave is certainly a drawback, and as such, my final score is 4 stars of 5.**Disclaimer: This product was sent to me by the manufacturer at no cost to review. While I do not feel that this influenced me in any capacity, I am legally obligated to disclose this fact so that you can come to your own conclusions about the merit of this analysis.**

In addition to having huge pores over my nose and cheeks, I also suffer from minor bouts of acne that peppers my chin with lovely, red, deep zits. Sure, I have been trying to figure out a way to clone the flawless skin of Nicole Kidman, but the government grants arenâ€™t coming through and Ms. Kidman doesnâ€™t want to donate some DNA (something about a restraining orderâ€¦), so I opted to try out the decidedly less expensive MIRA Sonic Facial Cleaning Brush.ConstructionUpon receiving the MIRA Sonic Facial Cleaning Brush, I noticed that it is very well-made. This is not a cheap plastic device; the textured body and soft cleaning head definitely feel durable. The rubber-coated power button operates flawlessly, and the 60-second timer is wonderful for 1) ensuring that you are not overly enthusiastic with your facial scrub, and 2) preventing the batteries from going dead should the button be accidentally â€œbumpedâ€ during travel. Finally, as indicated in the product description, the brush head can be removed to allow for thorough cleaning and sanitation. When finished, snap the brush back on, replace the cover, and set your MIRA Sonic Facial Cleaning Brush on the shelf for the next use.EfficacyUsing sonic waves to clean is not a new concept; SonicareÂ® Toothbrushes spearheaded the use of this technology for personal hygiene. Thus the MIRA Sonic Facial Cleaning Brush is almost like an overgrown toothbrush (minus the Colgate, although a dab of toothpaste is wonderful for spot treatment of zits). After inserting the batteries (not included), the SFCB is ready-to-go; just make sure that you apply the soap to your face and not the brush, or you will end up with a mess when you turn on the unit.I do not wear makeup, but I do use acne medication and lotions, so my impressions of how well the SFCB cleans is based upon removal of the above substances. In addition, I used a blackhead remover tool over known problem areas after each cleaning to determine if any â€œgunkâ€ remains in my pores. Here are my impressions:1) I use BiorÃ© Blackhead Cleanser; it contains eucalyptus oil that gives a cool sensation to the skin. When using the SFCB to massage the soap across my face, I did notice that the cooling sensation felt much more intense, and it felt immediately cleaner underneath the soap.2) When I used the blackhead remover on my nose and cheeks, I noticed a significant drop in blackheads. In addition, for those pores that did have â€œgunkâ€ within them, the quantity was much fewer as opposed to the times I massaged the soap onto my skin with my fingers.3) Those craters, errâ€¦. Large pores across my nose we so clean that I did notice that they diminished slightly; they were still there, but they were nowhere near as obvious as they had been. This is a huge plus in my book.4) After using the SFCB, my skin feels so baby-smooth that I could compete with my infant niece! Her Aunty Stacy could give her a run for her money! Even better, the promise made by MIRA about the improved absorption of acne medicine, lotions, creams, and so forth, is accurate. Even creams that are a bit thicker and/or serums are going to be more effective once applied to your exfoliated skin.Finally, if you follow a cleaning routine that includes the MIRA SFCB, you will notice that acne and other blemishes will be less of a problem over time. I stress, though, that you should only use the SFCB when your skin is healthy; during use, if you feel pain from the brush bristles, turn the device off immediately and give your skin a few days to heal.OverallIf you are looking for a quality-made facial cleaning brush that also has sonic technology to â€œshake the debrisâ€ from your pores, look no further than the MIRA Sonic Facial Cleaning Brush. This brush, with proper care, will last you quite a while, and is perfect for home and travel. You are able to remove the brush head to clean it easier; keeping the unit sanitary is important to ensure a proper scrub. Finally, the best aspect of the MIRA Sonic Facial Cleaning Brush is its efficacy: softer skin, better absorption of lotions/creams/medications, and over time, a reduction of pimples and other blemishes.My final say? 4 stars of 5 due to the fact that there is not a carrying bag (or other container) for packing this brush for trips. It is definitely a minor complaint, however, so do not let it discourage you from giving this great face cleaner a go!**Disclaimer: This product was sent to me by the manufacturer at no cost to review. While I do not feel that this influenced me in any capacity, I am legally obligated to disclose this fact so that you can come to your own conclusions about the merit of this analysis.**

As an avid canner, the need to label jars clearly is rather important. Sure, you can look through the glass and probably figure out what is inside each jar, yet without labeling, over time you will forget exactly WHEN that food was canned. Possibly more important, almost all canners have multiple jars to share with family and friends. A clearly written label will let them know the contents, especially for relatively â€œsmoothâ€ concoctions that may not be easily discerned (for example: mild vs. hot salsa). Enter: liquid chalk and chalkboard labels.ConstructionThere is not much to say here; included with this set are sheets of labels of various sizes and shapes. A liquid chalk pen is included along with a test swatch for preparing the aforementioned pen for use. In terms of stickiness, I feel that they are durable enough to adhere to a standard glass jar, or other non-porous surfaces that are not exposed to the elements. Once the â€œliquid chalkâ€ is dry it will not smudge or smear; a lightly damp rag will erase the text, however, allowing adjustments to test/drawings for corrections and/or reuse.UseThis is complicated, so make sure that you follow these steps EXACTLY!1) Apply pen to the desired label.2) Write the text desired.3) Allow the liquid chalk to dry, and then carefully remove the sticker from the backing sheet.4) Apply the sticker to the desired surface.5) Admire your handiwork; a glass of wine for your hard work. Cheers!Snark aside, the above steps are all that need to be used when applying the labels fresh from the package. As aforementioned, a damp cloth will clear off any text, and after the label surface is dry you can repeat steps 1-5. Also, if applied to a smooth surface, these labels will adhere well and perform admirably. Just make sure that you allow that liquid chalk to dry or you will have smudges!If I have a frustration with these labels, it lies with the liquid chalk pen. You will need to shake it many times (think of spraypaint) and press the tip down (it is spring-loaded) on the test swatch repeatedly before the liquid chalk will â€œflowâ€. While far from being a major issue, just be prepared to fuss with the pen for a while before you can use it.Final SayIf you want reusable labels that come in a variety of shapes and sizes, you really cannot go wrong with this set. The snazzy black background with the white text adds a touch of elegance to your canned jams, jellies, preserves, salsa, and a multitude of other containers. Being able to reuse them is a huge plus, also, and allows you to make corrections â€“ something not possible with â€œstandardâ€ labels. For the price you really cannot go wrong, and even the minor irritation with the liquid chalk pen is not enough to dissuade me from recommending these. Final say: 5 stars of 5.**Disclaimer: This product was sent to me by the manufacturer at no cost to review. While I do not feel that this influenced me in any capacity, I am legally obligated to disclose this fact so that you can come to your own conclusions about the merit of this analysis.**

Laptops are amazingly convenient devices. When they first arrived on the consumer market, they weighed a ton, had small screens, and very little (if any) memory storage. As with all technology, however, soon laptops were smaller and smaller, with larger screens, better battery life, and able to perform as well as, if not better than, your average desktop computer. The caveat being the portability. Yet, the very thing that makes laptops so great is also a major liability: just as easily as you transport it to a coffee house, so too can a thief transport it to their home.Thus, I am taking a look at the RUBAN Laptop Security Cable, a simple device that is very similar in design to a bicycle lock, yet specialized for the Lock slot on most laptops.ConstructionThe first thing that I noticed upon opening the RUBAN Laptop Security Cable is the heft: the tumbler head feels heavy, and if dropped on your foot would definitely hurt. The cable portion of the lock is also thick, with a rubber coating over the steel cables to ensure both comfort while handling it and strength underneath. Also included with the cable is a simple sheet with instructions; it is important that you read this carefully so that you know how to program your desired code. All-in-all, the thickness of the cable, durability of the locking mechanism, and ease of setting my personal code is definitely a huge plus for this product.UseAs with any cable-style lock, the thickness of the cable and the durability of the tumblers are all for naught if you do not secure the lock around a proper â€œballastâ€ point. Thus, when you are choosing a location to loop the cable around before you engage the lock, make sure that the chosen point is sturdy, not easy to transport, and also gives you enough length to comfortably use your laptop while locked into place. Fortunately, the cable is just over 6 feet long, so you have a good length that will enable you to find an appropriate location to secure your laptop.Going back to the setting of your personal code, the default is â€œ0000â€. In order to change it to your own four numbers, you simply depress a button on the side of the unit and dial in your choices. Once done, let go of the side button, and voila! One personalized code for your cable; the best part is that you can change it at any time should you feel that your initial security code was compromised, or even if you simply want to rotate the code periodically. The easy â€œprogrammingâ€ of the RUBAN Laptop Security Cable is just one more nice feature amongst a list of excellent design points.Final SayIf you are in the market for a laptop security cable/lock and do not want to break the bank, I can honestly state that the RUBAN Laptop Security Cable is an excellent choice. The thick cable, heavy-duty tumbler head, flexibility to customize the combination, and a length that allows you to secure your computer to larger â€œanchor pointsâ€, all work together to result in an inexpensive cable lock that will be indispensable for travel, studying in a cafÃ©, preventing your child from taking their laptop to school, and so forth. Thus, I give this product a solid 5 stars of 5.

Taking a temperature is easier than ever as technology has improved. No longer is there a glass thermometer filled with (potentially) toxic mercury, dipped in Vaseline (or KY Jelly) so that insertion for a basal temperature reading is more comfortable; digital, plastic thermometers can obtain readings in a fraction of the time with greater accuracy. Moving from doctor's offices into the consumer markets is the intra-ear infrared thermometer, a device that I recommend to any parent, especially if they have an infant. So, is the ChoiceMMed Infrared Ear Thermometer worth the price?ConstructionThe ChoiceMMed Infrared Ear Thermometer is constructed from plastic, and comes packaged with two AAA batteries, twenty disposable probe covers, and a felt drawstring storage bag. The thermometer unit is fairly lightweight, even with the batteries inserted. That being said, it is not "chintzy" or cheap, but I do think that if dropped onto a hard surface from a sufficient height, it could crack. In addition, when you remove the battery compartment cover you will notice that there are SDA/SCL pins extending from the motherboard below the battery tray (see image below). This is a bit unusual, although it does not affect the performance of the thermometer in any capacity.PerformanceEven though the instructions provided are written in horrible English, using the ChoiceMMed Infrared Ear Thermometer is easy. As the product pictures indicate, there is a grey probe cap that protects the sensor tip; simply remove the cap, push the probe head into a plastic cover, and then tug upward on the ear before inserting the tip as comfortably deep into the ear canal. Press the "Scan" button on the back and one second later you will hear a beep. VoilÃ ! The display will show the temperature of the most recent reading for fifty-five (55) seconds before timing out and turning the unit off.Since the product description indicates the other features of the ChoiceMMed Infrared Ear Thermometer, I will not delineate them here within this review. I will, however, comment upon the performance of the unit. In terms of ease of use, the CIET (for short) gets a silver star. Preventing the unit from having a perfect score is the fact that the digital display is not backlit, as well as the instructions indicating that the thermometer should be "acclimated to room ambience" before use. As such, if you pack this device for a trip and it has been in your suitcase in a hot car, you will need to let it lay in a room for about a half hour in order to ensure that the reading will be accurate. When I used the CIET I simultaneously took my temperature with my Easy@Home Infrared Thermometer, and over three tests the Ciet was consistently .1Â° F lower than the Easy@Home unit (which is very accurate).Finally, while the ease of use and unobtrusive nature of the probe placement makes this thermometer wonderful for babies and young children, the fact that ChoiceMMed does not sell replacement probe covers on Amazon means that after the twenty included are used, you will either have to improvise, risk a generic brand, or contact ChoiceMMed directly to obtain refills. I personally find this to be more hassle than it is worth, however, your mileage may vary.Final SayIf you would like to have a quick, unobtrusive thermometer in your home to help with squirmy kids, then the ChoiceMMed Infrared Ear Thermometer is an economical choice. The readings are accurate, there is a memory for the last ten readings, and it can convert between Â°F and Â°C with the simple press of a button. With soft probe covers, the thermometer is also very comfortable to use, and when combined with the one-second scan time, you really cannot go wrong. Unfortunately, the inability to purchase replacement probe covers, a display that has no backlight (meaning no quick readings without disturbing the "patient" at night), and the soft-sided drawstring storage bag combine to drag this unit from being "Must Have" to "Potential Contender". My final score: 3 stars of 5.

When out in the wilderness camping, I am aware that access to a shower is a bit of a luxury. That being said, driving a few hours in a car with another person who hasnâ€™t been able to bathe for a few days is not an experience that most people enjoy. Sure, there are camping showers that are little more than a bladder filled with water, using gravity to drip slowly over you is okay, but having access to pressurized water is better. That is where the RinseKit comes in.ConstructionThe RinseKit is constructed from durable plastic and is roughly double the size of a lunch cooler. As the pictures indicate, there is a latch on the front that keeps the kit securely closed, so carrying it around will not result in sloshing water everywhere. Upon opening the lid, you will notice that there is enough room to store the hose, spray handle, and faucet adapter, as well as the instructions (if needed). As a result, packing the RinseKit for a trip is easy due to everything being self-contained.The RinseKit is designed to hold two gallons of water, and using the faucet adapter enables a fast connection for filling the storage portion of the kit in 20 seconds (at the quickest flow). Pop off the adapter from the spigot, connect the spray head, and you will be able to use a pressurized spray of water for four minutes. Alternatively, if you do not have access to a spigot, you can still fill the RinseKit by pouring water into the fill hole on top of the storage tank. Finally, the accessories for the kit are of a decent quality, even though they are plastic (the hose is not). Since plastic spray heads have a tendency to crack easily if dropped, I strongly recommend ensuring that the person using it has the appropriate hand strength so that the pressure, while not overly strong, will not result in the handle slipping out of the hand and falling onto the ground.UseThe RinseKit, in short, does its job well. As indicated in the product description, there is no need to pump or charge the RinseKit; simply filling it is all that you need to do in order to achieve the pressurized spray. That being said, it will only last for four minutes, so you do not have a huge amount of time to utilize the RinseKit before you will need to refill it. Fortunately, the two gallon tank refills quickly, so it is not a huge issue (unless you have a line of people waiting for a quick shower).In addition to being useful for a quick shower, the RinseKit is also great for spraying off dishes, cleaning off equipment, or more mundane tasks such as watering plants. Since the RinseKit has a handle, you can carry the unit with you to take care of whichever chores needing completion. The unit is a bit bulky, and with two gallons of water it could be a bit heavy for smaller children, so I again recommend that you supervise kids while using this product.While the pressure that the unit dispenses is sufficient to rinse off sand, dirt, soap, shampoo, and so forth, do not expect it to scour embedded dirt and grime. As the name of the product implies the RinseKit is sufficient for rinsing items off; if you need to spray off siding or clean a driveway, you will want to invest in a standard powersprayer.Final SayWith the ability to be self-contained, fill quickly, and provide four minutes of spraying, you will quickly find that the RinseKit is indispensable for camping, boating, or a day at the beach. No more waiting to use a communal shower (and walking over those icky floors), simply fill up the RinseKit, connect the hose and sprayer, and voila: instant personal shower. Alternatively, the RinseKit is great for cleaning sand and saltwater off of equipment, or cleaning off food residue from a barbeque. Whatever you find a use for, the RinseKit is a surprisingly utilitarian device that will soon become a regular part of your gear when packing for an outing. The price is a bit steep, but the ability to take a shower after trekking through the woods will make camping not only cleaner, but much more pleasant, too. My final verdict: 5 stars of 5.**Disclaimer: This product was sent to me by the manufacturer at no cost to review. While I do not feel that this influenced me in any capacity, I am legally obligated to disclose this fact so that you can come to your own conclusions about the merit of this analysis.**

With the advent of smart watches, the ability to have Dick Tracyâ€™s communicator watch is finally at hand! True, the digital watches of the 80s were the first step toward living the crime fighter dream, but when it came to doing more than addition & subtraction (Iâ€™m looking at you, Casio Calculator Watch!), they simply could not pull it off. So after careful consideration, I grabbed my yellow trench coat & fedora, $360, and purchased the LG UrbaneÂ® Smart Watch. Two days later I had the chic watch in-hand, and gleefully went about setting it up. Thus, without further ado, here is my review!Quick note: I opted for the black strap/silver face version of the LG UrbaneÂ®.ConstructionThe LG UrbaneÂ® arrives in a nice box and includes the watch, charging base, and USB cable. The watch itself feels durable, with a large screen that is bright and easy to read. As with all new electronic devices, I placed the watch on its charger to top it off while I perused the instruction manual. It only took about thirty minutes to charge it completely upon arrival; from completely drained it only takes about an hour to recharge, a truly speedy timeframe. The leather wristband is a bit stiff, but it will become more flexible over time. The watchstrap has many holes cut into it, more than a traditional watch, and thus offers a comfortable fit for a variety of wrist circumferences. This aspect is especially great for me as I have always had terribly skinny wrists (7in around); with the UrbaneÂ® I am able to cinch the watch snugly against my wrist, ensuring both the watch not spinning around my arm and proper contact for the fitness tracker.After owning this watch for nearly two full months, the contrast stitching on the watchband has not started to fray, and the two loops that you feed the end of the strap through to keep them from sticking out are still in-place and have no damage. In addition, even with no screen protector the LG UrbaneÂ® looks brand new still, with the only cosmetic issue being the lack of shine around the silver face. There are no scratches, nicks, or other signs of wear-and-tear, which is amazing considering how brutal I am on watches. Definitely impressive!Sure, It Looks Great, but How Does It Perform?First and foremost, FOLLOW THE SETUP INSTRUCTIONS TO THE LETTER! It is absolutely imperative that you download the Android Watch app to your phone/tablet and initiate the pairing through that software. If not, the watch will not be able to sync with your phone, resulting in the incorrect time being displayed and other issues. I made the mistake of not following the instructions and had to factory reset the watch in order for my phone to recognize it. Donâ€™t make my mistake!Once setup, the UrbaneÂ® will scour your device and copy compatible apps to the watch. Paypal, as an example, will allow you to browse items to purchase, and if you wish to check your transaction history the watch will open the app on your cell phone so that you can see more detail. In fact, whenever the watch is not able to display an app, it will tell you that it is opening the corresponding app on your phone/tablet. While this tends to happen more often than not, I did not find this to be inconvenient.Whenever you receive a phone call, the watch will display the caller ID and vibrate; likewise whenever you receive a text or email, you will be able to see the contents, but not any attached images. App messages will also appear, and with the P-OLED display and tweakable font size settings, you will be able to see everything clearly. The Urbaneâ€™sÂ® screen is simply beautiful, and it can be dimmed if it is too bright (this can be the case in a movie theatre), or even made brighter if you want to use the Flashlight function!The Fitness Tracker enables you to monitor your steps taken, distance traveled, and heart rate, and then track this information to approximate calories burned. Need to set a reminder? The watch allows you to do that with its Google Voice software, even enabling you to set a reminder for a specific place through the GPS capability. Thus, if you are running errands and think of something that is not on your list, simply set an alert for that item to pop up when you are in the store! Convenient!Some other features include:1) Calculator: I guess CasioÂ® left their mark!2) Navigation: use it for GPS information if you need directions!3) Say â€œOk Googleâ€ and give a command for the watch to perform, such as sending a text, placing a call, or setting an alarm. No hands needed.4) Navigating the screens is easy: swipe up, down, left, or right.5) Contacts: swipe right twice and browse your contacts list to make a call.6) Download a wide variety of faces for the watch, including weather radar, Pac-Man, and more; the Android store means more than a handful of faces (as opposed to the Apple Watch).7) Water resistant: wear it in the shower or while doing dishes and donâ€™t worry about frying it.The battery life is phenomenal; I can get about 24 hours of use out of it from one charge, a little more if I am not fiddling around on it much. The heavy-duty processor included with the UrbaneÂ® also means that it is not clunky. I have not experienced any lag or other performance issues.Final SayIf you want an Android watch that looks professional, is easy to read, has a whole host of features including a fitness tracker, GPS and alarm settings, weather tracking, and more, then the LG UrbaneÂ® is definitely one that you should consider. Cheaper (by far!) than the Apple watch, the UrbaneÂ® is sleek, sexy, and amazingly convenient to use. Whether I am checking the time and temperature, skimming an incoming text message, or checking my pulse, the LG UrbaneÂ® performs flawlessly. Plus, with the open Android market, there are tons of apps and features being added every day!So, with this said, I give the LG UrbaneÂ® a solid 5 out of 5 stars, and recommend this investment. You will not be disappointed!

Task lighting is something that can be amazingly frustrating to obtain. Whether it is too bright, not flexible enough, or just not able to deliver the amount of light that you need, finding a gooseneck lamp that does what it needs to is a hunt at times. Enter: the IvationÂ® Multipurpose Gooseneck 7-LED Dimmable Clip Light with Stand. With a long name like that, it has to be good, right? Letâ€™s settle in and see what it can do.ConstructionThe IvationÂ® Multipurpose Gooseneck 7-LED Dimmable Clip Light with Stand (or IMG7, to save my hands), is a solidly-built task lamp that enables the user to set it up in a variety of ways. One of the first things that you will notice is that the lamp can be USB-powered or run on three AAA batteries (not included). In addition, the lamp can be securely clipped onto the edge of a surface or balanced on its base by flipping out the silver side arms. Finally, a button on the base of the lamp head controls the lighting at a touch: simply hold it down to select the desired setting and release, then continue with your task.FunctionAs a task light, the IMG7 functions well. It is plenty bright enough to illuminate the smallest of objects, enabling you to work on painting miniatures or thread a needle, for example. The gooseneck is flexible enough to move into a desired position easily, yet strong enough to remain in place. This, of course, is a hallmark of a good gooseneck lamp, and the IMG7 thus far fits the bill. When clipped to the edge of a table it remains in place securely, and the clip has a rubber padding that prevents damage to the table surface, in addition to helping the lamp remain in place.The only area that I found to be problematic involved using the lamp base as a stand; with the arms flipped out on the side it remained in place and also would not tip over in most instances. However, if you do not have batteries in the base and are using the USB cable with the stand feature, tipping the headlamp down low at an angle did result in the base shifting and the lamp tipping over. While three AAA batteries do not have a huge amount of mass, I did find that using them as the power source while the lamp was free-standing did result in the lamp being a bit more stable. As such, if you want the lamp as a free-standing unit, I recommend using it when you do not need to manipulate the neck much for a complicated task. In that instance, you are better clipping it to something.Finally, while the power cable included is USB (and thus, can be plugged into an outlet with an adapter â€“ not included), the end that plugs into the lamp is a pin plug. As a result, if you lose the cable, you have to buy a specialized replacement. I wish that the lamp had a micro-USB port for charging, thus enabling the average consumer to utilize a variety of cables about the house, rather than having to buy a specialty (and potentially more expensive than it is worth) secondary/replacement cable.Final SayThe IvationÂ® Multipurpose Gooseneck 7-LED Dimmable Clip Light with Stand is utilitarian: it is flexible, able to be dimmed to virtually any light level needed, and can run on either batteries or the included USB power cable. In addition, you have the ability to use it as a free-standing lamp or clipped to a surface, dramatically increasing the functionality versus a clip-only gooseneck light. Thus, for the average consumer, this lamp is going to be a perfect task lamp for a variety of tasks, whether reading, computing, or crafting.All of this being said, I stand by my earlier statement: I wish that the USB cable did not have a pin plug for the lamp, and rather a much more common micro-USB plug. This would dramatically increase its usability, as you wouldnâ€™t have to worry about 1) losing the aforementioned pin plug cable, and 2) buying the properly-sized pin-plug cable should you wish to replace/add a secondary one for another room. For me this is an important aspect of the functionality, and I removed one star from the overall ranking as a result. Thus, my final say: 4 stars of 5.**Disclaimer: This product was sent to me by the manufacturer at no cost to review. While I do not feel that this influenced me in any capacity, I am legally obligated to disclose this fact so that you can come to your own conclusions about the merit of this analysis.**

Bluetooth headsets are one of those conveniences that you take for granted. While I loved my [[ASIN: B001DETCUG PlantronicsÂ® 520 Headset]] (which I have had for several years), the technology on it was becoming outdated and the sound quality was noticeably inferior to even my Bluetooth speakers. Thus, the quest for a new, modern, and functional headset began. In short order the aLLreLiÂ® K6 Bluetooth V4.1 came into my purview, and thus, here is my review of it.Before I get started, I want to point out that I am using this headset with my [[ASIN: B00IZ1XA94 Samsung Galaxy S5 (G900A)]] cell phone, running Android 4.4.2 (KitKat).ConstructionAs indicated in the product images, the aLLreLiÂ® K6 Bluetooth V4.1 Headset comes neatly packaged with the headset, instructions, and charging cable. What is not shown is the variety of ear pieces that are also included, enabling you to adjust the size/style to suit your preference (and thus, comfort). The headset arrives with the white, mid-size silicone earpiece on by default (you can see it on the box picture); included are two more silicone pieces, one smaller and one larger, and three form fabric covers like those on earbuds. Swapping these out is easy: simply pop the silicone piece off and replace it with the desired size with or without the black fabric covering.The charging cable is a standard micro-USB connection, so you can either use the one included with the package or any other cable that you already have on-hand. The headset arrived nearly fully charged, and while this will most likely vary among purchasers, it only took about twenty minutes to reach a full charge after I plugged it in. A small light appears at the base of the earpiece that changes from red to blue to indicate a full battery level.Finally, there are two sets of buttons on the headset, the first being the volume control on the back of the earpiece, and the second being a button that is actually on the round hinge of the microphone (opposite side of the silicone/foam-covered earpiece). The volume button is a paddle that you flip up or down to adjust the level, and the button on the hinge is used to power on/off the headset and also for syncing with your device. When you are finished with the headset and have it plugged in to charge, you can twist the boom mic so that the unit is flat with the earpiece facing inward toward the back of the headset. This helps to keep the earpieces clean and also prevent breakage due to the mic sticking out.FunctionSyncing the aLLreLiÂ® K6 Bluetooth V4.1 was easy as pie: while the instructions indicate the password to use for setup, my phone did not require me to enter it. This, of course, will vary between devices, so be sure to reference the instruction manual, written in English and German, should yours prompt a password entry. Two great features: the silicone piece (which I replaced) was VERY comfortable, and the headset was comfortable and not clunky. I was not a fan of this style of headset beforehand, and the lightweight feel surprised me. I wore the headset for a full day (eight hours) and never felt irritation or discomfort. In addition, the headset remained fully charged. I took it off and left it on my end table overnight without re-charging it; the next day when I put it on I realized that the K6 had turned off automatically to conserve power. I turned it back on and it worked like a champ; all-in-all I was able to get nearly a full week of functionality in stand-by mode without needing to recharge it. Talk time was approximately 8 hours, including playing music for one hour as well.The sound quality of the K6 is really where the awesomeness of this unit lays. The aLLreLiÂ® description indicates that it is â€œHDâ€, and I can attest that this is very accurate. Talking on the phone was crystal clear, and the volume controls enable you to adjust to a loudness that is much better than other models out there. I found myself lowering the volume on several occasions; while I am not hearing impaired, this headset could benefit someone who is. I never had any problems hearing a call or song, even if that person was in a noisy environment. My conversations were clear, also. The K6 boasts of noise cancellation and delivers in spades. I was in a storm walking back into a building and the person on the other end heard me clearly.The default incoming call sound is Wagnerâ€™s â€œRide of the Valkyriesâ€, which made me smile the first time that I heard it; unfortunately, it is also the source of one issue with this headset: the incoming ring is not loud at all, and I found myself belatedly realizing that a call was coming in a few times. Finally, the first headset that I received died after the first use; it worked great for a day, but when I came back the next day it would not turn on. Indeed, when I plugged it in the light indicating the charge did not illuminate. I received a replacement headset and have had no issues thus far. I am chalking up the first headset to a glitch at this point; should my second headset also do the same thing, I will update this review.Final SayIf you are looking for a headset with amazing sound quality and a great battery life, the aLLreLiÂ® K6 Bluetooth V4.1 Headset is going to give you the most bang for your buck. Both music and voice are crystal clear, the headset is lightweight and comfortable, and the battery life is amazing. Little things, such as being able to swap out earpieces to suit your comfort level and being able to swivel the mic so that the headset lays flat add a touch of refinement that only increases my love of this model. In short, if you want a solid headset that will perform for ages, looks good, and can charge with any micro-USB cable, buy the aLLreLiÂ® K6 â€“ you will not be disappointed. Final say: 5 stars!

I have lupus, more specifically systemic lupus erythematosus, a disease with ride-ranging effects and no known cure. In fact, the FDA approval of the lupus medication BenlystaÂ® in 2011 marked the first time since 1955 that a new treatment for lupus came to be; in the interim, patients deal with the myriad symptoms through a combination of therapies. This, of course, brings me to my review: VITAMINSÂ® shampoo, designed to promote hair growth for women who have experienced loss/thinning. As you have no doubt surmised, all forms of lupus are known to cause hair loss in some patients, and while not as horrific as other aspects of the disease, having beautiful hair is very important for self-confidence, as well as a positive mental outlook, possibly more so than having scars, rashes, or other noticeable physical symptoms.Presentation, Packaging, and AppearanceVITAMINSÂ® shampoo comes in a standard plastic bottle, however it is a bit thinner than others that you may see in stores. The shampoo itself is clear and of a decent consistency, not too watery and not as thick as a conditioner. The lather is rich; a little bit goes a VERY long way, which is especially beneficial as each bottle costs $40. The smell is pleasant and â€œearthyâ€, a cross between sandalwood, roses, and coconut. After worked into a lather, the shampoo is pleasantly cool on the scalp, although milder than some eucalyptus oil-derived products. All-in-all the packaging and physical aspects of VITAMINSÂ® shampoo are professional, pleasant, and does not sacrifice too much space in the valuable real estate of a bath/shower.EfficacyThe bread & butter of VITAMINSÂ® shampoo is its claim that the ingredients used will promote hair growth; thus, without meeting this criteria, VITAMINSÂ® would become nothing more than an overpriced shampoo. So, does it work?As a result of the thinning of my hair due to my disease, it wasnâ€™t unusual for me to see decently-sized clumps coming out with every shower. Drano is a regular purchase for our household as a result. Thus, it was with a great deal of hope, not to mention skepticism, which I gladly accepted the opportunity to test out this product. So the burning question, then: does it work?The short answer? Yes. The long answer? Most likely.When I first started using this product to assess its performance, I was careful to include my boyfriendâ€™s â€œanalysisâ€ of my hair to curtail the â€œPlacebo Effectâ€. Even with skepticism, it is still possible to succumb to inflated perceptions while using a product when you are desperate for results. Thus, some of the opinion listed above is based upon his input.For the first week, showering every other day, while my hair felt clean and my scalp had a cool sensation even a couple of hours post-application, I really did not notice any difference with my hair. By week two, however, my hair felt thicker and had more body. Week three further expanded this result, and my boyfriend said that running his fingers through my hair he definitely noticed a change. Since I have medium-long hair that is all one length, I was able to check for new growth relatively easily; sliding my hands through it just now resulted in finding several strands that were shorter than the hairs around it. While some of these are no doubt from â€œregularâ€ growth patterns, the sheer number have me convinced that VITAMINSÂ® shampoo really does work.The manufacturerâ€™s description indicates that stopping this shampoo will return my â€œproductiveâ€ hair follicles back to their dormant activity. While I have not run out of the shampoo nor stopped using it long enough to verify the veracity of this statement, I will admit that I am disappointed in this fact. Being disabled, I cannot afford the price of this shampoo; even if I could, I wince at the price. Yes, my hair is important to me, but the cost of each bottle makes me want to embrace my â€œnaturalâ€ hair and just live with the painful effects of my lupus.In the EndVITAMINSÂ® shampoo surprised me; it truly does work. Combined with a formulation that only uses a small amount for each shampoo, the pleasant smell, and the undeniable effect of having thicker hair, I wholeheartedly recommend this product for anyone who wants gorgeous hair. Note: this product is not a miracle hair-grower and maximizing the benefits of this shampoo will require time and continued usage. Thus, due to this aspect as well as the $40 price tag that is a smidgen too rich for my blood, I am happy to grant 4 stars to VITAMINSÂ® shampoo by Nourish BeautÃ©. In short, if you can afford to shell out $40 on a bottle of shampoo and will be diligent with its usage, you too can have thicker, shiny, and pleasant-smelling hair.**Disclaimer: This product was sent to me by the manufacturer at no cost to review. While I do not feel that this influenced me in any capacity, I am legally obligated to disclose this fact so that you can come to your own conclusions about the merit of this analysis.**

Iâ€™m siiiiiiiiiiiiiiinginâ€™ in the rainâ€¦ and scaring the pets! Who doesnâ€™t love being outside in the rain, with the smell of the newly-cleansed Earth, the grey skies inviting you to go home and curl up in a blankie, and sipping a hot beverage or bowl of soup? While tolerances for allowing the droplets to fall freely upon your hair/person/clothing varies, a rainstorm is a unique phenomenon in its ability to alter mood AND the Earth. That said, for those of us who do not enjoy getting wet and/or are dressed up and want to protect your hair/makeup/clothing, a way to prevent the rain from hitting the aforementioned items is necessary.While there are a variety of items that can help you with protection from the elements, at issue here is the Big Ben Automatic Umbrella. Being relatively compact, this umbrella is designed for easy portability and rigid function. So, without further ado, here is my review.ConstructionThe Big Ben Automatic Umbrella is just that: a compact umbrella with a cover sleeve that pops open when you depress the button on the handgrip. It opens fully within two seconds, and is the size of a standard umbrella; you can fit two people underneath, as long as they are not obese. When finished, you pull down on the central slide, use the attached strip of fabric to streamline the umbrella, and slide it back into its protective sleeve.UseNot much to say: open the umbrella and hold it over your head to protect you from rain, snow, or sunshine. It repels water well and fits neatly into a tote bag, backpack, or large purse. While many umbrellas have sleeve covers, the unusual aspect of the Big Ben Automatic Umbrella is that the sleeve has a long handle attached to it. This strip of fabric is long enough that you can sling the umbrella over your shoulder; a tensioner that slides along the handle enables you to tighten the sleeve around the umbrella and thus prevent it from falling out of the holder.The only issue that I experienced is that the spring-loaded tension that enables the â€œautomaticâ€ function is a bit stiff and makes it a bit difficult to close the umbrella. While I was able to close it successfully, when my fingers act up from my lupus this aspect of the Big Ben Automatic Umbrella may pose difficulties. I am going to assume that it is solely my umbrella that has this problem, so hopefully other umbrellas will not present this issue to other customers.Final SayIf you want a stylish umbrella that includes a long handle to carry it about, opens at the touch of a button, and is compact enough to fit neatly into a variety of storage bags/backpacks, I recommend the Big Ben Automatic Umbrella. While closing it requires a bit more force that I expected, the umbrella serves its purpose and is well-made. Thus, I give it 4 stars.**Disclaimer: This product was sent to me by the manufacturer at no cost to review. While I do not feel that this influenced me in any capacity, I am legally obligated to disclose this fact so that you can come to your own conclusions about the merit of this analysis.**

Mosquitos, being the disease-spreading vector that they are, are absolute heathens. Recent studies have shown that certain blood types are more prone to attracting them, and as one of the people with the corresponding blood type, I abhor summer evenings. Living near the Missouri River (which is less than a full city block from our back yard) means that any time outside results in me batting bugs out of the way, avoiding water, and generally scratching my skin around the newly-minted red sucker bites left from the small bugs from hell.Enter: the Kinven Mosquito Repellent Bracelet. Constructed of nylon with a mesh â€œholderâ€ attached to it, it claims that the malignant carriers of West Nile Virus are repelled due to the combination of â€œ100% Natural Ingredientsâ€. So, does it work?ConstructionThe bracelet itself is soft and doesnâ€™t irritate the flesh, and loading the repellent packets into the mesh holder is not rocket science. After securing the braceletâ€™s Velcro around my wrist, I was ready-to-go within 5 minutes of opening the package. I should note that the instructions indicate that the packs have a shelf life of 3 years, and each one is designed to give you 15 days of protection. The ingredients listed:CitronellaGeraniumPeppermintLavenderEfficacyAs anyone who has ever lit a citronella candle knows, their efficacy is dubious at worst, and â€œmildâ€ at best. After going outside with my new Kinven Mosquito Repellent Bracelet, I went about my business of tidying up my garden and generally building up a sweat (to better attract those vile little buggers). An hour later, my arm was covered with sucker bites. I even had a mosquito walking over the bracelet, obviously nonplussed by the â€œall naturalâ€ ingredients that are purported to prevent sucker bites.I tried again the second night, and again, the mosquitos landed on the bracelet and generally made a mockery of my futile attempts to ward against them. True, I am not likely to develop malaria in the wilds of South Dakota, but being able to enjoy an evening outside without developing a cornucopia of insect bites along my very pale skin is a simple enough desire.In The EndLong story short: if you want effective mosquito repellent, get something with DEET in it. While the Kinven Mosquito Repellent Bracelet does smell pleasant, it does absolutely nothing to help you if you are unfortunate enough to be a mosquito magnet in the first place. In the interim, I have tossed my Kinven Bracelet in the trash; if I had paid for this I would return it ASAP.Play it safe, people, and use bug spray with DEET. Not only will you stop mosquitos, other nasties like biting flies will leave you alone, too. Final say: 2 stars of five, and only offering the bonus star for looks.**Disclaimer: This product was sent to me by the manufacturer at no cost to review. While I do not feel that this influenced me in any capacity, I am legally obligated to disclose this fact so that you can come to your own conclusions about the merit of this analysis.**

For anyone who has a long-haired cat, you quickly learn that, while it is a cute fuzzball, hairballs become somewhat routine. If you have the added bonus of a thick fur coat, the other problem is helping your cat to remain cool during the summer months. While grooming cats can sometimes require the use of a full set of maille armor, falconer gloves, and the wish that you could give your pet Benadryl beforehand in the hopes of knocking it out, it is a necessary evil. Fortunately, our monster cat is sweet and has never bit anyone (nor do I think that he ever will), and so we were elated to shave down Smoke the cat's belly.Or, at least, that was the plan. After fifteen minutes of frustration, Smoke's belly looks more like the result of a drunken bet gone awry. And, before you think that it was the cat who caused this to happen, that was not the case.It was the Pet MagasinÂ® Pet Clipper Kit.ConstructionThe hard plastic case with egg crate foam feels durable enough and has plenty of room for the included grooming supplies (all of which are shown in the product images). The clipper itself feels fairly heavy, and has a screw on the side that allows you to adjust the power output; the machine oil that was used on the clipper blades somehow leaked and smudged the sticker next to the power adjustment screw and blurred the instructions. A small metal "key" for the power adjustment screw is the only other maintenance accessory than the cleaning brush.The clipper heads are the first source of frustration. In terms of their construction, they all look like those found in "human" clipper kits. Indeed, the metal plate on the back of each gives you the impression that they are of a high quality. This is misleading. The tips of each comb are sharp, and poke into your fingers when you are attempting to attach it to the clipper head. The biggest problem?The comb adjustment heads are not wide enough; in short, THEY DON'T FIT THE CLIPPER HEAD!UseAfter plugging in the unit, I grabbed the shortest guide comb and attempted to attach it to the clipper. It would not fit; the back of the head has metal "hooks" that look like they should snap onto the back of the blade assembly, but this is not the case. After fiddling around with it, I consulted the instruction manual to see if there was some trick to getting the guide combs into place; there were no directions, illustrations, or any other explanation of how these are supposed to fit onto the clipper. Even after my boyfriend fiddled with it and appeared to have the guide in place, once I turned the clipper on it vibrated off.Giving up on the guides, I opted to just use the clipper blades to trim the fur off of the cat's belly. After making a few passes there was a *thud* noise as though something dropped. Not seeing anything, I continued attempting to shave the cat with little success. When I went to adjust the clipper, I noticed that one of the screws holding the upper clipper blade in place had fallen out; no wonder I was unable to shave anything! Fortunately, I located the screw, put it back in, and was able to continue with the grooming session.The end result of navigating a cat's belly, fighting with the Pet MagasinÂ® Clippers, and using a fur rake was a noticeably thinner cat who should be much cooler come summer. That being said, his belly looks like he lost a bet and allowed a buddy to shave him. The clippers were able to clip his fur, but never in a smooth pass. I had to use short "strokes" in order for the blades to cut the fur properly. In fact, I was able to remove more fur by using the undercoat rake than through shaving the belly.Final SayWhile the low price of this clipper set may seem enticing, with guide combs that won't fit/stay in place over the blades, screws that fall out during use, and an ineffectual cutting capability, you are better off spending more money on a higher-quality kit. Or, barring that, take your cat to the groomers. If I purchased this with my own money, I can assure you that I would return it. Final say: 2 stars.**Disclaimer: This product was sent to me by the manufacturer at no cost to review. While I do not feel that this influenced me in any capacity, I am legally obligated to disclose this fact so that you can come to your own conclusions about the merit of this analysis.**

Jewelry is a highly personal thing, something that jewelers are all-to-willing to tackle through their designs. The Zodiac Necklace from RUINUO exemplifies this mantra through their Stainless Steel Zodiac Pendants, allowing you to choose a piece that matches either your Zodiac, or that of a friend or loved one. But, are they worth the price?ConstructionAs indicated in the product description and images, the RUINUO Zodiac Constellation Necklace, or RZCN to prevent hand cramps from typing that out, comes with a cubic zirconia-laden zodiac constellation traced in black that is superimposed over a stylized cross; the name of the constellation is engraved at the bottom of the cross and also traced with black to ensure readability. In addition, there are two necklace options; one is a stainless steel rolo chain, while the other is black satin with a silver lobster clasp and jump ring. Overall the design is unique, even if the constellation is a bit cramped with the â€œstarsâ€ being relatively closer together than in reality.FunctionItâ€™s a necklace. It wraps around your neck with the length of the chain causing the pendant to rest against your chest. I chose the black satin, and the pendant dangled just below my collarbone. The measurements are:ChainsStainless steel: 21â€ (inches), or roughly 54cm (centimeters)Satin cord: 19â€, or roughly 48cmPendantLength: 2â€Widest Point: 1.25â€As you can see by the measurements, this is a rather large pendant. While I wouldnâ€™t call it gaudy, it is something that will dwarf most necklaces. If you wear more than one necklace, this one will most likely â€œdrown outâ€ the other. That being said, the stainless steel chain and the pendant itself are of very good quality, and with proper care should last a while.The satin cord has considerably cheaper quality jump rings for the clasp, and it has already snagged a few times on my other necklace. If you prefer a black cord for this pendant, you may want to have a replacement on standby.OverallThis is a nice necklace that allows you to proudly display your zodiac constellation, or as a nifty gift for another. The pendant is a smidgen large, however, and may look awkward with certain outfits. That being said, using it as a hanger for your rearview mirror is a good second option if the necklace ends up being too large for your taste.The quality is good, and overall the necklace is a neat piece of jewelry. I just wish that the included satin cord wasn't so lousy. Final say: 4 stars.**Disclaimer: This product was sent to me by the manufacturer at no cost to review. While I do not feel that this influenced me in any capacity, I am legally obligated to disclose this fact so that you can come to your own conclusions about the merit of this analysis.**

Mixing up a drink after a hard day, to celebrate with friends, or as an accompaniment to a fine meal is something of an art. Sure, you can argue that pouring alcohol and various other ingredients into a glass is as much an art as video game animations are (Iâ€™m sorry Roger Egbert, you were wrong), but the fact remains that in order to get the flavor you want you need to follow a recipe. Just as important as having the best ingredients you can afford, so too is having the proper bartending tools. Fortunately, TeiKisÂ® has a very competent all-in-one set for every budding connoisseur.ConstructionSince the product description lists all of the items included, I will not delineate them here. I will, however, comment upon the quality of the items. Overall each of the included pieces are well-made, with no burrs, splinters, rust spots, or other issues. Measurements are clearly marked on the glass and jiggers, and the glass opening fits inside of the Boston Shaker neatly so that you can shake up your drinks. The set cleans up easily, although I recommend against putting the muddler in the dishwasher, as it will dry out the wood during the drying cycle. Aside from lacking a sugar spoon for absinthe, this set has everything that you need to make virtually every mixed cocktail in existence (including those not invented yet!).UseSince the primary function of this set is for alcohol, mixers, and other ingredients to be poured into it, I could dumb this review down and say that the containers hold liquids well. Short of springing a leak, the TeiKisÂ® Cocktail Set will be able to hold liquids/mashes with no issue. However, that oversimplifies the uses for this set, so I will elaborate a bit further.This set is great for both experienced and newbie bartenders, the casual at-home drink, or for a dedicated lush. The glass included in the set not only indicates measurements on the sides, but includes recipes for a Manhattan, Margarita, Bloody Mary, Daiquiri, and/or Dry Martini. The double-sided jigger is nice for quick measuring, while the individual jiggers are perfect for exact one and two shot measurements. The Hawthorn Strainer is very solid, and not like the cheap models you often find in sets. The body of the strainer is heavy and the stainless steel coils are thick and will not warp easily.Finally, while the muddler is made from a lightweight wood, it is smooth and comfortable to use. The spoon is also heavy duty, and short of intentionally trying to bend it, I do not see it breaking or otherwise being ruined through regular (even daily) use. The masher end has a one inch (1â€) diameter, and while not huge, should be sufficient for most mashing requirements. If you are working on a larger quantity, you may want to run it through a blender; otherwise mash it in small batches.Final SayWhether hosting a party or for a party of one, this is a great set to help anyone make the perfect cocktail. No more eyeballing; you can control whether you want a â€œheavy-handedâ€ pour while still maintaining the flavor of the drink that you have in mind. With the high quality of the items included in this set, you will get a lot of use out of it. If not for yourself, the TeiKisÂ® Cocktail Set will make a wonderful gift for a friend or family member. Just remember: drink responsibly!**Disclaimer: This product was sent to me by the manufacturer at no cost to review.
