While I do not feel that this influenced me in any capacity, I am legally obligated to disclose this fact so that you can come to your own conclusions about the merit of this analysis.**

I remember the first time that I heard Cranius; I was bopping around YouTube and came across a blurry video of an Alliance mage PvPing in Arathi Basin. The wonderful lyrics of "Big Blue Dress" played while a human mage bounced around while nuking everything in sight. When the chorus came with three gnomes singing in accompaniment, I was hooked. The awesome music and wry lyrics that poked fun at the many elements of World of Warcraft were masterfully interwoven into a tapestry of pure awesomeness. Oh yea, and unlike other popular YouTube WoW videos (I'm looking at you, Nimh), Cranius can actually sing!While being a gamer and playing World of Warcraft adds another layer of comprehension to the songs on this CD, it is not necessary. Cranius's songs have a blend of folk, rock, and a touch of country musical styles, primarily played through acoustic & electric guitars and drums. Cranius himself is the vocalist, although you can hear a trio of higher-pitched backup singers during some chorus lines. The recordings of these songs are clear, with the singing being audible and clearly understood.The songs on this CD are few, but each one will make you smile and laugh. Whether Cranius is poking fun at male mages having to wear the eponymous "Big Blue Dress", being ganked by a high-level player while you are minding your own business on your low-level toon, or singing a sad ballad about the ruins in Darrowshire, I can guarantee that you will be humming each one after listening to this CD. The songs are also amazing in that they draw in everyone, regardless of your normal tastes in music. Oh, and gearing up your male mage character will never be the same again.So, if you would like some awesome music to play while you are kickin' ass in World of Warcraft, mentally wishing that you could summon a fireball to nuke that rude driver while stuck in traffic, exercising, or cleaning your home, "Big Blue Dress" is a great addition to any record collection. The catchy songs and clever writing will leave you hooked and wanting more. Definitely a 5 star CD.

Most cell phones have some sort of camera; likewise, most people have a phone with a camera that is on or near their person all of the time. This omnipresent capability to photograph life has given the world the ability to see things through the unbiased â€œeyeâ€ of the camera. Thus, for the first time in history humanity is documenting its existence thoroughly and in amazing detail, with all of it being saved for posterity. With this philosophical drivel out of the way, cell phone cameras have one major drawback: you cannot change the lens.ConstructionThe YOPOÂ® Universal Clip Lens LQ-001 is comprised of an aluminum clip, a felt bag, lens caps, and the eponymous lenses. The YUCL set contains three lenses: one each of a wide angle, macro, and fish eye lens. As the product name indicates, the lenses screw into a spring-loaded clip (think of a clothespin) that opens to clamp onto a cell phone in a manner that places the YOPOÂ® lens over that of the cell phone. The inside portion of the clamp that rests against the phone have rubber gaskets in order to prevent damage to the cell phone lens and/or touch screen.UseThe phone that I tested this set with is the Samsung Galaxy S5.So, at this point I would elaborate upon my impressions of how well the lenses function. After all, the premise behind their use makes a world of sense, and clipping a lens onto my phone is childâ€™s play. Here is the problem: I was only able to test out the fish eye and macro lenses. Of those two, only the fish eye lens produced the desired result. The macro lens was blurry, no matter the distance of the subject or the settings on my phone. Insofar as the fish eye view goes, every other picture resulted in a black arc covering the top of the frame; I moved and readjusted the lens in every position that I could manage and I was unable to get rid of that black arc.In regard to being unable to use the wide angle lens, there is the design flaw. As aforementioned, the lens bases are threaded in order to screw them into the spring clip (the wide angle lens is too narrow and instead screws over the macro lens). I tried and tried to screw the wide angle lens into the macro lens base with no success. The overall height of the male and female threading is very short, meaning that there is not a lot of room for error. In addition, trying to twist the wide angle lens by finding a starting point on the macro lens is nearly impossible due to the threads being the thickness of a hair. I finally got so angry that I packed up the entire set; when you anticipate being able to use the lenses to achieve three different views, only to be able to see with one lens that also has issues, there is no point in clogging up my bag by carrying this set around.The other problems that I encountered had to do with the portion of the clip that rests against my touchscreen. While the YUCL did not damage my screen, it did interfere with my ability to navigate through my menus by either slowing the input detection of my finger or by blocking my display so that I could not see my camera settings. Finally, the clip also partially blocked the flash, resulting in odd lighting results (and the shadow of the lens appearing in my pictures).Final SayI wish that I could say that the YOPOÂ® Universal Clip Lens LQ-001 Set is all of the goofy fun that it should be. Unfortunately, there are too many flaws; the sturdy construction of the clips and lens bodies are ruined by the inadequate threading and a design that ultimately results in poor pictures (or none at all in the case of the wide angle lens). I know that it could just be the design of my phone that contributes to the pictures having shadows or the view being blurry. That said, not being able to screw the wide angle lens into the macro lens is just a bad design and has nothing to do with my phone. In the end, I cannot recommend this set at all, and I strongly recommend that you look for one with a larger lens and/or better design that wonâ€™t make you want to chuck the entire affair across the room. My analysis? 2 stars out of 5.**Disclaimer: This product was sent to me by the manufacturer at no cost to review. While I do not feel that this influenced me in any capacity, I am legally obligated to disclose this fact so that you can come to your own conclusions about the merit of this analysis.**

While I feel that women carry around way too much stuff in their bags, even with just the bare necessities they are pretty much indispensable. In order to prevent me from loading my handbag with entirely too much stuff, I make sure that I use the smallest model available. Recently though, I realized that I needed a smidgen more room, so I opted to try out the Avber Western Style Cow Leather Cross Studded Shoulder Bag.ConstructionThe Avber Western Style Cow Leather Cross Studded Shoulder Bag, or ASB to save my hands from developing carpal tunnel, is a soft leather purse with an interchangeable shoulder strap or wrist loop. There is one main compartment with two open pockets on one side and a zippered pocket on the other. The bag is large enough to hold most wallets, a checkbook, pens/pencils, makeup, or other items. The two open pouches on one side of the main compartment are wide enough to hold most cell/smartphones. The zippered pocket can hold smaller items, such as a Swiss Army Knife, eye drops, nail file, asthma inhaler, and other knick-knacks.The metal fleurs-de-lis ornaments on the outer body of the ASB are securely attached, and during the past two weeks I did not experience any issues such as snagging or other damage related to these. In relation to the construction, there are two portions that I feel detract from the overall design of the bag. These are:1. The zipper for the main compartment does not connect to one end (the base of the zipper), and instead is unattached and hangs over the side of the purse (imagine if your jeans had the base of the zipper [when unzipped it is where the grasp is] not sewn into the jeans, instead allowing the base of it to hang loose inside of your jeans). While the end of the zipper strip gives you a grip to open and close the bag, it does mean that there is a small opening at the end of the compartment where the zipper is not attached. Thus, even if the bag is zipped shut, it is still possible for smaller items to slip outside of the bag should it be upended. Granted, this is likely to only occur during specific types of falls, but the bigger issue of possible damage to the zipper because it hangs over the edge of the bag is another potential problem.2. The shoulder strap for the bag is not one contiguous piece of leather, rather, it has several pieces sewn together. For the price of the bag, especially considering that even â€œcheapâ€ purses at WalMart have shoulder straps with no seams along the length, it really detracts from the overall appearance. It is especially puzzling, as the rest of the seams and fabric construction of the bag are well-done and professional.FunctionWhile the ASB is large enough to hold a great deal of items, you are limited in the sub-compartment department (say that three times fast!). As a result, you have to cram everything into one of four pockets, meaning that you will be shuffling through the bag frequently when you are trying to find smaller items. In addition, the pockets for your cell phone and/or other electronic gadgets are not overly deep, and may stick out above the top of the bag altogether, preventing you from being able to zip it closed. Yes, the main compartment and inner zippered pocket are roomier, but the lack of more pockets (and a sorely-needed secondary â€œmasterâ€ compartment) hinders you being able to sort contents neatly.The bag itself looks good and has that lovely smell of leather. It is very soft to the touch and supple to the skin. If you are using this as a dress purse, you will definitely receive a lot of compliments. In fact, I feel that the best use of the ASB is to attach the wrist strap and use the bag for dressier occasions. Otherwise, you will face a constant battle with 1) locating a smaller item amongst the contents, and/or 2) not having enough room to carry essentials, especially items that you may want to keep out of sight (such as feminine hygiene products).Final SayThe Avber Western Style Cow Leather Cross Studded Shoulder Bag, the bane of carpal tunnel sufferers everywhere, is constructed from soft, lovely leather. It has a chic design with fleurs-de-lis and cross metallic ornaments, solid metal clasps, and professional stitching. That being said, the pieced-together shoulder strap, severe lack of compartments, and unattached zipper work in conjunction to really make me hesitate to recommend this bag. Sure, it looks great and has several quality features; not being able to carry my medications or organize my â€œstuffâ€ adequately, even forcing me to remove some items from my usual inventory, conspire against the positive aspects. The final nail in the coffin, though, is that odd zipper.Just to clarify: before I composed this review I contacted the manufacturer to ascertain whether I received a defective product or not. They told me that the design of the zipper was intended, and that it should hang over the edge of the bag.I wish that I could say that the chic appearance and overall craftsmanship outweighed the flaws listed, but I cannot. Thus, if you are eyeing this for a main bag, I would recommend another type. If this is meant as a dress purse and not daily use, go for it. Otherwise you may find yourself frustrated by all of the stuff that you canâ€™t fit into it. Final say: 3 stars.**Disclaimer: This product was sent to me by the manufacturer at no cost to review. While I do not feel that this influenced me in any capacity, I am legally obligated to disclose this fact so that you can come to your own conclusions about the merit of this analysis.**

While pre-ground coffee is convenient, any coffee connoisseur can tell you that the full flavor of the beans, regardless of brand, is sacrificed during the packaging process. Sure, the best flavor for coffee is obtained from freshly-roasted beans that are ground while still hot, but most people (I dare say!) do not have coffee plants, much less the necessary roasting equipment, on-hand to prepare the pinnacle of morning caffeine ablutions each day. Thus, it is up to us plebeians to resort to grinding pre-roasted whole beans purchased from a supermarket/specialty store as the next-best solution. This is where the IdylcHomes KONA Coffee Slim Grinder comes in.ConstructionThe IdylcHomes KONA Coffee Slim Grinder (IHKCG, for short) is roughly the size of a peppermill, with the marked difference of having a glass jar to collect the ground material coming from the grinding burrs. The hand crank and tension nut are constructed with heavy stainless steel, while the hopper and its clear guard are made with food-safe plastic. My first impression upon opening the IHKCG box and removing the grinder was positive: the construction quality is excellent and with proper care, the grinder will last for a long time â€“ or at least until the ceramic grinding burrs are worn.FunctionFirst and foremost, just to reinforce the product description, this grinder is not going to grind up enough coffee to fill a 12-cup pot of coffee, not unless you plan on grinding three to four batches each time that you want to make some. The IHKCG is only meant to prepare three cups at max, maybe more if you prefer weaker coffee. With that out of the way, letâ€™s get to the â€œmeat & potatoesâ€ of this review.Filling the hopper can be a bit tricky, especially since it is cross-divided. Due to this, you may need to fine-tune the amount of beans poured into each of the four compartments since the walls prevent the beans from spilling over into the other areas. In addition, the mouth of the hopper is not overly large, so you may find yourself scooping in only a few beans at a time to prevent spills. Once you have some practice loading the beans into the IHKCG it does help in cutting back the time spent, which can take several minutes overall to complete the grinding process.The instructions for the IdylcHomes Grinder indicate that the handle should only be rotated in one direction â€“ clockwise â€“ so as to prevent any damage to the ceramic burrs. Thus, when you are turning the crank, if it â€œjamsâ€ or â€œlocks upâ€ you cannot reverse the crank to loosen the blockage. Rather, you need to shake the unit in the hopes that you will work it free. Unfortunately, this sometimes does not work, and you will find yourself disassembling it in order to stick something into the bean chambers and shuffle the beans around (in my case it was a metal chopstick). Fortunately, jams are not too common, but be aware that it can be frustrating.In terms of the quality of the grind, the beans are reduced to a slightly coarse ground, one that works equally well in a single-serve coffee pot or French Press. That being said, in order to obtain a full jar of grounds you will need to refill the hopper at least twice, more if you want a stronger brew. While it does not require a lot of strength to use this grinder, it can be tedious if you are making more than one cup of coffee. So be sure to have one of your kids handy for free labor!In the EndIf you like to grind your own coffee and want to make just enough grounds for one to three cups of joe, then the IdylcHomes KONA Coffee Slim Grinder is a great choice. The construction quality is excellent, the grind useable in a coffeemaker or French Press, and it is easy to use. That being said, I need to spill the beans: the design of the hopper, the narrowness of the opening, and the chambered compartments do mean that you will have to fiddle around when loading the grinder so as to not create a mess. So, depending upon the kind of timeframe that you have, this is probably not the type of grinder that you want to deal with when you are preparing for work in the morning.So, in short, this is a great gift for a bachelor, yourself, or another coffee lover who would like to make freshly-ground coffee in small batches. The design quality is very good overall, and the price isnâ€™t too shabby either. Still, the aforementioned flaw of the hopper prevents me from giving this product a perfect rating. 4 stars.**Disclaimer: This product was sent to me by the manufacturer at no cost to review. While I do not feel that this influenced me in any capacity, I am legally obligated to disclose this fact so that you can come to your own conclusions about the merit of this analysis.**

Kitchen timers are one of those things that you never really think about until you need one, and as technology has improved, the type, features, size, and more can truly be overwhelming when ascertaining which model to purchase. If you prefer a digital display, which is no doubt why you are on this page, allow me to introduce you to the Fontiene Digital Timer & Clock.  This palm-sized unit has a bevy of features, and I will do my best to let you know whether this timer is worth the cost. Without further ado, here we go!ConstructionThe Fontiene Digital Timer & Clock (henceforth referred to as FDTC) is constructed from thick plastic, a large LCD display, and plastic buttons that allow you to utilize the unit. The product packaging is written entirely in Mandarin, although the included instructions are translated into English. Finally, two button batteries (the size is L1154) are included to power the FDTC; simply press the spring clip on the back side, slide the battery cover off, drop in the batteries, and replace the cover. While a minor detail, the clip on the back (which also has the magnet stuck to it) has a spring-loaded, flip-out piece of metal that locks into place each time that you press down on the clip; this allows the timer to upright on a surface similar to a picture frame.The FDTC is relatively lightweight, and if dropped off of the countertop it will most likely chip/crack. I also want to point out that the hanging loop listed in the product title is not included with the timer. In fact, the only evidence of it is a small hole on the top of the clip in the back.UseSetting up the Fontiene Digital Timer & Clock is fairly straightforward and somewhat intuitive, and moving in between the four available timer slots is fluid. The clock uses the 24-hour reading for the display, so be aware that 1 PM will display as 13:00, 2 PM as 14:00, and so forth.The FDTC is able to simultaneously track four different timers at the same time. Setting up the timer is easy: press the desired button on the right side (T1, T2, T3, or T4), and once the display appears, press the Hour (H), Minute (M), and Seconds (S) buttons on the left side of the display until you have the desired timer programmed. If you make a mistake, simply press the â€œClearâ€ button and start over. Once finished, you can either start the timer straight away or go to the other slots to program any other needed timers, and then come back to start the countdown. Once you have the timer(s) active, a flashing T1, T2, T3, and/or T4 will appear along the upper part of the digital display. If the timers are not counting down, the only time a T1 â€“ T4 message will illuminate is when you are in one of the menus for the timers, and then it will only show the corresponding button (solid, not flashing, if the timer is off).The alarms are fairly audible, and unless you have a loud TV or radio, should be heard from another room. Each timer beeps in the same octave, but the beeps change depending upon the timer that is alerting. For example: T1 will have one beep, T2 a double beep, and so forth; each alarm will continue to chirp every second for one minute past the completion of the countdown. Finally, the display will show how long it has been since the timer finished and will continue counting until you hit the ST/SP button.This is the point where I advise you that the Fontiene Digital Timer & Clock has a few flaws. While its primary function of maintaining time and allowing you to setup four different timers is adequate, the design of the unit itself can be frustrating. To wit:1. Upon pressing a button, sometimes the unit does not detect it. While not common, this is annoying when you want to move between timers.2. The magnet to mount the timer is attached to the clip on the back, which is a narrow strip that sticks out from the rear of the unit. As such, after you hang the timer from your fridge/stove, if you attempt to press the buttons on the sides, you will flip the timer off of wherever it is hanging. Either embedding the clip/stand or having the magnets along the edges with raised points so that they stick out as far as the clip would stabilize the unit and eliminate you having to pop it off of the fridge to program it in your hands each time that you want to use it.3. There is no backlight on the LCD screen, and under certain lighting conditions, it can make seeing the numeric display a little difficult.4. If you hold the unit up to your ear (without the timer beeping, of course), the unit does have a high-pitched noise that can be heard. It isnâ€™t truly loud, but I do wonder why a relatively simple device that does not have a huge power requirement would produce an audible â€œelectronicâ€ noise.Final SayIf you are in the market for an economical timer that is easy to use and enables you to set multiple timers for different purposes simultaneously, then the Fontiene Digital Timer & Clock is a product to consider. Even with the four issues that I listed above, most of them are relatively minor, and you can decide for yourself if they are â€œdeal-breakersâ€, so to speak. Personally, the FDTC does its job, and the large LCD display does make it easier to see the time and program it accordingly. That being said, the flaws that I mentioned keep me from giving the unit a perfect score; thus, my final say: 4 stars.**Disclaimer: This product was sent to me by the manufacturer at no cost to review. While I do not feel that this influenced me in any capacity, I am legally obligated to disclose this fact so that you can come to your own conclusions about the merit of this analysis.**

I decided to pick this set up because the tongs that we had, while similar in appearance, were starting to show significant wear. So, when I saw this set on sale as a Gold Box special for only $6, I jumped at the chance. I figured that at $6 even if they were crappy tongs that I could get some use out of them before I needed an upgrade. So $6 and three days later, my Chef's Star Heat-Resistant Silicone Tongs arrived. Since there were other items in the moderately-heavy package, I figured that it was these other purchases that weighted the box down.Boy, was I wrong! These tongs are heavy-duty and GREAT quality for the low price. The metal is smooth and has some heft to it, so I don't have to worry about accidentally bending the heads (which have happened to me on occasion). Secondly, the red silicone is smooth and comfortable, also enabling you to have a sturdy grip so that the tongs won't slide out of your hand. Finally, the silicone heads of the tongs again have smooth silicone with no burrs along the sides, and squeeze shut securely.Oh, I forgot to mention that the loop on top of each tong is not only used to hang them from a hook, but can be pulled up to lock the tongs closed. This is a great feature, as it reduces the space required in a drawer (should you store them that way, as I do), and also prevents damage to the tongs and/or spring control that may occur when stored with the arms spread apart.Oh, and the beauty about these tongs is the silicone! Silicone is heat-resistant, and as such, you can use these tongs to flip items in the oven, reach into a boiling pot of water to retrieve an object, even flip steaks on a grill. When you are done, some hot, soapy water or a spin in the dishwasher will clean the tongs up and make them look good as new!Final SayIf you are in the market for a nice set of kitchen tongs that lock closed, have silicone heat-resistant tips, are well-made and durable, and clean up easily, I completely recommend this set, even moreso if you can catch it on sale! That being said, even at $16 this set is a steal, and will make a wonderful addition to your kitchen or that of a loved one.

Julienning vegetables is time-consuming and a pain in the butt if you do not have a mandolin, food processor, or specialized peeler. With this in mind, the Ultra Sharp Dual Julienne peeler is a stainless steel hand peeler that has a misleading name. There are actually four different cuts that can be made with this item, and with the solid, heavy construction you will find that you invested in a kitchen gadget that you will be able to use for a long time.ConstructionAs indicated above, the Amenco Ultra Sharp Dual Julienne peeler (aka AUSDJP) is a stainless steel peeler with two different julienne peeling blades on either side of the head. One side has small, narrow teeth for shallower peels, while the other blade has larger teeth that are further apart. Thus, you will be able to peel off thicker pieces of the vegetable/fruit that you are peeling. As with straight-blade veggie peelers, the blades are designed to pivot back-and-forth within the frame of the unit, enabling the blade to flex across the decidedly uneven surfaces of most vegetables.The two other blades that are left off of the product name are actually exterior to the frame and on either narrow side of the peeler. These blades loop out from the frame that holds the julienne blades, with one having a larger arch than the other. These are designed for use in peeling the skin off of citrus, making notches in strawberries/radishes for decoration, scooping out the eyes/bruised spots from a potato, and myriad other uses that require a â€œdiggingâ€ tip. As a final observation, there is a loop that protrudes from the base of the handle (which is smooth and very comfortable to hold) that enables you to hang this peeler from a hook for storage.UseDue to the smooth, oval-shaped handle and the sturdy construction of the peeler as a whole, the VERY sharp AUSDJP allows you to have a firm grip while you pull the blade(s) along the veggie/fruit that you are peeling. If you are more accustomed to using peelers that have the blade along the side (as opposed to the top as in the AUSDJP), it can be a bit awkward to use at first. Fortunately, this is short-lived and soon you will be zipping along like a pro.Either julienne blade digs into the flesh of a veggie/fruit hungrily, with the pressure that you provide offering a minor boost to the thickness of the strips. The teeth are also short (even on the side with the larger teeth), thus trying to obtain large julienne strips will require you to carefully trace the peeler completely around a potato (for instance) in order to acquire the length desired. That being said, the thickness of the strips do mean that you can peel a carrot over a salad for perfectly-sized strips, or use the larger teeth to peel off strips of squash (or carrots) to boil for vegetarian pasta.If you are looking for truly chunky strips, the blades on the sides of the peeler can help with that, but you will want to be careful until you are accustomed to the sharpness and pressure required. These side blades are also great for quickly digging out the eyes of potatoes, dark spots, or any other â€œdivotsâ€ that can be created with them. As alluded to above, these side blades are also great at cutting flaps into vegetables/fruit, allowing you to give a truly artistic flare to your presentation without spending hours using a paring knife. Effortless aesthetics: what is not to love?Finally, this peeler cleans up easily with hot, soapy water (just be careful while cleaning it so that you do not accidentally cut yourself). Alternatively, the AUSDJP can be placed into a dishwasher for even easier clean-up.In the EndIf you want a durable, dishwasher-safe julienne peeler that can also create â€œprettyâ€ garnishes, look no further than the Amenco Ultra Sharp Dual Julienne Peeler. The quality construction and the multiple uses will make this gadget invaluable in a busy kitchen. Whether peeling carrots for a delicious salad or creating hash browns from fresh potatoes, this peeler makes quick work of any task set before it. With the added bonus of quick clean-up, you really cannot go wrong with this purchase. Definitely recommended for the cook in you, or your life!**Disclaimer: This product was sent to me by the manufacturer at no cost to review. While I do not feel that this influenced me in any capacity, I am legally obligated to disclose this fact so that you can come to your own conclusions about the merit of this analysis.**

As any gamer knows, the ability to communicate with your team is critical, especially when facing down a raid boss or defending against the attack of the enemy team. While most games have a text interface, I the heat of battle you may not have the time to type out instructions/comments, especially if you are not a proficient typist. Thus, the need for a voice chat is evident, and in order to participate you need to have a good microphone/speaker setup. That is where gaming headsets come in; SenteyÂ® has created a model called the Arches Gaming Headset, a USB 2.0 unit with Virtual 7.1 Dolby Surround Sound. Whew, what a mouthful!But, is it worth it?ConstructionThe SenteyÂ® Arches Gaming Headset (or SAGH for short) is constructed from heavy-duty plastic with metal screens for the speaker vents and the knobs that hold the earpieces onto the headband. The loops on the upper portion of the headband at constructed from metal that has a rubberized shield; the strap underneath the arches has light padding and feels soft to the touch, like kid leather (note: the material is not actual leather). The microphone can be rotated into an upward position for storage, and it is flexible enough to curve the mouthpiece toward your mouth while retaining the desired placement. Finally, the USB cable is heavy-duty and has a fabric sheath covering the length. Midway down is a plastic control box that controls the in/out volume, as well as housing the â€œMuteâ€ and â€œPush-to-Chatâ€ buttons.When powered up the Sentey logo on the outside of each earpiece will light up; the microphone tip will also glow red when the microphone has been muted. This is a nice feature and enables the user to quickly ascertain if they accidentally muted the headset. While the glow from the earpieces serves the practical purpose of showing that the unit is receiving power, it is also a nice aesthetic touch, to boot.FunctionOnce I had the SAGH plugged into my computer, the earpieces resting against my earlobes, and the mouthpiece curved toward my lips, I fired up TeamspeakÂ® and gave it a whirl. I had to tweak the volume settings at first so that my friends could hear me, but with a simple twist of the volume knob located on the control box on the USB cable, I was able to quickly adjust my settings so that I was heard (and could hear) clearly.In terms of audio quality, the sound is rich, especially if I am listening to music (such as the in-game soundtrack for World of Warcraft). Whether a song has significant bass, a tenor melody, or the powerful vocals of a diva, the Arches Gaming Headset translates those sounds into clear, loud, and beautiful sound. When listening to my fellow teammates in Teamspeak or Ventrilo, I was able to hear the chatter clearly, even when more than one person was speaking in a moment of confusion. What amazed me the most was the ability to hear people who are always soft-spoken, something that I struggled to do prior to trying out the SAGH. I have to say, I am both grateful and impressed by this feature of this headset.Finally, my teammates indicated that my voice was clear with no static or background noise interfering with my speech. When chatting on Skype my family indicated that they could hear me with no issues. The best part about the SAGH is the ease with which you can address any softness in your speech delivery: the knob that controls the volume for your earpieces also controls the microphone. The downside to this is that you may have to adjust the volume in-game or through your computer should you find that you have to set the microphone so high that it makes the earpieces too loud for comfort. Fortunately I never experienced that issue.Finally, the SAGH is VERY comfortable, with the fabric band resting comfortably against the top of my head. The ear cushions are comfy, too, although I wish that they were a bit larger. When wearing the headset for an extended period of time, you will need to adjust the earpieces, especially if your ears are a bit bigger than the opening within the foam. I want to caution that even with the size being an issue, there is no pain involved with the discomfort mentioned, more that my ears need a break from having a headset pressed against them over the duration of a raid (roughly two hours, if not longer).In the EndIf you are looking for an economical headset that sounds great, has a flexible microphone that picks up your voice beautifully, and is comfortable to wear, I highly recommend the SenteyÂ® Arches Gaming Headset. The construction is solid and very durable, and with proper care the headset will last you for a very long time. The USB connection doesnâ€™t require any software installation in order for the Arches Headset to function, and your system should pick up the unit with no issues. With the ease of adjusting the volume, microphone output, and the thick, durable USB cable, this is a quality headset that I could see costing much more than it does. If you have the extra $40 handy and want a nice gaming headset, the Arches may be for you.**Disclaimer: This product was sent to me by the manufacturer at no cost to review. While I do not feel that this influenced me in any capacity, I am legally obligated to disclose this fact so that you can come to your own conclusions about the merit of this analysis.**

Cats are little furry balls of neuroses. Over the last five years of cat ownership, I have learned that anything that is sparkly, crinkly, moves suddenly, or even sits still, can be the target of a random kitty attack of DOOM! While I love our kitties, having the little one run about the living room, creating total havoc, just to chase the shadows moving across the wall from traffic outside, went from cute to â€œokay, this is destructiveâ€ when she broke my great-grandfatherâ€™s pocket watch.Enter the Pet MagasinÂ® Cat Tunnel set. Two different collapsible tubes of crinkly fabric wrapped around a flexible wire frame, with one end having a small toy dangling from the opening. Now, as anyone who has owned a cat can attest, felines are notoriously fickle creatures, and I hoped fervently that the new tunnels would stoke their interest.Fortunately, they did!ConstructionThese lightweight cat tunnels are made from colorful fabric that is both tear-resistant and durable. The larger tunnel has loops on one end and plastic, oval â€œbuttonsâ€ on the opposite that enable you to collapse the chute and hook the buttons through the loops, securely keeping the tunnel flat for easy storage. The smaller tunnel has nothing to keep it compressed, but you can use the dangling plastic ball as a rope and wrap the cord around itself. Just a note: if you do this, the tunnel may not stay closed. Therefore, you may want to use Velcro strips or cotton string if you need to store the cat tunnels for any reason.UseBe prepared to endure the loud, crinkly noise that these tunnels create for your kitty! For that reason, you may want to set these up when you have no plans to watch TV, play video games, and/or listen to music; alternatively you can keep these tunnels in another room so that the sound will not disturb you and your family.The noise aside, our kitties love these! They run through them, poke their heads out of the center â€œport holeâ€ on the top of the larger tunnel, and bat the dangling toys like it is going out of style. For added fun, we sprinkled a little bit of catnip into the tunnels, and bore witness to our monster tomcat staking a claim on them. His draconian attempts to hog the tunnels were foiled by the simple fact that he cannot physically be in two locations at the same time, and that our smaller kitty is much more agile than he is.There is also added fun when the cats attempt to sneak through the tunnel to attack the other cat who is on the other side. The crinkle of the fabric betrays their intentions, and watching the cats bounce around and play together is certainly worth the loud noise created by the tunnels.Final SayIf you want a toy that your cat(s) will enjoy, that gives them a place to hide, make noise, and play with dangling toys, the Pet MagasinÂ® Cat Tunnels will fit that niche. Be forewarned, however, that the claim of the tunnels being crinkly is VERY accurate, and the sound can be distracting if you are trying to concentrate on another task. Fortunately, if necessary, both Cat Tunnels can be collapsed flat and stored away until a more convenient playtime presents itself.If you are in the market for toys that are constructed well, offer lots of stimulation for your cat(s), and are relatively inexpensive, you cannot go wrong with these tunnels. So, with this being said, I give these a solid 4 stars. I deducted one star since the smaller tube doesnâ€™t have the built-in buttons that enable you to collapse it easily, forcing you to find another way to keep the tunnel collapsed when you need to store it. Otherwise, this toy is absolutely purr-fect!**Disclaimer: This product was sent to me by the manufacturer at no cost to review. While I do not feel that this influenced me in any capacity, I am legally obligated to disclose this fact so that you can come to your own conclusions about the merit of this analysis.**

Silicone has proven itself to be absolutely amazing for the kitchen. Whether you have silicone oven mitts, cake pans, silicone-dipped tongs, or a variety of other gadgets, silicone is truly an amazingly heat-resistant and flexible product. In keeping with this trend, Home-Complete has developed silicone cupcake liners available in a rainbow of colors. But, are they worth it?ConstructionThere is really not much to say here that isnâ€™t already obvious; these molds are the same shape/size of traditional paper liners that you would use in a muffin pan. The silicone is relatively thin, however, the cups are sturdy enough to maintain their shape even after the cupcake batter is ladled into them. Thus, while you could simply place the liners on a jelly-roll sheet (aka cookie sheet), doing so can result in lopsided cupcakes as the batter expands during baking.UseWhile the Home-Complete Silicone Cupcake Liners are designed for use with muffin tins, I have found that they are wonderful for forming chocolate and other candies that can â€œsetâ€ within a shape. As with most silicone products, these baking cups are naturally nonstick and thus peel off easily from both cupcakes/muffins and cold-set chocolate. No more torn cupcake liners and having to pick off small pieces!Baking with these liners ensures that the heat for each cupcake is spread evenly. While paper liners can sometimes scorch or result in the bottom of a cupcake browning a bit too much, the silicone baking cups prevent that from happening. Unless your oven needs to be recalibrated, the Home-Complete Silicone Liners result in flawless cupcake/muffin results every time. No more scorched cupcakes!Cleaning up the liners is a cinch; all that you need is some warm, soapy water and a little elbow grease. I want to point out that the only aspect of using silicone cupcake liners is that a cake residue does stick to the insides of the cups. Since the cups are fluted the cake â€œgunkâ€ may need a brush to clean the liner thoroughly. That being said, these liners are easier to clean if you flip them inside-out; this exposes all of the inner creases and makes it exponentially simpler to scrub off any residue.Final SayIf you bake a lot of cupcakes and/or muffins, or desire a baking-cup mold in which chocolate or other candies can set, you really should consider purchasing the Home-Complete Silicone Cupcake Liners. In addition to creating less waste, they are wonderful for ensuring that you have wonderfully-baked cupcakes every batch by significantly reducing (if not eliminating outright) the possibility to burn the bottoms of each treat. If anything, the most difficult decision that you need to make is whether to invest in one set (12pk) or two (24pk).So, if you want reusable muffin tin liners that ensure even baking and are easy to clean up, I whole-heartedly recommend the Home-Complete Silicone Cupcake Liners. While flashlights (or torches for you Brits) are convenient and a necessity for all sorts of situations, they are cumbersome if you are working on a project that requires the use of both hands. Short of enlisting another person for assistance (I know that kids are free labor and all, but some of us donâ€™t have that option), having to coordinate the positioning of the light while both hands are in your engine compartment is an exercise in madness. Sure, if you are in a house you can always invest in a stand or clip lamp to direct light where you need it, but there will invariably be a project or other situation where these light sources will be irrelevant, not to mention holding a flashlight.Enter the Divine LED Headlamp, the hands-free way to light up whatever is in front of you. Whether it is illuminating your footpath or brightening up a work area, the purpose of the Divine LED headlamp is to make your life easier. So, does it function as well as the manufacturer claims?ConstructionAs the pictures for the Divine LED Headlamp shows, the unit consists of a plastic lamp unit thread through an elastic band. The band can be adjusted to accommodate virtually any head circumference, while the lamp can be tilted from facing straight ahead to facing down at an angle perpendicular to the forehead, along with several angles in-between. A rubberized button on top of the unit is soft to the touch and makes a clicking sound each time it is depressed; there are three different light configurations, the first two can be dimmed to allow you to set just the exact amount of illumination that you need, with the third being a strobe effect. As indicated in the product description, the body of the lamp is waterproof, a fact made easier due to the unit being powered with three AAA batteries (as opposed to requiring a charging cable).As an aside, the â€œRedâ€ unit is actually closer to pink in coloration. The strap is reddish, however.FunctionWhile the Divine LED Headlamp provides hands-free lighting and is comfortable to wear, what sets this headset apart is the fact that you can hold down the power button in order to dim/brighten the LED currently illuminated. Thus, should you have a project that requires lighting but a bright light would not be ideal, the Divine LED Headlamp is a great tool to keep in your home improvement and sporting toolbox. Are you planning to walk through a darkened room but do not want to disturb others? Are you working on a project with a mirrored surface and do not want a lot of glare reflected back toward you? This headset is the answer.The elastic band used with this headset is thick and comfortable, and the buckle enables you to adjust the size of the headband to suit whomever is using it. The band can be small enough to fit a child or large enough to fit around the biggest melon in the house. You can also move the headlamp along the strap so that you can arrange for it to rest against your head without the buckles being nearby. Finally, the battery case is easy to access but also seals tightly, thus ensuring that the Divine LED Headlamp remains waterproof. If there is any complaint about this product, it would be related to inserting the AAA batteries into the unit; I had them pop out a few times before they would remain in place and allow me to close the headset. This is a minor issue, however, so I am only pointing this out to warn you ahead of time.In the EndIf you need a headlamp that can be dimmed, is waterproof, and feels well-made with an adjustable headband, then the Divine LED Headlamp is just what you need. Sure, the â€œredâ€ headlamp is actually pink, and futzing with the batteries is a bit annoying at first, the actual function of the lamp and being able to dim it make this a great investment. Whether you keep this in your car for emergencies, the toolbox for home/work repair, or to use around the house and for safety for events such as Halloweâ€™en, the Divine LED Headlamp will quickly prove itself invaluable. Sure, flashlights may be the go-to method as a portable light source, but having a hands-free method to illuminate what is in front of you is so much more convenient. All-in-all, I give this product 5 stars.**Disclaimer: This product was sent to me by the manufacturer at no cost to review. While I do not feel that this influenced me in any capacity, I am legally obligated to disclose this fact so that you can come to your own conclusions about the merit of this analysis.**

The first thing that you will notice upon opening your shipment of the iLoveCos Cosmetic Brushes is their heft. These are not lightweight, cheap brushes; iLoveCos has created a product with thick handles and soft bristles to ensure both comfort and accuracy when applying makeup. In addition, due to the chunkiness of the grips on the brushes, they are comfortable to hold even with arthritic hands. No clawed hands or painful cramps while applying makeup; just like fat crayons for younger children, the iLoveCos Cosmetic Brushes are useable by anyone.Another feature of the iLoveCos Brushes (henceforth abbreviated as ILCCB) are the dense bristles used in each brush. Whether applying rouge or putting the finishing touch on your smoky eye makeup, the ILCCB set will pick up and retain enough makeup that you may only need one application, rather than having to return repeatedly to the makeup. If there is any complaint involving these brushes, it has to be the lack of a truly fine-point tip. Otherwise, chiseled, straight, narrow, and every other type of makeup application necessity is present within the set.Going back to the comfort aspect, as someone who suffers from lupus, there are times that holding a pen and/or thin brush can be difficult if not downright impossible. With this in mind, iLoveCos created a set of brushes with thick, wooden handles, which allow me to grip each brush with a minimum of discomfort. Even the narrowest brushes exhibit â€œfatterâ€ handles, thus allowing you to apply finishing touches and still have the best grip for maximum control.Final SayIf you are looking for a set of makeup brushes that are well-made with WOOD handles, comfortable to grip, have soft, dense bristles, and have nearly every brush head (cut) needed, then you cannot go wrong with the iLoveCos Cosmetic Brush Set. If you have difficulty grasping traditional makeup brushes, these are practically a godsend as well. So whether for yourself, a loved one, or as a professional starter set, the pink drawstring bag that holds this set will bring a smile to the recipient. In short, I give these 5 stars.

Finding a good Bluetooth speaker can sometimes be frustrating. This difficulty is compounded when you are seeking a waterproof model; the quality of these waterproof/water resistant speakers vary, with the differences increasing exponentially depending upon the features desired. With all of this in mind, the IvationÂ® Boomering Bluetooth Speaker has risen as a contender for the title of â€œBest Waterproof Bluetooth Speakerâ€. As the product description indicates, IvationÂ® promises stellar performance, natch. After a few weeks of use, here are my impressions.ConstructionThe IvationÂ® Boomering Bluetooth Speaker is constructed in the form of a brick, thus following the status quo. There is a rubberized plastic that surrounds the unit on the narrow sides, ensuring a solid grip through the â€œtackyâ€ surface. The control buttons on the rounded and sink into the top of the speaker, however, the control icons are embossed and protrude enough to enable you to feel each button cleanly. The microphone is located on the top of the Boomering near the aforementioned control buttons.The Boomering Bluetooth Speaker, while sharing a similar design with other portable models, separates itself from the rest of the pack through a flap on the short side of the unit. The primary function is to cover the ports that are located underneath it, and to that end it seals thoroughly and is flush with the unit so that it maintains the â€œwater resistantâ€ claims of the manufacturer. More than that, though, is that the Boomering Bluetooth Speaker can also function as a charging unit. Underneath the water seal flap are the micro-USB, DC 5V In, and Audio/Auxiliary cable ports that are used to charge the speaker and connect a non-Bluetooth audio source, respectively. There are additional slots, though: a micro SD memory card, DC 5V Out, and a standard USB port. These ports are used for the Boomeringâ€™s Power Bank capability.FunctionBefore I address the sound quality of the IvationÂ® Boomering Bluetooth Speaker (or IBBS to save my hands from cramping), I want to comment upon the performance of the above-mentioned features/ports located on the side of the speaker. The IBBS was designed as an all-in-one device that functions as a speaker for audio devices (including a cell phone), but also enables the user to connect said audio device to the speakerâ€™s 5V Out power outlets to keep the unit charged. That being said, the standard-sized USB port leaves me confused; when I connected a cable to the speaker and plugged in my Bluetooth headset for charging, no power was sent to the headset. I then plugged the speaker into a wall outlet, thinking that using the IBBS for charging/powering may require the speaker to be connected to a power source; long story short, this did not work either. Seeing as how other reviewers have been able to successfully utilize their Boomering to charge their devices, I am going to chalk my unitâ€™s lack of function as a manufacturing anomaly.Moving on, the IBBS is a Bluetooth speaker with amazing sound given its size. While the bass is not going to result in the unit bouncing around on a tabletop, the loudness and balanced sound quality more than makes up for this. Lyrics, subtle song chords, and nuanced sounds in general are all clearly heard through the IBBS, thus giving larger and more expensive Bluetooth speakers a true run for the money. Whether you are listening to rock, reggae, classical, Gregorian chant, and everything in between, you will be able to enjoy and appreciate your music as loud as you can tolerate. Speaking to this, the claims of the manufacturer that you will have 16 hours of music even when the volume is maximized is a very accurate statement; the IBBS can fill a room and even be heard over the soft chatter of guests. Finally, the IvationÂ® Boomering can be synced through Bluetooth (and it does so quickly) or through NFC, with either method working with no issues, thus eliminating the frustration that can occur when a device decides to be fickle with an established connection. Once you have synced your device the first time, the Boomering will locate it quickly each time the speaker is powered on.Now, while this is all great, there are a few small issues that resulted in my deduction of one star for this review. The sound quality and the speakerâ€™s flexibility in using an audio source through a variety of connection possibilities is great and worth the price of the IBBS alone. However, I found that the control buttons are not as intuitive as I would like. In order to save space the buttons on the top of the unit serve double-duty. While this is not a major issue for the Play/Pause/Answer Call, Power, and Syncing buttons, it is the + and â€“ functions for which I feel there should be dedicated buttons, or at the least, programmed differently. To wit:1) To advance a song, you must double-click the + button; the same rule is required with the â€“ button in order to rewind/go to the previous song.2) To adjust the volume, you only have to push the + or â€“ once per increment. If you press and hold the buttons it will adjust the sound rapidly in either direction (based upon the button pushed). Once you have reached the highest volume, the speaker will beep to alert you to this fact; lowering the volume simply results in the sound disappearing with no beep to let you know that the speaker is at its softest volume.3) Factoring in 1 & 2 above, using the speaker to shuffle through multiple songs is more tedious than it has to be. To that end, if the functionality of the buttons was reversed (so that advancing a song is one button push, while adjusting the volume is a double-press), it would be a bit more convenient.OverallEven with the minor issues mentioned, I still feel that the IvationÂ® Boomering Bluetooth Speaker is a great, water-resistant device that sounds great and accommodates a variety of audio sources to increase its appeal. The sound is great, the battery life is amazing, and you can use the IBBS as a power source to keep your audio device charged while you are enjoying your favorite songs or speaking a friend on a phone call. If you are looking for a portable Bluetooth speaker that you can use at home, work, or out by the spa/pool, the Boomering is definitely worth considering. A solid 4 stars.**Disclaimer: This product was sent to me by the manufacturer at no cost to review. While I do not feel that this influenced me in any capacity, I am legally obligated to disclose this fact so that you can come to your own conclusions about the merit of this analysis.**

Whether your children have several bath toys to gather or you want to store your various bath accoutrements in one location, keeping a bathtub or shower clutter-free can sometimes be problematic. Most showers do not have a lot of storage space, and what space is available is usually occupied by shampoo/conditioner, soap, razors, and other bathroom staples. So what options do you have that are cheaper than installing a new tub/shower surround?ConstructionThe VIVAÂ® Bath Toy Organizer is a mesh bag that hangs from two large suction hooks. Upon opening the bag that it arrives in, I discovered a product that was higher quality than expected. To begin with, the mesh bag is constructed from heavy-duty nylon cord that is woven into a fine-mesh honeycomb pattern. The sides and the bottom of this bag have a white fabric hem that is sewn into place, reinforcing the bag itself and substantially improving the durability and capacity function of the VIVAÂ® Bath Toy Organizer. Finally, the same white fabric that is used as edging for the bag is also used to form the loops from which to hang the organizer from the enclosed hooks.The two hooks that are included are rather large and have a locking design; when the hook is suctioned to the wall, flipping the hook down into the locked position intensifies the suction power and greatly increases the amount of weight that can be hung from it. In addition, the hooks are easier to remove than a standard suction cup; simply lift up the hook to â€œunlockâ€ it and the suction will break. In many instances this would result in the hook coming loose, however, should it not fall off immediately, you can flip up a corner of the suction pad to break the seal (just as you would with a standard suction cup). Another thing to note about the VIVAÂ® Bath Toy Organizer: the included instructions also indicate that you can use alternative hooks and/or â€œpegsâ€ should you wish to use the mesh bag for storage in other locations (such as the laundry room, kitchen, and so forth). It should be noted that these other hanging methods are not included with the Organizer; you will need to purchase those on your own.UseYou cannot really elaborate upon the use of a bag, so I will keep this brief. The hooks are surprisingly strong, as I was able to hang the bag within my bathtub/shower and then load the bag with two full bottles of shampoo, a face cleanser bottle, and bath pouf with no issues. The best aspect, though, has to be the fact that this bag is HUGE, with my bag having room for more bottles of shampoo if I had any to place within it. The internal storage dimensions are 16â€ L x 13â€ W, giving you plenty of space to store your toiletry needs and/or bath toys. Finally, the bag is mildew resistant, so you do not have to worry about wet toys or other contents ruining the bag over time. With all of this taken into consideration, it is safe to say that the usability (and thus the function) of the VIVAÂ® Bath Toy Organizer meets and even exceeds my expectations.Final SayIf you are in need of some way to store your childâ€™s bath toys, toiletry items, or anything else within your tub/shower, the VIVAÂ® Bath Toy Organizer is worth the investment. The bag is large and mildew resistant, the construction is solid, and the hooks that are included are both strong and decently-sized. Whether as a necessity for yourself or as a gift for another, this is a nice product that will help keep your bathroom (or laundry, or kitchenâ€¦) tidier. When you factor in the modest price, the VIVAÂ® Bath Toy Organizer is a no-brainer. I definitely recommend it.**Disclaimer: This product was sent to me by the manufacturer at no cost to review.
